[Everybody]464-everybody rose and stood while [he]647-the stranger sang , and [their]464-everybody faces glowed and [their]464-everybody eyes burned ; and the tears came and flowed down [their]464-everybody cheeks and [their]464-everybody forms began to sway unconsciously to the swing of the song , and [their]464-everybody bosoms to heave and pant ; and moanings broke out , and deep ejaculations ; and when the last verse was reached , and [Roland]146-roland lay dying , all alone , with [his]146-roland face to [the field]698-the field and to [his]146-roland slain , lying there in heaps and winrows , and took off and held up [his]146-roland gauntlet to [God]140-god with [his]146-roland failing hand , and breathed [his]146-roland beautiful prayer with [his]146-roland paling pips , all burst out in sobs and wailings . But when the final great note died out and the song was done , [they]464-everybody all flung [themselves]464-everybody in a body at [the singer]699-the singer , stark mad with love of [him]699-the singer and love of [France]4-france and pride in [her]700-her great deeds and old renown , and smothered [him]699-the singer with [their]464-everybody embracings ; but [Joan]110-joan was there first , hugged close to [his]699-the singer breast , and covering [his]699-the singer face with idolatrous kisses . The storm raged on outside , but that was no matter ; this was [[the stranger]647-the stranger ’s home]702-the stranger ’s home now , for as long as [he]699-the singer might please . Chapter 4 [Joan]110-joan Tames [the Mad Man]703-the mad man ALL [CHILDREN]550-children have nicknames , and [we]705-we had [ours]705-we . [We]705-we got one apiece early , and [they]550-children stuck to [us]705-we ; but [Joan]110-joan was richer in this matter , for , as time went on , [she]110-joan earned a second , and then a third , and so on , and [we]705-we gave [them]550-children to [her]110-joan . First and last [she]110-joan had as many as half a dozen . Several of these [she]110-joan never lost . [Peasant - girls]706-peasant - girls are bashful naturally ; but [she]110-joan surpassed the rule so far , and colored so easily , and was so easily embarrassed in the presence of [strangers]707-strangers , that [we]705-we nicknamed [her]110-joan [the Bashful]708-the bashful . [We]705-we were [all patriots]709-all patriots , but [she]110-joan was called [the Patriot]710-the patriot , because [our]705-we warmest feeling for [[our]705-we country]711-our country was cold beside [hers]110-joan . Also [she]110-joan was called [the Beautiful]712-the beautiful ; and this was not merely because of the extraordinary beauty of [her]110-joan face and form , but because of the loveliness of [her]110-joan character . These names [she]110-joan kept , and one other — [the Brave]713-the brave . [We]705-we grew along up , in [that plodding and peaceful region]714-that plodding and peaceful region , and got to be [good - sized boys]715-good - sized boys and [girls]716-girls — big enough , in fact , to begin to know as much about the wars raging perpetually to the west and north of [us]705-we as [[our]705-we elders]717-our elders , and also to feel as stirred up over the occasional news from [these red fields]718-these red fields as [they]717-our elders did . [I]0-i remember certain of these days very clearly . One Tuesday [a crowd of [us]705-we]719-a crowd of us were romping and singing around the Fairy Tree , and hanging garlands on it in memory of [[our]705-we lost little fairy friends]720-our lost little fairy friends , when [Little Mengette]138-little mengette cried out : “ Look ! What is that ? ”[138-little mengette] When [one]461-one exclaims like that in a way that shows astonishment and apprehension , [he]461-one gets attention . [All the panting breasts and flushed faces]722-all the panting breasts and flushed faces flocked together , and all the eager eyes were turned in one direction — down [the slope]723-the slope , toward [the village]401-the village . “ It ’s a black flag . ”[138-little mengette] “ A black flag ! No — is it ? ”[138-little mengette] “ [You]138-little mengette can see for [yourself]138-little mengette that it is nothing else . ”[138-little mengette] “ It is a black flag , sure ! Now , has any ever seen the like of that before ? ”[138-little mengette] “ What can it mean ? ”[138-little mengette] “ Mean ? It means something dreadful — what else ? ”[138-little mengette] “ That is nothing to the point ; [anybody]563-anybody knows that without the telling . But what?—that is the question . ”[138-little mengette] “ It is a chance that [he]134-etienne roze that bears it can answer as well as any that are here , if [you]138-little mengette contain [yourself]138-little mengette till [he]134-etienne roze comes . ”[138-little mengette] “ [He]134-etienne roze runs well . Who is it ? ”[725-some named one] [Some named one]725-some named one , [some another]726-some another ; but presently all saw that it was [Etienne Roze]134-etienne roze , called the Sunflower , because [he]134-etienne roze had yellow hair and a round pock - marked face . [[His]134-etienne roze ancestors]727-his ancestors had been Germans some centuries ago . [He]134-etienne roze came straining up [the slope]723-the slope , now and then projecting [his]134-etienne roze flag - stick aloft and giving [his]134-etienne roze black symbol of woe a wave in the air , whilst all eyes watched [him]134-etienne roze , all tongues discussed [him]134-etienne roze , and every heart beat faster and faster with impatience to know [his]134-etienne roze news . At last [he]134-etienne roze sprang among [us]729-us , and struck [his]134-etienne roze flag - stick into the ground , saying : “ There ! Stand there and represent [France]4-france while [I]134-etienne roze get [my]134-etienne roze breath . [She]4-france needs no other flag now . ”[134-etienne roze] All the giddy chatter stopped . It was as if [one]461-one had announced a death . In that chilly hush there was no sound audible but the panting of [the breath - blown boy]731-the breath - blown boy . When [he]134-etienne roze was presently able to speak , [he]134-etienne roze said : “ Black news is come . A treaty has been made at [Troyes]33-troyes between [France]4-france and [the English and Burgundians]2441-the english and burgundians . By it [France]4-france is betrayed and delivered over , tied hand and foot , to [the enemy]2442-the enemy . It is the work of [the Duke of [Burgundy]34-burgundy and that [she]2443-she - devil]147-the duke of burgundy and that she - devil , [the Queen of [France]4-france]2444-the queen of france . [It]2445-it marries [Henry]148-henry of [England]24-england to [Catharine of [France]4-france]2446-catharine of france — ”[134-etienne roze] “ Is not this a lie ? Marries [the daughter of [France]4-france]2447-the daughter of france to [the Butcher of [Agincourt]26-agincourt]2448-the butcher of agincourt ? It is not to be believed . [You]2449-you have not heard aright . ”[134-etienne roze] “ If [you]2449-you can not believe that , [Jacques]130-jacques d’Arc , then [you]2449-you have a difficult task indeed before [you]2449-you , for worse is to come . [Any child that is born of that marriage]2450-any child that is born of that marriage — if even [a girl]2451-a girl — is to inherit the thrones of both [England]24-england and [France]4-france , and this double ownership is to remain with [its]2450-any child that is born of that marriage posterity forever ! ”[134-etienne roze] “ Now that is certainly a lie , for it runs counter to [our]2452-our Salic law , and so is not legal and can not have effect , ”[136-edmond aubrey] said [Edmond Aubrey]136-edmond aubrey , called [the Paladin]732-the paladin , because of the armies [he]136-edmond aubrey was always going to eat up some day . [He]136-edmond aubrey would have said more , but [he]136-edmond aubrey was drowned out by the clamors of [the others]733-the others , who all burst into a fury over this feature of the treaty , all talking at once and [nobody]434-nobody hearing [anybody]563-anybody , until [presently Haumette]149-haumette persuaded [them]733-the others to be still , saying : “ It is not fair to break [him]136-edmond aubrey up so in [his]136-edmond aubrey tale ; pray let [him]136-edmond aubrey go on . [You]2449-you find fault with [his]136-edmond aubrey history because it seems to be lies . That were reason for satisfaction — that kind of lies — not discontent . Tell [the rest]2453-the rest , [Etienne]134-etienne roze . ”[149-haumette] “ There is but this to tell : [[Our]2452-our King]2454-our king , [Charles VI]150-charles vi . , is to reign until [he]2454-our king dies , then [[Henry]148-henry V. of [England]24-england]148-henry is to be [Regent of [France]4-france]2455-regent of france until [a child of]2456-a child of [his]148-henry shall be old enough to — ”[149-haumette] “ [That man]2334-that man is to reign over [us]2452-our — [the Butcher]2458-the butcher ? It is lies ! all lies ! ”[732-the paladin] cried [the Paladin]732-the paladin . “ Besides , look [you]134-etienne roze — what becomes of [[our]2452-our Dauphin]2459-our dauphin ? What says the treaty about [him]2459-our dauphin ? ”[732-the paladin] “ Nothing . It takes away [his]2459-our dauphin throne and makes [him]2459-our dauphin [an outcast]2460-an outcast . ”[149-haumette] Then [everybody]464-everybody shouted at once and said the news was a lie ; and [all]738-all began to get cheerful again , saying , “ [[Our]2452-our King]2454-our king would have to sign the treaty to make it good ; and that [he]2454-our king would not do , seeing how it serves [[his]2454-our king own son]2462-his own son . ”[738-all] But [the Sunflower]151-the sunflower said : “ [I]151-the sunflower will ask [you]134-etienne roze this : Would [the Queen]2463-the queen sign a treaty disinheriting [[her]2463-the queen son]2464-her son ? ”[151-the sunflower] “ That viper ? Certainly . [Nobody]434-nobody is talking of [her]2463-the queen . [Nobody]434-nobody expects better of [her]2463-the queen . There is no villainy [she]2463-the queen will stick at , if it feed [her]2463-the queen spite ; and [she]2463-the queen hates [[her]2463-the queen son]2464-her son . [Her]2463-the queen signing it is of no consequence . [The King]270-the king must sign . ”[732-the paladin] “ [I]130-jacques will ask [you]134-etienne roze another thing . What is [the King]270-the king ’s condition ? [Mad]152-mad , is n’t [he]270-the king ? ”[130-jacques] “ Yes , and [[his]270-the king people]2470-his people love [him]270-the king all the more for it . It brings [him]270-the king near to [them]2470-his people by [his]270-the king sufferings ; and pitying [him]270-the king makes [them]2470-his people love [him]270-the king . ”[151-the sunflower] “ [You]134-etienne roze say right , [Jacques d’Arc]130-jacques . Well , what would [you]134-etienne roze of one that is mad ? Does [he]270-the king know what [he]270-the king does ? No . Does [he]270-the king do what [others]506-others make [him]270-the king do ? Yes . Now , then , [I]732-the paladin tell [you]134-etienne roze [he]270-the king has signed the treaty . ”[732-the paladin] “ Who made [him]270-the king do it ? ”[130-jacques] “ [You]134-etienne roze know , without [my]151-the sunflower telling . [The Queen]153-yolande . ”[151-the sunflower] Then there was another uproar — [everybody]464-everybody talking at once , and all heaping execrations upon [the Queen]2463-the queen ’s head . Finally [Jacques]130-jacques d’Arc said : “ But many reports come that are not true . Nothing so shameful as this has ever come before , nothing that cuts so deep , nothing that has dragged [France]4-france so low ; therefore there is hope that this tale is but another idle rumor . Where did [you]130-jacques get it ? ”[130-jacques] The color went out of [[his]130-jacques sister]741-his sister [Joan]110-joan ’s face . [She]110-joan dreaded the answer ; and [her]110-joan instinct was right . “ The cure of [Maxey]154-maxey brought it . ”[110-joan] There was a general gasp . [We]742-we knew [him]130-jacques , [you]743-you see , for [a trusty man]744-a trusty man . “ Did [he]130-jacques believe it ? ”[742-we] The hearts almost stopped beating . Then came the answer : “ [He]130-jacques did . And that is not all . [He]130-jacques said [he]130-jacques knew it to be true . ”[745-some of the girls] [Some of [the girls]746-the girls]745-some of the girls began to sob ; [the boys]747-the boys were struck silent . The distress in [Joan]110-joan ’s face was like that which [one]461-one sees in the face of [a dumb animal that has received a mortal hurt]749-a dumb animal that has received a mortal hurt . [The animal]750-the animal bears it , making no complaint ; [she]110-joan bore it also , saying no word . [[Her]110-joan brother]751-her brother [Jacques]130-jacques put [his]130-jacques hand on [her]110-joan head and caressed [her]110-joan hair to indicate [his]130-jacques sympathy , and [she]110-joan gathered the hand to [her]110-joan lips and kissed it for thanks , not saying anything . Presently the reaction came , and [the boys]747-the boys began to talk . [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel said : “ Oh , are [we]747-the boys never going to be [men]282-men ! [We]747-the boys do grow along so slowly , and [France]4-france never needed [soldiers]2473-soldiers as [she]4-france needs [them]2473-soldiers now , to wipe out this black insult . ”[135-noel] “ [I]132-pierre hate [youth]2474-youth ! ”[132-pierre] said [Pierre Morel]132-pierre , called the Dragon - fly because [his]132-pierre eyes stuck out so . “ [You]2475-you ’ve always got to wait , and wait , and wait — and here are the great wars wasting away for a hundred years , and [you]2475-you never get a chance . If [I]132-pierre could only be [a soldier]2476-a soldier now ! ”[132-pierre] “ As for [me]732-the paladin , [I]732-the paladin ’m not going to wait much longer , ”[732-the paladin] said [the Paladin]732-the paladin ; “ and when [I]732-the paladin do start [you]2475-you ’ll hear from [me]732-the paladin , [I]732-the paladin promise [you]2475-you that . There are some who , in storming [a castle]2477-a castle , prefer to be in the rear ; but as for [me]732-the paladin , give [me]732-the paladin the front or none ; [I]732-the paladin will have none in front of [me]732-the paladin but [the officers]2478-the officers . ”[732-the paladin] Even [the girls]746-the girls got the war spirit , and [Marie Dupont]155-marie dupont said : “ [I]155-marie dupont would [I]155-marie dupont were [a man]2329-a man ; [I]155-marie dupont would start this minute ! ”[155-marie dupont] and looked very proud of [herself]155-marie dupont , and glanced about for applause . “ So would [I]156-cecile letellier , ”[156-cecile letellier] said [Cecile Letellier]156-cecile letellier , sniffing the air like a war - horse that smells the battle ; “ [I]156-cecile letellier warrant [you]2475-you [I]156-cecile letellier would not turn back from [the field]698-the field though all [England]24-england were in front of [me]156-cecile letellier . ”[156-cecile letellier] “ Pooh ! ”[732-the paladin] said [the Paladin]732-the paladin ; “ [girls]716-girls can brag , but that ’s all [they]716-girls are good for . Let a thousand of [them]716-girls come face to face with [a handful of [soldiers]2473-soldiers]2482-a handful of soldiers once , if [you]2475-you want to see what running is like . Here ’s [little Joan]2484-little joan — next [she]2484-little joan ’ll be threatening to go for [a soldier]2476-a soldier ! ”[732-the paladin] The idea was so funny , and got such a good laugh , that [the Paladin]157-the paladin gave it another trial , and said : “ Why [you]2475-you can just see her!—see [her]2484-little joan plunge into battle like [any old veteran]2486-any old veteran . Yes , indeed ; and not [a poor shabby common soldier like [us]2488-us]2487-a poor shabby common soldier like us , but [an officer]2489-an officer — [an officer , mind [you]2475-you , with armor on , and the bars of a steel helmet to blush behind and hide [her]2484-little joan embarrassment when [she]2484-little joan finds [an army in front of [her]2484-little joan that [she]2484-little joan has n’t been introduced to]2491-an army in front of her that she has n’t been introduced to . [An officer]2489-an officer ? Why , [she]2484-little joan ’ll be [a captain]2493-a captain ! [A captain]2493-a captain , [I]157-the paladin tell [you]2475-you , with [a hundred men at [her]2484-little joan back]2495-a hundred men at her back]2490-an officer , mind you , with armor on , and the bars of a steel helmet to blush behind and hide her embarrassment when she finds an army in front of her that she has n’t been introduced to . an officer ? why , she ’ll be a captain ! a captain , i tell you , with a hundred men at her back — or maybe [girls]716-girls . Oh , no common - soldier business for [her]2484-little joan ! And , dear [me]157-the paladin , when [she]2484-little joan starts for [that other army]2497-that other army , [you]2475-you ’ll think there ’s a hurricane blowing it away ! ”[157-the paladin] Well , [he]756-he kept it up like that till [he]756-he made [their]757-their sides ache with laughing ; which was quite natural , for certainly it was a very funny idea — at that time — [I]0-i mean , the idea of that gentle little creature , that would n’t hurt a fly , and could n’t bear the sight of blood , and was so girlish and shrinking in all ways , rushing into battle with [a gang of soldiers at [her]759-her back]758-a gang of soldiers at her back . Poor thing , [she]759-her sat there confused and ashamed to be so laughed at ; and yet at that very minute there was something about to happen which would change the aspect of things , and make [those young people]760-those young people see that when it comes to laughing , [the person that laughs last]761-the person that laughs last has the best chance . For just then a face which [we]762-we all knew and all feared projected itself from behind the Fairy Tree , and the thought that shot through [us]762-we all was , crazy [Benoist]158-benoist has gotten loose from [his]158-benoist cage , and [we]762-we are as good as dead ! [This ragged and hairy and horrible creature]763-this ragged and hairy and horrible creature glided out from behind the tree , and raised an ax as [he]158-benoist came . [We]762-we all broke and fled , this way and that , [the girls]746-the girls screaming and crying . No , not all ; all but [Joan]110-joan . [She]110-joan stood up and faced [the man]648-the man , and remained so . As [we]762-we reached the wood that borders [the grassy clearing]766-the grassy clearing and jumped into [its]766-the grassy clearing shelter , [two or three of [us]762-we]767-two or three of us glanced back to see if [Benoist]158-benoist was gaining on [us]762-we , and that is what [we]762-we saw — [Joan]110-joan standing , and [the maniac]768-the maniac gliding stealthily toward [her]110-joan with [his]648-the man ax lifted . The sight was sickening . [We]762-we stood where [we]762-we were , trembling and not able to move . [I]0-i did not want to see the murder done , and yet [I]0-i could not take [my]0-i eyes away . Now [I]0-i saw [Joan]110-joan step forward to meet [the man]648-the man , though [I]0-i believed [my]0-i eyes must be deceiving [me]0-i . Then [I]0-i saw [him]648-the man stop . [He]648-the man threatened [her]110-joan with [his]648-the man ax , as if to warn [her]110-joan not to come further , but [she]110-joan paid no heed , but went steadily on , until [she]110-joan was right in front of [him]648-the man — right under [his]648-the man ax . Then [she]110-joan stopped , and seemed to begin to talk with [him]648-the man . It made [me]0-i sick , yes , giddy , and everything swam around [me]0-i , and [I]0-i could not see anything for a time — whether long or brief [I]0-i do not know . When this passed and [I]0-i looked again , [Joan]110-joan was walking by [the man]648-the man ’s side toward [the village]401-the village , holding [him]648-the man by [his]648-the man hand . The ax was in [her]110-joan other hand . One by one [the boys]747-the boys and [girls]716-girls crept out , and [we]774-we stood there gazing , open - mouthed , till [those two]775-those two entered [the village]401-the village and were hid from sight . It was then that [we]774-we named [her]110-joan [the Brave]713-the brave . [We]774-we left the black flag there to continue its mournful office , for [we]774-we had other matter to think of now . [We]774-we started for [the village]401-the village on a run , to give warning , and get [Joan]110-joan out of [her]110-joan peril ; though for one , after seeing what [I]0-i had seen , it seemed to [me]0-i that while [Joan]110-joan had the ax [the man]648-the man ’s chance was not the best of [the two]780-the two . When [we]774-we arrived the danger was past , [the madman]781-the madman was in [custody]782-custody . [All the people]783-all the people were flocking to [the little square in front of [the church]409-the church]784-the little square in front of the church to talk and exclaim and wonder over the event , and it even made [the town]786-the town forget the black news of the treaty for two or three hours . [All the women]787-all the women kept hugging and kissing [Joan]110-joan , and praising [her]110-joan , and crying , and [the men]788-the men patted [her]110-joan on the head and said [they]788-the men wished [she]110-joan was [a man]2329-a man , [they]788-the men would send [her]110-joan to the wars and never doubt but that [she]110-joan would strike some blows that would be heard of . [She]110-joan had to tear [herself]110-joan away and go and hide , this glory was so trying to [her]110-joan diffidence . Of course [the people]313-the people began to ask [us]791-us for the particulars . [I]0-i was so ashamed that [I]0-i made an excuse to [the first comer]792-the first comer , and got privately away and went back to [the Fairy Tree]30-the fairy tree , to get relief from the embarrassment of those questionings . There [I]0-i found [Joan]110-joan , but [she]110-joan was there to get relief from the embarrassment of glory . One by one [the others]733-the others shirked [the inquirers]794-the inquirers and joined [us]791-us in [[our]791-us refuge]795-our refuge . Then [we]791-us gathered around [Joan]110-joan , and asked [her]110-joan how [she]110-joan had dared to do that thing . [She]110-joan was very modest about it , and said : “ [You]0-i make a great thing of it , but [you]0-i mistake ; it was not a great matter . It was not as if [I]110-joan had been [a stranger to [the man]648-the man]2498-a stranger to the man . [I]110-joan know [him]648-the man , and have known [him]648-the man long ; and [he]648-the man knows [me]110-joan , and likes [me]110-joan . [I]110-joan have fed [him]648-the man through the bars of [his]648-the man cage many times ; and last December , when [they]2500-they chopped off two of [his]648-the man fingers to remind [him]648-the man to stop seizing and wounding [people passing by]2501-people passing by , [I]110-joan dressed [his]648-the man hand every day till it was well again . ”[110-joan] “ That is all well enough , ”[138-little mengette] said [Little Mengette]138-little mengette , “ but [he]648-the man is [a madman]2502-a madman , [dear]2328-dear , and so [his]648-the man likings and [his]648-the man gratitude and friendliness go for nothing when [his]648-the man rage is up . [You]2328-dear did a perilous thing . ”[138-little mengette] “ Of course [you]2328-dear did , ”[151-the sunflower] said [the Sunflower]151-the sunflower . “ Did n’t [he]648-the man threaten to kill [you]2328-dear with the ax ? ”[151-the sunflower] “ Yes . ”[138-little mengette] “ Did n’t [he]648-the man threaten [you]2328-dear more than once ? ”[138-little mengette] “ Yes . ”[151-the sunflower] “ Did n’t [you]2328-dear feel afraid ? ”[138-little mengette] “ No — at least not much — very little . ”[138-little mengette] “ Why did n’t [you]2328-dear ? ”[796-she] [She]796-she thought a moment , then said , quite simply : “ [I]796-she do n’t know . ”[796-she] It made [everybody]464-everybody laugh . Then [the Sunflower]151-the sunflower said it was like a lamb trying to think out how it had come to eat a wolf , but had to give it up . [Cecile Letellier]156-cecile letellier asked , “ Why did n’t [you]2328-dear run when [we]2504-we did ? ”[156-cecile letellier] “ Because it was necessary to get [him]648-the man to [[his]648-the man cage]2505-his cage ; else [he]648-the man would kill [some one]2506-some one . Then [he]648-the man would come to the like harm [himself]648-the man . ”[156-cecile letellier] It is noticeable that this remark , which implies that [Joan]110-joan was entirely forgetful of [herself]110-joan and [her]110-joan own danger , and had thought and wrought for the preservation of [other people]798-other people alone , was not challenged , or criticized , or commented upon by [anybody there]799-anybody there , but was taken by all as matter of course and true . It shows how clearly [her]110-joan character was defined , and how well it was known and established . There was silence for a time , and perhaps [we]800-we were all thinking of the same thing — namely , what [a poor figure [we]800-we had cut in that adventure as contrasted with [Joan]110-joan ’s performance]801-a poor figure we had cut in that adventure as contrasted with joan ’s performance . [I]0-i tried to think up some good way of explaining why [I]0-i had run away and left [a little girl]802-a little girl at the mercy of [a maniac armed with an ax]803-a maniac armed with an ax , but all of the explanations that offered themselves to [me]0-i seemed so cheap and shabby that [I]0-i gave the matter up and remained still . But others were less wise . [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel fidgeted awhile , then broke out with a remark which showed what [his]135-noel mind had been running on : “ The fact is , [I]135-noel was taken by surprise . That is the reason . If [I]135-noel had had a moment to think , [I]135-noel would no more have thought of running that [I]135-noel would think of running from [a baby]2507-a baby . For , after all , what is [Theophile Benoist]158-benoist , that [I]135-noel should seem to be afraid of [him]2507-a baby ? Pooh ! the idea of being afraid of that poor thing ! [I]135-noel only wish [he]2507-a baby would come along now — [I’d]135-noel show [you]135-noel ! ”[135-noel] “ So do [I]132-pierre ! ”[132-pierre] cried [Pierre Morel]132-pierre . “ If [I]132-pierre would n’t make [him]2507-a baby climb this tree quicker than — well , [you]135-noel ’d see what [I]132-pierre would do ! Taking [a person]467-a person by surprise , that way — why , [I]132-pierre never meant to run ; not in earnest , [I]132-pierre mean . [I]132-pierre never thought of running in earnest ; [I]132-pierre only wanted to have some fun , and when [I]132-pierre saw [Joan]110-joan standing there , and [him]2507-a baby threatening [her]110-joan , it was all [I]132-pierre could do to restrain [myself]132-pierre from going [there]460-there and just tearing the livers and lights out of [him]2507-a baby . [I]132-pierre wanted to do it bad enough , and if it was to do over again , [I]132-pierre would ! If ever [he]2507-a baby comes fooling around [me]132-pierre again , [I]132-pierre ’ll — ”[132-pierre] “ Oh , hush ! ”[157-the paladin] said [the Paladin]157-the paladin , breaking in with an air of disdain ; “ the way [you]2510-you people talk , [a person]467-a person would think there ’s something heroic about standing up and facing down [that poor remnant of [a man]2329-a man]2512-that poor remnant of a man . Why , it ’s nothing ! There ’s small glory to be got in facing [him]2507-a baby down , [I]157-the paladin should say . Why , [I]157-the paladin would n’t want any better fun than to face down [a hundred like [him]2507-a baby]2514-a hundred like him . If [he]2507-a baby was to come along here now , [I]157-the paladin would walk up to [him]2507-a baby just as [I]157-the paladin am now — [I]157-the paladin would n’t care if [he]2507-a baby had a thousand axes — and say — ”[157-the paladin] And so [he]157-the paladin went on and on , telling the brave things [he]157-the paladin would say and the wonders [he]157-the paladin would do ; and [the others]733-the others put in a word from time to time , describing over again the gory marvels [they]733-the others would do if ever [that madman]805-that madman ventured to cross [their]733-the others path again , for next time [they]733-the others would be ready for [him]157-the paladin , and would soon teach [him]157-the paladin that if [he]157-the paladin thought [he]157-the paladin could surprise [them]733-the others twice because [he]157-the paladin had surprised [them]733-the others once , [he]157-the paladin would find [himself]157-the paladin very seriously mistaken , that ’s all . And so , in the end , [they]733-the others all got back [their]733-the others self - respect ; yes , and even added somewhat to it ; indeed when [the sitting]806-the sitting broke up [they]733-the others had a finer opinion of [themselves]733-the others than [they]733-the others had ever had before . Chapter 5 [Domremy]1-domremy Pillaged and Burned [THEY]807-they WERE peaceful and pleasant , those young and smoothly flowing days of [ours]808-we ; that is , that was the case as a rule , [we]808-we being remote from the seat of war ; but at intervals [roving bands]809-roving bands approached near enough for [us]808-we to see the flush in the sky at night which marked where [they]809-roving bands were burning [some farmstead]810-some farmstead or [village]811-village , and [we]808-we all knew , or at least felt , that some day [they]809-roving bands would come yet nearer , and [we]808-we should have [our]808-we turn . This dull dread lay upon [our]808-we spirits like a physical weight . It was greatly augmented a couple of years after the Treaty of [Troyes]33-troyes . It was truly a dismal year for [France]145-france . One day [we]808-we had been over to have one of [our]808-we occasional pitched battles with [those hated Burgundian boys of [the village of [Maxey]154-maxey]813-the village of maxey]812-those hated burgundian boys of the village of maxey , and had been whipped , and were arriving on [[our]808-we side of [the river]454-the river]814-our side of the river after dark , bruised and weary , when [we]808-we heard the bell ringing [the tocsin]37-the tocsin . [We]808-we ran all the way , and when [we]808-we got to [the square]816-the square [we]808-we found [it]816-the square crowded with [the excited villagers]817-the excited villagers , and weirdly lighted by smoking and flaring torches . On the steps of [the church]409-the church stood [a stranger]819-a stranger , [a Burgundian priest , who was telling [the people]313-the people news which made [them]313-the people weep , and rave , and rage , and curse , by turns]820-a burgundian priest , who was telling the people news which made them weep , and rave , and rage , and curse , by turns . [He]819-a stranger said [[our]808-we old mad King]822-our old mad king was dead , and that now [we]808-we and [France]4-france and [the crown]823-the crown were the property of [an English baby lying in [his]824-an english baby lying in his cradle in london cradle in [London]38-london]824-an english baby lying in his cradle in london . And [he]819-a stranger urged [us]808-we to give [that child]495-that child [our]808-we allegiance , and be [[its]495-that child faithful servants]826-its faithful servants and [well - wishers]827-well - wishers ; and said [we]808-we should now have a strong and stable government at last , and that in a little time [the English armies]828-the english armies would start on [their]828-the english armies last march , and it would be a brief one , for all that it would need to do would be to conquer what odds and ends of [[our]808-we country]711-our country yet remained under that rare and almost forgotten rag , the banner of [France]4-france . [The people]313-the people stormed and raged at [him]819-a stranger , and [you]831-you could see dozens of [them]313-the people stretch [their]313-the people fists above the sea of torch - lighted faces and shake [them]313-the people at [him]819-a stranger ; and it was all a wild picture , and stirring to look at ; and [the priest]399-the priest was a first - rate part of it , too , for [he]399-the priest stood there in the strong glare and looked down on [those angry people]833-those angry people in the blandest and most indifferent way , so that while [you]831-you wanted to burn [him]819-a stranger at the stake , [you]831-you still admired the aggravating coolness of [him]819-a stranger . And [his]819-a stranger winding - up was the coolest thing of all . For [he]819-a stranger told [them]313-the people how , at the funeral of [[our]808-we old King]834-our old king , [the French King - at - Arms]835-the french king - at - arms had broken [his]835-the french king - at - arms staff of office over the coffin of “ [Charles VI]150-charles vi . and [[his]835-the french king - at - arms dynasty]2515-his dynasty , ”[819-a stranger] at the same time saying , in a loud voice , “ [God]140-god grant long life to [Henry]148-henry , [King of [France]4-france]2516-king of france and [England]24-england , [[our]2517-our sovereign lord]2518-our sovereign lord ! ”[819-a stranger] and then [he]819-a stranger asked [them]313-the people to join [him]819-a stranger in a hearty Amen to that ! [The people]313-the people were white with wrath , and it tied [their]313-the people tongues for the moment , and [they]313-the people could not speak . But [Joan]110-joan was standing close by , and [she]110-joan looked up in [his]819-a stranger face , and said in [her]110-joan sober , earnest way : “ [I]110-joan would [I]110-joan might see [thy]819-a stranger head struck from [thy]819-a stranger body!”—then[110-joan] , after a pause , and crossing herself—“if it were the will of [God]140-god . ”[110-joan] This is worth remembering , and [I]0-i will tell [you]837-you why : it is the only harsh speech [Joan]110-joan ever uttered in [her]110-joan life . When [I]0-i shall have revealed to [you]837-you the storms [she]110-joan went through , and the wrongs and persecutions , then [you]837-you will see that it was wonderful that [she]110-joan said but one bitter thing while [she]110-joan lived . From the day that that dreary news came [we]838-we had one scare after another , [the marauders]839-the marauders coming almost to [our]838-we doors every now and then ; so that [we]838-we lived in ever - increasing apprehension , and yet were somehow mercifully spared from actual attack . But at last [our]838-we turn did really come . This was in the spring of ’ 28 . [The Burgundians]159-the burgundians swarmed in with a great noise , in the middle of a dark night , and [we]838-we had to jump up and fly for [our]838-we lives . [We]838-we took [the road]840-the road to [Neufchateau]25-neufchateau , and rushed along in the wildest disorder , [everybody]464-everybody trying to get ahead , and thus the movements of all were impeded ; but [Joan]110-joan had a cool head — the only cool head there — and [she]110-joan took command and brought order out of that chaos . [She]110-joan did [her]110-joan work quickly and with decision and despatch , and soon turned the panic flight into a quite steady - going march . [You]837-you will grant that for [so young a person]842-so young a person , and [a girl]2451-a girl at that , this was a good piece of work . [She]110-joan was sixteen now , shapely and graceful , and of a beauty so extraordinary that [I]0-i might allow [myself]0-i any extravagance of language in describing it and yet have no fear of going beyond the truth . There was in [her]110-joan face a sweetness and serenity and purity that justly reflected [her]110-joan spiritual nature . [She]110-joan was deeply religious , and this is a thing which sometimes gives a melancholy cast to [a person]467-a person ’s countenance , but it was not so in [her]110-joan case . [Her]110-joan religion made [her]110-joan inwardly content and joyous ; and if [she]110-joan was troubled at times , and showed the pain of it in [her]110-joan face and bearing , it came of distress for [[her]110-joan country]845-her country ; no part of it was chargeable to [her]110-joan religion . [A considerable part of [[our]847-we village]848-our village]846-a considerable part of our village was destroyed , and when it became safe for [us]847-we to venture back [there]460-there [we]847-we realized what [other people]798-other people had been suffering in [all the various quarters of [France]4-france]851-all the various quarters of france for many years — yes , decades of years . For the first time [we]847-we saw [wrecked and smoke - blackened homes]852-wrecked and smoke - blackened homes , and in [the lanes]853-the lanes and alleys carcasses of [dumb creatures that had been slaughtered in pure wantonness]854-dumb creatures that had been slaughtered in pure wantonness — among [them]854-dumb creatures that had been slaughtered in pure wantonness calves and lambs that had been [pets of [the children]483-the children]855-pets of the children ; and it was pity to see [the children]483-the children lament over [them]854-dumb creatures that had been slaughtered in pure wantonness . And then , the taxes , the taxes ! [Everybody]464-everybody thought of that . That burden would fall heavy now in [the commune]859-the commune ’s crippled condition , and all faces grew long with the thought of it . [Joan]110-joan said : “ Paying taxes with naught to pay [them]854-dumb creatures that had been slaughtered in pure wantonness with is what the rest of [France]4-france has been doing these many years , but [we]847-we never knew the bitterness of that before . [We]847-we shall know it now . ”[110-joan] And so [she]110-joan went on talking about it and growing more and more troubled about it , until [one]461-one could see that it was filling all [her]110-joan mind . At last [we]847-we came upon a dreadful object . It was [the madman]781-the madman — hacked and stabbed to death in [his]781-the madman iron cage in [the corner of [the square]816-the square]862-the corner of the square . It was a bloody and dreadful sight . [Hardly any of [[us]847-we young people]865-us young people had ever seen [a man]2329-a man before who had lost [his]2329-a man life by violence]864-hardly any of us young people had ever seen a man before who had lost his life by violence ; so [this cadaver]867-this cadaver had an awful fascination for [us]847-we ; [we]847-we could not take [our]847-we eyes from it . [I]0-i mean , it had that sort of fascination for all of [us]847-we but one . That one was [Joan]110-joan . [She]110-joan turned away in horror , and could not be persuaded to go near it again . There — it is a striking reminder that [we]847-we are but [creatures of use and custom]868-creatures of use and custom ; yes , and it is a reminder , too , of how harshly and unfairly fate deals with [us]847-we sometimes . For it was so ordered that [the very ones among [us]847-we who were most fascinated with mutilated and bloody death]869-the very ones among us who were most fascinated with mutilated and bloody death were to live [their]869-the very ones among us who were most fascinated with mutilated and bloody death lives in peace , while [that other , who had a native and deep horror of it , must presently go forth and have it as a familiar spectacle every day on the field of battle]870-that other , who had a native and deep horror of it , must presently go forth and have it as a familiar spectacle every day on the field of battle . [You]871-you may well believe that [we]847-we had plenty of matter for talk now , since the raiding of [[our]847-we village]848-our village seemed by long odds the greatest event that had really ever occurred in [the world]320-the world ; for although [these dull peasants]874-these dull peasants may have thought [they]874-these dull peasants recognized the bigness of some of the previous occurrences that had filtered from [the world]320-the world ’s history dimly into [their]874-these dull peasants minds , the truth is that [they]874-these dull peasants had n’t . One biting little fact , visible to [their]874-these dull peasants eyes of flesh and felt in [their]874-these dull peasants own personal vitals , became at once more prodigious to [them]874-these dull peasants than the grandest remote episode in [the world]320-the world ’s history which [they]874-these dull peasants had got at second hand and by hearsay . It amuses [me]0-i now when [I]0-i recall how [[our]847-we elders]717-our elders talked then . [They]717-our elders fumed and fretted in a fine fashion . “ Ah , yes , ”[130-jacques] said [old Jacques]130-jacques d’Arc , “ things are come to a pretty pass , indeed ! [The King]270-the king must be informed of this . It is time that [he]270-the king cease from idleness and dreaming , and get at [his]270-the king proper business . ”[130-jacques] [He]130-jacques meant [[our]847-we young disinherited King]878-our young disinherited king , [the hunted refugee]879-the hunted refugee , [Charles VII]160-charles vii . “ [You]130-jacques say well , ”[653-the maire] said [the maire]653-the maire . “ [He]270-the king should be informed , and that at once . It is an outrage that such things would be permitted . Why , [we]847-we are not safe in [[our]847-we beds]2520-our beds , and [he]270-the king taking [his]270-the king ease yonder . It shall be made known , indeed it shall — [all France]2521-all france shall hear of it ! ”[653-the maire] To hear [them]717-our elders talk , [one]461-one would have imagined that all the previous ten thousand sackings and burnings in [France]4-france had been but fables , and this one the only fact . It is always the way ; words will answer as long as it is only [a person ’s neighbor who is in trouble]882-a person ’s neighbor who is in trouble , but when [that person]2332-that person gets into trouble [himself]2332-that person , it is time that [the King]270-the king rise up and do something . The big event filled [us]847-we [young people]885-young people with talk , too . [We]847-we let it flow in a steady stream while [we]847-we tended the flocks . [We]847-we were beginning to feel pretty important now , for [I]0-i was eighteen and [the other youths]886-the other youths were from one to four years older — [young men]887-young men , in fact . One day [the Paladin]157-the paladin was arrogantly criticizing [the patriot generals of [France]4-france]888-the patriot generals of france and said : “ Look at [Dunois]161-dunois , [Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2522-bastard of orleans — call [him]161-dunois [a general]2523-a general ! Just put [me]157-the paladin in [his]161-dunois place once — never mind what [I]157-the paladin would do , it is not for [me]157-the paladin to say , [I]157-the paladin have no stomach for talk , [my]157-the paladin way is to act and let [others]506-others do the talking — but just put [me]157-the paladin in [his]161-dunois place once , that ’s all ! And look at [Saintrailles]40-saintrailles — pooh ! and [that blustering La Hire]2525-that blustering la hire , now what [a general that is]2526-a general that is ! ”[157-the paladin] It shocked [everybody]464-everybody to hear these great names so flippantly handled , for to [us]890-us [these renowned soldiers]891-these renowned soldiers were [almost gods]892-almost gods . In [their]891-these renowned soldiers far - off splendor [they]891-these renowned soldiers rose upon [our]890-us imaginations dim and huge , shadowy and awful , and it was a fearful thing to hear [them]891-these renowned soldiers spoken of as if [they]891-these renowned soldiers were [mere men]893-mere men , and [their]891-these renowned soldiers acts open to comment and criticism . The color rose in [Joan]110-joan ’s face , and [she]110-joan said : “ [I]110-joan know not how any can be so hardy as to use such words regarding [these sublime men]2527-these sublime men , who are the very pillars of [the French state]2528-the french state , supporting it with [their]891-these renowned soldiers strength and preserving it at daily cost of [their]891-these renowned soldiers blood . As for [me]110-joan , [I]110-joan could count [myself]110-joan honored past all deserving if [I]110-joan might be allowed but the privilege of looking upon [them]891-these renowned soldiers once — at a distance , [I]110-joan mean , for it would not become one of [my]110-joan degree to approach [them]891-these renowned soldiers too near . ”[110-joan] [The Paladin]157-the paladin was disconcerted for a moment , seeing by the faces around [him]157-the paladin that [Joan]110-joan had put into words what [the others]733-the others felt , then [he]157-the paladin pulled [his]157-the paladin complacency together and fell to fault - finding again . [[Joan]110-joan ’s brother]895-joan ’s brother [Jean]115-jeanne said : “ If [you]110-joan do n’t like what [[our]2529-our generals]2530-our generals do , why do n’t [you]110-joan go to the great wars [yourself]110-joan and better [their]2530-our generals work ? [You]110-joan are always talking about going to the wars , but [you]110-joan do n’t go . ”[115-jeanne] “ Look [you]110-joan , ”[157-the paladin] said [the Paladin]157-the paladin , “ it is easy to say that . Now [I]157-the paladin will tell [you]110-joan why [I]157-the paladin remain chafing [here]2531-here in a bloodless tranquillity which [my]157-the paladin reputation teaches [you]110-joan is repulsive to [my]157-the paladin nature . [I]157-the paladin do not go because [I]157-the paladin am not [a gentleman]2532-a gentleman . That is the whole reason . What can [one private soldier]2533-one private soldier do in a contest like this ? Nothing . [He]2533-one private soldier is not permitted to rise from the ranks . If [I]157-the paladin were [a gentleman]2532-a gentleman would [I]157-the paladin remain [here]2531-here ? Not one moment . [I]157-the paladin can save [France]4-france — ah , [you]110-joan may laugh , but [I]157-the paladin know what is in [me]157-the paladin , [I]157-the paladin know what is hid under this peasant cap . [I]157-the paladin can save [France]4-france , and [I]157-the paladin stand ready to do it , but not under these present conditions . If [they]2536-them want [me]157-the paladin , let [them]2536-them send for [me]157-the paladin ; otherwise , let [them]2536-them take the consequences ; [I]157-the paladin shall not budge but as [an officer]2489-an officer . ”[157-the paladin] “ Alas , poor [France]4-france — [France]4-france is lost ! ”[132-pierre] said [Pierre]132-pierre d’Arc . “ Since [you]132-pierre sniff so at [others]506-others , why do n’t [you]132-pierre go to the wars [yourself]132-pierre , [Pierre]132-pierre d’Arc ? ”[132-pierre] “ Oh , [I]896-i have n’t been sent for , either . [She]110-joan said it in a low voice and musingly , but [several]662-several heard it . “ How do [you]110-joan know that , [Joan]110-joan ? ”[897-the dragon - fly] said [the Dragon - fly]897-the dragon - fly , with a surprised look . But [Jean d’Arc]115-jeanne broke in and said : “ [I]115-jeanne want to go [myself]115-jeanne , but as [I]115-jeanne am rather young yet , [I]115-jeanne also will wait , and march when [the Paladin]157-the paladin is sent for . ”[115-jeanne] “ No , ”[110-joan] said [Joan]110-joan , “ [he]157-the paladin will go with [Pierre]132-pierre . ”[110-joan] [She]110-joan said it as one who talks to [himself]110-joan aloud without knowing it , and [none]367-none heard it but [me]0-i . [I]0-i glanced at [her]110-joan and saw that [her]110-joan knitting - needles were idle in [her]110-joan hands , and that [her]110-joan face had a dreamy and absent look in it . There were fleeting movements of [her]110-joan lips as if [she]110-joan might be occasionally saying parts of sentences to [herself]110-joan . But there was no sound , for [I]0-i was [the nearest person to [her]110-joan]901-the nearest person to her and [I]0-i heard nothing . But [I]0-i set [my]0-i ears open , for those two speeches had affected [me]0-i uncannily , [I]0-i being superstitious and easily troubled by any little thing of a strange and unusual sort . [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel said : “ There is one way to let [France]4-france have a chance for [her]4-france salvation . [We]2542-we ’ve got [one gentleman in [the commune]859-the commune]2543-one gentleman in the commune , at any rate . Why ca n’t [the Scholar]2545-the scholar change name and condition with [the Paladin]157-the paladin ? Then [he]2545-the scholar can be [an officer]2489-an officer . [France]4-france will send for [him]2545-the scholar then , and [he]2545-the scholar will sweep [these English and Burgundian armies]2547-these english and burgundian armies into [the sea]2548-the sea like flies . ”[135-noel] [I]0-i was [the Scholar]2545-the scholar . That was [my]0-i nickname , because [I]0-i could read and write . There was a chorus of approval , and [the Sunflower]151-the sunflower said : “ That is the very thing — it settles every difficulty . It makes [one]461-one feel creepy to hear such things . “ Come , now , ”[135-noel] [Noel]135-noel continued , “ it ’s all arranged ; there ’s nothing to do but organize under [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s banner and go forth and rescue [France]4-france . [You]738-all ’ll all join ? ”[135-noel] [All]738-all said yes , except [Jacques]130-jacques d’Arc , who said : “ [I]130-jacques ’ll ask [you]0-i to excuse [me]130-jacques . It is pleasant to talk war , and [I]130-jacques am with [you]0-i there , and [I]130-jacques ’ve always thought [I]130-jacques should go soldiering about this time , but the look of [[our]2550-our wrecked village]2551-our wrecked village and [that carved - up and bloody madman]2552-that carved - up and bloody madman have taught [me]130-jacques that [I]130-jacques am not made for such work and such sights . [I]130-jacques could never be at [home]377-home in that trade . Face swords and the big guns and death ? It is n’t in [me]130-jacques . No , no ; count [me]130-jacques out . [I]130-jacques shall stay at [home]377-home , and grow old in peace and tranquillity . ”[130-jacques] “ [He]130-jacques will stay at [home]377-home , but not grow old , ”[110-joan] murmured [Joan]110-joan . The talk rattled on in the gay and careless fashion privileged to youth , and [we]905-we got [the Paladin]732-the paladin to map out [his]732-the paladin campaigns and fight [his]732-the paladin battles and win [his]732-the paladin victories and extinguish [the English]128-the english and put [[our]905-we King]2454-our king upon [his]2454-our king throne and set [his]2454-our king crown upon [his]2454-our king head . Then [we]905-we asked [him]732-the paladin what [he]732-the paladin was going to answer when [the King]270-the king should require [him]732-the paladin to name [his]732-the paladin reward . [The Paladin]157-the paladin had it all arranged in [his]157-the paladin head , and brought it out promptly : “ [He]270-the king shall give [me]157-the paladin a dukedom , name [me]157-the paladin [premier peer]2562-premier peer , and make [me]157-the paladin [Hereditary Lord High Constable of [France]4-france]145-france . ”[157-the paladin] “ And marry [you]110-joan to [a princess]2563-a princess — [you’re]110-joan not going to leave that out , are [you]110-joan ? ”[157-the paladin] [The Paladin]157-the paladin colored a trifle , and said , brusquely : “ [He]270-the king may keep [[his]270-the king princesses]2564-his princesses — [I]157-the paladin can marry more to [my]157-the paladin taste . ”[157-the paladin] Meaning [Joan]110-joan , though [nobody]434-nobody suspected it at that time . If any had , [the Paladin]157-the paladin would have been finely ridiculed for [his]157-the paladin vanity . There was [no fit mate in [that village]911-that village for [Joan of Arc]110-joan]910-no fit mate in that village for joan of arc . [Every one]529-every one would have said that . The answers were given in fun , and [each of [us]917-we]916-each of us tried to outdo [[his]916-each of us predecessors]918-his predecessors in the extravagance of the reward [he]916-each of us would claim ; but when it came to [Joan]110-joan ’s turn , and [they]919-they rallied [her]110-joan out of [her]110-joan dreams and asked [her]110-joan to testify , [they]919-they had to explain to [her]110-joan what the question was , for [her]110-joan thought had been absent , and [she]110-joan had heard none of this latter part of [our]917-we talk . [She]110-joan supposed [they]919-they wanted a serious answer , and [she]110-joan gave it . [She]110-joan sat considering some moments , then [she]110-joan said : “ If [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin , out of [his]2565-the dauphin grace and nobleness , should say to [me]110-joan , ‘ Now that [I]110-joan am rich and am come to [my]110-joan own again , choose and have , ’ [I]110-joan should kneel and ask [him]2565-the dauphin to give command that [[our]917-we village]848-our village should nevermore be taxed . ”[110-joan] It was so simple and out of [her]110-joan heart that it touched [us]917-we and [we]917-we did not laugh , but fell to thinking . [We]917-we did not laugh ; but there came a day when [we]917-we remembered that speech with a mournful pride , and were glad that [we]917-we had not laughed , perceiving then how honest [her]110-joan words had been , and seeing how faithfully [she]110-joan made them good when the time came , asking just that boon of [the King]270-the king and refusing to take even any least thing for [herself]110-joan . Chapter 6 [Joan]110-joan and [Archangel Michael]108-archangel michael ALL THROUGH [her]110-joan childhood and up to the middle of [her]110-joan fourteenth year , [Joan]110-joan had been [the most light - hearted creature and the merriest in [the village]401-the village]921-the most light - hearted creature and the merriest in the village , with a hop - skip - and - jump gait and a happy and catching laugh ; and this disposition , supplemented by [her]110-joan warm and sympathetic nature and frank and winning ways , had made [her]110-joan [[everybody]464-everybody ’s pet]924-everybody ’s pet . [She]110-joan had been [a hot patriot]925-a hot patriot all this time , and sometimes the war news had sobered [her]110-joan spirits and wrung [her]110-joan heart and made [her]110-joan acquainted with tears , but always when these interruptions had run their course [her]110-joan spirits rose and [she]110-joan was [her]110-joan old self again . But now for a whole year and a half [she]110-joan had been mainly grave ; not melancholy , but given to thought , abstraction , dreams . [She]110-joan was carrying [France]4-france upon [her]110-joan heart , and [she]110-joan found the burden not light . [I]0-i knew that this was [her]110-joan trouble , but [others]506-others attributed [her]110-joan abstraction to religious ecstasy , for [she]110-joan did not share [her]110-joan thinkings with [the village]401-the village at large , yet gave [me]0-i glimpses of them , and so [I]0-i knew , better than the rest , what was absorbing [her]110-joan interest . Many a time the idea crossed [my]0-i mind that [she]110-joan had a secret — a secret which [she]110-joan was keeping wholly to [herself]110-joan , as well from [me]0-i as from [the others]733-the others . This idea had come to [me]0-i because several times [she]110-joan had cut a sentence in two and changed the subject when apparently [she]110-joan was on the verge of a revelation of some sort . [I]0-i was to find this secret out , but not just yet . The day after the conversation which [I]0-i have been reporting [we]929-we were together in [the pastures]930-the pastures and fell to talking about [France]4-france , as usual . For [her]110-joan sake [I]0-i had always talked hopefully before , but that was mere lying , for really there was not anything to hang a rag of hope for [France]4-france upon . Now it was such a pain to lie to [her]110-joan , and cost [me]0-i such shame to offer this treachery to one so snow - pure from lying and treachery , and even from suspicion of such baseness in others , as [she]110-joan was , that [I]0-i was resolved to face about now and begin over again , and never insult [her]110-joan more with deception . [I]0-i started on the new policy by saying — still opening up with a small lie , of course , for habit is habit , and not to be flung out of the window by [any man]931-any man , but coaxed downstairs a step at a time : “ [Joan]110-joan , [I]0-i have been thinking the thing all over last night , and have concluded that [we]2567-we have been in the wrong all this time ; that the case of [France]4-france is desperate ; that it has been desperate ever since [Agincourt]26-agincourt ; and that to - day it is more than desperate , it is hopeless . ”[0-i] [I]0-i did not look [her]110-joan in the face while [I]0-i was saying it ; it could not be expected of [a person]467-a person . To break [her]110-joan heart , to crush [her]110-joan hope with a so frankly brutal speech as that , without one charitable soft place in it — it seemed a shameful thing , and it was . But when it was out , the weight gone , and [my]0-i conscience rising to the surface , [I]0-i glanced at [her]110-joan face to see the result . There was none to see . At least none that [I]0-i was expecting . There was a barely perceptible suggestion of wonder in [her]110-joan serious eyes , but that was all ; and [she]110-joan said , in [her]110-joan simple and placid way : “ The case of [France]4-france hopeless ? Why should [you]0-i think that ? Tell [me]110-joan . ”[110-joan] It is a most pleasant thing to find that what [you]933-you thought would inflict a hurt upon [one whom [you]933-you honor]934-one whom you honor , has not done it . [I]0-i was relieved now , and could say all [my]0-i say without any furtivenesses and without embarrassment . So [I]0-i began : “ Let [us]2568-us put sentiment and patriotic illusions aside , and look at the facts in the face . What do [they]2569-they say ? [They]2569-they speak as plainly as the figures in [a merchant]2570-a merchant ’s account - book . One has only to add the two columns up to see that [the French house]2571-the french house is bankrupt , that one - half of [[its]2571-the french house property]2572-its property is already in [the English sheriff]2573-the english sheriff ’s hands and the other half in [nobody’s]2574-nobody’s — except those of [irresponsible raiders]2575-irresponsible raiders and [robbers]2576-robbers confessing allegiance to [nobody]434-nobody . [[Our]2568-us King]2454-our king is shut up with [[his]2454-our king favorites]2579-his favorites and [fools]2580-fools in inglorious idleness and poverty in [a narrow little patch of [the kingdom]2582-the kingdom]2581-a narrow little patch of the kingdom — a sort of back lot , as one may say — and has no authority there or anywhere else , has n’t a farthing to [his]2454-our king name , nor [a regiment of [soldiers]2473-soldiers]2583-a regiment of soldiers ; [he]2454-our king is not fighting , [he]2454-our king is not intending to fight , [he]2454-our king means to make no further resistance ; in truth , there is but one thing that [he]2454-our king is intending to do — give the whole thing up , pitch [his]2454-our king crown into [the sewer]2585-the sewer , and run away to [Scotland]41-scotland . There are the facts . Are they correct ? ”[0-i] “ Yes , they are correct . ”[935-i] “ Then it is as [I]935-i have said : one needs but to add them together in order to realize what they mean . ”[935-i] [She]935-i asked , in an ordinary , level tone : “ What — that the case of [France]4-france is hopeless ? ”[935-i] “ Necessarily . In face of these facts , doubt of it is impossible . ”[935-i] “ How can [you]935-i say that ? How can [you]935-i feel like that ? ”[935-i] “ How can [I]935-i ? How could [I]935-i think or feel in any other way , in the circumstances ? [Joan]110-joan , with these fatal figures before , [you]110-joan , have [you]110-joan really any hope for [France]4-france — really and actually ? ”[935-i] “ Hope — oh , more than that ! [France]4-france will win [her]4-france freedom and keep it . Do not doubt it . ”[935-i] It seemed to [me]0-i that [her]935-i clear intellect must surely be clouded to - day . It must be so , or [she]935-i would see that those figures could mean only one thing . Perhaps if [I]0-i marshaled [them]936-them again [she]935-i would see . So [I]0-i said : “ [Joan]110-joan , [your]110-joan heart , which worships [France]4-france , is beguiling [your]110-joan head . [You]110-joan are not perceiving the importance of these figures . Here — [I]0-i want to make a picture of them , here on the ground with a stick . Now , this rough outline is [France]4-france . Through [its]4-france middle , east and west , [I]0-i draw [a river]2586-a river . ”[0-i] “ Yes , [the Loire]42-the loire . ”[935-i] “ Now , then , [this whole northern half of [the country]315-the country]2587-this whole northern half of the country is in the tight grip of [the English]128-the english . ”[937-her] “ Yes . ”[0-i] “ And [this whole southern half]2589-this whole southern half is really in [nobody]434-nobody ’s hands at all — as [[our]2591-our King]2454-our king confesses by meditating desertion and flight to [a foreign land]2593-a foreign land . [England]24-england has [armies]2594-armies [here]2531-here ; opposition is dead ; [she]24-england can assume full possession whenever [she]24-england may choose . In very truth , all [France]4-france is gone , [France]4-france is already lost , [France]4-france has ceased to exist . What was [France]4-france is now but [a British province]2596-a british province . Is this true ? ”[937-her] [Her]937-her voice was low , and just touched with emotion , but distinct : “ Yes , it is true . ”[937-her] “ Very well . Now add this clinching fact , and surely the sum is complete : When have [French soldiers]2597-french soldiers won a victory ? [Scotch soldiers]2598-scotch soldiers , under the French flag , have won a barren fight or two a few years back , but [I]937-her am speaking of [French ones]2599-french ones . Since [eight thousand Englishmen]2600-eight thousand englishmen nearly annihilated [sixty thousand Frenchmen]2601-sixty thousand frenchmen a dozen years ago at [Agincourt]26-agincourt , French courage has been paralyzed . And so it is a common saying to - day that if [you]2602-you confront [fifty French soldiers]2603-fifty french soldiers with [five English ones]2604-five english ones , the French will run . ”[937-her] “ It is a pity , but even these things are true . ”[937-her] “ Then certainly the day for hoping is past . ”[937-her] [I]0-i believed the case would be clear to [her]937-her now . [I]0-i thought it could not fail to be clear to [her]937-her , and that [she]937-her would say , [herself]937-her , that there was no longer any ground for hope . But [I]0-i was mistaken ; and disappointed also . [She]937-her said , without any doubt in [her]937-her tone : “ [France]4-france will rise again . [You]0-i shall see . ”[937-her] “ Rise?—with this burden of English armies on [her]937-her back ! ”[937-her] “ [She]937-her will cast it off ; [she]937-her will trample it under foot ! ”[937-her] This with spirit . “ Without [soldiers]2473-soldiers to fight with ? ”[937-her] “ The drums will summon [them]2473-soldiers . [They]2473-soldiers will answer , and [they]2473-soldiers will march . ”[937-her] “ March to the rear , as usual ? ”[937-her] “ No ; to the front — ever to the front — always to the front ! [You]0-i shall see . ”[937-her] “ And [the pauper King]2606-the pauper king ? ”[937-her] “ [He]2606-the pauper king will mount [his]2606-the pauper king throne — [he]2606-the pauper king will wear [his]2606-the pauper king crown . ”[937-her] “ Well , of a truth this makes [one]461-one ’s head dizzy . Why , if [I]937-her could believe that in thirty years from now the English domination would be broken and [the French monarch]2608-the french monarch ’s head find itself hooped with a real crown of sovereignty — ”[937-her] “ Both will have happened before two years are sped . ”[937-her] “ Indeed ? and who is going to perform all these sublime impossibilities ? ”[937-her] “ [God]140-god . ”[937-her] It was a reverent low note , but it rang clear . What could have put those strange ideas in [her]937-her head ? This question kept running in [my]0-i mind during two or three days . It was inevitable that [I]0-i should think of madness . What other way was there to account for such things ? Grieving and brooding over the woes of [France]4-france had weakened that strong mind , and filled it with fantastic phantoms — yes , that must be it . But [I]0-i watched [her]937-her , and tested [her]937-her , and it was not so . [Her]937-her eye was clear and sane , [her]937-her ways were natural , [her]937-her speech direct and to the point . No , there was nothing the matter with [her]937-her mind ; it was still the soundest in [the village]401-the village and the best . [She]937-her went on thinking for [others]506-others , planning for [others]506-others , sacrificing [herself]937-her for [others]506-others , just as always before . [She]937-her went on ministering to [her]937-her sick and to [[her]937-her poor]942-her poor , and still stood ready to give [the wayfarer]943-the wayfarer [her]937-her bed and content [herself]937-her with the floor . There was a secret somewhere , but madness was not the key to it . This was plain . Now the key did presently come into [my]0-i hands , and the way that it happened was this . [You]944-you have heard all the world talk of this matter which [I]0-i am about to speak of , but [you]944-you have not heard [an eyewitness]945-an eyewitness talk of it before . [I]0-i was coming from over [the ridge]946-the ridge , one day — it was the 15th of May , ’ 28 — and when [I]0-i got to [the edge of [the oak forest]948-the oak forest]947-the edge of the oak forest and was about to step out of it upon the turfy open space in which the haunted beech tree stood , [I]0-i happened to cast a glance from cover , first — then [I]0-i took a step backward , and stood in the shelter and concealment of the foliage . For [I]0-i had caught sight of [Joan]110-joan , and thought [I]0-i would devise some sort of playful surprise for [her]110-joan . Think of it — that trivial conceit was neighbor , with but a scarcely measurable interval of time between , to an event destined to endure forever in histories and songs . The day was overcast , and all that grassy space wherein the Tree stood lay in a soft rich shadow . [Joan]110-joan sat on a natural seat formed by gnarled great roots of [the Tree]141-tree . [Her]110-joan hands lay loosely , one reposing in the other , in [her]110-joan lap . [Her]110-joan head was bent a little toward the ground , and [her]110-joan air was that of [one who is lost to thought , steeped in dreams]949-one who is lost to thought , steeped in dreams , and not conscious of [herself]110-joan or of [the world]320-the world . And now [I]0-i saw a most strange thing , for [I]0-i saw a white shadow come slowly gliding along the grass toward the Tree . It was of grand proportions — a robed form , with wings — and the whiteness of this shadow was not like any other whiteness that [we]951-we know of , except it be the whiteness of lightnings , but even the lightnings are not so intense as it was , for one can look at them without hurt , whereas this brilliancy was so blinding that it pained [my]0-i eyes and brought the water into them . [I]0-i uncovered [my]0-i head , perceiving that [I]0-i was in the presence of something not of [this world]345-this world . [My]0-i breath grew faint and difficult , because of the terror and the awe that possessed [me]0-i . Another strange thing . [The wood]468-the wood had been silent — smitten with that deep stillness which comes when a storm - cloud darkens [a forest]954-a forest , and [the wild creatures]955-the wild creatures lose heart and are afraid ; but now all the birds burst forth into song , and the joy , the rapture , the ecstasy of it was beyond belief ; and was so eloquent and so moving , withal , that it was plain it was an act of worship . With the first note of those birds [Joan]110-joan cast [herself]110-joan upon [her]110-joan knees , and bent [her]110-joan head low and crossed [her]110-joan hands upon [her]110-joan breast . [She]110-joan had not seen the shadow yet . Had the song of the birds told [her]110-joan it was coming ? It had that look to [me]0-i . Then the like of this must have happened before . Yes , there might be no doubt of that . The shadow approached [Joan]110-joan slowly ; the extremity of it reached [her]110-joan , flowed over [her]110-joan , clothed [her]110-joan in its awful splendor . In that immortal light [her]110-joan face , only humanly beautiful before , became divine ; flooded with that transforming glory [her]110-joan mean peasant habit was become like to the raiment of [the sun - clothed children of [God]140-god]956-the sun - clothed children of god as [we]957-we see [them]956-the sun - clothed children of god thronging the terraces of the Throne in [our]957-we dreams and imaginings . Presently [she]110-joan rose and stood , with [her]110-joan head still bowed a little , and with [her]110-joan arms down and the ends of [her]110-joan fingers lightly laced together in front of [her]110-joan ; and standing so , all drenched with that wonderful light , and yet apparently not knowing it , [she]110-joan seemed to listen — but [I]0-i heard nothing . After a little [she]110-joan raised [her]110-joan head , and looked up as one might look up toward the face of [a giant]958-a giant , and then clasped [her]110-joan hands and lifted them high , imploringly , and began to plead . [I]0-i heard some of the words . [I]0-i heard [her]110-joan say : “ But [I]110-joan am so young ! oh , so young to leave [[my]110-joan mother]2609-my mother and [[my]110-joan home]404-my home and go out into [the strange world]2611-the strange world to undertake a thing so great ! Ah , how can [I]110-joan talk with [men]282-men , be [comrade]2613-comrade with [men?—soldiers]2614-men?—soldiers ! It would give [me]110-joan over to insult , and rude usage , and contempt . How can [I]110-joan go to the great wars , and lead armies?—I [a girl , and ignorant of such things , knowing nothing of arms]2615-a girl , and ignorant of such things , knowing nothing of arms , nor how to mount a horse , nor ride it .... Yet — if it is commanded — ”[110-joan] [Her]110-joan voice sank a little , and was broken by sobs , and [I]0-i made out no more of [her]110-joan words . Then [I]0-i came to [myself]0-i . [I]0-i reflected that [I]0-i had been intruding upon a mystery of [God]140-god — and what might [my]0-i punishment be ? [I]0-i was afraid , and went deeper into the wood . Then [I]0-i carved a mark in the bark of a tree , saying to [myself]0-i , it may be that [I]0-i am dreaming and have not seen this vision at all . [I]0-i will come again , when [I]0-i know that [I]0-i am awake and not dreaming , and see if this mark is still here ; then [I]0-i shall know . Chapter 7 [She]110-joan Delivers the Divine Command [I]0-i HEARD [my]0-i name called . It was [Joan]110-joan ’s voice . It startled [me]0-i , for how could [she]110-joan know [I]0-i was there ? [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , it is part of the dream ; it is all dream — voice , vision and all ; [the fairies]489-the fairies have done this . So [I]0-i crossed [myself]0-i and pronounced the name of [God]140-god , to break the enchantment . [I]0-i knew [I]0-i was awake now and free from the spell , for no spell can withstand this exorcism . Then [I]0-i heard [my]0-i name called again , and [I]0-i stepped at once from under cover , and there indeed was [Joan]110-joan , but not looking as [she]110-joan had looked in the dream . For [she]110-joan was not crying now , but was looking as [she]110-joan had used to look a year and a half before , when [her]110-joan heart was light and [her]110-joan spirits high . [Her]110-joan old - time energy and fire were back , and a something like exaltation showed itself in [her]110-joan face and bearing . It was almost as if [she]110-joan had been in a trance all that time and had come awake again . Really , it was just as if [she]110-joan had been away and lost , and was come back to [us]960-us at last ; and [I]0-i was so glad that [I]0-i felt like running to call [everybody]464-everybody and have [them]464-everybody flock around [her]110-joan and give [her]110-joan welcome . [I]0-i ran to [her]110-joan excited and said : “ Ah , [Joan]110-joan , [I]0-i ’ve got such a wonderful thing to tell [you]110-joan about ! [You]110-joan would never imagine it . [I]0-i ’ve had a dream , and in the dream [I]0-i saw [you]110-joan right here where [you]110-joan are standing now , and — ”[0-i] But [she]110-joan put up [her]110-joan hand and said : “ It was not a dream . ”[110-joan] It gave [me]0-i a shock , and [I]0-i began to feel afraid again . “ Not a dream ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ how can [you]110-joan know about it , [Joan]110-joan ? ”[0-i] “ Are [you]110-joan dreaming now ? ”[110-joan] “ [I]0-i — [I]0-i suppose not . [I]0-i think [I]0-i am not . ”[0-i] “ Indeed [you]110-joan are not . [I]0-i know [you]110-joan are not . And [you]110-joan were not dreaming when [you]110-joan cut the mark in the tree . ”[0-i] [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i turning cold with fright , for now [I]0-i knew of a certainty that [I]0-i had not been dreaming , but had really been in the presence of a dread something not of [this world]345-this world . Then [I]0-i remembered that [my]0-i sinful feet were upon holy ground — the ground where that celestial shadow had rested . [I]0-i moved quickly away , smitten to the bones with fear . [Joan]110-joan followed , and said : “ Do not be afraid ; indeed there is no need . Come with [me]110-joan . [We]2616-we will sit by the spring and [I]110-joan will tell [you]0-i all [my]110-joan secret . ”[110-joan] When [she]110-joan was ready to begin , [I]0-i checked [her]110-joan and said : “ First tell [me]0-i this . [You]110-joan could not see [me]0-i in the wood ; how did [you]110-joan know [I]0-i cut a mark in the tree ? ”[0-i] “ Wait a little ; [I]0-i will soon come to that ; then [you]110-joan will see . ”[0-i] “ But tell [me]0-i one thing now ; what was that awful shadow that [I]0-i saw ? ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i will tell [you]110-joan , but do not be disturbed ; [you]110-joan are not in danger . It was the shadow of [an archangel]2617-an archangel — [Michael]108-archangel michael , [the chief and lord of the armies of heaven]2618-the chief and lord of the armies of heaven . ”[0-i] [I]0-i could but cross [myself]0-i and tremble for having polluted that ground with [my]0-i feet . “ [You]110-joan were not afraid , [Joan]110-joan ? Did [you]110-joan see [his]2617-an archangel face — did [you]110-joan see [his]2617-an archangel form ? ”[0-i] “ Yes ; [I]0-i was not afraid , because this was not the first time . [I]0-i was afraid the first time . ”[0-i] “ When was that , [Joan]110-joan ? ”[0-i] “ It is nearly three years ago now . ”[0-i] “ So long ? Have [you]110-joan seen [him]2617-an archangel many times ? ”[0-i] “ Yes , many times . ”[0-i] “ It is this , then , that has changed [you]110-joan ; it was this that made [you]110-joan thoughtful and not as [you]110-joan were before . [I]0-i see it now . Why did [you]110-joan not tell [us]2619-us about it ? ”[0-i] “ It was not permitted . It is permitted now , and soon [I]0-i shall tell all . But only [you]110-joan , now . It must remain a secret for a few days still . ”[0-i] “ Has [none]367-none seen that white shadow before but [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] “ [No one]284-no one . It has fallen upon [me]0-i before when [you]110-joan and [others]506-others were present , but [none]367-none could see it . To - day it has been otherwise , and [I]0-i was told why ; but it will not be visible again to any . ”[0-i] “ It was a sign to [me]0-i , then — and a sign with a meaning of some kind ? ”[0-i] “ Yes , but [I]0-i may not speak of that . ”[0-i] “ Strange — that that dazzling light could rest upon an object before [one]461-one ’s eyes and not be visible . ”[0-i] “ With it comes speech , also . [Several saints come , attended by myriads of angels]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels , and [they]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels speak to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i hear [their]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels voices , but [others]506-others do not . [They]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels are very dear to [me]0-i — [my]0-i Voices ; that is what [I]0-i call [them]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels to [myself]0-i . ”[0-i] “ [Joan]110-joan , what do [they]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels tell [you]110-joan ? ”[0-i] “ All manner of things — about [France]4-france , [I]0-i mean . ”[0-i] “ What things have [they]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels been used to tell [you]110-joan ? ”[963-her] [She]963-her sighed , and said : “ Disasters — only disasters , and misfortunes , and humiliation . There was naught else to foretell . ”[963-her] “ [They]2625-several saints come , attended by myriads of angels spoke of them to [you]110-joan beforehand ? ”[0-i] “ Yes . So that [I]963-her knew what was going to happen before it happened . It made [me]963-her grave — as [you]110-joan saw . It could not be otherwise . But always there was a word of hope , too . More than that : [France]4-france was to be rescued , and made great and free again . But how and by whom — that was not told . Not until to - day . ”[963-her] As [she]963-her said those last words a sudden deep glow shone in [her]963-her eyes , which [I]0-i was to see there many times in after - days when the bugles sounded the charge and learn to call it the battle - light . [Her]963-her breast heaved , and the color rose in [her]963-her face . “ But to - day [I]0-i know . [God]140-god has chosen the meanest of [[His]140-god creatures]2627-his creatures for this work ; and by [His]140-god command , and in [His]140-god protection , and by [His]140-god strength , not [mine]0-i , [I]0-i am to lead [His]140-god armies , and win back [France]4-france , and set the crown upon the head of [[His]140-god servant]2628-his servant that is [Dauphin]162-the dauphin and shall be [King]2629-king . ”[0-i] [I]0-i was amazed , and said : “ [You]0-i , [Joan]110-joan ? [You]0-i , [a child]327-a child , lead armies ? ”[0-i] “ Yes . For one little moment or two the thought crushed [me]0-i ; for it is as [you]110-joan say — [I]0-i am only [a child]327-a child ; [a child and ignorant]2632-a child and ignorant — ignorant of everything that pertains to war , and not fitted for the rough life of [camps]2633-camps and the companionship of [soldiers]2473-soldiers . But those weak moments passed ; [they]2635-they will not come again . [I]0-i am enlisted , [I]0-i will not turn back , [God]140-god helping [me]0-i , till the English grip is loosed from the throat of [France]4-france . [[My]0-i Voices]2636-my voices have never told [me]0-i lies , [they]2636-my voices have not lied to - day .
