[They]2636-my voices say [I]0-i am to go to [Robert de Baudricourt]163-robert de baudricourt , [governor of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]2637-governor of vaucouleurs , and [he]163-robert de baudricourt will give [me]0-i [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms for escort and send [me]0-i to [the King]270-the king . A year from now a blow will be struck which will be the beginning of the end , and the end will follow swiftly . ”[0-i] “ Where will it be struck ? ”[0-i] “ [[My]0-i Voices]2636-my voices have not said ; nor what will happen this present year , before it is struck . It is appointed [me]0-i to strike it , that is all [I]0-i know ; and follow it with [others]506-others , sharp and swift , undoing in ten weeks [England]24-england ’s long years of costly labor , and setting the crown upon the [Dauphin]162-the dauphin ’s head — for such is [God]140-god ’s will ; [[my]0-i Voices]2636-my voices have said it , and shall [I]0-i doubt it ? No ; it will be as [they]2636-my voices have said , for [they]2636-my voices say only that which is true . ”[0-i] These were tremendous sayings . They were impossibilities to [my]0-i reason , but to [my]0-i heart they rang true ; and so , while [my]0-i reason doubted , [my]0-i heart believed — believed , and held fast to the belief from that day . Presently [I]0-i said : “ [Joan]110-joan , [I]0-i believe the things which [you]110-joan have said , and now [I]0-i am glad that [I]0-i am to march with [you]110-joan to the great wars — that is , if it is with [you]110-joan [I]0-i am to march when [I]0-i go . ”[0-i] [She]964-she looked surprised , and said : “ It is true that [you]0-i will be with [me]964-she when [I]964-she go to the wars , but how did [you]0-i know ? ”[964-she] “ [I]964-she shall march with [you]110-joan , and so also will [Jean]115-jeanne and [Pierre]132-pierre , but not [Jacques]130-jacques . ”[964-she] “ All true — it is so ordered , as was revealed to [me]0-i lately , but [I]0-i did not know until to - day that [the marching]2643-the marching would be with [me]0-i , or that [I]0-i should march at all . How did [you]964-she know these things ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i told [her]964-she when it was that [she]964-she had said them . But [she]964-she did not remember about it . So then [I]0-i knew that [she]964-she had been asleep , or in a trance or an ecstasy of some kind , at that time . [She]964-she bade [me]0-i keep these and the other revelations to [myself]0-i for the present , and [I]0-i said [I]0-i would , and kept the faith [I]0-i promised . None who met [Joan]110-joan that day failed to notice the change that had come over [her]110-joan . [She]110-joan moved and spoke with energy and decision ; there was a strange new fire in [her]110-joan eye , and also a something wholly new and remarkable in [her]110-joan carriage and in the set of [her]110-joan head . This new light in the eye and this new bearing were born of the authority and leadership which had this day been vested in [her]110-joan by the decree of [God]140-god , and [they]965-they asserted that authority as plainly as speech could have done it , yet without ostentation or bravado . This calm consciousness of command , and calm unconscious outward expression of it , remained with [her]110-joan thenceforth until [her]110-joan mission was accomplished . Like [the other villagers]966-the other villagers , [she]110-joan had always accorded [me]0-i the deference due [my]0-i rank ; but now , without word said on either side , [she]110-joan and [I]0-i changed places ; [she]110-joan gave orders , not suggestions . [I]0-i received them with the deference due [a superior]967-a superior , and obeyed [them]965-they without comment . In the evening [she]110-joan said to [me]0-i : “ [I]110-joan leave before dawn . [No one]284-no one will know it but [you]0-i . [I]110-joan go to speak with [the governor of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]2645-the governor of vaucouleurs as commanded , who will despise [me]110-joan and treat [me]110-joan rudely , and perhaps refuse [my]110-joan prayer at this time . [I]110-joan go first to [Burey]44-burey , to persuade [[my]110-joan uncle]2646-my uncle [Laxart]164-laxart to go with [me]110-joan , it not being meet that [I]110-joan go alone . [I]110-joan may need [you]0-i in [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs ; for if [the governor]2647-the governor will not receive [me]110-joan [I]110-joan will dictate a letter to [him]2647-the governor , and so must have some one by [me]110-joan who knows the art of how to write and spell the words . [You]0-i will go from here to - morrow in the afternoon , and remain in [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs until [I]110-joan need [you]0-i . ”[110-joan] [I]0-i said [I]0-i would obey , and [she]968-she went [her]968-she way . [You]969-you see how clear a head [she]968-she had , and what a just and level judgment . [She]968-she did not order [me]0-i to go with [her]968-she ; no , [she]968-she would not subject [her]968-she good name to gossiping remark . [She]968-she knew that [the governor]2647-the governor , being [a noble]971-a noble , would grant [me]0-i , [another noble]972-another noble , audience ; but no , [you]969-you see , [she]968-she would not have that , either . [A poor peasant - girl]973-a poor peasant - girl presenting a petition through [a young nobleman]974-a young nobleman — how would that look ? [She]968-she always protected [her]968-she modesty from hurt ; and so , for reward , [she]968-she carried [her]968-she good name unsmirched to the end . [I]0-i knew what [I]0-i must do now , if [I]0-i would have [her]968-she approval : go to [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs , keep out of [her]968-she sight , and be ready when wanted . [I]0-i went the next afternoon , and took [an obscure lodging]975-an obscure lodging ; the next day [I]0-i called at [the castle]976-the castle and paid [my]0-i respects to [the governor]2647-the governor , who invited [me]0-i to dine with [him]2647-the governor at noon of the following day . [He]2647-the governor was [an ideal soldier of the time]978-an ideal soldier of the time ; tall , brawny , gray - headed , rough , full of strange oaths acquired here and there and yonder in the wars and treasured as if they were decorations . [He]2647-the governor had been used to [the camp]979-the camp all [his]2647-the governor life , and to [his]2647-the governor notion war was [God]140-god ’s best gift to [man]577-man . [He]2647-the governor had [his]2647-the governor steel cuirass on , and wore boots that came above [his]2647-the governor knees , and was equipped with a huge sword ; and when [I]0-i looked at [this martial figure]981-this martial figure , and heard the marvelous oaths , and guessed how little of poetry and sentiment might be looked for in this quarter , [I]0-i hoped [the little peasant - girl]982-the little peasant - girl would not get the privilege of confronting [this battery]983-this battery , but would have to content [herself]982-the little peasant - girl with the dictated letter . [I]0-i came again to [the castle]976-the castle the next day at noon , and was conducted to [the great dining - hall]985-the great dining - hall and seated by the side of [the governor]2647-the governor at a small table which was raised a couple of steps higher than the general table . At the small table sat [several other guests]987-several other guests besides [myself]0-i , and at the general table sat [the chief officers of [the garrison]989-the garrison]988-the chief officers of the garrison . At the entrance door stood [a guard of halberdiers , in morion and breastplate]990-a guard of halberdiers , in morion and breastplate . As for talk , there was but one topic , of course — the desperate situation of [France]4-france . There was a rumor , [some one]2506-some one said , that [Salisbury]165-salisbury was making preparations to march against [Orleans]39-orleans . It raised a turmoil of excited conversation , and opinions fell thick and fast . [Some]505-some believed [he]165-salisbury would march at once , others that [he]165-salisbury could not accomplish the investment before fall , others that the siege would be long , and bravely contested ; but upon one thing all voices agreed : that [Orleans]39-orleans must eventually fall , and with it [France]4-france . With that , the prolonged discussion ended , and there was silence . [Every man]993-every man seemed to sink [himself]993-every man in [his]993-every man own thoughts , and to forget where [he]993-every man was . This sudden and profound stillness , where before had been so much animation , was impressive and solemn . Now came [a servant]994-a servant and whispered something to [the governor]2647-the governor , who said : “ Would talk with [me]994-a servant ? ”[994-a servant] “ Yes , [[your]2647-the governor Excellency]2648-your excellency . ”[994-a servant] “ H’m ! A strange idea , certainly . Bring [them]997-the great people in . ”[994-a servant] It was [Joan]110-joan and [[her]110-joan uncle]996-her uncle [Laxart]164-laxart . At the spectacle of [the great people]997-the great people the courage oozed out of [the poor old peasant]998-the poor old peasant and [he]998-the poor old peasant stopped midway and would come no further , but remained there with [his]998-the poor old peasant red nightcap crushed in [his]998-the poor old peasant hands and bowing humbly here , there , and everywhere , stupefied with embarrassment and fear . But [Joan]110-joan came steadily forward , erect and self - possessed , and stood before [the governor]2647-the governor . [She]110-joan recognized [me]0-i , but in no way indicated it . There was a buzz of admiration , even [the governor]2647-the governor contributing to it , for [I]0-i heard [him]2647-the governor mutter , “ By [God]140-god ’s grace , it is [a beautiful creature]2649-a beautiful creature ! ”[2647-the governor] [He]2647-the governor inspected [her]110-joan critically a moment or two , then said : “ Well , what is [your]110-joan errand , [[my]2647-the governor child]2372-my child ? ”[2647-the governor] “ [My]2647-the governor message is to [you]110-joan , [Robert de Baudricourt]163-robert de baudricourt , [governor of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]2637-governor of vaucouleurs , and it is this : that [you]110-joan will send and tell [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin to wait and not give battle to [[his]2565-the dauphin enemies]2653-his enemies , for [God]140-god will presently send [him]2565-the dauphin help . ”[2647-the governor] This strange speech amazed [the company]639-the company , and [many]1002-many murmured , “ [The poor young thing]2654-the poor young thing is demented . ”[1002-many] [The governor]2647-the governor scowled , and said : “ What nonsense is this ? [The King]270-the king — or [the Dauphin]162-the dauphin , as [you]110-joan call [him]2565-the dauphin — needs no message of that sort . [He]2565-the dauphin will wait , give [yourself]110-joan no uneasiness as to that . What further do [you]110-joan desire to say to [me]2647-the governor ? ”[2647-the governor] “ This . To beg that [you]110-joan will give [me]2647-the governor an escort of [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms and send [me]2647-the governor to [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin . ”[2647-the governor] “ What for ? ”[2647-the governor] “ That [he]2565-the dauphin may make [me]2647-the governor [[his]2565-the dauphin general]2658-his general , for it is appointed that [I]2647-the governor shall drive [the English]2659-the english out of [France]4-france , and set the crown upon [his]2565-the dauphin head . ”[2647-the governor] “ What — [you]2647-the governor ? Why , [you]2647-the governor are but [a child]327-a child ! ”[2647-the governor] “ Yet am [I]2647-the governor appointed to do it , nevertheless . ”[2647-the governor] “ Indeed ! And when will all this happen ? ”[2647-the governor] “ Next year [he]2565-the dauphin will be crowned , and after that will remain [master of [France]4-france]2661-master of france . ”[2647-the governor] There was a great and general burst of laughter , and when it had subsided [the governor]2647-the governor said : “ Who has sent [you]2647-the governor with these extravagant messages ? ”[2647-the governor] “ [[My]2647-the governor Lord]2662-my lord . ”[2647-the governor] “ [What Lord]2663-what lord ? ”[2647-the governor] “ [The King of [Heaven]45-heaven]2664-the king of heaven . ”[166-many] [Many]166-many murmured , “ Ah , [poor thing]2665-poor thing , poor thing ! ”[166-many] and others , “ Ah , [her]2665-poor thing mind is but a wreck ! ”[2647-the governor] [The governor]2647-the governor hailed [Laxart]164-laxart , and said : “ Harkye!—take [this mad child]2666-this mad child home and whip [her]2665-poor thing soundly . That is the best cure for [her]2665-poor thing ailment . ”[2647-the governor] As [Joan]110-joan was moving away [she]110-joan turned and said , with simplicity : “ [You]2647-the governor refuse [me]110-joan [the soldiers]2667-the soldiers , [I]110-joan know not why , for it is [[my]110-joan Lord]2662-my lord that has commanded [you]2647-the governor . Yes , it is [He]2662-my lord that has made the command ; therefore [I]110-joan must come again , and yet again ; then [I]110-joan shall have [the men - at - arms]2669-the men - at - arms . ”[110-joan] There was a great deal of wondering talk , after [she]110-joan was gone ; and [the guards]1006-the guards and [servants]1007-servants passed the talk to [the town]786-the town , [the town]786-the town passed it to [the country]315-the country ; [Domremy]1-domremy was already buzzing with it when [we]1011-we got back . Chapter 8 Why [the Scorners]109-the scorners Relented HUMAN NATURE is the same everywhere : it defies success , it has nothing but scorn for defeat . [The village]401-the village considered that [Joan]110-joan had disgraced [it]401-the village with [her]110-joan grotesque performance and its ridiculous failure ; so all the tongues were busy with the matter , and as bilious and bitter as [they]1013-they were busy ; insomuch that if the tongues had been teeth [she]110-joan would not have survived [her]110-joan persecutions . [Those persons who did not scold]1014-those persons who did not scold did what was worse and harder to bear ; for [they]1014-those persons who did not scold ridiculed [her]110-joan , and mocked at [her]110-joan , and ceased neither day nor night from [their]1014-those persons who did not scold witticisms and jeerings and laughter . [Haumette]149-haumette and [Little Mengette]138-little mengette and [I]0-i stood by [her]110-joan , but the storm was too strong for [[her]110-joan other friends]1015-her other friends , and [they]1015-her other friends avoided [her]110-joan , being ashamed to be seen with [her]110-joan because [she]110-joan was so unpopular , and because of the sting of the taunts that assailed [them]1015-her other friends on [her]110-joan account . [She]110-joan shed tears in secret , but none in public . In public [she]110-joan carried [herself]110-joan with serenity , and showed no distress , nor any resentment — conduct which should have softened the feeling against [her]110-joan , but it did not . [[Her]110-joan father]650-her father was so incensed that [he]650-her father could not talk in measured terms about [her]110-joan wild project of going to the wars like [a man]2329-a man . [He]650-her father had dreamed of [her]110-joan doing such a thing , some time before , and now [he]650-her father remembered that dream with apprehension and anger , and said that rather than see [her]110-joan unsex [herself]110-joan and go away with the armies , [he]650-her father would require [[her]110-joan brothers]1018-her brothers to drown [her]110-joan ; and that if [they]1018-her brothers should refuse , [he]650-her father would do it with [his]650-her father own hands . But none of these things shook [her]110-joan purpose in the least . [[Her]110-joan parents]1019-her parents kept a strict watch upon [her]110-joan to keep [her]110-joan from leaving [the village]401-the village , but [she]110-joan said [her]110-joan time was not yet ; that when the time to go was come [she]110-joan should know it , and then [the keepers]1021-the keepers would watch in vain . The summer wasted along ; and when it was seen that [her]110-joan purpose continued steadfast , [the parents]1022-the parents were glad of a chance which finally offered itself for bringing [her]110-joan projects to an end through marriage . [The Paladin]157-the paladin had the effrontery to pretend that [she]110-joan had engaged [herself]110-joan to [him]157-the paladin several years before , and now [he]157-the paladin claimed a ratification of the engagement . [She]110-joan said [his]157-the paladin statement was not true , and refused to marry [him]157-the paladin . [She]110-joan was cited to appear before [the ecclesiastical court at [Toul]46-toul]1023-the ecclesiastical court at toul to answer for [her]110-joan perversity ; when [she]110-joan declined to have [counsel]1024-counsel , and elected to conduct [her]110-joan case [herself]110-joan , [[her]110-joan parents]1019-her parents and [all [her]110-joan ill - wishers]1026-all her ill - wishers rejoiced , and looked upon [her]110-joan as already defeated . And that was natural enough ; for who would expect that [an ignorant peasant - girl of sixteen]1027-an ignorant peasant - girl of sixteen would be otherwise than frightened and tongue - tied when standing for the first time in presence of [the practised doctors of the law]1028-the practised doctors of the law , and surrounded by the cold solemnities of [a court]1029-a court ? Yet [all these people]1030-all these people were mistaken . [They]1030-all these people flocked to [Toul]46-toul to see and enjoy this fright and embarrassment and defeat , and [they]1030-all these people had [their]1030-all these people trouble for [their]1030-all these people pains . [She]110-joan was modest , tranquil , and quite at [her]110-joan ease . [She]110-joan called [no witnesses]1031-no witnesses , saying [she]110-joan would content [herself]110-joan with examining [the witnesses for the prosecution]1032-the witnesses for the prosecution . When [they]1030-all these people had testified , [she]110-joan rose and reviewed [their]1030-all these people testimony in a few words , pronounced it vague , confused , and of no force , then [she]110-joan placed [the Paladin]732-the paladin again on the stand and began to search [him]732-the paladin . [His]732-the paladin previous testimony went rag by rag to ruin under [her]110-joan ingenious hands , until at last [he]732-the paladin stood bare , so to speak , [he]732-the paladin that had come so richly clothed in fraud and falsehood . [[His]732-the paladin counsel]1034-his counsel began an argument , but [the court]389-the court declined to hear it , and threw out the case , adding a few words of grave compliment for [Joan]110-joan , and referring to [her]110-joan as “ [this marvelous child]2670-this marvelous child . ”[110-joan] After this victory , with this high praise from [so imposing a source]1036-so imposing a source added , [the fickle village]1037-the fickle village turned again , and gave [Joan]110-joan countenance , compliment , and peace . [[Her]110-joan mother]296-her mother took [her]110-joan back to [her]296-her mother heart , and even [[her]110-joan father]650-her father relented and said [he]650-her father was proud of [her]110-joan . But the time hung heavy on [her]110-joan hands , nevertheless , for the siege of [Orleans]39-orleans was begun , the clouds lowered darker and darker over [France]4-france , and still [her]110-joan Voices said wait , and gave [her]110-joan no direct commands . The winter set in , and wore tediously along ; but at last there was a change . BOOK II IN [COURT AND CAMP]47-court and camp Chapter 1 [Joan]110-joan Says Good - By THE 5th of January , 1429 , [Joan]110-joan came to [me]0-i with [[her]110-joan uncle]996-her uncle [Laxart]164-laxart , and said : “ The time is come . [My]110-joan Voices are not vague now , but clear , and [they]2671-they have told [me]110-joan what to do . In two months [I]110-joan shall be with [the Dauphin]162-the dauphin . ”[110-joan] [Her]110-joan spirits were high , and [her]110-joan bearing martial . [I]0-i caught the infection and felt a great impulse stirring in [me]0-i that was like what [one]461-one feels when [he]461-one hears the roll of the drums and the tramp of [marching men]1042-marching men . “ [I]0-i believe it , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ [I]164-laxart also believe it , ”[164-laxart] said [Laxart]164-laxart . “ If [she]110-joan had told [me]164-laxart before , that [she]110-joan was commanded of [God]140-god to rescue [France]4-france , [I]164-laxart should not have believed ; [I]164-laxart should have let [her]110-joan seek [the governor]2647-the governor by [her]110-joan own ways and held [myself]164-laxart clear of meddling in the matter , not doubting [she]110-joan was mad . But [I]164-laxart have seen [her]110-joan stand before [those nobles]2673-those nobles and [mighty men]2674-mighty men unafraid , and say [her]110-joan say ; and [she]110-joan had not been able to do that but by the help of [God]140-god . That [I]164-laxart know . Therefore with all humbleness [I]164-laxart am at [her]110-joan command , to do with [me]164-laxart as [she]110-joan will . ”[164-laxart] “ [[My]110-joan uncle]2646-my uncle is very good to [me]110-joan , ”[110-joan] [Joan]110-joan said . “ [I]110-joan sent and asked [him]2646-my uncle to come and persuade [[my]110-joan mother]2609-my mother to let [him]2646-my uncle take [me]110-joan [home]377-home with [him]2646-my uncle to tend [[his]2646-my uncle wife]412-his wife , who is not well . It is arranged , and [we]2679-we go at dawn to - morrow . From [[his]2646-my uncle house]2680-his house [I]110-joan shall go soon to [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs , and wait and strive until [my]110-joan prayer is granted . Who were [the two cavaliers who sat to [your]110-joan left at [the governor]2647-the governor ’s table]2681-the two cavaliers who sat to your left at the governor ’s table that day ? ”[110-joan] “ [One]461-one was [the Sieur Jean de Novelonpont de Metz]167-jean , the other [the Sieur Bertrand de Poulengy]168-the sieur bertrand . ”[164-laxart] “ Good metal — good metal , both . [I]0-i marked [them]2681-the two cavaliers who sat to your left at the governor ’s table for [men of [mine]0-i]2684-men of mine .... What is it [I]0-i see in [your]1043-you face ? Doubt ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i was teaching [myself]0-i to speak the truth to [her]1043-you , not trimming it or polishing it ; so [I]0-i said : “ [They]2681-the two cavaliers who sat to your left at the governor ’s table considered [you]1043-you out of [your]1043-you head , and said so . It is true [they]2681-the two cavaliers who sat to your left at the governor ’s table pitied [you]1043-you for being in such misfortune , but still [they]2681-the two cavaliers who sat to your left at the governor ’s table held [you]1043-you to be mad . ”[0-i] This did not seem to trouble [her]1043-you in any way or wound [her]1043-you . [She]1043-you only said : “ [The wise]2685-the wise change [their]2685-the wise minds when [they]2685-the wise perceive that [they]2685-the wise have been in error . [These]2685-the wise will . [They]2685-the wise will march with [me]1043-you . [I]1043-you shall see [them]2685-the wise presently .... [You]0-i seem to doubt again ? Do [you]0-i doubt ? ”[1043-you] “ N - no . Not now . [I]1044-i was remembering that it was a year ago , and that [they]2685-the wise did not belong [here]2531-here , but only chanced to stop a day on [their]2685-the wise journey . ”[1044-i] “ [They]2685-the wise will come again . But as to matters now in hand ; [I]1044-i came to leave with [you]1043-you some instructions . [You]1043-you will follow [me]1044-i in a few days . Order [your]1043-you affairs , for [you]1043-you will be absent long . ”[1044-i] “ Will [Jean]167-jean and [Pierre]132-pierre go with [me]1044-i ? ”[1044-i] “ No ; [they]2685-the wise would refuse now , but presently [they]2685-the wise will come , and with [them]2685-the wise [they]2685-the wise will bring [[my]1044-i parents]2687-my parents ’ blessing , and likewise [their]2685-the wise consent that [I]1044-i take up [my]1044-i mission . [I]1044-i shall be stronger , then — stronger for that ; for lack of it [I]1044-i am weak now . ”[1044-i] [She]1044-i paused a little while , and the tears gathered in [her]1044-i eyes ; then [she]1044-i went on : “ [I]1044-i would say good - by to [Little Mengette]138-little mengette . Bring [her]2688-her outside [the village]401-the village at dawn ; [she]2688-her must go with [me]1044-i a little of the way — ”[1044-i] “ And [Haumette]149-haumette ? ”[1044-i] [She]1044-i broke down and began to cry , saying : “ No , oh , no — [she]2688-her is too dear to [me]1044-i , [I]1044-i could not bear it , knowing [I]1044-i should never look upon [her]2688-her face again . ”[1044-i] Next morning [I]0-i brought [Mengette]138-little mengette , and [we]1045-we four walked along [the road]840-the road in the cold dawn till [the village]401-the village was far behind ; then [the two girls]1048-the two girls said [their]1048-the two girls good - bys , clinging about [each other]1049-each other ’s neck , and pouring out [their]1048-the two girls grief in loving words and tears , a pitiful sight to see . And [Joan]110-joan took one long look back upon [the distant village]1050-the distant village , and the Fairy Tree , and [the oak forest]948-the oak forest , and [the flowery plain]1052-the flowery plain , and [the river]454-the river , as if [she]110-joan was trying to print these scenes on [her]110-joan memory so that they would abide there always and not fade , for [she]110-joan knew [she]110-joan would not see them any more in this life ; then [she]110-joan turned , and went from [us]1045-we , sobbing bitterly . It was [her]110-joan birthday and [mine]1054-mine . [She]110-joan was seventeen years old . Chapter 2 [The Governor Speeds Joan]110-joan After a few days , [Laxart]164-laxart took [Joan]110-joan to [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs , and found lodging and guardianship for [her]110-joan with [Catherine Royer]170-catherine royer , [[a wheelwright]1055-a wheelwright ’s wife]1056-a wheelwright ’s wife , [an honest and good woman]1057-an honest and good woman . [Joan]110-joan went to mass regularly , [she]110-joan helped do the housework , earning [her]110-joan keep in that way , and if any wished to talk with [her]110-joan about [her]110-joan mission — and [many]1002-many did — [she]110-joan talked freely , making no concealments regarding the matter now . [I]0-i was soon housed near by , and witnessed the effects which followed . At once the tidings spread that [a young girl]1059-a young girl was come who was appointed of [God]140-god to save [France]4-france . [The common people]1060-the common people flocked in [crowds]1061-crowds to look at [her]1059-a young girl and speak with [her]1059-a young girl , and [her]1059-a young girl fair young loveliness won the half of [their]1060-the common people belief , and [her]1059-a young girl deep earnestness and transparent sincerity won the other half . [The well - to - do]1062-the well - to - do remained away and scoffed , but that is [their]1062-the well - to - do way . Next , a prophecy of [Merlin]171-merlin ’s , more than eight hundred years old , was called to mind , which said that in a far future time [France]4-france would be lost by [a woman]1063-a woman and restored by [a woman]1063-a woman . [France]4-france was now , for the first time , lost — and by [a woman]1063-a woman , [Isabel of Bavaria]172-isabel of bavaria , [[her]171-merlin base Queen]1066-her base queen ; doubtless [this fair and pure young girl]1067-this fair and pure young girl was commissioned of [Heaven]45-heaven to complete the prophecy . This gave [the growing interest]1068-the growing interest a new and powerful impulse ; the excitement rose higher and higher , and hope and faith along with it ; and so from [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs wave after wave of this inspiring enthusiasm flowed out over [the land]1069-the land , far and wide , invading all [the villages]1070-the villages and refreshing and revivifying [the perishing children of [France]4-france]1071-the perishing children of france ; and from [these villages]1072-these villages came [[people]2327-people who wanted to see for [themselves]2327-people , hear for [themselves]2327-people]1074-people who wanted to see for themselves , hear for themselves ; and [they]2327-people did see and hear , and believe . [They]2327-people filled [the town]786-the town ; [they]2327-people more than filled [it]786-the town ; [inns]1076-inns and [lodgings]1077-lodgings were packed , and yet [half of [the inflow]1079-the inflow]1078-half of the inflow had to go without shelter . And still [they]2327-people came , winter as it was , for when [a man]2329-a man ’s soul is starving , what does [he]2329-a man care for meat and roof so [he]2329-a man can but get that nobler hunger fed ? Day after day , and still day after day the great tide rose . [Domremy]1-domremy was dazed , amazed , stupefied , and said to [itself]1-domremy , “ Was [this world]345-this world - wonder in [our]1-domremy familiar midst all these years and [we]1-domremy too dull to see it ? ”[1-domremy] [Jean]167-jean and [Pierre]132-pierre went out from [the village]401-the village , stared at and envied like the great and fortunate of [the earth]474-the earth , and [their]2327-people progress to [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs was like a triumph , all the country - side flocking to see and salute [the brothers of one with whom [angels had spoken face to face]1084-angels had spoken face to face , and into whose hands by command of [God]140-god [they]2327-people had delivered the destinies of [France]4-france]1083-the brothers of one with whom angels had spoken face to face , and into whose hands by command of god they had delivered the destinies of france . [The brothers]1085-the brothers brought [the parents]1022-the parents ’ blessing and godspeed to [Joan]110-joan , and [their]1085-the brothers promise to bring it to [her]110-joan in person later ; and so , with this culminating happiness in [her]110-joan heart and the high hope it inspired , [she]110-joan went and confronted [the governor]2647-the governor again . But [he]2647-the governor was no more tractable than [he]2647-the governor had been before . [He]2647-the governor refused to send [her]110-joan to [the King]270-the king . [She]110-joan was disappointed , but in no degree discouraged . [She]110-joan said : “ [I]110-joan must still come to [you]2647-the governor until [I]110-joan get [the men - at - arms]2669-the men - at - arms ; for so it is commanded , and [I]110-joan may not disobey . [I]110-joan must go to [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin , though [I]110-joan go on [my]110-joan knees . ”[110-joan] [I]0-i and [the two brothers]1089-the two brothers were with [Joan]110-joan daily , to see [the people that came]1090-the people that came and hear what [they]1090-the people that came said ; and one day , sure enough , [the Sieur Jean de Metz]167-jean came . [He]2647-the governor talked with [her]110-joan in a petting and playful way , as [one]461-one talks with [children]550-children , and said : “ What are [you]110-joan doing here , [[my]2647-the governor little maid]2693-my little maid ? Will [they]1089-the two brothers drive [the King]270-the king out of [France]4-france , and shall [we]2695-we all turn English ? ”[2647-the governor] [She]110-joan answered [him]2647-the governor in [her]110-joan tranquil , serious way : “ [I]110-joan am come to bid [Robert de Baudricourt]163-robert de baudricourt take or send [me]110-joan to [the King]270-the king , but [he]270-the king does not heed [my]110-joan words . ”[110-joan] “ Ah , [you]110-joan have an admirable persistence , truly ; a whole year has not turned [you]110-joan from [your]110-joan wish . [I]110-joan saw [you]110-joan when [you]110-joan came before . ”[110-joan] [Joan]110-joan said , as tranquilly as before : “ It is not a wish , it is a purpose . [He]270-the king will grant it . [I]110-joan can wait . ”[110-joan] “ Ah , perhaps it will not be wise to make too sure of that , [[my]110-joan child]2372-my child . [These governors]2698-these governors are [stubborn people to deal with]2699-stubborn people to deal with . In case [he]270-the king shall not grant [your]110-joan prayer — ”[110-joan] “ [He]270-the king will grant it . [He]270-the king must . It is not a matter of choice . ”[1093-the gentleman] [The gentleman]1093-the gentleman ’s playful mood began to disappear — [one]461-one could see that , by [his]1093-the gentleman face . [Joan]110-joan ’s earnestness was affecting [him]1093-the gentleman . It always happened that [[people]2327-people who began in jest with [her]110-joan]1096-people who began in jest with her ended by being in earnest . [They]2327-people soon began to perceive depths in [her]110-joan that [they]2327-people had not suspected ; and then [her]110-joan manifest sincerity and the rocklike steadfastness of [her]110-joan convictions were forces which cowed levity , and it could not maintain its self - respect in [their]2327-people presence . [The Sieur de Metz]167-jean was thoughtful for a moment or two , then [he]1093-the gentleman began , quite soberly : “ Is it necessary that [you]110-joan go to [the King]270-the king soon?—that is , [I]1093-the gentleman mean — ”[1093-the gentleman] “ Before Mid - Lent , even though [I]110-joan wear away [my]110-joan legs to the knees ! ”[110-joan] [She]110-joan said it with that sort of repressed fieriness that means so much when [a person]467-a person ’s heart is in a thing . [You]1098-you could see the response in [that nobleman]1099-that nobleman ’s face ; [you]1098-you could see [his]1099-that nobleman eye light up ; there was sympathy there . [He]1093-the gentleman said , most earnestly : “ [God]140-god knows [I]1093-the gentleman think [you]110-joan should have [the men - at - arms]2669-the men - at - arms , and that somewhat would come of it . What is it that [you]110-joan would do ? What is [your]110-joan hope and purpose ? ”[1093-the gentleman] “ To rescue [France]4-france . And it is appointed that [I]1093-the gentleman shall do it . For [no one else in [the world]320-the world]2702-no one else in the world , [neither kings]2704-neither kings , nor [dukes]2705-dukes , [no any other]2706-no any other , can recover [the kingdom of]2707-the kingdom of [France]4-france , and there is no help but in [me]1093-the gentleman . ”[1093-the gentleman] The words had a pleading and pathetic sound , and they touched [that good nobleman]1100-that good nobleman . [I]0-i saw it plainly . [Joan]110-joan dropped [her]110-joan voice a little , and said : “ But indeed [I]110-joan would rather spin with [[my]110-joan poor mother]2708-my poor mother , for this is not [my]110-joan calling ; but [I]110-joan must go and do it , for it is [[my]110-joan [Lord]2710-lord]2662-my lord ’s will . ”[110-joan] “ Who is [[your]110-joan Lord]2711-your lord ? ”[110-joan] “ [He]2711-your lord is [God]140-god . ”[110-joan] Then the [Sieur de Metz]167-jean , following the impressive old feudal fashion , knelt and laid [his]1101-his hands within [Joan]110-joan ’s in sign of fealty , and made oath that by [God]140-god ’s help [he]1101-his [himself]1101-his would take [her]110-joan to [the king]270-the king . The next day came [the Sieur Bertrand de Poulengy]168-the sieur bertrand , and [he]1101-his also pledged [his]1101-his oath and knightly honor to abide with [her]110-joan and follow [her]110-joan witherosever [she]110-joan might lead . This day , too , toward evening , a great rumor went flying abroad through [the town]786-the town — namely , that [the very governor]1104-the very governor [himself]1104-the very governor was going to visit [the young girl]1105-the young girl in [[her]1105-the young girl humble lodgings]1106-her humble lodgings . So in the morning [the streets]361-the streets and [lanes]1108-lanes were packed with [people]2327-people waiting to see if this strange thing would indeed happen . And happen it did . [The governor]2647-the governor rode in state , attended by [[his]2647-the governor guards]1111-his guards , and the news of it went everywhere , and made a great sensation , and modified the scoffings of [the people of quality]1112-the people of quality and raised [Joan]110-joan ’s credit higher than ever . [The governor]2647-the governor had made up [his]2647-the governor mind to one thing : [Joan]110-joan was either [a witch]1114-a witch or [a saint]1115-a saint , and [he]2647-the governor meant to find out which it was . So [he]2647-the governor brought [a priest]1116-a priest with [him]2647-the governor to exorcise the devil that was in [her]110-joan in case there was [one there]1117-one there . [The priest]399-the priest performed [[his]399-the priest office]1119-his office , but found [no devil]1120-no devil . [He]2647-the governor merely hurt [Joan]110-joan ’s feelings and offended [her]110-joan piety without need , for [he]2647-the governor had already confessed [her]110-joan before this , and should have known , if [he]2647-the governor knew anything , that [devils]1121-devils can not abide the confessional , but utter cries of anguish and the most profane and furious cursings whenever [they]1121-devils are confronted with that holy office . [The governor]2647-the governor went away troubled and full of thought , and not knowing what to do . And while [he]2647-the governor pondered and studied , several days went by and the 14th of February was come . Then [Joan]110-joan went to [the castle]976-the castle and said : “ In [God]140-god ’s name , [Robert de Baudricourt]163-robert de baudricourt , [you]2647-the governor are too slow about sending [me]110-joan , and have caused damage thereby , for this day [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin ’s cause has lost a battle near [Orleans]39-orleans , and will suffer yet greater injury if [you]2647-the governor do not send [me]110-joan to [him]2565-the dauphin soon . ”[110-joan] [The governor]2647-the governor was perplexed by this speech , and said : “ To - day , [child]2713-child , to - day ? How can [you]2713-child know what has happened in [that region]2714-that region to - day ? It would take eight or ten days for the word to come . ”[2647-the governor] “ [[My]2647-the governor Voices]2636-my voices have brought the word to [me]2647-the governor , and it is true . A battle was lost to - day , and [you]2713-child are in fault to delay [me]2647-the governor so . ”[2647-the governor] [The governor]2647-the governor walked the floor awhile , talking within [himself]2647-the governor , but letting a great oath fall outside now and then ; and finally [he]2647-the governor said : “ Harkye ! go in peace , and wait . If it shall turn out as [you]2713-child say , [I]2647-the governor will give [you]2713-child the letter and send [you]2713-child to [the King]270-the king , and not otherwise . ”[2647-the governor] [Joan]110-joan said with fervor : “ Now [God]140-god be thanked , these waiting days are almost done . In nine days [you]2647-the governor will fetch [me]110-joan the letter . ”[110-joan] Already [the people of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]1126-the people of vaucouleurs had given [her]110-joan [a horse]1127-a horse and had armed and equipped [her]110-joan as [a soldier]2476-a soldier . [She]110-joan got no chance to try the horse and see if [she]110-joan could ride it , for [her]110-joan great first duty was to abide at [her]110-joan post and lift up the hopes and spirits of all who would come to talk with [her]110-joan , and prepare [them]1126-the people of vaucouleurs to help in the rescue and regeneration of [the kingdom]2582-the kingdom . This occupied every waking moment [she]110-joan had . But it was no matter . There was nothing [she]110-joan could not learn — and in the briefest time , too . [Her]110-joan horse would find this out in the first hour . Meantime [the brothers]1085-the brothers and [I]0-i took the horse in turn and began to learn to ride . And [we]1131-us had teaching in the use of the sword and other arms also . On the 20th [Joan]110-joan called [[her]110-joan small army]1132-her small army together — [the two knights]1133-the two knights and [[her]110-joan two brothers]1134-her two brothers and [me]0-i — for a private council of war . No , it was not a council , that is not the right name , for [she]110-joan did not consult with [us]1131-us , [she]110-joan merely gave [us]1131-us orders . [She]110-joan mapped out the course [she]110-joan would travel toward [the King]270-the king , and did it like [a person perfectly versed in geography]1136-a person perfectly versed in geography ; and this itinerary of daily marches was so arranged as to avoid here and [there peculiarly dangerous regions]1137-there peculiarly dangerous regions by flank movements — which showed that [she]110-joan knew [her]110-joan political geography as intimately as [she]110-joan knew [her]110-joan physical geography ; yet [she]110-joan had never had a day ’s schooling , of course , and was without education . [I]0-i was astonished , but thought [her]110-joan Voices must have taught [her]110-joan . But upon reflection [I]0-i saw that this was not so . By [her]110-joan references to what this and that and [the other person]1138-the other person had told [her]110-joan , [I]0-i perceived that [she]110-joan had been diligently questioning [those crowds of [visiting strangers]1140-visiting strangers]1139-those crowds of visiting strangers , and that out of [them]1139-those crowds of visiting strangers [she]110-joan had patiently dug all this mass of invaluable knowledge . [The two knights]1133-the two knights were filled with wonder at [her]110-joan good sense and sagacity . [She]110-joan commanded [us]1142-we to make preparations to travel by night and sleep by day in concealment , as almost the whole of [our]1142-we long journey would be through [[the enemy]2442-the enemy ’s country]1144-the enemy ’s country . Also , [she]110-joan commanded that [we]1142-we should keep the date of [our]1142-we departure a secret , since [she]110-joan meant to get away unobserved . Otherwise [we]1142-we should be sent off with a grand demonstration which would advertise [us]1142-we to [the enemy]2442-the enemy , and [we]1142-we should be ambushed and captured somewhere . Finally [she]110-joan said : “ Nothing remains , now , but that [I]110-joan confide to [you]2717-you the date of [our]1142-we departure , so that [you]2717-you may make all needful preparation in time , leaving nothing to be done in haste and badly at the last moment . [We]1142-we march the 23d , at eleven of the clock at night . ”[110-joan] Then [we]1142-we were dismissed . [The two knights]1133-the two knights were startled — yes , and troubled ; and [the Sieur Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand said : “ Even if [the governor]2647-the governor shall really furnish the letter and [the escort]2719-the escort , [he]2647-the governor still may not do it in time to meet the date [she]110-joan has chosen . Then how can [she]110-joan venture to name that date ? It is a great risk — a great risk to select and decide upon the date , in this state of uncertainty . ”[168-the sieur bertrand] [I]0-i said : “ Since [she]110-joan has named [the 23d]2720-the 23d , [we]1142-we may trust [her]110-joan . [The Voices]174-the voices have told [her]110-joan , [I]0-i think . [We]1142-we shall do best to obey . ”[0-i] [We]1142-we did obey . [[Joan]110-joan ’s parents]408-joan ’s parents were notified to come before the 23d , but prudence forbade that [they]408-joan ’s parents be told why this limit was named . All day , [the 23d]2720-the 23d , [she]110-joan glanced up wistfully whenever new bodies of [strangers]707-strangers entered [the house]630-the house , but [[her]110-joan parents]1019-her parents did not appear . Still [she]110-joan was not discouraged , but hoped on . But when night fell at last , [her]110-joan hopes perished , and the tears came ; however , [she]110-joan dashed them away , and said : “ It was to be so , no doubt ; no doubt it was so ordered ; [I]110-joan must bear it , and will . ”[110-joan] [De Metz]175-de metz tried to comfort [her]110-joan by saying : “ [The governor]2647-the governor sends no word ; it may be that [they]1085-the brothers will come to - morrow , and — ”[175-de metz] [He]1152-he got no further , for [she]110-joan interrupted [him]1152-he , saying : “ To what good end ? [We]2722-we start at eleven to - night . ”[110-joan] And it was so . At ten [the governor]2647-the governor came , with [his]2647-the governor guard and arms , with horses and equipment for [me]0-i and for [the brothers]1085-the brothers , and gave [Joan]110-joan a letter to [the King]270-the king . Then [he]2647-the governor took off [his]2647-the governor sword , and belted it about [her]110-joan waist with [his]2647-the governor own hands , and said : “ [You]110-joan said true , [child]2713-child . The battle was lost , on the day [you]110-joan said . So [I]2647-the governor have kept [my]2647-the governor word . Now go — come of it what may . ”[2647-the governor] [Joan]110-joan gave [him]2647-the governor thanks , and [he]2647-the governor went [his]2647-the governor way . The lost battle was the famous disaster that is called in history the Battle of [the Herrings]176-the herrings . All the lights in [the house]630-the house were at once put out , and a little while after , when [the streets]361-the streets had become dark and still , [we]1158-we crept stealthily through [them]361-the streets and out at the western gate and rode away under whip and spur . Chapter 3 [The Paladin]157-the paladin Groans and Boasts [WE]1158-we WERE twenty - five strong , and well equipped . [We]1158-we rode in double file , [Joan]110-joan and [[her]110-joan brothers]1018-her brothers in the center of the column , with [Jean de Metz]167-jean at the head of it and [the Sieur Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand at its extreme rear . In two or three hours [we]1158-we should be in [[the enemy]2442-the enemy ’s country]1144-the enemy ’s country , and then [none]367-none would venture to desert . By and by [we]1158-we began to hear groans and sobs and execrations from different points along the line , and upon inquiry found that [six of [[our]1158-we men]1164-our men]1163-six of our men were [peasants who had never ridden a horse before]1165-peasants who had never ridden a horse before , and were finding it very difficult to stay in [their]1163-six of our men saddles , and moreover were now beginning to suffer considerable bodily torture . [They]1163-six of our men had been seized by [the governor]2647-the governor at the last moment and pressed into the service to make up the tale , and [he]2647-the governor had placed [a veteran alongside of each]1167-a veteran alongside of each with orders to help [him]1167-a veteran alongside of each stick to the saddle , and kill [him]1167-a veteran alongside of each if [he]1167-a veteran alongside of each tried to desert . These poor devils had kept quiet as long as [they]1163-six of our men could , but [their]1163-six of our men physical miseries were become so sharp by this time that [they]1163-six of our men were obliged to give [them]1163-six of our men vent . But [we]1158-we were within [[the enemy]2442-the enemy ’s country]1144-the enemy ’s country now , so there was no help for [them]1163-six of our men , [they]1163-six of our men must continue the march , though [Joan]110-joan said that if [they]1163-six of our men chose to take the risk [they]1163-six of our men might depart . [They]1163-six of our men preferred to stay with [us]1158-we . [We]1158-we modified [our]1158-we pace now , and moved cautiously , and [the new men]1170-the new men were warned to keep [their]1170-the new men sorrows to [themselves]1170-the new men and not get the command into danger with [their]1170-the new men curses and lamentations . Toward dawn [we]1158-we rode deep into [a forest]954-a forest , and soon all but [the sentries]1172-the sentries were sound asleep in spite of the cold ground and the frosty air . [I]0-i woke at noon out of such a solid and stupefying sleep that at first [my]0-i wits were all astray , and [I]0-i did not know where [I]0-i was nor what had been happening . Then [my]0-i senses cleared , and [I]0-i remembered . As [I]0-i lay there thinking over the strange events of the past month or two the thought came into [my]0-i mind , greatly surprising [me]0-i , that one of [Joan]110-joan ’s prophecies had failed ; for where were [Noel]135-noel and [the Paladin]732-the paladin , who were to join [us]1158-we at the eleventh hour ? By this time , [you]1174-you see , [I]0-i had gotten used to expecting everything [Joan]110-joan said to come true . So , being disturbed and troubled by these thoughts , [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes . Well , there stood [the Paladin]157-the paladin leaning against a tree and looking down on [me]0-i ! How often that happens ; [you]1174-you think of [a person]467-a person , or speak of [a person]467-a person , and there [he]157-the paladin stands before [you]1174-you , and [you]1174-you not dreaming [he]157-the paladin is near . It looks as if [his]157-the paladin being near is really the thing that makes [you]1174-you think of [him]157-the paladin , and not just an accident , as [people]2327-people imagine . Well , be that as it may , there was [the Paladin]157-the paladin , anyway , looking down in [my]0-i face and waiting for [me]0-i to wake . [I]0-i was ever so glad to see [him]157-the paladin , and jumped up and shook [him]157-the paladin by the hand , and led [him]157-the paladin a little way from [the camp]979-the camp — [he]157-the paladin limping like a cripple — and told [him]157-the paladin to sit down , and said : “ Now , where have [you]157-the paladin dropped down from ? And how did [you]157-the paladin happen to light in [this place]2724-this place ? And what do [the soldier - clothes]2725-the soldier - clothes mean ? Tell [me]157-the paladin all about it . ”[157-the paladin] [He]157-the paladin answered : “ [I]157-the paladin marched with [you]0-i last night . ”[157-the paladin] “ No ! ”[0-i] ( To [myself]0-i [I]0-i said , “ The prophecy has not all failed — half of it has come true . ”[0-i] ) “ Yes , [I]0-i did . [I]0-i hurried up from [Domremy]1-domremy to join , and was within a half a minute of being too late . In fact , [I]0-i was too late , but [I]0-i begged so hard that [the governor]2647-the governor was touched by [my]0-i brave devotion to [[my]0-i country]2727-my country ’s cause — those are the words [he]2647-the governor used — and so [he]2647-the governor yielded , and allowed [me]0-i to come . ”[0-i] [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , this is a lie , [he]157-the paladin is one of those six [the governor recruited by force]1179-the governor recruited by force at the last moment ; [I]0-i know it , for [Joan]110-joan ’s prophecy said [he]157-the paladin would join at the eleventh hour , but not by [his]157-the paladin own desire . Then [I]0-i said aloud : “ [I]0-i am glad [you]157-the paladin came ; it is a noble cause , and [one]461-one should not sit at [home]377-home in times like these . ”[0-i] “ Sit at [home]377-home ! [I]0-i could no more do it than the thunderstone could stay hid in the clouds when the storm calls it . ”[0-i] “ That is the right talk . It sounds like [you]157-the paladin . ”[0-i] That pleased [him]157-the paladin . “ [I]0-i ’m glad [you]157-the paladin know [me]0-i . [Some]505-some do n’t . But [they]505-some will , presently . [They]505-some will know [me]0-i well enough before [I]0-i get done with this war . ”[0-i] “ That is what [I]157-the paladin think . [I]157-the paladin believe that wherever danger confronts [you]157-the paladin [you]157-the paladin will make [yourself]157-the paladin conspicuous . ”[157-the paladin] [He]157-the paladin was charmed with this speech , and it swelled [him]157-the paladin up like a bladder . [He]157-the paladin said : “ If [I]157-the paladin know [myself]157-the paladin — and [I]157-the paladin think [I]157-the paladin do — [my]157-the paladin performances in this campaign will give [you]157-the paladin occasion more than once to remember those words . ”[157-the paladin] “ [I]0-i were [a fool]2732-a fool to doubt it . That [I]0-i know . ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i shall not be at [my]0-i best , being but [a common soldier]2733-a common soldier ; still , [the country]315-the country will hear of [me]0-i . If [I]0-i were where [I]0-i belong ; if [I]0-i were in [the place of [La Hire]195-la hire]2735-the place of la hire , or [Saintrailles]40-saintrailles , or [the Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2736-the bastard of orleans — well , [I]0-i say nothing . [I]0-i am not of the talking kind , like [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel and [[his]135-noel sort]432-his sort , [I]0-i thank [God]140-god . But it will be something , [I]0-i take it — a novelty in [this world]345-this world , [I]0-i should say — to raise the fame of [a private soldier]2739-a private soldier above [theirs]2739-a private soldier , and extinguish the glory of [their]2739-a private soldier names with its shadow . ”[0-i] “ Why , look here , [[my]0-i friend]2740-my friend , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ do [you]2740-my friend know that [you]2740-my friend have hit out a most remarkable idea there ? Do [you]2740-my friend realize the gigantic proportions of it ? For look [you]2740-my friend ; to be [a general of vast renown]2741-a general of vast renown , what is that ? Nothing — history is clogged and confused with [them]2739-a private soldier ; [one]461-one can not keep [their]2739-a private soldier names in [his]461-one memory , there are so many . But [a common soldier of supreme renown]2743-a common soldier of supreme renown — why , [he]2743-a common soldier of supreme renown would stand alone ! [He]2743-a common soldier of supreme renown would the be one moon in a firmament of mustard - seed stars ; [his]2743-a common soldier of supreme renown name would outlast [the human race]2744-the human race ! [[My]0-i friend]2740-my friend , who gave [you]2740-my friend that idea ? ”[0-i] [He]1180-his was ready to burst with happiness , but [he]1180-his suppressed betrayal of it as well as [he]1180-his could . [He]1180-his simply waved the compliment aside with [his]1180-his hand and said , with complacency : “ It is nothing . [I]1180-his have them often — ideas like that — and even greater ones . [I]1180-his do not consider this one much . ”[1180-his] “ [You]2740-my friend astonish [me]1180-his ; [you]2740-my friend do , indeed . So it is really [your]2740-my friend own ? ”[1180-his] “ Quite . And there is plenty more where it came from”—tapping[1180-his] [his]1180-his head with [his]1180-his finger , and taking occasion at the same time to ca nt [his]1180-his morion over [his]1180-his right ear , which gave [him]1180-his a very self - satisfied air—“I do not need to borrow [my]1180-his ideas , like [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel . ”[1180-his] “ Speaking of [Noel]135-noel , when did [you]2740-my friend see [him]135-noel last ? ”[1180-his] “ Half an hour ago . [He]135-noel is sleeping yonder like a corpse . Rode with [us]2746-our last night . ”[0-i] [I]0-i felt a great upleap in [my]0-i heart , and said to [myself]0-i , now [I]0-i am at rest and glad ; [I]0-i will never doubt [her]1181-her prophecies again . Then [I]0-i said aloud : “ It gives [me]0-i joy . It makes [me]0-i proud of [[our]2746-our village]848-our village . There is not keeping [our]2746-our lion - hearts at [home]377-home in these great times , [I]0-i see that . ”[0-i] “ Lion - heart ! Who — [that baby]2749-that baby ? Why , [he]2749-that baby begged like a dog to be let off . Cried , and said [he]2749-that baby wanted to go to [[his]2749-that baby mother]2750-his mother . [Him]2749-that baby a lion - heart!—that tumble - bug ! ”[1180-his] “ Dear [me]0-i , why [I]0-i supposed [he]2749-that baby volunteered , of course . Did n’t [he]2749-that baby ? ”[0-i] “ Oh , yes , [he]2749-that baby volunteered the way [people]2327-people do to [the headsman]2752-the headsman . Why , when [he]2749-that baby found [I]0-i was coming up from [Domremy]1-domremy to volunteer , [he]2749-that baby asked [me]0-i to let [him]2749-that baby come along in [my]0-i protection , and see the crowds and the excitement . Well , [we]2753-we arrived and saw the torches filing out at [the Castle]976-the castle , and ran [there]460-there , and [the governor]2647-the governor had [him]2749-that baby seized , along with four more , and [he]2749-that baby begged to be let off , and [I]0-i begged for [his]2749-that baby place , and at last [the governor]2647-the governor allowed [me]0-i to join , but would n’t let [Noel]135-noel off , because [he]2647-the governor was disgusted with [him]135-noel , [he]135-noel was such [a cry - baby]2758-a cry - baby . Yes , and much good [he]135-noel ’ll do [the King]270-the king ’s service ; [he]135-noel ’ll eat for six and run for sixteen . [I]0-i hate [a pygmy with half a heart and nine stomachs]2760-a pygmy with half a heart and nine stomachs ! ”[0-i] “ Why , this is very surprising news to [me]1180-his , and [I]1180-his am sorry and disappointed to hear it . [I]1180-his thought [he]135-noel was [a very manly fellow]2761-a very manly fellow . ”[1180-his] [The Paladin]157-the paladin gave [me]0-i an outraged look , and said : “ [I]157-the paladin do n’t see how [you]0-i can talk like that , [I]157-the paladin ’m sure [I]157-the paladin do n’t . [I]157-the paladin do n’t dislike [him]135-noel , and [I]157-the paladin ’m not saying these things out of prejudice , for [I]157-the paladin do n’t allow [myself]157-the paladin to have prejudices against [people]2327-people . [I]157-the paladin like [him]135-noel , and have always comraded with [him]135-noel from the cradle , but [he]135-noel must allow [me]157-the paladin to speak [my]157-the paladin mind about [his]135-noel faults , and [I]157-the paladin am willing [he]135-noel shall speak [his]135-noel about [mine]157-the paladin , if [I]157-the paladin have any . And , true enough , maybe [I]157-the paladin have ; but [I]157-the paladin reckon [they]2763-they ’ll bear inspection — [I]157-the paladin have that idea , anyway . [A manly fellow]2764-a manly fellow ! [You]2765-you should have heard [him]135-noel whine and wail and swear , last night , because the saddle hurt [him]135-noel . Why did n’t the saddle hurt [me]157-the paladin ? Pooh — [I]157-the paladin was as much at [home]377-home in [it]2767-it as if [I]157-the paladin had been born [there]460-there . And yet it was the first time [I]157-the paladin was ever on a horse . [All those old soldiers]2769-all those old soldiers admired [my]157-the paladin riding ; [they]2769-all those old soldiers said [they]2769-all those old soldiers had never seen anything like it . But [him]135-noel — why , [they]2769-all those old soldiers had to hold [him]135-noel on , all the time . ”[157-the paladin] An odor as of breakfast came stealing through the wood ; [the Paladin]732-the paladin unconsciously inflated [his]732-the paladin nostrils in lustful response , and got up and limped painfully away , saying [he]732-the paladin must go and look to [his]732-the paladin horse . At bottom [he]732-the paladin was all right and a good - hearted giant , without any harm in [him]732-the paladin , for it is no harm to bark , if one stops there and does not bite , and it is no harm to be [an ass]1183-an ass , if one is content to bray and not kick . If this vast structure of brawn and muscle and vanity and foolishness seemed to have a libelous tongue , what of it ? There was no malice behind it ; and besides , the defect was not of [his]732-the paladin own creation ; it was the work of [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel , who had nurtured [it]1184-it , fostered [it]1184-it , built [it]1184-it up and perfected [it]1184-it , for the entertainment [he]135-noel got out of it . [His]135-noel careless light heart had to have [somebody to nag and chaff and make fun of]1185-somebody to nag and chaff and make fun of , [the Paladin]157-the paladin had only needed development in order to meet its requirements , consequently the development was taken in hand and diligently attended to and looked after , gnat - and - bull fashion , for years , to the neglect and damage of far more important concerns . The result was an unqualified success . [Noel]135-noel prized [the society of [the Paladin]157-the paladin above [everybody else]1187-everybody else ’s]1186-the society of the paladin above everybody else ’s ; [the Paladin]157-the paladin preferred [anybody]563-anybody ’s to [Noel]135-noel ’s . [The big fellow]1189-the big fellow was often seen with [the little fellow]1190-the little fellow , but it was for the same reason that the bull is often seen with the gnat . With the first opportunity , [I]0-i had a talk with [Noel]135-noel . [I]0-i welcomed [him]135-noel to [our]1191-our expedition , and said : “ It was fine and brave of [you]135-noel to volunteer , [Noel]135-noel . ”[0-i] [His]135-noel eye twinkled , and [he]135-noel answered : “ Yes , it was rather fine , [I]135-noel think . Still , the credit does n’t all belong to [me]135-noel ; [I]135-noel had help . ”[135-noel] “ Who helped [you]135-noel ? ”[0-i] “ [The governor]2647-the governor . ”[0-i] “ How ? ”[135-noel] “ Well , [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]135-noel the whole thing . [I]0-i came up from [Domremy]1-domremy to see [the crowds]2771-the crowds and the general show , for [I]0-i had n’t ever had any experience of such things , of course , and this was a great opportunity ; but [I]0-i had n’t any mind to volunteer . [I]0-i overtook [the Paladin]732-the paladin on [the road]840-the road and let [him]732-the paladin have [my]0-i company the rest of the way , although [he]732-the paladin did not want it and said so ; and while [we]2774-us were gawking and blinking in the glare of [the governor]2647-the governor ’s torches [they]2647-the governor seized [us]2774-us and four more and added [us]2774-us to [the escort]2719-the escort , and that is really how [I]0-i came to volunteer . But , after all , [I]0-i was n’t sorry , remembering how dull life would have been in [the village]401-the village without [the Paladin]157-the paladin . ”[0-i] “ How did [he]732-the paladin feel about it ? Was [he]732-the paladin satisfied ? ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i think [he]732-the paladin was glad . ”[0-i] “ Why ? ”[0-i] “ Because [he]732-the paladin said [he]732-the paladin was n’t . [He]732-the paladin was taken by surprise , [you]0-i see , and it is not likely that [he]732-the paladin could tell the truth without preparation . Not that [he]732-the paladin would have prepared , if [he]732-the paladin had had the chance , for [I]0-i do not think [he]732-the paladin would . [I]0-i am not charging [him]732-the paladin with that . In the same space of time that [he]732-the paladin could prepare to speak the truth , [he]732-the paladin could also prepare to lie ; besides , [his]732-the paladin judgment would be cool then , and would warn [him]732-the paladin against fooling with new methods in an emergency . No , [I]0-i am sure [he]732-the paladin was glad , because [he]732-the paladin said [he]732-the paladin was n’t . ”[0-i] “ Do [you]0-i think [he]732-the paladin was very glad ? ”[0-i] “ Yes , [I]0-i know [he]732-the paladin was . [He]732-the paladin begged like [a slave]2778-a slave , and bawled for [[his]732-the paladin mother]2750-his mother . [He]732-the paladin said [his]732-the paladin health was delicate , and [he]732-the paladin did n’t know how to ride a horse , and [he]732-the paladin knew [he]732-the paladin could n’t outlive the first march . But really [he]732-the paladin was n’t looking as delicate as [he]732-the paladin was feeling . There was a cask of wine there , a proper lift for [four men]2780-four men . [The governor]2647-the governor ’s temper got afire , and [he]2647-the governor delivered an oath at [him]732-the paladin that knocked up the dust where it struck the ground , and told [him]732-the paladin to shoulder that cask or [he]2647-the governor would carve [him]732-the paladin to cutlets and send [him]732-the paladin [home]377-home in a basket . [The Paladin]157-the paladin did it , and that secured [his]732-the paladin promotion to a privacy in [the escort]2719-the escort without any further debate . ”[0-i] “ Yes , [you]2784-you seem to make it quite plain that [he]732-the paladin was glad to join — that is , if [your]2784-you premises are right that [you]2784-you start from . How did [he]732-the paladin stand the march last night ? ”[0-i] “ About as [I]0-i did . If [he]732-the paladin made the more noise , it was the privilege of [his]732-the paladin bulk . [We]1192-we stayed in [our]1192-we saddles because [we]1192-we had help . [We]1192-we are equally lame to - day , and if [he]732-the paladin likes to sit down , let [him]732-the paladin ; [I]0-i prefer to stand . ”[0-i] Chapter 4 [Joan]110-joan Leads [Us]1192-we Through [the Enemy]2442-the enemy [WE]1192-we WERE called to [quarters]1194-quarters and subjected to a searching inspection by [Joan]110-joan . Then [she]110-joan made a short little talk in which [she]110-joan said that even the rude business of war could be conducted better without profanity and other brutalities of speech than with [them]1195-them , and that [she]110-joan should strictly require [us]1192-we to remember and apply this admonition . [She]110-joan ordered half an hour ’s horsemanship drill for [the novices]1196-the novices then , and appointed one of [the veterans]1197-the veterans to conduct it . It was a ridiculous exhibition , but [we]1192-we learned something , and [Joan]110-joan was satisfied and complimented [us]1192-we . [She]110-joan did not take any instruction [herself]110-joan or go through the evolutions and manoeuvres , but merely sat [her]110-joan horse like a martial little statue and looked on . That was sufficient for [her]110-joan , [you]1198-you see . [She]110-joan would not miss or forget a detail of the lesson , [she]110-joan would take it all in with [her]110-joan eye and [her]110-joan mind , and apply it afterward with as much certainty and confidence as if [she]110-joan had already practised it . [We]1192-we now made three night marches of twelve or thirteen leagues each , riding in peace and undisturbed , being taken for [a roving band of Free Companions]1199-a roving band of free companions . [Country - folk]1200-country - folk were glad to have that sort of [people]2327-people go by without stopping . Still , [they]1200-country - folk were very wearying marches , and not comfortable , for the bridges were few and the streams many , and as [we]1192-we had to ford them [we]1192-we found the water dismally cold , and afterward had to bed [ourselves]1192-we , still wet , on the frosty or snowy ground , and get warm as [we]1192-we might and sleep if [we]1192-we could , for it would not have been prudent to build fires . [Our]1192-we energies languished under these hardships and deadly fatigues , but [Joan]110-joan ’s did not . [Her]110-joan step kept its spring and firmness and [her]110-joan eye its fire . [We]1192-we could only wonder at this , [we]1192-we could not explain it . But if [we]1192-we had had hard times before , [I]0-i know not what to call the five nights that now followed , for the marches were as fatiguing , the baths as cold , and [we]1192-we were ambuscaded seven times in addition , and lost [two novices]1202-two novices and [three veterans]1203-three veterans in the resulting fights . The news had leaked out and gone abroad that [the inspired Virgin of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]1204-the inspired virgin of vaucouleurs was making for [the King]270-the king with [an escort]1206-an escort , and all [the roads]643-the roads were being watched now . These five nights disheartened the command a good deal . This was aggravated by a discovery which [Noel]135-noel made , and which [he]135-noel promptly made known at [headquarters]1208-headquarters . [Some of [the men]788-the men]1209-some of the men had been trying to understand why [Joan]110-joan continued to be alert , vigorous , and confident while [the strongest men in the company]1211-the strongest men in the company were fagged with the heavy marches and exposure and were become morose and irritable . There , it shows [you]1212-you how [men]282-men can have eyes and yet not see . All [their]282-men lives [those men]1214-those men had seen [[their]282-men own women]1215-their own women - folks hitched up with a cow and dragging the plow in [the fields]1216-the fields while [the men]788-the men did the driving . [They]282-men had also seen other evidences that [women]1218-women have far more endurance and patience and fortitude than [men]282-men — but what good had [their]282-men seeing these things been to [them]282-men ? None . It had taught [them]282-men nothing . [They]282-men were still surprised to see [a girl of seventeen]1220-a girl of seventeen bear the fatigues of war better than [trained veterans of the army]1221-trained veterans of the army . Moreover , [they]282-men did not reflect that [a great soul]1222-a great soul , with a great purpose , can make a weak body strong and keep it so ; and here was the greatest soul in [the universe]1223-the universe ; but how could [they]282-men know that , [those dumb creatures]1224-those dumb creatures ? No , [they]282-men knew nothing , and [their]282-men reasonings were of a piece with [their]282-men ignorance . [They]282-men argued and discussed among [themselves]282-men , with [Noel]135-noel listening , and arrived at the decision that [Joan]110-joan was [a witch]1114-a witch , and had [her]110-joan strange pluck and strength from [Satan]144-satan ; so [they]282-men made a plan to watch for a safe opportunity to take [her]110-joan life . To have secret plottings of this sort going on in [our]1226-our midst was a very serious business , of course , and [the knights]1227-the knights asked [Joan]110-joan ’s permission to hang [the plotters]1228-the plotters , but [she]110-joan refused without hesitancy . [She]110-joan said : “ Neither [these men]2785-these men nor [any others]2786-any others can take [my]110-joan life before [my]110-joan mission is accomplished , therefore why should [I]110-joan have [their]2785-these men blood upon [my]110-joan hands ? [I]110-joan will inform [them]2785-these men of this , and also admonish [them]2785-these men . Call [them]2785-these men before [me]110-joan . ”[110-joan] When [they]282-men came [she]110-joan made that statement to [them]282-men in a plain matter - of - fact way , and just as if the thought never entered [her]110-joan mind that [any one]2338-any one could doubt it after [she]110-joan had given [her]110-joan word that it was true . [The men]788-the men were evidently amazed and impressed to hear [her]110-joan say such a thing in such a sure and confident way , for prophecies boldly uttered never fall barren on superstitious ears . Yes , this speech certainly impressed [them]788-the men , but [her]110-joan closing remark impressed [them]788-the men still more . It was for [the ringleader]1231-the ringleader , and [Joan]110-joan said it sorrowfully : “ It is a pity that [you]1231-the ringleader should plot [another]2787-another ’s death when [your]1231-the ringleader own is so close at hand . ”[110-joan] [That man]2334-that man ’s horse stumbled and fell on [him]2334-that man in [the first ford which [we]1234-we crossed]1233-the first ford which we crossed that night , and [he]2334-that man was drowned before [we]1234-we could help [him]2334-that man . [We]1234-we had [no more conspiracies]1235-no more conspiracies . This night was harassed with [ambuscades]1236-ambuscades , but [we]1234-we got through without having [any men]1237-any men killed . One more night would carry [us]1234-we over [the hostile frontier]1238-the hostile frontier if [we]1234-we had good luck , and [we]1234-we saw the night close down with a good deal of solicitude . Always before , [we]1234-we had been more or less reluctant to start out into the gloom and the silence to be frozen in [the fords]1239-the fords and persecuted by [the enemy]2442-the enemy , but this time [we]1234-we were impatient to get under way and have it over , although there was promise of more and harder fighting than any of the previous nights had furnished . Moreover , in front of [us]1234-we about three leagues there was [a deep stream]1241-a deep stream with [a frail wooden bridge over [it]1241-a deep stream]1242-a frail wooden bridge over it , and as a cold rain mixed with snow had been falling steadily all day [we]1234-we were anxious to find out whether [we]1234-we were in a trap or not . If [the swollen stream]1243-the swollen stream had washed away [the bridge]1244-the bridge , [we]1234-we might properly consider [ourselves]1234-we trapped and cut off from escape . As soon as it was dark [we]1234-we filed out from the depth of [the forest]1245-the forest where [we]1234-we had been hidden and began the march . From the time that [we]1234-we had begun to encounter ambushes [Joan]110-joan had ridden at the head of the column , and [she]110-joan took this post now . By the time [we]1234-we had gone a league the rain and snow had turned to sleet , and under the impulse of the storm - wind it lashed [my]0-i face like whips , and [I]0-i envied [Joan]110-joan and [the knights]1227-the knights , who could close [their]1227-the knights visors and shut up [their]1227-the knights heads in [their]1227-the knights helmets as in a box . Now , out of the pitchy darkness and close at hand , came the sharp command : “ Halt ! ”[1234-we] [We]1234-we obeyed . [I]0-i made out a dim mass in front of [us]1234-we which might be a body of [horsemen]1247-horsemen , but [one]461-one could not be sure . [A man]2329-a man rode up and said to [Joan]110-joan in a tone of reproof : “ Well , [you]110-joan have taken [your]110-joan time , truly . And what have [you]110-joan found out ? Is [she]110-joan still behind [us]1234-we , or in front ? ”[2329-a man] [Joan]110-joan answered in a level voice : “ [She]110-joan is still behind . ”[110-joan] This news softened [the stranger]647-the stranger ’s tone . Where was [she]110-joan camped ? ”[2329-a man] “ In [the forest]1245-the forest , not more than a league from here . ”[2329-a man] “ Good ! [No one]284-no one has so well earned the privilege of abolishing this pestilent limb of [Satan]144-satan . ”[2329-a man] “ [I]2329-a man do not know how to thank [you]177-captain raymond sufficiently . How many [men]282-men has [she]110-joan ? ”[2329-a man] “ [I]2329-a man counted but eighteen , but [she]110-joan may have had two or three pickets out . ”[2329-a man] “ Is that all ? Is [she]110-joan robust , or slender ? ”[2329-a man] “ Slender . ”[1251-the officer] [The officer]1251-the officer pondered a moment or two , then [he]1251-the officer said : “ Was [she]110-joan preparing to break camp ? ”[1251-the officer] “ Not when [I]2329-a man had [my]2329-a man last glimpse of [her]110-joan . ”[2329-a man] “ What was [she]110-joan doing ? ”[2329-a man] “ [She]110-joan was talking quietly with [an officer]2489-an officer . ”[2329-a man] “ Quietly ? Not giving orders ? ”[2329-a man] “ No , talking as quietly as [we]2798-we are now . ”[2329-a man] “ That is good . [She]110-joan is feeling a false security . [She]110-joan would have been restless and fussy else — it is the way of [her]110-joan sex when danger is about . As [she]110-joan was making no preparation to break camp — ”[2329-a man] “ [She]110-joan certainly was not when [I]2329-a man saw [her]110-joan last . ”[2329-a man] “ — and was chatting quietly and at [her]110-joan ease , it means that this weather is not to [her]110-joan taste . Night - marching in sleet and wind is not for chits of seventeen . No ; [she]110-joan will stay where [she]110-joan is . [She]110-joan has [my]2329-a man thanks . [We]2798-we will camp , [ourselves]2798-we ; [here]2531-here is as good [a place]2800-a place as any . Let [us]2798-we get about it . ”[2329-a man] “ If [you]2329-a man command it — certainly . But [she]110-joan has [two knights]2801-two knights with [her]110-joan . [They]2801-two knights might force [her]110-joan to march , particularly if the weather should improve . ”[2329-a man] [I]0-i was scared , and impatient to be getting out of this peril , and it distressed and worried [me]0-i to have [Joan]110-joan apparently set [herself]110-joan to work to make delay and increase the danger — still , [I]0-i thought [she]110-joan probably knew better than [I]0-i what to do . [The officer]1251-the officer said : “ Well , in that case [we]2798-we are here to block the way . ”[1251-the officer] “ Yes , if [they]2801-two knights come this way . But if [they]2801-two knights should send out [spies]2802-spies , and find out enough to make [them]2801-two knights want to try for the bridge through [the woods]628-the woods ? Is it best to allow [the bridge]1244-the bridge to stand ? ”[1251-the officer] It made [me]0-i shiver to hear [her]110-joan . [The officer]1251-the officer considered awhile , then said : “ It might be well enough to send a force to destroy [the bridge]1244-the bridge . [I]1251-the officer was intending to occupy it with the whole command , but that is not necessary now . ”[1251-the officer] [Joan]110-joan said , tranquilly : “ With [your]1251-the officer permission , [I]110-joan will go and destroy it [myself]110-joan . ”[110-joan] Ah , now [I]0-i saw [her]110-joan idea , and was glad [she]110-joan had had the cleverness to invent it and the ability to keep [her]110-joan head cool and think of it in that tight place . [The officer]1251-the officer replied : “ [You]1251-the officer have it , [Captain]2788-captain , and [my]1251-the officer thanks . With [you]1251-the officer to do it , it will be well done ; [I]1251-the officer could send another in [your]1251-the officer place , but not a better . ”[1251-the officer] [They]1255-they saluted , and [we]1256-we moved forward . [I]0-i breathed freer . A dozen times [I]0-i had imagined [I]0-i heard the hoofbeats of [the real Captain [Raymond]177-captain raymond ’s troop arriving behind [us]1256-we]1257-the real captain raymond ’s troop arriving behind us , and had been sitting on pins and needles all the while that that conversation was dragging along . [I]0-i breathed freer , but was still not comfortable , for [Joan]110-joan had given only the simple command , “ Forward ! ”[110-joan] Consequently [we]1256-we moved in a walk . Moved in a dead walk past a dim and lengthening column of [enemies]1258-enemies at [our]1256-we side . The suspense was exhausting , yet it lasted but a short while , for when [the enemy]2442-the enemy ’s bugles sang the “ Dismount ! ”[2442-the enemy] [Joan]110-joan gave the word to trot , and that was a great relief to [me]0-i . [She]110-joan was always at [herself]110-joan , [you]1260-you see . Before the command to dismount had been given , [somebody]636-somebody might have wanted the countersign somewhere along that line if [we]1256-we came flying by at speed , but now [we]1256-we seemed to be on [our]1256-we way to [our]1256-we allotted camping position , so [we]1256-we were allowed to pass unchallenged .
