The further [we]1256-we went the more formidable was the strength revealed by [the hostile force]1262-the hostile force . Perhaps it was only a hundred or two , but to [me]0-i it seemed a thousand . When [we]1256-we passed [the last of [these people]1264-these people]1263-the last of these people [I]0-i was thankful , and the deeper [we]1256-we plowed into the darkness beyond [them]1263-the last of these people the better [I]0-i felt . [I]0-i came nearer and nearer to feeling good , for an hour ; then [we]1256-we found [the bridge]1244-the bridge still standing , and [I]0-i felt entirely good . [We]1256-we crossed [it]1244-the bridge and destroyed [it]1244-the bridge , and then [I]0-i felt — but [I]0-i can not describe what [I]0-i felt . [One]461-one has to feel it [himself]461-one in order to know what it is like . [We]1256-we had expected to hear the rush of [a pursuing force]1267-a pursuing force behind [us]1256-we , for [we]1256-we thought that [the real Captain Raymond]177-captain raymond would arrive and suggest that perhaps [the troop that had been mistaken for [his]177-captain raymond]1268-the troop that had been mistaken for his belonged to [the Virgin of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]1269-the virgin of vaucouleurs ; but [he]177-captain raymond must have been delayed seriously , for when [we]1256-we resumed [our]1256-we march beyond [the river]454-the river there were no sounds behind [us]1256-we except those which the storm was furnishing . [I]0-i said that [Joan]110-joan had harvested a good many compliments intended for [Captain Raymond]177-captain raymond , and that [he]177-captain raymond would find nothing of a crop left but a dry stubble of reprimands when [he]177-captain raymond got back , and [a commander just in the humor to superintend the gathering of it]1271-a commander just in the humor to superintend the gathering of it in . [Joan]110-joan said : “ It will be as [you]2807-you say , no doubt ; for [the commander]2808-the commander took [a troop]2809-a troop for granted , in the night and unchallenged , and would have camped without sending a force to destroy [the bridge]1244-the bridge if [he]2808-the commander had been left unadvised , and none are so ready to find fault with [others]506-others as those who do things worthy of blame [themselves]506-others . ”[110-joan] [The Sieur Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand was amused at [Joan]110-joan ’s naive way of referring to [her]110-joan advice as if it had been a valuable present to [a hostile leader who was saved by it from making a censurable blunder of omission]1272-a hostile leader who was saved by it from making a censurable blunder of omission , and then [he]1273-he went on to admire how ingeniously [she]110-joan had deceived [that man]2334-that man and yet had not told [him]2334-that man anything that was not the truth . This troubled [Joan]110-joan , and [she]110-joan said : “ [I]110-joan thought [he]2334-that man was deceiving [himself]2334-that man . [I]110-joan forbore to tell [him]2334-that man lies , for that would have been wrong ; but if [my]110-joan truths deceived [him]2334-that man , perhaps that made them lies , and [I]110-joan am to blame . [I]110-joan would God [I]110-joan knew if [I]110-joan have done wrong . ”[110-joan] [She]110-joan was assured that [she]110-joan had done right , and that in the perils and necessities of war deceptions that help [one]461-one ’s own cause and hurt [the enemy]2442-the enemy ’s were always permissible ; but [she]110-joan was not quite satisfied with that , and thought that even when a great cause was in danger [one]461-one ought to have the privilege of trying honorable ways first . [Jean]167-jean said : “ [Joan]110-joan , [you]110-joan told [us]2812-us [yourself]110-joan that [you]110-joan were going to [Uncle Laxart]164-laxart ’s to nurse [[his]164-laxart wife]412-his wife , but [you]110-joan did n’t say [you]110-joan were going further , yet [you]110-joan did go on to [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs . There ! ”[167-jean] “ [I]110-joan see now , ”[110-joan] said [Joan]110-joan , sorrowfully . “ [I]110-joan told no lie , yet [I]110-joan deceived . [I]110-joan had tried all other ways first , but [I]110-joan could not get away , and [I]110-joan had to get away . [My]110-joan mission required it . [I]110-joan did wrong , [I]110-joan think , and am to blame . ”[110-joan] [She]110-joan was silent a moment , turning the matter over in [her]110-joan mind , then [she]110-joan added , with quiet decision , “ But the thing itself was right , and [I]110-joan would do it again . ”[110-joan] It seemed an over - nice distinction , but [nobody]434-nobody said anything . If [we]1279-we had known [her]110-joan as well as [she]110-joan knew [herself]110-joan , and as [her]110-joan later history revealed [her]110-joan to [us]1279-we , [we]1279-we should have perceived that [she]110-joan had a clear meaning there , and that [her]110-joan position was not identical with [ours]1279-we , as [we]1279-we were supposing , but occupied a higher plane . [She]110-joan would sacrifice [herself]110-joan — and [[her]110-joan best self]1280-her best self ; that is , [her]110-joan truthfulness — to save [her]110-joan cause ; but only that ; [she]110-joan would not buy [her]110-joan life at that cost ; whereas [our]1279-we war - ethics permitted the purchase of [our]1279-we lives , or any mere military advantage , small or great , by deception . [Her]110-joan saying seemed a commonplace at the time , the essence of its meaning escaping [us]1279-we ; but [one]461-one sees now that it contained a principle which lifted it above that and made it great and fine . Presently the wind died down , the sleet stopped falling , and the cold was less severe . [The road]840-the road was become [a bog]1283-a bog , and the horses labored through it at a walk — [they]1284-they could do no better . As the heavy time wore on , exhaustion overcame [us]1279-we , and [we]1279-we slept in [our]1279-we saddles . Not even the dangers that threatened [us]1279-we could keep [us]1279-we awake . This tenth night seemed longer than any of the others , and of course it was the hardest , because [we]1279-we had been accumulating fatigue from the beginning , and had more of it on hand now than at any previous time . But [we]1279-we were not molested again . When the dull dawn came at last [we]1279-we saw [a river]2586-a river before [us]1279-we and [we]1279-we knew it was [the Loire]42-the loire ; [we]1279-we entered [the town of [Gien]51-gien]1286-the town of gien , and knew [we]1279-we were in [a friendly land]1287-a friendly land , with [the hostiles]1288-the hostiles all behind [us]1279-we . That was a glad morning for [us]1279-we . [We]1279-we were [a worn and bedraggled and shabby - looking troop]1289-a worn and bedraggled and shabby - looking troop ; and still , as always , [Joan]110-joan was the freshest of [us]1279-we all , in both body and spirits . [We]1279-we had averaged above thirteen leagues a night , by [tortuous and wretched roads]1290-tortuous and wretched roads . It was a remarkable march , and shows what [men]282-men can do when [they]282-men have [a leader with a determined purpose and a resolution that never flags]1292-a leader with a determined purpose and a resolution that never flags . Chapter 5 [We]1279-we Pierce [the Last Ambuscades]1293-the last ambuscades [WE]1279-we RESTED and otherwise refreshed [ourselves]1279-we two or three hours at [Gien]51-gien , but by that time the news was abroad that [the young girl commissioned of [God]140-god to deliver [France]4-france]1294-the young girl commissioned of god to deliver france was come ; wherefore , [such a press of [people]2327-people]1295-such a press of people flocked to [[our]1279-we quarters]1297-our quarters to get sight of [her]1294-the young girl commissioned of god to deliver france that it seemed best to seek a quieter place ; so [we]1279-we pushed on and halted at [a small village called [Fierbois]52-fierbois]1298-a small village called fierbois . [We]1279-we were now within six leagues of [the King]270-the king , who was at [the Castle of [Chinon]53-chinon]1300-the castle of chinon . [Joan]110-joan dictated a letter to [him]270-the king at once , and [I]0-i wrote it . In it [she]110-joan said [she]110-joan had come a hundred and fifty leagues to bring [him]270-the king good news , and begged the privilege of delivering it in person . [She]110-joan added that although [she]110-joan had never seen [him]270-the king [she]110-joan would know [him]270-the king in any disguise and would point [him]270-the king out . [The two knights]1133-the two knights rode away at once with the letter . [The troop]1302-the troop slept all the afternoon , and after supper [we]1279-we felt pretty fresh and fine , especially [[our]1279-we little group of [young Domremians]178-young domremians]1303-our little group of young domremians . [We]1279-we had [the comfortable tap - room of [the village inn]1305-the village inn]1304-the comfortable tap - room of the village inn to [ourselves]1279-we , and for the first time in ten unspeakably long days were exempt from bodings and terrors and hardships and fatiguing labors . [The Paladin]157-the paladin was suddenly become [his]157-the paladin ancient self again , and was swaggering up and down , a very monument of self - complacency . [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel said : “ [I]135-noel think it is wonderful , the way [he]157-the paladin has brought [us]1279-we through . ”[135-noel] “ Who ? ”[167-jean] asked [Jean]167-jean . “ Why , [the Paladin]157-the paladin . ”[157-the paladin] [The Paladin]157-the paladin seemed not to hear . “ What had [he]157-the paladin to do with it ? ”[132-pierre] asked [Pierre]132-pierre d’Arc . “ Everything . It was nothing but [Joan]110-joan ’s confidence in [his]157-the paladin discretion that enabled [her]110-joan to keep up [her]110-joan heart . [She]110-joan could depend on [us]1279-we and on [herself]110-joan for valor , but discretion is the winning thing in war , after all ; discretion is the rarest and loftiest of qualities , and [he]157-the paladin has got more of it than [any other man in [France]4-france]2814-any other man in france — more of it , perhaps , than [any other sixty men in [France]4-france]2815-any other sixty men in france . ”[132-pierre] “ Now [you]167-jean are getting ready to make a fool of [yourself]167-jean , [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel , ”[157-the paladin] said [the Paladin]157-the paladin , “ and [you]167-jean want to coil some of that long tongue of [yours]167-jean around [your]167-jean neck and stick the end of it in [your]167-jean ear , then [you]167-jean ’ll be the less likely to get into trouble . ”[157-the paladin] “ [I]132-pierre did n’t know [he]157-the paladin had more discretion than [other people]798-other people , ”[132-pierre] said [Pierre]132-pierre , “ for discretion argues brains , and [he]157-the paladin has n’t any more brains than the rest of [us]2817-us , in [my]132-pierre opinion . ”[132-pierre] “ No , [you]167-jean are wrong there . [Discretion]179-discretion has n’t anything to do with brains ; brains are an obstruction to it , for it does not reason , it feels . Perfect discretion means absence of brains . Discretion is a quality of the heart — solely a quality of the heart ; it acts upon [us]2817-us through feeling . [We]2817-us know this because if it were an intellectual quality it would only perceive a danger , for instance , where a danger exists ; whereas — ”[157-the paladin] “ Hear [him]157-the paladin twaddle — [the damned idiot]2818-the damned idiot ! ”[157-the paladin] muttered [the Paladin]157-the paladin . “ — whereas , it being purely a quality of the heart , and proceeding by feeling , not reason , its reach is correspondingly wider and sublimer , enabling it to perceive and avoid dangers that have n’t any existence at all ; as , for instance , that night in the fog , when [the Paladin]157-the paladin took [his]157-the paladin horse ’s ears for hostile lances and got off and climbed a tree — ”[157-the paladin] “ It ’s a lie ! a lie without shadow of foundation , and [I]157-the paladin call upon [you]167-jean all to beware [you]167-jean give credence to the malicious inventions of this ramshackle slander - mill that has been doing its best to destroy [my]157-the paladin character for years , and will grind up [your]167-jean own reputations for [you]167-jean next . [I]157-the paladin got off to tighten [my]157-the paladin saddle - girth — [I]157-the paladin wish [I]157-the paladin may die in [my]157-the paladin tracks if it is n’t so — and whoever wants to believe it can , and whoever do n’t can let it alone . ”[157-the paladin] “ There , that is the way with [him]157-the paladin , [you]167-jean see ; [he]157-the paladin never can discuss a theme temperately , but always flies off the handle and becomes disagreeable . And [you]167-jean notice [his]157-the paladin defect of memory . [He]157-the paladin remembers getting off [his]157-the paladin horse , but forgets all the rest , even the tree . But that is natural ; [he]157-the paladin would remember getting off the horse because [he]157-the paladin was so used to doing it . [He]157-the paladin always did it when there was an alarm and the clash of arms at the front . ”[157-the paladin] “ Why did [he]157-the paladin choose that time for it ? ”[167-jean] asked [Jean]167-jean . “ [I]167-jean do n’t know . To tighten up [his]157-the paladin girth , [he]157-the paladin thinks , to climb a tree , [I]167-jean think ; [I]167-jean saw [him]157-the paladin climb nine trees in a single night . ”[167-jean] “ [You]167-jean saw nothing of the kind ! [A person that can lie like that]2819-a person that can lie like that deserves [no one]284-no one ’s respect . [I]132-pierre ask [you]180-all all to answer [me]132-pierre . Do [you]180-all believe what [this reptile]2821-this reptile has said ? ”[132-pierre] [All]180-all seemed embarrassed , and only [Pierre]132-pierre replied . [He]132-pierre said , hesitatingly : “ [I]132-pierre — well , [I]132-pierre hardly know what to say . It is a delicate situation . It seems offensive to [me]132-pierre to refuse to believe [a person]467-a person when [he]467-a person makes so direct a statement , and yet [I]132-pierre am obliged to say , rude as it may appear , that [I]132-pierre am not able to believe the whole of it — no , [I]132-pierre am not able to believe that [you]180-all climbed nine trees . ”[132-pierre] “ There ! ”[157-the paladin] cried [the Paladin]157-the paladin ; “ now what do [you]180-all think of [yourself]180-all , [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel ? How many do [you]180-all believe [I]157-the paladin climbed , [Pierre]132-pierre ? ”[157-the paladin] “ Only eight . ”[132-pierre] The laughter that followed inflamed [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s anger to white heat , and [he]132-pierre said : “ [I]132-pierre bide [my]132-pierre time — [I]132-pierre bide [my]132-pierre time . [I]132-pierre will reckon with [you]180-all all , [I]132-pierre promise [you]180-all that ! ”[132-pierre] “ Do n’t get [him]2823-him started , ”[135-noel] [Noel]135-noel pleaded ; “ [he]2823-him is a perfect lion when [he]2823-him gets started . [I]135-noel saw enough to teach [me]135-noel that , after the third skirmish . After it was over [I]135-noel saw [him]2823-him come out of the bushes and attack [a dead man]2824-a dead man single - handed . ”[135-noel] “ It is another lie ; and [I]132-pierre give [you]180-all fair warning that [you]180-all are going too far . [You]180-all will see [me]132-pierre attack [a live one]2825-a live one if [you]180-all are not careful . ”[132-pierre] “ Meaning [me]132-pierre , of course . This wounds [me]132-pierre more than any number of injurious and unkind speeches could do . In gratitude to [one ’s benefactor]2826-one ’s benefactor — ”[132-pierre] “ [Benefactor]2827-benefactor ? What do [I]132-pierre owe [you]180-all , [I]132-pierre should like to know ? ”[132-pierre] “ [You]180-all owe [me]132-pierre [your]180-all life . [I]132-pierre stood between the trees and [the foe]2828-the foe , and kept hundreds and thousands of [the enemy]2442-the enemy at bay when [they]2442-the enemy were thirsting for [your]180-all blood . And [I]132-pierre did not do it to display [my]132-pierre daring . [I]132-pierre did it because [I]132-pierre loved [you]180-all and could not live without [you]180-all . ”[132-pierre] “ There — [you]180-all have said enough ! [I]132-pierre will not stay here to listen to these infamies . [I]132-pierre can endure [your]180-all lies , but not [your]180-all love . Keep that corruption for [somebody with a stronger stomach than [mine]132-pierre]2830-somebody with a stronger stomach than mine . And [I]132-pierre want to say this , before [I]132-pierre go . That [[you]180-all people]2831-you people ’s small performances might appear the better and win [you]180-all the more glory , [I]132-pierre hid [my]132-pierre own deeds through all the march . [I]132-pierre went always to the front , where the fighting was thickest , to be remote from [you]180-all in order that [you]180-all might not see and be discouraged by the things [I]132-pierre did to [the enemy]2442-the enemy . It was [my]132-pierre purpose to keep this a secret in [my]132-pierre own breast , but [you]180-all force [me]132-pierre to reveal it . If [you]180-all ask for [[my]132-pierre witnesses]2833-my witnesses , yonder [they]2833-my witnesses lie , on [the road [we]2835-we have come]2834-the road we have come . [I]132-pierre found [that road]2836-that road mud , [I]132-pierre paved it with corpses . [I]132-pierre found [that country]2837-that country sterile , [I]132-pierre fertilized it with blood . Time and again [I]132-pierre was urged to go to the rear because the command could not proceed on account of [my]132-pierre dead . And yet [you]2838-you , [[you]2838-you miscreant]2839-you miscreant , accuse [me]132-pierre of climbing trees ! Pah ! ”[132-pierre] And [he]1306-him strode out , with a lofty air , for the recital of [his]1306-him imaginary deeds had already set [him]1306-him up again and made [him]1306-him feel good . Next day [we]1307-we mounted and faced toward [Chinon]53-chinon . [Orleans]39-orleans was at [our]1307-we back now , and close by , lying in the strangling grip of [the English]128-the english ; soon , please [God]140-god , [we]1307-we would face about and go to [their]1308-their relief . From [Gien]51-gien the news had spread to [Orleans]39-orleans that [the peasant Maid of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]1309-the peasant maid of vaucouleurs was on [her]1309-the peasant maid of vaucouleurs way , divinely commissioned to raise the siege . The news made a great excitement and raised a great hope — the first breath of hope [those poor souls]1310-those poor souls had breathed in five months . [They]1308-their sent [commissioners]1311-commissioners at once to [the King]270-the king to beg [him]270-the king to consider this matter , and not throw this help lightly away . [These commissioners]1313-these commissioners were already at [Chinon]53-chinon by this time . When [we]1307-we were half - way to [Chinon]53-chinon [we]1307-we happened upon yet [one more squad of [enemies]1258-enemies]1314-one more squad of enemies . [They]1314-one more squad of enemies burst suddenly out of [the woods]628-the woods , and in considerable force , too ; but [we]1307-we were not [the apprentices [we]1307-we were ten or twelve days before]1317-the apprentices we were ten or twelve days before ; no , [we]1307-we were seasoned to this kind of adventure now ; [our]1307-we hearts did not jump into [our]1307-we throats and [our]1307-we weapons tremble in [our]1307-we hands . [We]1307-we had learned to be always in battle array , always alert , and always ready to deal with any emergency that might turn up . [We]1307-we were no more dismayed by the sight of [those people]1318-those people than [[our]1307-we commander]1319-our commander was . Before [they]1318-those people could form , [Joan]110-joan had delivered the order , “ Forward ! ”[110-joan] and [we]1307-we were down upon [them]1318-those people with a rush . [They]1318-those people stood no chance ; [they]1318-those people turned tail and scattered , [we]1307-we plowing through [them]1318-those people as if [they]1318-those people had been [men of straw]1320-men of straw . That was [our]1307-we last ambuscade , and it was probably laid for [us]1307-we by [that treacherous rascal]1321-that treacherous rascal , [[the King]270-the king ’s own minister]1323-the king ’s own minister and favorite , [De la Tremouille]182-de la tremouille . [We]1307-we housed [ourselves]1307-we in [an inn]1324-an inn , and soon [the town]786-the town came flocking to get a glimpse of [the Maid]1326-the maid . Ah , [the tedious King]1327-the tedious king and [[his]1327-the tedious king tedious people]1328-his tedious people ! [[Our]1307-we two good knights]1329-our two good knights came presently , [their]1329-our two good knights patience well wearied , and reported . [They]1329-our two good knights and [we]1307-we reverently stood — as [becomes persons who are in the presence of [kings]1331-kings and [the superiors of kings]1332-the superiors of kings]1330-becomes persons who are in the presence of kings and the superiors of kings — until [Joan]110-joan , troubled by this mark of homage and respect , and not content with it nor yet used to it , although [we]1307-we had not permitted [ourselves]1307-we to do otherwise since the day [she]110-joan prophesied [that wretched traitor]1333-that wretched traitor ’s death and [he]1333-that wretched traitor was straightway drowned , thus confirming many previous signs that [she]110-joan was indeed [an ambassador commissioned of [God]140-god]1334-an ambassador commissioned of god , commanded [us]1307-we to sit ; then [the Sieur de Metz]167-jean said to [Joan]110-joan : “ [The King]270-the king has got the letter , but [they]1329-our two good knights will not let [us]1307-we have speech with [him]270-the king . ”[167-jean] “ Who is it that forbids ? ”[167-jean] “ [None]367-none forbids , but there be three or four that are nearest [[his]270-the king person]2842-his person — [schemers]2843-schemers and [traitors every one]2844-traitors every one — that put obstructions in the way , and seek all ways , by lies and pretexts , to make delay . Chiefest of these are [Georges de la Tremouille]183-tremouille and [that plotting fox]2845-that plotting fox , [the Archbishop of [Rheims]54-rheims]2846-the archbishop of rheims . While [they]1329-our two good knights keep [the King]270-the king idle and in bondage to [his]270-the king sports and follies , [they]1329-our two good knights are great and their importance grows ; whereas if ever [he]270-the king assert [himself]270-the king and rise and strike for crown and [country]2848-country like [a man]2329-a man , [their]1329-our two good knights reign is done . So [they]1329-our two good knights but thrive , [they]1329-our two good knights care not if the crown go to destruction and [the King]270-the king with it . ”[167-jean] “ [You]2851-you have spoken with [others besides these]2852-others besides these ? ”[167-jean] “ Not of [the Court]389-the court , no — [the Court]389-the court are [the meek slaves of [those reptiles]2856-those reptiles]2855-the meek slaves of those reptiles , and watch [their]389-the court mouths and [their]389-the court actions , acting as [they]389-the court act , thinking as [they]389-the court think , saying as [they]389-the court say ; wherefore [they]389-the court are cold to [us]2857-we , and turn aside and go another way when [we]2857-we appear . But [we]2857-we have spoken with [the commissioners from [Orleans]39-orleans]2858-the commissioners from orleans . [They]2858-the commissioners from orleans said with heat : ‘ It is a marvel that [any man]931-any man in such desperate case as is [the King]270-the king can moon around in this torpid way , and see [his]270-the king all go to ruin without lifting a finger to stay the disaster . What a most strange spectacle it is ! Here [he]270-the king is , shut up in [this wee corner of [the realm]2862-the realm]2861-this wee corner of the realm like a rat in a trap ; [his]270-the king royal shelter [this huge gloomy tomb of [a castle]2477-a castle]2863-this huge gloomy tomb of a castle , with wormy rags for upholstery and crippled furniture for use , [a very house of desolation]2865-a very house of desolation ; in [his]270-the king treasure forty francs , and not a farthing more , [God]140-god be witness ! [no army]2866-no army , nor any shadow of one ; and by contrast with [his]270-the king hungry poverty [you]2867-you behold [this crownless pauper]2868-this crownless pauper and [his]270-the king shoals of [fools]2580-fools and [favorites tricked out in the gaudiest silks and velvets]2870-favorites tricked out in the gaudiest silks and velvets [you]2867-you shall find in [any Court in [Christendom]21-christendom]2871-any court in christendom . And look [you]2867-you , [he]270-the king knows that when [[our]2872-our city]2873-our city falls — as fall it surely will except succor come swiftly — [France]4-france falls ; [he]270-the king knows that when that day comes [he]270-the king will be [an outlaw]2874-an outlaw and [a fugitive]2875-a fugitive , and that behind [him]270-the king the English flag will float unchallenged over [every acre of [his]270-the king great heritage]2876-every acre of his great heritage ; [he]270-the king knows these things , [he]270-the king knows that [[our]2872-our faithful city]2877-our faithful city is fighting all solitary and alone against disease , starvation , and the sword to stay this awful calamity , yet [he]270-the king will not strike one blow to save [her]2877-our faithful city , [he]270-the king will not hear [our]2872-our prayers , [he]270-the king will not even look upon [our]2872-our faces . ’ That is what [the commissioners]2878-the commissioners said , and [they]2878-the commissioners are in despair . ”[110-joan] [Joan]110-joan said , gently : “ It is pity , but [they]2878-the commissioners must not despair . [The Dauphin]162-the dauphin will hear [them]2878-the commissioners presently . Tell [them]2878-the commissioners so . ”[110-joan] [She]110-joan almost always called [the King]270-the king [the Dauphin]162-the dauphin . To [her]110-joan mind [he]270-the king was [not King]1336-not king yet , not being crowned . “ [We]2872-our will tell [them]2878-the commissioners so , and it will content [them]2878-the commissioners , for [they]2878-the commissioners believe [you]2879-you come from [God]140-god . [The Archbishop]2880-the archbishop and [[his]2880-the archbishop confederate]2881-his confederate have for backer [that veteran soldier [Raoul de Gaucourt]184-raoul de gaucourt , [Grand Master of [the Palace]2884-the palace]2883-grand master of the palace , [a worthy man]2885-a worthy man , but simply [a soldier]2476-a soldier , with no head for any greater matter . [He]184-raoul de gaucourt can not make out to see how [a country - girl , ignorant of war]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war , can take a sword in [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war small hand and win victories where [the trained generals of [France]4-france]2888-the trained generals of france]2882-that veteran soldier raoul de gaucourt , grand master of the palace , a worthy man , but simply a soldier , with no head for any greater matter . he can not make out to see how a country - girl , ignorant of war , can take a sword in her small hand and win victories where the trained generals of france have looked for defeats only , for fifty years — and always found [them]2888-the trained generals of france . And so [he]184-raoul de gaucourt lifts [his]184-raoul de gaucourt frosty mustache and scoffs . ”[270-the king] “ When [God]140-god fights it is but small matter whether the hand that bears [His]184-raoul de gaucourt sword is big or little . [He]184-raoul de gaucourt will perceive this in time . Is there none in [that Castle of [Chinon]53-chinon who favors [us]2890-us]2889-that castle of chinon who favors us ? ”[110-joan] “ Yes , [[the King]270-the king ’s mother - in - law]2892-the king ’s mother - in - law , [Yolande]153-yolande , [Queen of [Sicily]55-sicily]2893-queen of sicily , who is wise and good . [She]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war spoke with [the Sieur Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand . ”[270-the king] “ [She]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war favors [us]2890-us , and [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war hates those others , [[the King]185-the king ’s beguilers]2894-the king ’s beguilers , ”[168-the sieur bertrand] said [Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand . “ [She]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war was full of interest , and asked a thousand questions , all of which [I]168-the sieur bertrand answered according to [my]168-the sieur bertrand ability . Then [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war sat thinking over these replies until [I]168-the sieur bertrand thought [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war was lost in a dream and would wake no more . But it was not so . At last [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war said , slowly , and as if [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war were talking to [herself]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war : ‘ [A child of seventeen]2895-a child of seventeen — [a girl — country - bred — untaught — ignorant of war , the use of arms , and the conduct of battles]2896-a girl — country - bred — untaught — ignorant of war , the use of arms , and the conduct of battles — modest , gentle , shrinking — yet throws away [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war shepherd ’s crook and clothes [herself]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war in steel , and fights [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war way through a hundred and fifty leagues of fear , and comes — [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war to whom [a king]2897-a king must be [a dread and awful presence]2898-a dread and awful presence — and will stand up before [such an one]2899-such an one and say , Be not afraid , [God]140-god has sent [me]168-the sieur bertrand to save [you]2899-such an one ! Ah , whence could come a courage and conviction so sublime as this but from very God [Himself]2897-a king ! ’ [She]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war was silent again awhile , thinking and making up [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war mind ; then [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war said , ‘ And whether [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war comes of [God]140-god or no , there is that in [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war heart that raises [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war above [men]282-men — high above [all men that breathe in [France]4-france to - day]2901-all men that breathe in france to - day — for in [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war is that mysterious something that puts heart into [soldiers]2473-soldiers , and turns [mobs of cowards]2903-mobs of cowards into armies of fighters that forget what fear is when [they]2473-soldiers are in that presence — [fighters who go into battle with joy in [their]2904-fighters who go into battle with joy in their eyes and songs on their lips , and sweep over the field like a storm eyes and songs on [their]2904-fighters who go into battle with joy in their eyes and songs on their lips , and sweep over the field like a storm lips , and sweep over [the field]698-the field like a storm]2904-fighters who go into battle with joy in their eyes and songs on their lips , and sweep over the field like a storm — that is the spirit that can save [France]4-france , and that alone , come it whence it may ! It is in [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war , [I]168-the sieur bertrand do truly believe , for what else could have borne up [that child]495-that child on that great march , and made [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war despise its dangers and fatigues ? [The King]270-the king must see [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war face to face — and shall ! ’ [She]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war dismissed [me]168-the sieur bertrand with those good words , and [I]168-the sieur bertrand know [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war promise will be kept . [They]2473-soldiers will delay [her]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war all [they]2473-soldiers can — those animals — but [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war will not fail in the end . ”[168-the sieur bertrand] “ Would [she]2887-a country - girl , ignorant of war were [King]2629-king ! ”[1337-the other knight] said [the other knight]1337-the other knight , fervently . “ For there is little hope that [the King]270-the king [himself]270-the king can be stirred out of [his]270-the king lethargy . [He]270-the king is wholly without hope , and is only thinking of throwing away everything and flying to [some foreign land]2910-some foreign land . [The commissioners]2878-the commissioners say there is a spell upon [him]270-the king that makes [him]270-the king hopeless — yes , and that it is shut up in a mystery which [they]2878-the commissioners can not fathom . ”[1337-the other knight] “ [I]110-joan know the mystery , ”[110-joan] said [Joan]110-joan , with quiet confidence ; “ [I]110-joan know it , and [he]270-the king knows it , but no other but [God]140-god . When [I]110-joan see [him]270-the king [I]110-joan will tell [him]270-the king a secret that will drive away [his]270-the king trouble , then [he]270-the king will hold up [his]270-the king head again . ”[110-joan] [I]0-i was miserable with curiosity to know what it was that [she]110-joan would tell [him]1338-him , but [she]110-joan did not say , and [I]0-i did not expect [she]110-joan would . [She]110-joan was but [a child]327-a child , it is true ; but [she]110-joan was not a chatterer to tell great matters and make [herself]110-joan important to [little people]1340-little people ; no , [she]110-joan was reserved , and kept things to [herself]110-joan , as the truly great always do . The next day [Queen Yolande]153-yolande got one victory over [[the King]185-the king ’s keepers]1341-the king ’s keepers , for , in spite of [their]1341-the king ’s keepers protestations and obstructions , [she]153-yolande procured an audience for [[our]1342-our two knights]1343-our two knights , and [they]1341-the king ’s keepers made the most [they]1341-the king ’s keepers could out of [their]1341-the king ’s keepers opportunity . [They]1341-the king ’s keepers told [the King]270-the king what [a spotless and beautiful character]1345-a spotless and beautiful character [Joan]110-joan was , and how great and noble a spirit animated [her]110-joan , and [they]1341-the king ’s keepers implored [him]270-the king to trust in [her]110-joan , believe in [her]110-joan , and have faith that [she]110-joan was sent to save [France]4-france . [They]1341-the king ’s keepers begged [him]270-the king to consent to see [her]110-joan . [He]270-the king was strongly moved to do this , and promised that [he]270-the king would not drop the matter out of [his]270-the king mind , but would consult with [[his]270-the king council]1346-his council about it . This began to look encouraging . Two hours later there was a great stir below , and [the innkeeper]1347-the innkeeper came flying up to say a commission of [illustrious ecclesiastics]1348-illustrious ecclesiastics was come from [the King]270-the king — from [the King]270-the king [his]270-the king very self , understand!—think of this vast honor to [[his]270-the king humble little hostelry!—and]1351-his humble little hostelry!—and [he]270-the king was so overcome with the glory of it that [he]270-the king could hardly find breath enough in [his]270-the king excited body to put the facts into words . [They]1341-the king ’s keepers were come from [the King]270-the king to speak with [the Maid of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]1353-the maid of vaucouleurs . Then [he]270-the king flew [downstairs]1354-downstairs , and presently appeared again , backing into [the room]1355-the room , and bowing to the ground with every step , in front of [four imposing and austere bishops]1356-four imposing and austere bishops and [[their]1356-four imposing and austere bishops train of [servants]1007-servants]1357-their train of servants . [Joan]110-joan rose , and [we]1359-we all stood . [The bishops]1360-the bishops took seats , and for a while no word was said , for it was [their]1360-the bishops prerogative to speak first , and [they]1360-the bishops were so astonished to see what [a child]327-a child it was that was making such a noise in [the world]320-the world and degrading personages of [their]1360-the bishops dignity to the base function of ambassadors to [her]110-joan in [[her]110-joan plebeian tavern]1363-her plebeian tavern , that [they]1360-the bishops could not find any words to say at first . Then presently [[their]1360-the bishops spokesman]1364-their spokesman told [Joan]110-joan [they]1360-the bishops were aware that [she]110-joan had a message for [the King]270-the king , wherefore [she]110-joan was now commanded to put it into words , briefly and without waste of time or embroideries of speech . As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i could hardly contain [my]0-i joy — [our]1366-our message was to reach [the King]270-the king at last ! And there was the same joy and pride and exultation in the faces of [[our]1366-our knights]1368-our knights , too , and in those of [[Joan]110-joan ’s brothers]1369-joan ’s brothers . And [I]0-i knew that [they]1360-the bishops were all praying — as [I]0-i was — that the awe which [we]1366-our felt in the presence of [these great dignitaries]1370-these great dignitaries , and which would have tied [our]1366-our tongues and locked [our]1366-our jaws , would not affect [her]110-joan in the like degree , but that [she]110-joan would be enabled to word [her]110-joan message well , and with little stumbling , and so make a favorable impression here , where it would be so valuable and so important . Ah , [dear]2328-dear , how little [we]1366-our were expecting what happened then ! [We]1366-our were aghast to hear [her]110-joan say what [she]110-joan said . [She]110-joan was standing in a reverent attitude , with [her]110-joan head down and [her]110-joan hands clasped in front of [her]110-joan ; for [she]110-joan was always reverent toward [the consecrated servants of [God]140-god]1372-the consecrated servants of god . When [the spokesman]1373-the spokesman had finished , [she]110-joan raised [her]110-joan head and set [her]110-joan calm eye on those faces , not any more disturbed by [their]1374-their state and grandeur than [a princess]2563-a princess would have been , and said , with all [her]110-joan ordinary simplicity and modesty of voice and manner : “ [Ye]1376-those surprised men will forgive [me]110-joan , [reverend sirs]2912-reverend sirs , but [I]110-joan have no message save for [the King]270-the king ’s ear alone . ”[110-joan] [Those surprised men]1376-those surprised men were dumb for a moment , and [their]1376-those surprised men faces flushed darkly ; then [the spokesman]1373-the spokesman said : “ Hark [ye]1376-those surprised men , to [you]1376-those surprised men fling [the King]270-the king ’s command in [his]270-the king face and refuse to deliver this message of [yours]1376-those surprised men to [[his]270-the king servants]2915-his servants appointed to receive it ? ”[1373-the spokesman] “ [God]140-god has appointed [me]1373-the spokesman to receive it , and another ’s commandment may not take precedence of that . [I]1373-the spokesman pray [you]1373-the spokesman let [me]1373-the spokesman have speech for [his]270-the king grace [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin . ”[1373-the spokesman] “ Forbear this folly , and come at [your]1373-the spokesman message ! Deliver it , and waste no more time about it . ”[110-joan] “ [You]1373-the spokesman err indeed , [most reverend fathers in [God]140-god]2917-most reverend fathers in god , and it is not well . [I]1373-the spokesman am not come hither to talk , but to deliver [Orleans]186-bastard , and lead [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin to [[his]2565-the dauphin good city of [Rheims]54-rheims]2919-his good city of rheims , and set the crown upon [his]2565-the dauphin head . ”[1373-the spokesman] “ Is that the message [you]1373-the spokesman send to [the King]270-the king ? ”[110-joan] But [Joan]110-joan only said , in the simple fashion which was [her]110-joan wo nt : “ [Ye]1373-the spokesman will pardon [me]110-joan for reminding [you]1373-the spokesman again — but [I]110-joan have no message to send to [any one]2338-any one . ”[110-joan] [[The King]270-the king ’s messengers]1379-the king ’s messengers rose in deep anger and swept out of [the place]585-the place without further words , [we]1381-we and [Joan]110-joan kneeling as [they]1379-the king ’s messengers passed . [Our]1381-we countenances were vacant , [our]1381-we hearts full of a sense of disaster . [Our]1381-we precious opportunity was thrown away ; [we]1381-we could not understand [Joan]110-joan ’s conduct , [she]110-joan who had been so wise until this fatal hour . At last [the Sieur Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand found courage to ask [her]110-joan why [she]110-joan had let this great chance to get [her]110-joan message to [the King]270-the king go by . “ Who sent [them]1379-the king ’s messengers here ? ”[110-joan] [she]110-joan asked . “ [The King]270-the king . ”[110-joan] “ Who moved [the King]270-the king to send [them]1379-the king ’s messengers ? ”[110-joan] [She]110-joan waited for an answer ; none came , for [we]1381-we began to see what was in [her]110-joan mind — so [she]110-joan answered [herself]110-joan : “ [[The Dauphin]162-the dauphin ’s council]2924-the dauphin ’s council moved [him]270-the king to [it]2925-it . Are [they]1379-the king ’s messengers enemies to [me]110-joan and to [[the Dauphin]162-the dauphin ’s weal]2926-the dauphin ’s weal , or are [they]1379-the king ’s messengers [friends]2434-friends ? ”[110-joan] “ [Enemies]1258-enemies , ”[168-the sieur bertrand] answered [the Sieur Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand . “ If one would have a message go sound and ungarbled , does one choose [traitors]2929-traitors and [tricksters]2930-tricksters to send it by ? ”[168-the sieur bertrand] [I]0-i saw that [we]1381-we had been [fools]2580-fools , and [she]110-joan wise . [They]1384-they saw it too , so [none]367-none found anything to say . Then [she]110-joan went on : “ [They]1384-they had but small wit that contrived this trap . [They]1384-they thought to get [my]110-joan message and seem to deliver it straight , yet deftly twist it from its purpose . [You]2931-you know that one part of [my]110-joan message is but this — to move [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin by argument and reasonings to give [me]110-joan [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms and send [me]110-joan to the siege . If [an enemy]2934-an enemy carried these in the right words , the exact words , and no word missing , yet left out the persuasions of gesture and supplicating tone and beseeching looks that inform the words and make them live , where were the value of that argument — whom could it convince ? Be patient , [the Dauphin]2565-the dauphin will hear [me]110-joan presently ; have no fear . ”[110-joan] [The Sieur de Metz]167-jean nodded [his]1386-his head several times , and muttered as to [himself]1386-his : “ [She]1388-that untaught girl , taken suddenly was right and wise , and [we]1387-we are but [dull fools]2936-dull fools , when all is said . ”[1386-his] It was just [my]0-i thought ; [I]0-i could have said it [myself]0-i ; and indeed it was the thought of all there present . A sort of awe crept over [us]1387-we , to think how [that untaught girl , taken suddenly]1388-that untaught girl , taken suddenly and unprepared , was yet able to penetrate the cunning devices of [a King ’s trained advisers]1389-a king ’s trained advisers and defeat [them]1389-a king ’s trained advisers . Marveling over this , and astonished at it , [we]1387-we fell silent and spoke no more . [We]1387-we had come to know that [she]1388-that untaught girl , taken suddenly was great in courage , fortitude , endurance , patience , conviction , fidelity to all duties — in all things , indeed , that make [a good and trusty soldier]1390-a good and trusty soldier and perfect [him]1390-a good and trusty soldier for [his]1390-a good and trusty soldier post ; now [we]1387-we were beginning to feel that maybe there were greatnesses in [her]1388-that untaught girl , taken suddenly brain that were even greater than these great qualities of the heart . It set [us]1387-we thinking . What [Joan]110-joan did that day bore fruit the very day after . [The King]270-the king was obliged to respect the spirit of [a young girl who could hold [her]1388-that untaught girl , taken suddenly own and stand [her]1388-that untaught girl , taken suddenly ground like that]1392-a young girl who could hold her own and stand her ground like that , and [he]270-the king asserted [himself]270-the king sufficiently to put [his]270-the king respect into an act instead of into polite and empty words . [He]270-the king moved [Joan]110-joan out of [that poor inn]1393-that poor inn , and housed [her]110-joan , with [us]1387-we [[her]110-joan servants]1394-her servants , in [the Castle of [Courdray]56-courdray]1395-the castle of courdray , personally confiding [her]110-joan to the care of [Madame de Bellier]187-madame de bellier , [wife of old [Raoul de Gaucourt]184-raoul de gaucourt , [Master of [the Palace]2884-the palace]1397-master of the palace]1396-wife of old raoul de gaucourt , master of the palace . Of course , this royal attention had an immediate result : [all the great lords and [ladies of the Court]1400-ladies of the court]1399-all the great lords and ladies of the court began to flock [there]460-there to see and listen to [the wonderful girl - soldier that [all the world]1403-all the world]1402-the wonderful girl - soldier that all the world was talking about , and who had answered [the King]270-the king ’s mandate with a bland refusal to obey . [Joan]110-joan charmed [them]1399-all the great lords and ladies of the court every one with [her]110-joan sweetness and simplicity and unconscious eloquence , and [all the best and capablest among [them]1399-all the great lords and ladies of the court]1405-all the best and capablest among them recognized that there was an indefinable something about [her]110-joan that testified that [she]110-joan was not made of common clay , that [she]110-joan was built on a grander plan than the mass of [mankind]1406-mankind , and moved on a loftier plane . These spread [her]110-joan fame . [She]110-joan always made [friends]2434-friends and [advocates]1408-advocates that way ; [neither the high nor the low]1409-neither the high nor the low could come within the sound of [her]110-joan voice and the sight of [her]110-joan face and go out from [her]110-joan presence indifferent . Chapter 6 [Joan]110-joan Convinces [the King]270-the king WELL , anything to make delay . [[The King]270-the king ’s council]1412-the king ’s council advised [him]270-the king against arriving at a decision in [our]1413-our matter too precipitately . [He]270-the king arrive at a decision too precipitately ! So [they]1414-they sent a committee of [priests]1415-priests — always [priests]1415-priests — into [Lorraine]19-lorraine to inquire into [Joan]110-joan ’s character and history — a matter which would consume several weeks , of course . [You]1417-you see how fastidious [they]1414-they were . It was as if [people]2327-people should come to put out the fire when [[a man]2329-a man ’s house]1420-a man ’s house was burning down , and [they]1414-they waited till [they]1414-they could send into [another country]1421-another country to find out if [he]2329-a man had always kept the Sabbath or not , before letting [him]2329-a man try . So the days poked along ; dreary for [us]1413-our [young people]885-young people in some ways , but not in all , for [we]1413-our had one great anticipation in front of [us]1413-our ; [we]1413-our had never seen [a king]2897-a king , and now some day [we]1413-our should have that prodigious spectacle to see and to treasure in [our]1413-our memories all [our]1413-our lives ; so [we]1413-our were on the lookout , and always eager and watching for the chance . [The others]733-the others were doomed to wait longer than [I]0-i , as it turned out . One day great news came — [the Orleans commissioners]1425-the orleans commissioners , with [Yolande]153-yolande and [[our]1413-our knights]1368-our knights , had at last turned [the council]1427-the council ’s position and persuaded [the King]270-the king to see [Joan]110-joan . [Joan]110-joan received the immense news gratefully but without losing [her]110-joan head , but with [us]1413-our others it was otherwise ; [we]1413-our could not eat or sleep or do any rational thing for the excitement and the glory of it . During two days [[our]1413-our pair of [noble knights]1430-noble knights]1429-our pair of noble knights were in distress and trepidation on [Joan]110-joan ’s account , for [the audience]1431-the audience was to be at night , and [they]1431-the audience were afraid that [Joan]110-joan would be so paralyzed by the glare of light from the long files of torches , the solemn pomps and ceremonies , the great concourse of [renowned personages]1432-renowned personages , the brilliant costumes , and the other splendors of [the Court]389-the court , that [she]110-joan , [a simple country - maid]1434-a simple country - maid , and [all unused to such things]1435-all unused to such things , would be overcome by these terrors and make a piteous failure . No doubt [I]0-i could have comforted [them]1431-the audience , but [I]0-i was not free to speak . Would [Joan]110-joan be disturbed by this cheap spectacle , this tinsel show , with [its small King]1436-its small king and [[his]1436-its small king butterfly dukelets?—she who had spoken face to face with [the princes of heaven]1438-the princes of heaven]1437-his butterfly dukelets?—she who had spoken face to face with the princes of heaven , [the familiars of [God]140-god]1439-the familiars of god , and seen [their]1431-the audience retinue of [angels stretching back into the remoteness of the sky , myriads upon myriads , like a measureless fan of light]1440-angels stretching back into the remoteness of the sky , myriads upon myriads , like a measureless fan of light , a glory like the glory of the sun streaming from each of those innumerable heads , the massed radiance filling the deeps of space with a blinding splendor ? [I]0-i thought not . [Queen Yolande]153-yolande wanted [Joan]110-joan to make the best possible impression upon [the King]270-the king and [the Court]389-the court , so [she]153-yolande was strenuous to have [her]110-joan clothed in the richest stuffs , wrought upon the princeliest pattern , and set off with jewels ; but in that [she]153-yolande had to be disappointed , of course , [Joan]110-joan not being persuadable to it , but begging to be simply and sincerely dressed , as became [a servant of [God]140-god]1443-a servant of god , and [one sent upon a mission of a serious sort and grave political import]1444-one sent upon a mission of a serious sort and grave political import . So then [the gracious Queen]1445-the gracious queen imagined and contrived that simple and witching costume which [I]0-i have described to [you]1446-you so many times , and which [I]0-i can not think of even now in [my]0-i dull age without being moved just as rhythmical and exquisite music moves [one]461-one ; for that was music , that dress — that is what it was — music that [one]461-one saw with the eyes and felt in the heart . Yes , [she]110-joan was a poem , [she]110-joan was a dream , [she]110-joan was [a spirit]1449-a spirit when [she]110-joan was clothed in that . [She]110-joan kept that raiment always , and wore it several times upon occasions of state , and it is preserved to this day in [the Treasury of [Orleans]39-orleans]1450-the treasury of orleans , with two of [her]110-joan swords , and [her]110-joan banner , and other things now sacred because they had belonged to [her]110-joan . At the appointed time [the Count of [Vendome]57-vendome]1451-the count of vendome , [a great lord of [the court]389-the court]1452-a great lord of the court , came richly clothed , with [[his]1451-the count of vendome train of [servants]1007-servants and [assistants]1456-assistants]1454-his train of servants and assistants , to conduct [Joan]110-joan to [the King]270-the king , and [the two knights]1133-the two knights and [I]0-i went with [her]110-joan , being entitled to this privilege by reason of [our]1459-our official positions near [her]110-joan person . When [we]1459-our entered [the great audience - hall]1460-the great audience - hall , there it all was just as [I]0-i have already painted [it]1460-the great audience - hall . Here were ranks of [guards in shining armor and with polished halberds]1461-guards in shining armor and with polished halberds ; two sides of [the hall]1462-the hall were like [flower - gardens]1463-flower - gardens for variety of color and the magnificence of the costumes ; light streamed upon these masses of color from two hundred and fifty flambeaux . There was a wide free space down the middle of [the hall]1462-the hall , and at the end of [it]1462-the hall was a throne royally canopied , and upon [it]1462-the hall sat [a crowned and sceptered figure nobly clothed and blazing with jewels]1465-a crowned and sceptered figure nobly clothed and blazing with jewels . It is true that [Joan]110-joan had been hindered and put off a good while , but now that [she]110-joan was admitted to an audience at last , [she]110-joan was received with honors granted to only [the greatest personages]1466-the greatest personages . At the entrance door stood [four heralds in a row]1467-four heralds in a row , in splendid tabards , with long slender silver trumpets at [their]1467-four heralds in a row mouths , with square silken banners depending from [them]1467-four heralds in a row embroidered with the arms of [France]4-france . As [Joan]110-joan and [the Count]1468-the count passed by , these trumpets gave forth in unison one long rich note , and as [we]1469-our moved down [the hall]1462-the hall under [the pictured and gilded vaulting]1471-the pictured and gilded vaulting , this was repeated at every fifty feet of [our]1469-our progress — six times in all . It made [[our]1469-our good knights]1472-our good knights proud and happy , and [they]1472-our good knights held [themselves]1472-our good knights erect , and stiffened [their]1472-our good knights stride , and looked fine and soldierly . [They]1472-our good knights were not expecting this beautiful and honorable tribute to [[our]1469-our little country - maid]1473-our little country - maid . [Joan]110-joan walked two yards behind [the Count]1468-the count , [we]1469-our three walked two yards behind [Joan]110-joan . [Our]1469-our solemn march ended when [we]1469-our were as yet some eight or ten steps from the throne . [The Count]1468-the count made a deep obeisance , pronounced [Joan]110-joan ’s name , then bowed again and moved to [his]1468-the count place among [a group of officials near the throne]1476-a group of officials near the throne . [I]0-i was devouring [the crowned personage]1477-the crowned personage with all [my]0-i eyes , and [my]0-i heart almost stood still with awe . The eyes of all others were fixed upon [Joan]110-joan in a gaze of wonder which was half worship , and which seemed to say , “ How sweet — how lovely — how divine ! ”[110-joan] All lips were parted and motionless , which was a sure sign that [those people]1318-those people , who seldom forget [themselves]1318-those people , had forgotten [themselves]1318-those people now , and were not conscious of anything but the one object [they]1318-those people were gazing upon . [They]1318-those people had the look of [people who are under the enchantment of a vision]1479-people who are under the enchantment of a vision . Then [they]1318-those people presently began to come to life again , rousing [themselves]1318-those people out of the spell and shaking it off as one drives away little by little a clinging drowsiness or intoxication . Now [they]1318-those people fixed [their]1318-those people attention upon [Joan]110-joan with a strong new interest of another sort ; [they]1318-those people were full of curiosity to see what [she]110-joan would do — [they]1318-those people having a secret and particular reason for this curiosity . So [they]1318-those people watched . This is what [they]1318-those people saw : [She]110-joan made no obeisance , nor even any slight inclination of [her]110-joan head , but stood looking toward the throne in silence . That was all there was to see at present . [I]0-i glanced up at [De Metz]175-de metz , and was shocked at the paleness of [his]1480-his face . [I]0-i whispered and said : “ What is it , [man]577-man , what is it ? ”[0-i] [His]1480-his answering whisper was so weak [I]0-i could hardly catch it : “ [They]1318-those people have taken advantage of the hint in [her]110-joan letter to play a trick upon [her]110-joan ! [She]110-joan will err , and [they]1318-those people will laugh at [her]110-joan . That is not [the King that sits there]2938-the king that sits there . ”[0-i] Then [I]0-i glanced at [Joan]110-joan . [She]110-joan was still gazing steadfastly toward the throne , and [I]0-i had the curious fancy that even [her]110-joan shoulders and the back of [her]110-joan head expressed bewilderment . Now [she]110-joan turned [her]110-joan head slowly , and [her]110-joan eye wandered along the lines of [standing courtiers]1481-standing courtiers till it fell upon [a young man who was very quietly dressed]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed ; then [her]110-joan face lighted joyously , and [she]110-joan ran and threw [herself]110-joan at [his]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed feet , and clasped [his]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed knees , exclaiming in that soft melodious voice which was [her]110-joan birthright and was now charged with deep and tender feeling : “ [God of [his]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed grace]2939-god of his grace give [you]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed long life , [O dear and gentle Dauphin]2940-o dear and gentle dauphin ! ”[110-joan] In [his]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed astonishment and exultation [De Metz]175-de metz cried out : “ By the shadow of [God]140-god , it is an amazing thing ! ”[175-de metz] Then [he]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed mashed all the bones of [my]0-i hand in [his]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed grateful grip , and added , with a proud shake of [his]1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed mane , “ Now , what have [these painted infidels]2941-these painted infidels to say ! ”[1482-a young man who was very quietly dressed] Meantime [the young person in the plain clothes]1483-the young person in the plain clothes was saying to [Joan]110-joan : “ Ah , [you]110-joan mistake , [[my]1483-the young person in the plain clothes child]2372-my child , [I]1483-the young person in the plain clothes am not [the King]270-the king . There [he]270-the king is , ”[1483-the young person in the plain clothes] and [he]1483-the young person in the plain clothes pointed to the throne . [The knight]1484-the knight ’s face clouded , and [he]1483-the young person in the plain clothes muttered in grief and indignation : “ Ah , it is a shame to use [her]110-joan so . But for this lie [she]110-joan had gone through safe . [I]1483-the young person in the plain clothes will go and proclaim to all [the house]630-the house what — ”[1483-the young person in the plain clothes] “ Stay where [you]1483-the young person in the plain clothes are ! ”[0-i] whispered [I]0-i and [the Sieur Bertrand]1485-the sieur bertrand in a breath , and made [him]1483-the young person in the plain clothes stop in [his]1483-the young person in the plain clothes place . [Joan]110-joan did not stir from [her]110-joan knees , but still lifted [her]110-joan happy face toward [the King]270-the king , and said : “ No , [gracious liege]2945-gracious liege , [you]1483-the young person in the plain clothes are [he]270-the king , and [none other]2946-none other . ”[110-joan] [De Metz]175-de metz ’s troubles vanished away , and [he]1483-the young person in the plain clothes said : “ Verily , [she]110-joan was not guessing , [she]110-joan knew . Now , how could [she]110-joan know ? It is a miracle . [I]1483-the young person in the plain clothes am content , and will meddle no more , for [I]1483-the young person in the plain clothes perceive that [she]110-joan is equal to [her]110-joan occasions , having that in [her]110-joan head that can not profitably be helped by the vacancy that is in [mine]1483-the young person in the plain clothes . ”[1483-the young person in the plain clothes] This interruption of [his]1483-the young person in the plain clothes lost [me]0-i a remark or two of the other talk ; however , [I]0-i caught [the King]270-the king ’s next question : “ But tell [me]270-the king who [you]1483-the young person in the plain clothes are , and what would [you]1483-the young person in the plain clothes ? ”[270-the king] “ [I]1488-i am called [Joan the Maid]110-joan , and am sent to say that [the King of Heaven]2664-the king of heaven wills that [you]1483-the young person in the plain clothes be crowned and consecrated in [[your]1483-the young person in the plain clothes good city of [Rheims]54-rheims]2948-your good city of rheims , and be thereafter [Lieutenant of [the Lord of Heaven]2950-the lord of heaven , who is [King of [France]4-france]2516-king of france]2949-lieutenant of the lord of heaven , who is king of france . And [He]2950-the lord of heaven willeth also that [you]1483-the young person in the plain clothes set [me]1488-i at [my]1488-i appointed work and give [me]1488-i [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms . ”[1488-i] After a slight pause [she]1488-i added , [her]1488-i eye lighting at the sound of [her]1488-i words , “ For then will [I]1488-i raise the siege of [Orleans]39-orleans and break the English power ! ”[1488-i] [The young monarch]1489-the young monarch ’s amused face sobered a little when this martial speech fell upon that sick air like a breath blown from [embattled camps]1490-embattled camps and fields of war , and this trifling smile presently faded wholly away and disappeared . [He]1489-the young monarch was grave now , and thoughtful . After a little [he]1489-the young monarch waved [his]1489-the young monarch hand lightly , and all [the people]313-the people fell away and left [those two]775-those two by [themselves]775-those two in [a vacant space]1493-a vacant space . [The knights]1227-the knights and [I]0-i moved to the opposite side of [the hall]1462-the hall and stood there . [We]1496-we saw [Joan]110-joan rise at a sign , then [she]110-joan and [the King]270-the king talked privately together . [All that host]1498-all that host had been consumed with curiosity to see what [Joan]110-joan would do . Well , [they]1498-all that host had seen , and now [they]1498-all that host were full of astonishment to see that [she]110-joan had really performed that strange miracle according to the promise in [her]110-joan letter ; and [they]1498-all that host were fully as much astonished to find that [she]110-joan was not overcome by the pomps and splendors about [her]110-joan , but was even more tranquil and at [her]110-joan ease in holding speech with [a monarch]1499-a monarch than ever [they]1498-all that host [themselves]1498-all that host had been , with all [their]1498-all that host practice and experience . As for [[our]1496-we two knights]1343-our two knights , [they]1498-all that host were inflated beyond measure with pride in [Joan]110-joan , but nearly dumb , as to speech , [they]1498-all that host not being able to think out any way to account for [her]110-joan managing to carry [herself]110-joan through this imposing ordeal without ever a mistake or an awkwardness of any kind to mar the grace and credit of [her]110-joan great performance . The talk between [Joan]110-joan and [the King]270-the king was long and earnest , and held in low voices . [We]1496-we could not hear , but [we]1496-we had [our]1496-we eyes and could note effects ; and presently [we]1496-we and [all the house]1502-all the house noted one effect which was memorable and striking , and has been set down in memoirs and histories and in testimony at the Process of Rehabilitation by [some who witnessed it]1503-some who witnessed it ; for all knew it was big with meaning , though [none]367-none knew what that meaning was at that time , of course . For suddenly [we]1496-we saw [the King]270-the king shake off [his]270-the king indolent attitude and straighten up like [a man]2329-a man , and at the same time look immeasurably astonished . It was as if [Joan]110-joan had told [him]270-the king something almost too wonderful for belief , and yet of a most uplifting and welcome nature . It was long before [we]1496-we found out the secret of this conversation , but [we]1496-we know it now , and all [the world]320-the world knows it . That part of the talk was like this — as one may read in all histories . [The perplexed King]1508-the perplexed king asked [Joan]110-joan for a sign . [He]270-the king wanted to believe in [her]110-joan and [her]110-joan mission , and that [her]110-joan Voices were supernatural and endowed with knowledge hidden from [mortals]1509-mortals , but how could [he]270-the king do this unless [these Voices]1510-these voices could prove [their]1510-these voices claim in some absolutely unassailable way ? It was then that [Joan]110-joan said : “ [I]110-joan will give [you]270-the king a sign , and [you]270-the king shall no more doubt . There is a secret trouble in [your]270-the king heart which [you]270-the king speak of to none — a doubt which wastes away [your]270-the king courage , and makes [you]270-the king dream of throwing all away and fleeing from [[your]270-the king realm]2953-your realm . Within this little while [you]270-the king have been praying , in [your]270-the king own breast , that [[God]140-god of [his]270-the king grace]2939-god of his grace would resolve that doubt , even if the doing of it must show [you]270-the king that no kingly right is lodged in [you]270-the king . ”[110-joan] It was that that amazed [the King]270-the king , for it was as [she]110-joan had said : [his]270-the king prayer was the secret of [his]270-the king own breast , and none but [God]140-god could know about it . So [he]270-the king said : “ The sign is sufficient . [I]270-the king know now that [these Voices]1510-these voices are of [God]140-god . [They]1510-these voices have said true in this matter ; if [they]1510-these voices have said more , tell it [me]270-the king — [I]270-the king will believe . ”[270-the king] “ [They]1510-these voices have resolved that doubt , and [I]270-the king bring [their]1510-these voices very words , which are these : [Thou]2956-thy art [lawful heir to [[the King]270-the king [thy]2956-thy father]2959-the king thy father , and [true heir of [France]4-france]2960-true heir of france]2957-lawful heir to the king thy father , and true heir of france . [God]140-god has spoken it . Now lift up [thy]2956-thy head , and doubt no more , but give [me]270-the king [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms and let [me]270-the king get about [my]270-the king work . ”[270-the king] Telling [him]1512-him [he]1512-him was of lawful birth was what straightened [him]1512-him up and made [a man]2329-a man of [him]1512-him for a moment , removing [his]1512-him doubts upon that head and convincing [him]1512-him of [his]1512-him royal right ; and if any could have hanged [[his]1512-him hindering and pestiferous council]1514-his hindering and pestiferous council and set [him]1512-him free , [he]1512-him would have answered [Joan]110-joan ’s prayer and set [her]110-joan in [the field]698-the field . But no , [those creatures]1516-those creatures were only checked , not checkmated ; [they]1516-those creatures could invent some more delays . [We]1517-we had been made proud by the honors which had so distinguished [Joan]110-joan ’s entrance into [that place]1518-that place — honors restricted to [personages of very high rank and worth]1519-personages of very high rank and worth — but that pride was as nothing compared with the pride [we]1517-we had in the honor done [her]110-joan upon leaving [it]1518-that place . For whereas those first honors were shown only to [the great]1520-the great , these last , up to this time , had been shown only to [the royal]1521-the royal . [The King]270-the king [himself]270-the king led [Joan]110-joan by the hand down [the great hall]1523-the great hall to the door , [the glittering multitude]1524-the glittering multitude standing and making reverence as [they]1524-the glittering multitude passed , and the silver trumpets sounding those rich notes of theirs . Then [he]270-the king dismissed [her]110-joan with gracious words , bending low over [her]110-joan hand and kissing it . Always — from all companies , high or low — [she]110-joan went forth richer in honor and esteem than when [she]110-joan came . And [the King]270-the king did another handsome thing by [Joan]110-joan , for [he]270-the king sent [us]1517-we back to [Courdray Castle]58-courdray castle torch - lighted and in state , under escort of [[his]270-the king own troop]1526-his own troop — [[his]270-the king guard of honor]1527-his guard of honor — [the only soldiers [he]270-the king had]1528-the only soldiers he had ; and finely equipped and bedizened [they]1526-his own troop were , too , though [they]1526-his own troop had n’t seen the color of [their]1526-his own troop wages since [they]1526-his own troop were [children]550-children , as [a body]1530-a body might say . The wonders which [Joan]110-joan had been performing before [the King]270-the king had been carried all around by this time , so [the road]840-the road was so packed with [people who wanted to get a sight of [her]110-joan that [we]1517-we could hardly dig through]1533-people who wanted to get a sight of her that we could hardly dig through ; and as for talking together , [we]1517-we could n’t , all attempts at talk being drowned in the storm of shoutings and huzzas that broke out all along as [we]1517-we passed , and kept abreast of [us]1517-we like a wave the whole way . Chapter 7 [[Our]1517-we Paladin]1534-our paladin in [His]1534-our paladin Glory [WE]1517-we WERE doomed to suffer tedious waits and delays , and [we]1517-we settled [ourselves]1517-we down to [our]1517-we fate and bore it with a dreary patience , counting the slow hours and the dull days and hoping for a turn when [God]140-god should please to send it . [The Paladin]157-the paladin was the only exception — that is to say , [he]157-the paladin was the only one who was happy and had no heavy times . This was partly owing to the satisfaction [he]157-the paladin got out of [his]157-the paladin clothes . [He]157-the paladin bought them at second hand — a Spanish cavalier ’s complete suit , wide - brimmed hat with flowing plumes , lace collar and cuffs , faded velvet doublet and trunks , short cloak hung from the shoulder , funnel - topped buskins , long rapier , and all that — a graceful and picturesque costume , and [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s great frame was the right place to hang it for effect . [He]157-the paladin wore it when off duty ; and when [he]157-the paladin swaggered by with one hand resting on the hilt of [his]157-the paladin rapier , and twirling [his]157-the paladin new mustache with the other , [everybody]464-everybody stopped to look and admire ; and well [they]464-everybody might , for [he]157-the paladin was a fine and stately contrast to [the small French gentlemen of the day squeezed into the trivial French costume of the time]1536-the small french gentlemen of the day squeezed into the trivial french costume of the time . [He]157-the paladin was [king bee of [the little village that snuggled under the shelter of the frowning towers and bastions of [Courdray Castle]58-courdray castle]1538-the little village that snuggled under the shelter of the frowning towers and bastions of courdray castle]1537-king bee of the little village that snuggled under the shelter of the frowning towers and bastions of courdray castle , and [acknowledged lord of [the tap - room of [the inn]1541-the inn]1540-the tap - room of the inn]1539-acknowledged lord of the tap - room of the inn . When [he]157-the paladin opened [his]157-the paladin mouth there , [he]157-the paladin got a hearing . [Those simple artisans]1542-those simple artisans and [peasants]1543-peasants listened with deep and wondering interest ; for [he]157-the paladin was [a traveler]1544-a traveler and had seen [the world]320-the world — all of it that lay between [Chinon]53-chinon and [Domremy]1-domremy , at any rate — and that was a wide stretch more of it than [they]464-everybody might ever hope to see ; and [he]157-the paladin had been in battle , and knew how to paint its shock and struggle , its perils and surprises , with an art that was all [his]157-the paladin own . [He]157-the paladin was [cock of that walk]1546-cock of that walk , [hero of [that hostelry]1548-that hostelry]1547-hero of that hostelry ; [he]157-the paladin drew custom as honey draws flies ; so [he]157-the paladin was the pet of [the innkeeper]1347-the innkeeper , and of [[his]157-the paladin wife]412-his wife and [daughter]1551-daughter , and [they]1552-they were [[his]157-the paladin obliged and [willing servants]1554-willing servants]1553-his obliged and willing servants . [Most people who have the narrative gift — that great and rare endowment]1555-most people who have the narrative gift — that great and rare endowment — have with it the defect of telling [their]1555-most people who have the narrative gift — that great and rare endowment choice things over the same way every time , and this injures [them]1555-most people who have the narrative gift — that great and rare endowment and causes [them]1555-most people who have the narrative gift — that great and rare endowment to sound stale and wearisome after several repetitions ; but it was not so with [the Paladin , whose art was of a finer sort]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort ; it was more stirring and interesting to hear [him]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort tell about a battle the tenth time than it was the first time , because [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort did not tell it twice the same way , but always made a new battle of it and a better one , with more casualties on [the enemy]2442-the enemy ’s side each time , and more general wreck and disaster all around , and [more widows]1558-more widows and [orphans]1559-orphans and suffering in the neighborhood where it happened . [He]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort could not tell [his]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort battles apart [himself]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort , except by [their]1560-their names ; and by the time [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort had told one of then ten times it had grown so that there was n’t room enough in [France]4-france for it any more , but was lapping over the edges . But up to that point [the audience]1431-the audience would not allow [him]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort to substitute a new battle , knowing that [the old ones]1562-the old ones were the best , and sure to improve as long as [France]4-france could hold [them]1562-the old ones ; and so , instead of saying to [him]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort as [they]1431-the audience would have said to [another]2787-another , “ Give [us]1565-us something fresh , [we]1565-us are fatigued with that old thing , ”[1431-the audience] [they]1431-the audience would say , with one voice and with a strong interest , “ Tell about the surprise at [Beaulieu]60-beaulieu again — tell it three or four times ! ”[1431-the audience] That is a compliment which [few narrative experts]1564-few narrative experts have heard in [their]1564-few narrative experts lifetime . At first when [the Paladin]157-the paladin heard [us]1565-us tell about the glories of [the Royal Audience]1566-the royal audience [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort was broken - hearted because [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort was not taken with [us]1565-us to it ; next , [his]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort talk was full of what [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort would have done if [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort had been [there]460-there ; and within two days [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort was telling what [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort did do when [he]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort was [there]460-there . [[His]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort mill]1569-his mill was fairly started , now , and could be trusted to take care of its affair . Within three nights afterward all [his]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort battles were taking a rest , for already [[his]1556-the paladin , whose art was of a finer sort worshipers in [the tap - room]1571-the tap - room]1570-his worshipers in the tap - room were so infatuated with the great tale of [the Royal Audience]1566-the royal audience that [they]1570-his worshipers in the tap - room would have nothing else , and so besotted with it were [they]1570-his worshipers in the tap - room that [they]1570-his worshipers in the tap - room would have cried if [they]1570-his worshipers in the tap - room could not have gotten it . [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel hid [himself]135-noel and heard it , and came and told [me]0-i , and after that [we]1573-we went together to listen , bribing [the inn hostess]1574-the inn hostess to let [us]1573-we have [[her]1574-the inn hostess little private parlor]1575-her little private parlor , where [we]1573-we could stand at the wickets in the door and see and hear . [The tap - room]1571-the tap - room was large , yet had a snug and cozy look , with [its]1571-the tap - room inviting little tables and chairs scattered irregularly over [its]1571-the tap - room red brick floor , and [its]1571-the tap - room great fire flaming and crackling in the wide chimney . [It]1571-the tap - room was [a comfortable place]1577-a comfortable place to be in on such chilly and blustering March nights as these , and [a goodly company]1578-a goodly company had taken shelter [there]460-there , and were sipping [their]1578-a goodly company wine in contentment and gossiping one with [another]2787-another in a neighborly way while [they]1578-a goodly company waited for the historian . [The host]1581-the host , [the hostess]1582-the hostess , and [[their]1578-a goodly company pretty daughter]1583-their pretty daughter were flying here and there and yonder among the tables and doing [their]1578-a goodly company best to keep up with the orders .
