[The room]1355-the room was about forty feet square , and a space or aisle down the center of [it]1355-the room had been kept vacant and reserved for [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s needs . At the end of [it]1355-the room was a platform ten or twelve feet wide , with a big chair and a small table on [it]1355-the room , and three steps leading up to [it]1355-the room . Among [the wine - sippers]1585-the wine - sippers were [many familiar faces]1586-many familiar faces : [the cobbler]1587-the cobbler , [the farrier]1588-the farrier , [the blacksmith]1589-the blacksmith , [the wheelwright]1590-the wheelwright , [the armorer]1591-the armorer , [the maltster]1592-the maltster , [the weaver]1593-the weaver , [the baker]1594-the baker , [[the miller]1595-the miller ’s man with [his]1595-the miller dusty coat , and so on]1596-the miller ’s man with his dusty coat , and so on ; and conscious and important , as a matter of course , was [the barber - surgeon]1597-the barber - surgeon , for [he]1597-the barber - surgeon is that in [all villages]1598-all villages . As [he]1597-the barber - surgeon has to pull [everybody]464-everybody ’s teeth and purge and bleed [all the grown people]1600-all the grown people once a month to keep [their]1600-all the grown people health sound , [he]1597-the barber - surgeon knows [everybody]464-everybody , and by constant contact with [all sorts of folk]1602-all sorts of folk becomes [a master of etiquette and manners and a conversationalist of large facility]1603-a master of etiquette and manners and a conversationalist of large facility . There were plenty of [carriers]1604-carriers , [drovers]1605-drovers , and [[their]1605-drovers sort]1606-their sort , and [journeymen artisans]1607-journeymen artisans . When [the Paladin]732-the paladin presently came sauntering indolently in , [he]732-the paladin was received with a cheer , and [the barber]1609-the barber hustled forward and greeted [him]732-the paladin with several low and most graceful and courtly bows , also taking [his]732-the paladin hand and touching [his]732-the paladin lips to it . Then [he]1609-the barber called in a loud voice for a stoup of wine for [the Paladin]157-the paladin , and when [[the host]1581-the host ’s daughter]1611-the host ’s daughter brought it up on the platform and dropped [her]1611-the host ’s daughter courtesy and departed , [the barber]1609-the barber called after [her]1611-the host ’s daughter , and told [her]1611-the host ’s daughter to add the wine to [his]1609-the barber score . This won [him]1609-the barber ejaculations of approval , which pleased [him]1609-the barber very much and made [his]1609-the barber little rat - eyes shine ; and such applause is right and proper , for when [we]1613-we do a liberal and gallant thing it is but natural that [we]1613-we should wish to see notice taken of it . [The barber]1609-the barber called upon [the people]313-the people to rise and drink [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s health , and [they]313-the people did it with alacrity and affectionate heartiness , clashing [their]313-the people metal flagons together with a simultaneous crash , and heightening the effect with a resounding cheer . It was a fine thing to see how [that young swashbuckler]1616-that young swashbuckler had made [himself]1616-that young swashbuckler so popular in [a strange land]1617-a strange land in so little a while , and without other helps to [his]1616-that young swashbuckler advancement than just [his]1616-that young swashbuckler tongue and the talent to use it given [him]1616-that young swashbuckler by [God]140-god — a talent which was but one talent in the beginning , but was now become ten through husbandry and the increment and usufruct that do naturally follow that and reward it as by a law . [The people]313-the people sat down and began to hammer on the tables with [their]313-the people flagons and call for “ [the King]270-the king ’s Audience!—the King ’s Audience!—the King ’s Audience ! ”[313-the people] [The Paladin]732-the paladin stood there in one of [his]732-the paladin best attitudes , with [his]732-the paladin plumed great hat tipped over to the left , the folds of [his]732-the paladin short cloak drooping from [his]732-the paladin shoulder , and the one hand resting upon the hilt of [his]732-the paladin rapier and the other lifting [his]732-the paladin beaker . As the noise died down [he]732-the paladin made a stately sort of a bow , which [he]732-the paladin had picked up somewhere , then fetched [his]732-the paladin beaker with a sweep to [his]732-the paladin lips and tilted [his]732-the paladin head back and drained it to the bottom . [The barber]1609-the barber jumped for it and set it upon [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s table . Then [the Paladin]732-the paladin began to walk up and down [[his]732-the paladin platform]1622-his platform with a great deal of dignity and quite at [his]732-the paladin ease ; and as [he]732-the paladin walked [he]732-the paladin talked , and every little while stopped and stood facing [[his]732-the paladin house]2680-his house and so standing continued [his]732-the paladin talk . [We]1624-we went three nights in succession . It was plain that there was a charm about the performance that was apart from the mere interest which attaches to lying . It was presently discoverable that this charm lay in [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s sincerity . [He]157-the paladin was not lying consciously ; [he]157-the paladin believed what [he]157-the paladin was saying . To [him]157-the paladin , [his]157-the paladin initial statements were facts , and whenever [he]157-the paladin enlarged a statement , the enlargement became a fact too . [He]157-the paladin put [his]157-the paladin heart into [his]157-the paladin extravagant narrative , just as [a poet]1625-a poet puts [his]157-the paladin heart into a heroic fiction , and [his]157-the paladin earnestness disarmed criticism — disarmed it as far as [he]157-the paladin [himself]157-the paladin was concerned . [Nobody]434-nobody believed [his]157-the paladin narrative , but [all]738-all believed that [he]157-the paladin believed it . [He]157-the paladin made [his]157-the paladin enlargements without flourish , without emphasis , and so casually that often [one]461-one failed to notice that a change had been made . [He]157-the paladin spoke of [the governor of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]2645-the governor of vaucouleurs , the first night , simply as [the governor of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]2645-the governor of vaucouleurs ; [he]157-the paladin spoke of [him]157-the paladin the second night as [[his]157-the paladin uncle]1631-his uncle [the governor of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]2645-the governor of vaucouleurs ; the third night [he]157-the paladin was [[his]157-the paladin father]1633-his father . [He]157-the paladin did not seem to know that [he]157-the paladin was making these extraordinary changes ; they dropped from [his]157-the paladin lips in a quite natural and effortless way . By [his]157-the paladin first night ’s account [the governor]2647-the governor merely attached [him]157-the paladin to [[the Maid]1326-the maid ’s military escort]1636-the maid ’s military escort in a general and unofficial way ; the second night [[his]157-the paladin uncle]1631-his uncle [the governor]2647-the governor sent [him]157-the paladin with [the Maid]1326-the maid as [lieutenant of [her]1326-the maid rear guard]1640-lieutenant of her rear guard ; the third night [[his]157-the paladin father]1633-his father [the governor]2647-the governor put the whole command , [Maid]1643-maid and all , in [his]2647-the governor special charge . The first night [the governor]2647-the governor spoke of [him]157-the paladin as [a youth without name or ancestry , but “ destined to achieve both ”]2963-a youth without name or ancestry , but “ destined to achieve both ”[2647-the governor] ; the second night [[his]157-the paladin uncle]1631-his uncle [the governor]2647-the governor spoke of [him]157-the paladin as [the latest and worthiest lineal descendent of [the chiefest and noblest of the Twelve Paladins of Charlemagne]1648-the chiefest and noblest of the twelve paladins of charlemagne]1647-the latest and worthiest lineal descendent of the chiefest and noblest of the twelve paladins of charlemagne ; the third night [he]2647-the governor spoke of [him]157-the paladin as [the lineal descendent of the whole dozen]1649-the lineal descendent of the whole dozen . In three nights [he]2647-the governor promoted [the Count of [Vendome]57-vendome]1451-the count of vendome from [a fresh acquaintance]1651-a fresh acquaintance to [a schoolmate]1652-a schoolmate , and then [brother - in - law]1653-brother - in - law . At [[the King]270-the king ’s Audience]1655-the king ’s audience everything grew , in the same way . First the four silver trumpets were twelve , then thirty - five , finally ninety - six ; and by that time [he]2647-the governor had thrown in so many drums and cymbals that [he]2647-the governor had to lengthen [the hall]1462-the hall from five hundred feet to nine hundred to accommodate [them]1657-them . Under [his]2647-the governor hand [the people present]1658-the people present multiplied in the same large way . The first two nights [he]2647-the governor contented [himself]2647-the governor with merely describing and exaggerating the chief dramatic incident of [the Audience]1431-the audience , but the third night [he]2647-the governor added illustration to description . [He]2647-the governor throned [the barber]1609-the barber in [his]2647-the governor own high chair to represent [the sham King]1661-the sham king ; then [he]2647-the governor told how [the Court]389-the court watched [the Maid]1326-the maid with intense interest and suppressed merriment , expecting to see [her]1326-the maid fooled by the deception and get [herself]1326-the maid swept permanently out of credit by the storm of scornful laughter which would follow . [He]2647-the governor worked this scene up till [he]2647-the governor got [[his]2647-the governor house]2680-his house in a burning fever of excitement and anticipation , then came [his]2647-the governor climax . Turning to [the barber]1609-the barber , [he]2647-the governor said : “ But mark [you]1609-the barber what [she]1326-the maid did . [She]1326-the maid gazed steadfastly upon [that sham]2964-that sham ’s villain face as [I]2647-the governor now gaze upon [yours]2965-yours — this being [her]1326-the maid noble and simple attitude , just as [I]2647-the governor stand now — then turned [she]1326-the maid — thus — to [me]2647-the governor , and stretching [her]1326-the maid arm out — so — and pointing with [her]1326-the maid finger , [she]1326-the maid said , in that firm , calm tone which [she]1326-the maid was used to use in directing the conduct of a battle , ‘ Pluck [me]2647-the governor this false knave from the throne ! ’ [I]2647-the governor , striding forward as [I]2647-the governor do now , took [him]2647-the governor by the collar and lifted [him]2647-the governor out and held [him]2647-the governor aloft — thus — as if [he]2647-the governor had been but [a child]327-a child . ”[2647-the governor] ( [The house]630-the house rose , shouting , stamping , and banging with [their]630-the house flagons , and went fairly mad over this magnificent exhibition of strength — and there was not the shadow of a laugh anywhere , though the spectacle of the limp but proud barber hanging there in the air like a puppy held by the scruff of its neck was a thing that had nothing of solemnity about it . ) “ Then [I]1667-she set [him]2647-the governor down upon [his]2647-the governor feet — thus — being minded to get [him]2647-the governor by a better hold and heave [him]2647-the governor out of the window , but [she]1667-she bid [me]1667-she forbear , so by that error [he]2647-the governor escaped with [his]2647-the governor life . “[1667-she] Then [she]1667-she turned [her]1667-she about and viewed [the throng]1668-the throng with those eyes of [hers]1667-she , which are the clear - shining windows whence [her]1667-she immortal wisdom looketh out upon [the world]320-the world , resolving its falsities and coming at the kernel of truth that is hid within them , and presently [they]1670-they fell upon [a young man]1671-a young man modestly clothed , and [him]1671-a young man [she]1667-she proclaimed for what [he]1671-a young man truly was , saying , ‘ [I]0-i am [[thy]1671-a young man servant]1672-thy servant — [thou]0-i art [the King]270-the king ! ’ Then [all]738-all were astonished , and a great shout went up , the whole six thousand joining in it , so that the walls rocked with the volume and the tumult of it . ” [He]270-the king made a fine and picturesque thing of the march - out from [the Audience]1431-the audience , augmenting the glories of it to the last limit of the impossibilities ; then [he]270-the king took from [his]270-the king finger and held up a brass nut from a bolt - head which [the head ostler at [the castle]976-the castle]2968-the head ostler at the castle had given [him]270-the king that morning , and made [his]270-the king conclusion — thus : “[270-the king] Then [the King]270-the king dismissed [the Maid]110-joan most graciously — as indeed was [her]110-joan desert — and , turning to [me]0-i , said , ‘ Take this signet - ring , [son of [the Paladins]188-the paladins]1676-son of the paladins , and command [me]0-i with it in [your]0-i day of need ; and look [you]0-i , ’ said [he]270-the king , touching [my]0-i temple , ‘ preserve this brain , [France]4-france has use for it ; and look well to [its]4-france casket also , for [I]0-i foresee that it will be hooped with a ducal coronet one day . ’ [I]0-i took the ring , and knelt and kissed [his]270-the king hand , saying , ‘ [Sire]189-sire , where glory calls , there will [I]0-i be found ; where danger and death are thickest , that is [my]0-i native air ; when [France]4-france and [the throne]1677-the throne need help — well , [I]0-i say nothing , for [I]0-i am not of the talking sort — let [my]0-i deeds speak for [me]0-i , it is all [I]0-i ask . ’ “ So ended the most fortunate and memorable episode , so big with future weal for the crown and [the nation]2970-the nation , and unto [God]140-god be the thanks ! Rise ! Fill [your]2971-your flagons ! Now — to [France]4-france and [the King]270-the king — drink ! ”[1678-they] [They]1678-they emptied [them]1679-them to the bottom , then burst into cheers and huzzas , and kept it up as much as two minutes , [the Paladin]157-the paladin standing at stately ease the while and smiling benignantly from [his]157-the paladin platform . Chapter 8 [Joan]110-joan Persuades [[Her]110-joan Inquisitors]1680-her inquisitors WHEN [JOAN]110-joan told [the King]270-the king what that deep secret was that was torturing [his]270-the king heart , [his]270-the king doubts were cleared away ; [he]270-the king believed [she]110-joan was sent of [God]140-god , and if [he]270-the king had been let alone [he]270-the king would have set [her]110-joan upon [her]110-joan great mission at once . But [he]270-the king was not let alone . [Tremouille]183-tremouille and [the holy fox of [Rheims]54-rheims]1682-the holy fox of rheims knew [[their]1680-her inquisitors man]1683-their man . All [they]1680-her inquisitors needed to say was this — and [they]1680-her inquisitors said it : “ [[Your]270-the king Highness]2973-your highness says [her]110-joan Voices have revealed to [you]270-the king , by [her]110-joan mouth , a secret known only to [yourself]270-the king and [God]140-god . How can [you]270-the king know that [her]110-joan Voices are not of [Satan]144-satan , and [she]110-joan [his]144-satan mouthpiece?—for does not [Satan]144-satan know the secrets of [men]282-men and use [his]144-satan knowledge for the destruction of [their]282-men souls ? It is a dangerous business , and [[your]270-the king Highness]2973-your highness will do well not to proceed in it without probing the matter to the bottom . ”[1680-her inquisitors] That was enough . It shriveled up [the King]270-the king ’s little soul like a raisin , with terrors and apprehensions , and straightway [he]270-the king privately appointed a commission of [bishops]1685-bishops to visit and question [Joan]110-joan daily until [they]1686-they should find out whether [her]110-joan supernatural helps hailed from heaven or from [hell]1687-hell . [[The King]270-the king ’s relative]1689-the king ’s relative , [the Duke of [Alencon]61-alencon]1690-the duke of alencon , [three years prisoner of war to [the English]2659-the english]1691-three years prisoner of war to the english , was in these days released from captivity through promise of a great ransom ; and the name and fame of [the Maid]1326-the maid having reached [him]1689-the king ’s relative — for the same filled all mouths now , and penetrated to all parts — [he]1689-the king ’s relative came to [Chinon]53-chinon to see with [his]1689-the king ’s relative own eyes what manner of creature [she]110-joan might be . [The King]270-the king sent for [Joan]110-joan and introduced [her]110-joan to [the Duke]1695-the duke . [She]110-joan said , in [her]110-joan simple fashion : “ [You]270-the king are welcome ; the more of the blood of [France]4-france that is joined to this cause , the better for the cause and it . ”[110-joan] Then [the two]780-the two talked together , and there was just the usual result : when [they]780-the two departed , [the Duke]1695-the duke was [[her]110-joan friend]1698-her friend and [advocate]1699-advocate . [Joan]110-joan attended [the King]270-the king ’s mass the next day , and afterward dined with [the King]270-the king and [the Duke]1695-the duke . [The King]270-the king was learning to prize [her]110-joan company and value [her]110-joan conversation ; and that might well be , for , like [other kings]1704-other kings , [he]270-the king was used to getting nothing out of [people]2327-people ’s talk but guarded phrases , colorless and non - committal , or carefully tinted to tally with the color of what [he]270-the king said [himself]270-the king ; and so this kind of conversation only vexes and bores , and is wearisome ; but [Joan]110-joan ’s talk was fresh and free , sincere and honest , and unmarred by timorous self - watching and constraint . [She]110-joan said the very thing that was in [her]110-joan mind , and said it in a plain , straightforward way . [One]461-one can believe that to [the King]270-the king this must have been like fresh cold water from [the mountains]1708-the mountains to parched lips used to the water of the sun - baked puddles of [the plain]1709-the plain . After dinner [Joan]110-joan so charmed [the Duke]1695-the duke with [her]110-joan horsemanship and lance practice in [the meadows]1711-the meadows by [the Castle of Chinon whither]1712-the castle of chinon whither [the King]270-the king also had come to look on , that [he]270-the king made [her]110-joan a present of a great black war - steed . Every day [the commission of [bishops]1685-bishops]1714-the commission of bishops came and questioned [Joan]110-joan about [her]110-joan Voices and [her]110-joan mission , and then went to [the King]270-the king with [their]1714-the commission of bishops report . These pryings accomplished but little . [She]110-joan told as much as [she]110-joan considered advisable , and kept the rest to [herself]110-joan . Both threats and trickeries were wasted upon [her]110-joan . [She]110-joan did not care for the threats , and the traps caught nothing . [She]110-joan was perfectly frank and childlike about these things . [She]110-joan knew [the bishops]1360-the bishops were sent by [the King]270-the king , that [their]1360-the bishops questions were [the King]270-the king ’s questions , and that by all law and custom [a King]2897-a king ’s questions must be answered ; yet [she]110-joan told [the King]270-the king in [her]110-joan naive way at [his]270-the king own table one day that [she]110-joan answered only such of those questions as suited [her]110-joan . [The bishops]1360-the bishops finally concluded that [they]1360-the bishops could n’t tell whether [Joan]110-joan was sent by [God]140-god or not . [They]1360-the bishops were cautious , [you]1723-you see . There were [two powerful parties at Court]1724-two powerful parties at court ; therefore to make a decision either way would infallibly embroil [them]1724-two powerful parties at court with one of those parties ; so it seemed to [them]1724-two powerful parties at court wisest to roost on the fence and shift the burden to other shoulders . And that is what [they]1360-the bishops did . [They]1360-the bishops made final report that [Joan]110-joan ’s case was beyond [their]1360-the bishops powers , and recommended that it be put into the hands of [the learned and illustrious doctors of [the University of [Poitiers]63-poitiers]62-the university of poitiers]1725-the learned and illustrious doctors of the university of poitiers . Then [they]1360-the bishops retired from [the field]698-the field , leaving behind [them]1360-the bishops this little item of testimony , wrung from [them]1360-the bishops by [Joan]110-joan ’s wise reticence : [they]1360-the bishops said [she]110-joan was [a “ gentle and simple little shepherdess]2976-a “ gentle and simple little shepherdess , very candid , but not given to talking . ”[1360-the bishops] It was quite true — in [their]1360-the bishops case . But if [they]1360-the bishops could have looked back and seen [her]110-joan with [us]1727-us in [the happy pastures of [Domremy]1-domremy]1728-the happy pastures of domremy , [they]1360-the bishops would have perceived that [she]110-joan had a tongue that could go fast enough when no harm could come of [her]110-joan words . So [we]1727-us traveled to [Poitiers]63-poitiers , to endure there three weeks of tedious delay while [this poor child]1729-this poor child was being daily questioned and badgered before a great bench of — what ? [Military experts?—since]1730-military experts?—since what [she]110-joan had come to apply for was [an army]1731-an army and the privilege of leading [it]1731-an army to battle against [the enemies of [France]4-france]1732-the enemies of france . Oh no ; it was a great bench of [priests]1415-priests and [monks]1734-monks — [profoundly leaned and astute casuists]1735-profoundly leaned and astute casuists — [renowned professors of theology]1736-renowned professors of theology ! Instead of setting [a military commission]1737-a military commission to find out if [this valorous little soldier]1738-this valorous little soldier could win victories , [they]1360-the bishops set [a company of holy hair - splitters]1739-a company of holy hair - splitters and [phrase - mongers]1740-phrase - mongers to work to find out if [the soldier]1741-the soldier was sound in [her]1741-the soldier piety and had no doctrinal leaks . The rats were devouring [the house]630-the house , but instead of examining the cat ’s teeth and claws , [they]1360-the bishops only concerned [themselves]1360-the bishops to find out if it was a holy cat . If it was a pious cat , a moral cat , all right , never mind about the other capacities , [they]1743-they were of no consequence . [Joan]110-joan was as sweetly self - possessed and tranquil before this grim tribunal , with [its]1744-its robed celebrities , its solemn state and imposing ceremonials , as if [she]110-joan were but [a spectator]1745-a spectator and not [herself]110-joan on trial . [She]110-joan sat there , solitary on [her]110-joan bench , untroubled , and disconcerted the science of [the sages]1746-the sages with [her]110-joan sublime ignorance — an ignorance which was a fortress ; arts , wiles , the learning drawn from books , and all like missiles rebounded from its unconscious masonry and fell to the ground harmless ; [they]1360-the bishops could not dislodge the garrison which was within — [Joan]110-joan ’s serene great heart and spirit , [the guards and keepers of [her]110-joan mission]1747-the guards and keepers of her mission . [She]110-joan answered all questions frankly , and [she]110-joan told all the story of [her]110-joan visions and of [her]110-joan experiences with [the angels]1748-the angels and what [they]1748-the angels said to [her]110-joan ; and the manner of the telling was so unaffected , and so earnest and sincere , and made it all seem so lifelike and real , that even that hard practical court forgot itself and sat motionless and mute , listening with a charmed and wondering interest to the end . And if [you]1749-you would have other testimony than [mine]1750-mine , look in the histories and [you]1749-you will find where [an eyewitness , giving sworn testimony in the Rehabilitation process]1751-an eyewitness , giving sworn testimony in the rehabilitation process , says that [she]110-joan told that tale “ with a noble dignity and simplicity , ”[110-joan] and as to its effect , says in substance what [I]0-i have said . Seventeen , [she]110-joan was — seventeen , and all alone on [her]110-joan bench by [herself]110-joan ; yet was not afraid , but faced [that great company of erudite doctors of law and theology]1752-that great company of erudite doctors of law and theology , and by the help of no art learned in [the schools]1753-the schools , but using only the enchantments which were [hers]110-joan by nature , of youth , sincerity , a voice soft and musical , and an eloquence whose source was the heart , not the head , [she]110-joan laid that spell upon [them]1748-the angels . Now was not that a beautiful thing to see ? If [I]0-i could , [I]0-i would put it before [you]1749-you just as [I]0-i saw it ; then [I]0-i know what [you]1749-you would say . As [I]0-i have told [you]1749-you , [she]110-joan could not read . “ One day [they]1748-the angels harried and pestered [her]110-joan with arguments , reasonings , objections , and other windy and wordy trivialities , gathered out of the works of this and that and the other great theological authority , until at last [her]110-joan patience vanished , and [she]110-joan turned upon [them]1748-the angels sharply and said : “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know A from B ; but [I]0-i know this : that [I]0-i am come by command of [the Lord of Heaven]2950-the lord of heaven to deliver [Orleans]186-bastard from the English power and crown [the King of [Rheims]54-rheims]1755-the king of rheims , and the matters [ye]1749-you are puttering over are of no consequence ! ” Necessarily those were trying days for [her]110-joan , and wearing for [everybody that took part]2977-everybody that took part ; but [her]110-joan share was the hardest , for [she]110-joan had no holidays , but must be always on hand and stay the long hours through , whereas this , that , and [the other inquisitor]2978-the other inquisitor could absent [himself]2978-the other inquisitor and rest up from [his]2978-the other inquisitor fatigues when [he]2978-the other inquisitor got worn out . And yet [she]110-joan showed no wear , no weariness , and but seldom let fly [her]110-joan temper . As a rule [she]110-joan put [her]110-joan day through calm , alert , patient , fencing with [those veteran masters of scholarly sword - play]2979-those veteran masters of scholarly sword - play and coming out always without a scratch . One day [a Dominican]2980-a dominican sprung upon [her]110-joan a question which made [everybody]464-everybody cock up [his]464-everybody ears with interest ; as for [me]1756-you , [I]1756-you trembled , and said to [myself]1756-you [she]110-joan is done this time , poor [Joan]110-joan , for there is no way of answering this . [The sly Dominican]191-the sly dominican began in this way — in a sort of indolent fashion , as if the thing [he]191-the sly dominican was about was a matter of no moment : “[1756-you] [You]1756-you assert that [God]140-god has willed to deliver [France]4-france from this English bondage ? ” “[140-god] Yes , [He]140-god has willed it . ” “[140-god] [You]1756-you wish for [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms , so that [you]1756-you may go to the relief of [Orleans]39-orleans , [I]0-i believe ? ” “[0-i] Yes — and the sooner the better . ” “[0-i] [God]140-god is all - powerful , and able to do whatsoever thing [He]140-god wills to do , is it not so ? ” “[140-god] Most surely . None doubts it . ” [The Dominican]2982-the dominican lifted [his]2982-the dominican head suddenly , and sprung that question [I]140-god have spoken of , with exultation : “[140-god] Then answer [me]0-i this . If [He]140-god has willed to deliver [France]4-france , and is able to do whatsoever [He]140-god wills , where is the need for [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms ? ” There was a fine stir and commotion when [he]2982-the dominican said that , and a sudden thrusting forward of heads and putting up of hands to ears to catch the answer ; and [the Dominican]2982-the dominican wagged [his]2982-the dominican head with satisfaction , and looked about [him]2982-the dominican collecting [his]2982-the dominican applause , for it shone in every face . But [Joan]110-joan was not disturbed . There was no note of disquiet in [her]110-joan voice when [she]110-joan answered : “[140-god] [He]140-god helps who help [themselves]1759-themselves . [The sons of]1760-the sons of [France]4-france will fight the battles , but [He]140-god will give the victory ! ” [You]2984-you could see a light of admiration sweep [the house]630-the house from face to face like a ray from the sun . Even [the Dominican]2982-the dominican [himself]2982-the dominican looked pleased , to see [his]2982-the dominican master - stroke so neatly parried , and [I]634-the child heard [a venerable bishop]2987-a venerable bishop mutter , in the phrasing common to [priest]2988-priest and [people]2327-people in that robust time , “[634-the child] By [God]140-god , [the child]634-the child has said true . [He]140-god willed that [Goliath]192-goliath should be slain , and [He]140-god sent [a child like this]1762-a child like this to do it ! ” Another day , when the inquisition had dragged along until [everybody]464-everybody looked drowsy and tired but [Joan]110-joan , [Brother Seguin]193-brother seguin , [professor of theology at [the University of [Poitiers]63-poitiers]62-the university of poitiers]2991-professor of theology at the university of poitiers , who was [a sour and sarcastic man]2992-a sour and sarcastic man , fell to plying [Joan]110-joan with all sorts of nagging questions in [his]193-brother seguin bastard Limousin French — for [he]193-brother seguin was from [Limoges]64-limoges . Finally [he]193-brother seguin said : “[140-god] How is it that [you]1763-you understand [those angels]1764-those angels ? What language did [they]1764-those angels speak ? ” “[1764-those angels] French . ” “[1764-those angels] In - deed ! How pleasant to know that [our]1765-our language is so honored ! Good French ? ” “[1764-those angels] Yes — perfect . ” “[1764-those angels] Perfect , eh ? Well , certainly [you]1763-you ought to know . It was even better than [your]1763-you own , eh ? ” “[1763-you] As to that , [I]0-i — [I]0-i believe [I]0-i can not say , ” said [she]0-i , and was going on , but stopped . Then [she]0-i added , almost as if [she]0-i were saying it to [herself]0-i , “[0-i] Still , it was an improvement on [yours]1763-you ! ” [I]1763-you knew there was a chuckle back of [her]0-i eyes , for all [their]1764-those angels innocence . [Everybody]464-everybody shouted . [Brother Seguin]193-brother seguin was nettled , and asked brusquely : “[1763-you] Do [you]1763-you believe in [God]140-god ? ” [Joan]110-joan answered with an irritating nonchalance : “[1763-you] Oh , well , yes — better than [you]1766-you , it is likely . ” [Brother Seguin]193-brother seguin lost [his]193-brother seguin patience , and heaped sarcasm after sarcasm upon [her]110-joan , and finally burst out in angry earnest , exclaiming : “[1763-you] Very well , [I]0-i can tell [you]1763-you this , [you]1763-you whose belief in [God]140-god is so great : [God]140-god has not willed that any shall believe in [you]1763-you without a sign . Where is [your]1763-you sign?—show it ! ” This roused [Joan]110-joan , and [she]110-joan was on [her]110-joan feet in a moment , and flung out [her]110-joan retort with spirit : “[0-i] [I]0-i have not come to [Poitiers]63-poitiers to show signs and do miracles . Send [me]0-i to [Orleans]39-orleans and [you]1766-you shall have signs enough . Give [me]0-i [men - at - arms]2638-men - at - arms — [few or many]1768-few or many — and let [me]0-i go ! ” The fire was leaping from [her]110-joan eyes — ah , [the heroic little figure]2994-the heroic little figure ! ca n’t [you]1766-you see [her]2994-the heroic little figure ? There was a great burst of acclamations , and [she]110-joan sat down blushing , for it was not in [her]110-joan delicate nature to like being conspicuous . This speech and that episode about the French language scored two points against [Brother Seguin]193-brother seguin , while [he]193-brother seguin scored nothing against [Joan]110-joan ; yet , [sour man]2995-sour man as [he]193-brother seguin was , [he]193-brother seguin was [a manly man]2996-a manly man , and honest , as [you]1766-you can see by the histories ; for at the Rehabilitation [he]193-brother seguin could have hidden those unlucky incidents if [he]193-brother seguin had chosen , but [he]193-brother seguin did n’t do it , but spoke them right out in [his]193-brother seguin evidence . On one of the latter days of that three - weeks session [the gowned scholars]2997-the gowned scholars and [professors]2998-professors made one grand assault all along the line , fairly overwhelming [Joan]110-joan with objections and arguments culled from the writings of [every ancient and illustrious authority of [the Roman Church]3000-the roman church]2999-every ancient and illustrious authority of the roman church . [She]110-joan was well - nigh smothered ; but at last [she]110-joan shook [herself]110-joan free and struck back , crying out : “[140-god] Listen ! The Book of [God]140-god is worth more than all these [ye]1769-ye cite , and [I]0-i stand upon it . And [I]0-i tell [ye]1769-ye there are things in that Book that not one among [ye]1769-ye can read , with all [your]1769-ye learning ! ” From the first [she]110-joan was [the guest]3001-the guest , by invitation , of [the dame De Rabateau]3002-the dame de rabateau , [wife of [a councilor of the Parliament of [Poitiers]63-poitiers]3004-a councilor of the parliament of poitiers]3003-wife of a councilor of the parliament of poitiers ; and to that house [the great ladies of [the city]372-the city]3005-the great ladies of the city came nightly to see [Joan]110-joan and talk with [her]110-joan ; and not these only , but [the old lawyers , councilors and [scholars of the Parliament]3008-scholars of the parliament and [the University]65-the university]3007-the old lawyers , councilors and scholars of the parliament and the university . And [these grave men]3009-these grave men , accustomed to weigh every strange and questionable thing , and cautiously consider it , and turn it about this way and that and still doubt it , came night after night , and night after night , falling ever deeper and deeper under the influence of that mysterious something , that spell , that elusive and unwordable fascination , which was the supremest endowment of [Joan of Arc]110-joan , that winning and persuasive and convincing something which high and low alike recognized and felt , but which [neither high nor low]3010-neither high nor low could explain or describe , and one by one [they]3009-these grave men all surrendered , saying , “[0-i] [This child]1770-this child is sent of [God]140-god . ” All day long [Joan]110-joan , in the great court and subject to its rigid rules of procedure , was at a disadvantage ; [[her]110-joan judges]3011-her judges had things [their]3011-her judges own way ; but at night [she]110-joan held [court]3012-court [herself]110-joan , and matters were reversed , [she]110-joan presiding , with [her]110-joan tongue free and [[her]110-joan same judges]3013-her same judges there before [her]110-joan . There could not be but one result : all the objections and hindrances [they]3009-these grave men could build around [her]110-joan with [their]3009-these grave men hard labors of the day [she]110-joan would charm away at night . In the end , [she]110-joan carried [[her]110-joan judges]3011-her judges with [her]110-joan in a mass , and got [her]110-joan great verdict without a dissenting voice . [The court]389-the court was a sight to see when [the president of it]3016-the president of it read it from [his]3016-the president of it throne , for [all the great people of [the town]786-the town]3017-all the great people of the town were there who could get admission and find [room]3019-room . First there were some solemn ceremonies , proper and usual at such times ; then , when there was silence again , the reading followed , penetrating the deep hush so that every word was heard in even the remotest parts of [the house]630-the house : “[1770-this child] It is found , and is hereby declared , that [Joan of Arc]110-joan , called [the Maid]1326-the maid , is [a good Christian]1772-a good christian and [a good Catholic]1773-a good catholic ; that there is nothing in [her]110-joan person or [her]110-joan words contrary to the faith ; and that [the King]270-the king may and ought to accept the succor [she]110-joan offers ; for to repel it would be to offend [the Holy Spirit]1775-the holy spirit , and render [him]270-the king unworthy of the air of [God]140-god . ” [The court]389-the court rose , and then the storm of plaudits burst forth unrebuked , dying down and bursting forth again and again , and [I]1776-i lost sight of [Joan]110-joan , for [she]110-joan was swallowed up in a great tide of [people who rushed to congratulate [her]110-joan and pour out benedictions upon [her]110-joan and upon the cause of [France]4-france]3022-people who rushed to congratulate her and pour out benedictions upon her and upon the cause of france , now solemnly and irrevocably delivered into [her]110-joan little hands . Chapter 9 [She]110-joan Is Made General - in - Chief IT WAS indeed a great day , and a stirring thing to see . [She]110-joan had won ! It was a mistake of [Tremouille]183-tremouille and [[her]110-joan other ill - wishers]3023-her other ill - wishers to let [her]110-joan hold court those nights . [The commission of priests sent to [Lorraine]19-lorraine]3024-the commission of priests sent to lorraine ostensibly to inquire into [Joan]110-joan ’s character — in fact to weary [her]110-joan with delays and wear out [her]110-joan purpose and make [her]110-joan give it up — arrived back and reported [her]110-joan character perfect . [Our]3025-our affairs were in full career now , [you]3026-you see . The verdict made a prodigious stir . Dead [France]4-france woke suddenly to life , wherever the great news traveled . Whereas before , [the spiritless and cowed people]3027-the spiritless and cowed people hung [their]3027-the spiritless and cowed people heads and slunk away if one mentioned war to [them]3027-the spiritless and cowed people , now [they]3027-the spiritless and cowed people came clamoring to be enlisted under the banner of [the Maid of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]1353-the maid of vaucouleurs , and the roaring of war - songs and the thundering of the drums filled all the air . [I]1776-i remembered now what [she]110-joan had said , that time there in [[our]3025-our village]848-our village when [I]1776-i proved by facts and statistics that [France]4-france ’s case was hopeless , and nothing could ever rouse [the people]313-the people from [their]313-the people lethargy : “[1776-i] [They]1776-i will hear the drums — and [they]1776-i will answer , [they]1776-i will march ! ” It has been said that misfortunes never come one at a time , but in a body . In [our]3025-our case it was the same with good luck . Having got a start , it came flooding in , tide after tide . [Our]3025-our next wave of it was of this sort . There had been grave doubts among [the priests]3031-the priests as to whether [the Church]409-the church ought to permit [a female soldier]3033-a female soldier to dress like [a man]2329-a man . But now came a verdict on that head . [Two of [the greatest scholars]3036-the greatest scholars and [theologians of the time]3037-theologians of the time — one of whom had been Chancellor of [the University of [Paris]2-paris]66-the university of paris]3035-two of the greatest scholars and theologians of the time — one of whom had been chancellor of the university of paris — rendered it . [They]3035-two of the greatest scholars and theologians of the time — one of whom had been chancellor of the university of paris decided that since [Joan]110-joan “[2476-a soldier] must do the work of [a man]2329-a man and [a soldier]2476-a soldier , it is just and legitimate that [her]1779-her apparel should conform to the situation . ” It was a great point gained , [the Church]409-the church ’s authority to dress as [a man]2329-a man . Oh , yes , wave on wave the good luck came sweeping in . Never mind about the smaller waves , let [us]3025-our come to the largest one of all , the wave that swept [us]3025-our small fry quite off [our]3025-our feet and almost drowned [us]3025-our with joy . The day of the great verdict , [couriers]3040-couriers had been despatched to [the King]270-the king with it , and the next morning bright and early the clear notes of a bugle came floating to [us]3025-our on the crisp air , and [we]3025-our pricked up [our]3025-our ears and began to count them . One — two — three ; pause ; one — two ; pause ; one — two — three , again — and out [we]3025-our skipped and went flying ; for that formula was used only when [[the King]270-the king ’s herald - at - arms]3043-the king ’s herald - at - arms would deliver a proclamation to [the people]313-the people . As [we]3025-our hurried along , [people]2327-people came racing out of [every street]3046-every street and [house]2406-house and [alley]3048-alley , [men]282-men , [women]1218-women , and [children]550-children , [all flushed , excited , and throwing lacking articles of clothing on]3052-all flushed , excited , and throwing lacking articles of clothing on as [they]2327-people ran ; still those clear notes pealed out , and still the rush of [people]2327-people increased till [the whole town]3054-the whole town was abroad and streaming along [the principal street]3055-the principal street . At last [we]3025-our reached [the square]816-the square , which was now packed with [citizens]3057-citizens , and there , high on the pedestal of the great cross , [we]3025-our saw [the herald]3058-the herald in [his]3058-the herald brilliant costume , with [his]3058-the herald servitors about [him]3058-the herald . The next moment [he]3058-the herald began [his]3058-the herald delivery in the powerful voice proper to [[his]3058-the herald office]1119-his office : “[1782-god king of france] Know [all men]1780-all men , and take heed therefore , that [the most high , the most illustrious Charles]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles , by the grace of [God King of [France]4-france]1782-god king of france , hath been pleased to confer upon [[his]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles well - beloved servant]1783-his well - beloved servant [Joan of Arc]110-joan , called [the Maid]1326-the maid , the title , emoluments , authorities , and dignity of [General - in - Chief of [the Armies of [France]4-france]339-the armies of france]1785-general - in - chief of the armies of france — ” Here a thousand caps flew in the air , and [the multitude]3060-the multitude burst into a hurricane of cheers that raged and raged till it seemed as if it would never come to an end ; but at last it did ; then [the herald]3058-the herald went on and finished:—“and[1326-the maid] hath appointed to be [[her]1787-she lieutenant]1788-her lieutenant and [chief of staff]1789-chief of staff [a prince of [[his]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles royal house]1791-his royal house , [his]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles grace [the Duke of [Alencon]61-alencon]1690-the duke of alencon]1790-a prince of his royal house , his grace the duke of alencon ! ” That was the end , and the hurricane began again , and was split up into innumerable strips by the blowers of it and wafted through [all the lanes and streets of [the town]786-the town]3062-all the lanes and streets of the town . [General of [the Armies of [France]4-france]67-the armies of france]3064-general of the armies of france , with [a prince of the blood for subordinate]3065-a prince of the blood for subordinate ! Yesterday [she]1787-she was nothing — to - day [she]1787-she was this . Yesterday [she]1787-she was not even [a sergeant]3066-a sergeant , not even [a corporal]3067-a corporal , not even [a private]3068-a private — to - day , with one step , [she]1787-she was at the top . Yesterday [she]1787-she was less than nobody to [the newest recruit]3069-the newest recruit — to - day [her]1787-she command was law to [La Hire]195-la hire , [Saintrailles]40-saintrailles , [the Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2736-the bastard of orleans , and [all those others]3071-all those others , [veterans of old renown]3072-veterans of old renown , [illustrious masters of the trade of war]3073-illustrious masters of the trade of war . These were the thoughts [I]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles was thinking ; [I]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles was trying to realize this strange and wonderful thing that had happened , [you]3074-you see . [My]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles mind went travelling back , and presently lighted upon a picture — a picture which was still so new and fresh in [my]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles memory that it seemed a matter of only yesterday — and indeed its date was no further back than the first days of January . This is what it was . [A peasant - girl in [a far - off village]3076-a far - off village]3075-a peasant - girl in a far - off village , [her]1787-she seventeenth year not yet quite completed , and [herself]1787-she and [[her]1787-she village]3077-her village as unknown as if [they]3078-they had been on [the other side of the globe]3079-the other side of the globe . [She]1787-she had picked up [a friendless wanderer somewhere]3080-a friendless wanderer somewhere and brought [it]3080-a friendless wanderer somewhere [home]377-home — a small gray kitten in a forlorn and starving condition — and had fed it and comforted [it]3080-a friendless wanderer somewhere and got its confidence and made [it]3080-a friendless wanderer somewhere believe in [her]1787-she , and now it was curled up in [her]1787-she lap asleep , and [she]1787-she was knitting a coarse stocking and thinking — dreaming — about what , [one]461-one may never know . And now — the kitten had hardly had time to become a cat , and yet already [the girl]3083-the girl is [General of [the Armies of [France]4-france]339-the armies of france , with [a prince of the blood to give orders]3086-a prince of the blood to give orders to , and out of [[her]3083-the girl village]3077-her village]3084-general of the armies of france , with a prince of the blood to give orders to , and out of her village obscurity [her]3083-the girl name has climbed up like the sun and is visible from [all corners of [the land]1069-the land]3088-all corners of the land ! It made [me]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles dizzy to think of these things , they were so out of the common order , and seemed so impossible . Chapter 10 [The Maid]1326-the maid ’s Sword and [Banner JOAN]110-joan ’S first official act was to dictate a letter to [the English commanders at [Orleans]39-orleans]3091-the english commanders at orleans , summoning [them]3091-the english commanders at orleans to deliver up [all strongholds in [their]3091-the english commanders at orleans possession]3092-all strongholds in their possession and depart out of [France]4-france . [She]110-joan must have been thinking it all out before and arranging it in [her]110-joan mind , it flowed from [her]110-joan lips so smoothly , and framed itself into such vivacious and forcible language . Still , it might not have been so ; [she]110-joan always had a quick mind and a capable tongue , and [her]110-joan faculties were constantly developing in these latter weeks . This letter was to be forwarded presently from [Blois]69-blois . [Men]282-men , provisions , and money were offering in plenty now , and [Joan]110-joan appointed [Blois]69-blois as [a recruiting - station and depot of supplies]3094-a recruiting - station and depot of supplies , and ordered up [La Hire]195-la hire from [the front]3095-the front to take charge . [The Great Bastard]3096-the great bastard — [him]3096-the great bastard of [the ducal house]3097-the ducal house , and [governor of [Orleans]39-orleans]3098-governor of orleans — had been clamoring for weeks for [Joan]110-joan to be sent to [him]3096-the great bastard , and now came [another messenger]3099-another messenger , [old D’Aulon]196-d’aulon , [a veteran officer]3100-a veteran officer , [a trusty man and fine and honest]3101-a trusty man and fine and honest . [The King]270-the king kept [him]196-d’aulon , and gave [him]196-d’aulon to [Joan]110-joan to be [chief of [[her]110-joan household]3104-her household]3103-chief of her household , and commanded [her]110-joan to appoint [the rest of [[her]110-joan people]3106-her people [herself]110-joan]3105-the rest of her people herself , making [their]3105-the rest of her people herself number and dignity accord with the greatness of [[her]110-joan office]3107-her office ; and at the same time [he]270-the king gave order that [they]3105-the rest of her people herself should be properly equipped with arms , clothing , and horses . Meantime [the King]270-the king was having a complete suit of armor made for [her]110-joan at [Tours]70-tours . It was of the finest steel , heavily plated with silver , richly ornamented with engraved designs , and polished like a mirror . [[Joan]110-joan ’s Voices]3109-joan ’s voices had told [her]110-joan that there was an ancient sword hidden somewhere behind the altar of [St. Catherine ’s at [Fierbois]52-fierbois]71-st. catherine ’s at fierbois , and [she]110-joan sent [De Metz]175-de metz to get it . [The priests]3031-the priests knew of no such sword , but a search was made , and sure enough it was found in [that place]1518-that place , buried a little way under the ground . It had no sheath and was very rusty , but [the priests]3031-the priests polished it up and sent it to [Tours]70-tours , whither [we]3113-we were now to come . [They]3031-the priests also had a sheath of crimson velvet made for it , and [the people of [Tours]70-tours]3114-the people of tours equipped [it]3031-the priests with another , made of cloth - of - gold . But [Joan]110-joan meant to carry this sword always in battle ; so [she]110-joan laid the showy sheaths away and got one made of leather . It was generally believed that this sword had belonged to [Charlemagne]197-charlemagne , but that was only a matter of opinion . [I]1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles wanted to sharpen that old blade , but [she]110-joan said it was not necessary , as [she]110-joan should never kill [anybody]563-anybody , and should carry it only as a symbol of authority . At [Tours]70-tours [she]110-joan designed [her]110-joan Standard , and [a Scotch painter named [James Power]198-james power]3116-a scotch painter named james power made it . It was of the most delicate white boucassin , with fringes of silk . For device it bore the image of [God the Father]140-god throned in the clouds and holding [the world]320-the world in [His]140-god hand ; [two angels]3118-two angels knelt at [His]140-god feet , presenting lilies ; inscription , JESUS , [MARIA]155-marie dupont ; on the reverse the crown of [France]145-france supported by [two angels]3118-two angels . [She]110-joan also caused a smaller standard or pennon to be made , whereon was represented an angel offering a lily to [the Holy Virgin]3120-the holy virgin . Everything was humming [there]460-there at Tours . Every now and then [one]461-one heard the bray and crash of military music , every little while [one]461-one heard the measured tramp of [marching men]1042-marching men — [squads of recruits]3125-squads of recruits leaving for [Blois]69-blois ; songs and shoutings and huzzas filled the air night and day , [the town]786-the town was full of [strangers]707-strangers , [the streets]361-the streets and [inns]1076-inns were thronged , the bustle of preparation was everywhere , and [everybody]464-everybody carried a glad and cheerful face . Around [[Joan]110-joan ’s headquarters]3131-joan ’s headquarters [a crowd of [people]2327-people]3132-a crowd of people was always massed , hoping for a glimpse of [the new General]3134-the new general , and when [they]3132-a crowd of people got it , [they]3132-a crowd of people went wild ; but [they]3132-a crowd of people seldom got it , for [she]110-joan was busy planning [her]110-joan campaign , receiving reports , giving orders , despatching [couriers]3040-couriers , and giving what odd moments [she]110-joan could spare to [the companies of [great folk waiting in [the drawing - rooms]3138-the drawing - rooms]3137-great folk waiting in the drawing - rooms]3136-the companies of great folk waiting in the drawing - rooms . As for [[us]3139-we [boys]3141-boys]3140-us boys , [we]3139-we hardly saw [her]110-joan at all , [she]110-joan was so occupied . [We]3139-we were in a mixed state of mind — sometimes hopeful , sometimes not ; mostly not . [She]110-joan had not appointed [[her]110-joan household]3104-her household yet — that was [our]3139-we trouble . [We]3139-we knew [she]110-joan was being overrun with applications for places in [it]3104-her household , and that these applications were backed by great names and weighty influence , whereas [we]3139-we had nothing of the sort to recommend [us]3139-we . [She]110-joan could fill [[her]110-joan humblest places]3143-her humblest places with [titled folk]3144-titled folk — [folk whose relationships would be a bulwark for [her]110-joan and a valuable support at all times]3145-folk whose relationships would be a bulwark for her and a valuable support at all times . In these circumstances would [policy]3146-policy allow [her]110-joan to consider [us]3139-we ? [We]3139-we were not as cheerful as [the rest of [the town]786-the town]3147-the rest of the town , but were inclined to be depressed and worried . Sometimes [we]3139-we discussed [our]3139-we slim chances and gave [them]3144-titled folk as good an appearance as [we]3139-we could . But the very mention of the subject was anguish to [the Paladin]157-the paladin ; for whereas [we]3139-we had some little hope , [he]157-the paladin had none at all . As a rule [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel was quite willing to let the dismal matter alone ; but not when [the Paladin]157-the paladin was present . Once [we]3139-we were talking the thing over , when [Noel]135-noel said : “[1781-the most high , the most illustrious charles] Cheer up , [Paladin]157-the paladin , [I]0-i had a dream last night , and [you]157-the paladin were the only one among [us]1793-us that got an appointment . It was n’t a high one , but it was an appointment , anyway — [some kind of a lackey or body - servant , or something of that kind]1794-some kind of a lackey or body - servant , or something of that kind . ” [The Paladin]157-the paladin roused up and looked almost cheerful ; for [he]157-the paladin was [a believer in dreams , and in anything and everything of a superstitious sort]3149-a believer in dreams , and in anything and everything of a superstitious sort , in fact . [He]157-the paladin said , with a rising hopefulness : “[0-i] [I]0-i wish it might come true . Do [you]157-the paladin think it will come true ? ” “[157-the paladin] Certainly ; [I]0-i might almost say [I]0-i know it will , for [my]0-i dreams hardly ever fail . ” “[135-noel] [Noel]135-noel , [I]0-i could hug [you]135-noel if that dream could come true , [I]0-i could , indeed ! To be servant of [the first General of [France]4-france]1795-the first general of france and have all [the world]320-the world hear of it , and the news go back to [the village]401-the village and make those gawks stare that always said [I]0-i would n’t ever amount to anything — wouldn’t it be great ! Do [you]135-noel think it will come true , [Noel]135-noel ? Do n’t [you]135-noel believe it will ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do . There ’s [my]0-i hand on it . ” “[0-i] [Noel]135-noel , if it comes true [I]0-i ’ll never forget [you]135-noel — shake again ! [I]0-i should be dressed in a noble livery , and the news would go to [the village]401-the village , and [those animals]1799-those animals would say , ‘ [Him]1800-he , lackey to [the General - in - Chief]1801-the general - in - chief , with the eyes of [the whole world]337-the whole world on [him]1800-he , admiring — well , [he]1800-he has shot up into the sky now , has n’t [he]1800-he ! ” [He]1800-he began to walk the floor and pile castles in the air so fast and so high that [we]3150-we could hardly keep up with [him]1800-he . Then all of a sudden all the joy went out of [his]1800-he face and misery took its place , and [he]1800-he said : “[1800-he] Oh , [dear]2328-dear , it is all a mistake , it will never come true . [I]0-i forgot that foolish business at [Toul]46-toul . [I]0-i have kept out of [her]1804-she sight as much as [I]0-i could , all these weeks , hoping [she]1804-she would forget that and forgive it — but [I]0-i know [she]1804-she never will . [She]1804-she ca n’t , of course . And , after all , [I]0-i was n’t to blame . [I]0-i did say [she]1804-she promised to marry [me]0-i , but [they]1805-they put [me]0-i up to it and persuaded [me]0-i . [I]0-i swear [they]1805-they did ! ” [The vast creature]3151-the vast creature was almost crying . Then [he]3151-the vast creature pulled [himself]3151-the vast creature together and said , remorsefully , “[1805-they] It was the only lie [I]0-i ’ve ever told , and — ” [He]3151-the vast creature was drowned out with a chorus of groans and outraged exclamations ; and before [he]3151-the vast creature could begin again , [one of [[D’Aulon]196-d’aulon ’s liveried servants]3153-d’aulon ’s liveried servants]3152-one of d’aulon ’s liveried servants appeared and said [we]1809-we were required at [headquarters]1208-headquarters . [We]1809-we rose , and [Noel]135-noel said : “[0-i] There — what did [I]0-i tell [you]1806-you ? [I]0-i have a presentiment — the spirit of prophecy is upon [me]0-i . [She]1807-she is going to appoint [him]1808-him , and [we]1809-we are to go [there]460-there and do [him]1808-him homage . Come along ! ” But [the Paladin]157-the paladin was afraid to go , so [we]1809-we left [him]157-the paladin . When [we]1809-we presently stood in the presence , in front of [a crowd of [glittering officers of [the army]3157-the army]3156-glittering officers of the army]3155-a crowd of glittering officers of the army , [Joan]110-joan greeted [us]1809-we with a winning smile , and said [she]110-joan appointed all of [us]1809-we to places in [[her]110-joan household]3104-her household , for [she]110-joan wanted [[her]110-joan old friends]3159-her old friends by [her]110-joan . One at a time [we]1809-we stepped forward and [each]3161-each received [his]3161-each warrant from the hand of [[our]1809-we chief]3162-our chief , [D’Aulon]196-d’aulon . [All of [us]1809-we]3163-all of us had honorable places ; [the two knights]1133-the two knights stood highest ; then [[Joan]110-joan ’s two brothers]3165-joan ’s two brothers ; [I]1807-she was [first page]3166-first page and [secretary]332-secretary , [a young gentleman named [Raimond]199-raimond]3168-a young gentleman named raimond was [second page]3169-second page ; [Noel]135-noel was [[her]110-joan messenger]3170-her messenger ; [she]110-joan had [two heralds]3171-two heralds , and also [a chaplain]3172-a chaplain and [almoner]3173-almoner , whose name was [Jean Pasquerel]200-jean pasquerel . [She]110-joan had previously appointed [a maitre d’hotel and a number of domestics]3174-a maitre d’hotel and a number of domestics . Now [she]110-joan looked around and said : “[1807-she] But where is [the Paladin]157-the paladin ? ” [The Sieur Bertrand]168-the sieur bertrand said : “[157-the paladin] [He]157-the paladin thought [he]157-the paladin was not sent for , [[your]1811-your Excellency]2648-your excellency . ” “[157-the paladin] Now that is not well . Let [him]157-the paladin be called . ” [The Paladin]157-the paladin entered humbly enough . [He]157-the paladin ventured no farther than just within the door . [He]157-the paladin stopped there , looking embarrassed and afraid . Then [Joan]110-joan spoke pleasantly , and said : “[0-i] [I]0-i watched [you]157-the paladin on [the road]840-the road . [You]157-the paladin began badly , but improved . Of old [you]157-the paladin were [a fantastic talker]1814-a fantastic talker , but there is [a man in [you]157-the paladin]1815-a man in you , and [I]0-i will bring it out . ” It was fine to see [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s face light up when [she]110-joan said that . “[0-i] Will [you]157-the paladin follow where [I]0-i lead ? ” “[157-the paladin] Into the fire ! ” [he]157-the paladin said ; and [I]157-the paladin said to [myself]157-the paladin , “[157-the paladin] By the ring of that , [I]0-i think [she]0-i has turned [this braggart]1816-this braggart into [a hero]1817-a hero . It is another of [her]0-i miracles , [I]0-i make no doubt of it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i believe [you]157-the paladin , ” said [Joan]110-joan . “[157-the paladin] Here — take [my]0-i banner . [You]157-the paladin will ride with [me]0-i in [every field]1818-every field , and when [France]4-france is saved , [you]157-the paladin will give it [me]0-i back . ” [He]157-the paladin took the banner , which is now the most precious of the memorials that remain of [Joan of Arc]110-joan , and [his]157-the paladin voice was unsteady with emotion when [he]157-the paladin said : “[157-the paladin] If [I]0-i ever disgrace this trust , [[my]0-i comrades]1819-my comrades here will know how to do [a friend]629-a friend ’s office upon [my]0-i body , and this charge [I]0-i lay upon [them]1819-my comrades , as knowing [they]1819-my comrades will not fail [me]0-i . ” Chapter 11 The War March Is Begun [NOEL]135-noel and [I]1821-the first went back together — silent at first , and impressed . Finally [Noel]135-noel came up out of [his]135-noel thinkings and said : “[1821-the first] [The first]1821-the first shall be last and the last first — there ’s authority for this surprise . But at the same time was n’t it a lofty hoist for [our]1822-our big bull ! ” “[1823-her] It truly was ; [I]0-i am not over being stunned yet . It was the greatest place in [her]1823-her gift . ” “[1823-her] Yes , it was . There are [many generals]1824-many generals , and [she]1823-her can create more ; but there is only [one Standard - Bearer]1825-one standard - bearer . ” “[1825-one standard - bearer] True . It is [the most conspicuous place in [the army]3157-the army , after [her]1823-her own]1826-the most conspicuous place in the army , after her own . ” “[1823-her] And the most coveted and honorable . [Sons of two dukes]1828-sons of two dukes tried to get it , as [we]1822-our know . And of [all people in [the world]320-the world]1829-all people in the world , [this majestic windmill]1831-this majestic windmill carries it off . Well , is n’t it a gigantic promotion , when [you]1832-you come to look at it ! ” “[1832-you] There ’s no doubt about it . [It]1833-it ’s a kind of copy of [Joan]110-joan ’s own in miniature . ” “[110-joan] [I]0-i do n’t know how to account for it — do [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes — without any trouble at all — that is , [I]0-i think [I]0-i do . ” [Noel]135-noel was surprised at that , and glanced up quickly , as if to see if [I]0-i was in earnest . [He]135-noel said : “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]0-i could n’t be in earnest , but [I]0-i see [you]0-i are . If [you]0-i can make [me]0-i understand this puzzle , do it . Tell [me]0-i what the explanation is . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i believe [I]0-i can . [You]0-i have noticed that [[our]1834-we chief knight]1835-our chief knight says a good many wise things and has a thoughtful head on [his]1835-our chief knight shoulders . One day , riding along , [we]1834-we were talking about [Joan]110-joan ’s great talents , and [he]1835-our chief knight said , ‘ But , greatest of all [her]110-joan gifts , [she]110-joan has the seeing eye . ’ [I]0-i said , like [an unthinking fool]1836-an unthinking fool , ‘ The seeing eye?—I should n’t count on that for much — [I]0-i suppose [we]1834-we all have it . ’ ‘ No , ’ [he]1835-our chief knight said ; ‘ very few have it . ’ Then [he]1835-our chief knight explained , and made [his]1835-our chief knight meaning clear . [He]1835-our chief knight said the common eye sees only the outside of things , and judges by that , but [the seeing eye]1837-the seeing eye pierces through and reads the heart and the soul , finding there capacities which the outside did n’t indicate or promise , and which the other kind of eye could n’t detect . [He]1835-our chief knight said [the mightiest military genius]1838-the mightiest military genius must fail and come to nothing if it have not the seeing eye — that is to say , if it can not read [men]282-men and select [its subordinates]1840-its subordinates with an infallible judgment . It sees as by intuition that [this man]692-this man is good for strategy , that one for dash and [daredevil assault]1842-daredevil assault , the other for patient bulldog persistence , and it appoints each to [his]692-this man right place and wins , while [the commander without the seeing eye]1843-the commander without the seeing eye would give to [each the other]1844-each the other ’s place and lose . [He]1835-our chief knight was right about [Joan]110-joan , and [I]0-i saw it . When [she]110-joan was [a child]327-a child and [the tramp]1846-the tramp came one night , [[her]110-joan father]650-her father and [all of [us]3163-all of us]3163-all of us took [him]692-this man for [a rascal]2409-a rascal , but [she]110-joan saw [the honest man]1850-the honest man through the rags . When [I]0-i dined with [the governor of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]2645-the governor of vaucouleurs so long ago , [I]0-i saw nothing in [[our]3163-all of us two knights]1343-our two knights , though [I]0-i sat with [them]1343-our two knights and talked with [them]1343-our two knights two hours ; [Joan]110-joan was there five minutes , and neither spoke with [them]1343-our two knights nor heard [them]1343-our two knights speak , yet [she]110-joan marked [them]1343-our two knights for [men of worth and fidelity]1853-men of worth and fidelity , and [they]1343-our two knights have confirmed [her]110-joan judgment . Whom has [she]110-joan sent for to take charge of [this thundering rabble of [new recruits at [Blois]69-blois]1855-new recruits at blois , made up of [old disbanded Armagnac raiders]1856-old disbanded armagnac raiders , unspeakable hellions , every one]1854-this thundering rabble of new recruits at blois , made up of old disbanded armagnac raiders , unspeakable hellions , every one ? Why , [she]110-joan has sent for [Satan]144-satan [himself]144-satan — that is to say , [La Hire]195-la hire — [that military hurricane]1857-that military hurricane , [that godless swashbuckler]1858-that godless swashbuckler , that lurid conflagration of blasphemy , [that Vesuvius of profanity]1859-that vesuvius of profanity , forever in eruption . Does [he]144-satan know how to deal with [that mob of roaring devils]1860-that mob of roaring devils ? Better than [any man that lives]1861-any man that lives ; for [he]144-satan is [the head devil of [this world]345-this world [his]144-satan own self]1862-the head devil of this world his own self , [he]144-satan is [the match of [the whole of [them]1866-them combined]1865-the whole of them combined , and probably [the father of most of [them]1866-them]1867-the father of most of them]1864-the match of the whole of them combined , and probably the father of most of them . [She]110-joan places [him]144-satan in temporary command until [she]110-joan can get to [Blois]69-blois [herself]110-joan — and then ! Why , then [she]110-joan will certainly take [them]1868-them in hand personally , or [I]0-i do n’t know [her]110-joan as well as [I]0-i ought to , after all these years of intimacy . That will be a sight to see — that fair spirit in [her]110-joan white armor , delivering [her]110-joan will to that muck - heap , that rag - pile , that abandoned refuse of perdition . ” “[195-la hire] [La Hire]195-la hire ! ” cried [Noel]135-noel , “[195-la hire] [[our]1869-our hero of all these years]1870-our hero of all these years — [I]0-i do want to see [that man]2334-that man ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i too . [His]2334-that man name stirs [me]0-i just as it did when [I]0-i was [a little boy]1872-a little boy . ” “[2334-that man] [I]0-i want to hear [him]2334-that man swear . ” “[2334-that man] Of course , [I]0-i would rather hear [him]2334-that man swear than [another man]1873-another man pray . [He]2334-that man is [the frankest man there is]1874-the frankest man there is , and the naivest . Once when [he]2334-that man was rebuked for pillaging on [[his]2334-that man raids]1875-his raids , [he]2334-that man said it was nothing . Said [he]2334-that man , ‘ If [God the Father]140-god were [a soldier]2476-a soldier , [He]2334-that man would rob . ’ [I]0-i judge [he]2334-that man is [the right man to take temporary charge [there]460-there at [Blois]69-blois]1877-the right man to take temporary charge there at blois . [Joan]110-joan has cast the seeing eye upon [him]2334-that man , [you]1879-you see . ” “[110-joan] Which brings [us]1880-us back to where [we]1880-us started . [I]0-i have an honest affection for [the Paladin]732-the paladin , and not merely because [he]732-the paladin is [a good fellow]1882-a good fellow , but because [he]732-the paladin is [[my]0-i child]2372-my child — [I]0-i made [him]732-the paladin what [he]732-the paladin is , [[the windiest blusterer]1884-the windiest blusterer and most catholic liar in [the kingdom]2582-the kingdom]1885-the windiest blusterer and most catholic liar in the kingdom . [Joan]110-joan probably knows what is in [him]732-the paladin better than [we]1890-we do . And [I]0-i ’ll give [you]1891-you another idea . When [a person in [Joan of Arc]110-joan ’s position]1892-a person in joan of arc ’s position tells [a man]2329-a man [he]2329-a man is brave , [he]2329-a man believes it ; and believing it is enough ; in fact , to believe [yourself]1891-you brave is to be brave ; it is the one only essential thing . ” “[1891-you] Now [you]1891-you ’ve hit it ! ” cried [Noel]135-noel . “[110-joan] [She]110-joan ’s got the creating mouth as well as the seeing eye ! Ah , yes , that is the thing . [France]4-france was cowed and [a coward]1894-a coward ; [Joan of Arc]110-joan has spoken , and [France]4-france is marching , with [her]110-joan head up ! ” [I]110-joan was summoned now to write a letter from [Joan]110-joan ’s dictation . During the next day and night [our]1890-we several uniforms were made by [the tailors]3175-the tailors , and [our]1890-we new armor provided . [We]1890-we were beautiful to look upon now , whether clothed for peace or war . [Clothed for peace , in costly stuffs and rich colors]3176-clothed for peace , in costly stuffs and rich colors , [the Paladin]732-the paladin was a tower dyed with the glories of the sunset ; plumed and sashed and iron - clad for war , [he]732-the paladin was a still statelier thing to look at . Orders had been issued for the march toward [Blois]69-blois . It was a clear , sharp , beautiful morning . As [[our]1890-we showy great company]3178-our showy great company trotted out in column , riding two and two , [Joan]110-joan and [the Duke of [Alencon]61-alencon]1690-the duke of alencon in the lead , [D’Aulon]196-d’aulon and [the big standard - bearer]3180-the big standard - bearer next , and so on , [we]1890-we made a handsome spectacle , as [you]3181-you may well imagine ; and as [we]1890-we plowed through [the cheering crowds]3182-the cheering crowds , with [Joan]110-joan bowing [her]110-joan plumed head to left and right and the sun glinting from [her]110-joan silver mail , [the spectators]3183-the spectators realized that the curtain was rolling up before [their]3183-the spectators eyes upon the first act of a prodigious drama , and [their]3183-the spectators rising hopes were expressed in an enthusiasm that increased with each moment , until at last one seemed to even physically feel the concussion of [the huzzas]3184-the huzzas as well as hear [them]3184-the huzzas . Far down [the street]3185-the street [we]1890-we heard the softened strains of wind - blown music , and saw a cloud of lancers moving , the sun glowing with a subdued light upon the massed armor , but striking bright upon the soaring lance - heads — a vaguely luminous nebula , so to speak , with a constellation twinkling above it — and that was [our]1890-we guard of honor . [It]3186-it joined [us]1890-we , the procession was complete , the first war - march of [Joan of Arc]110-joan was begun , the curtain was up . Chapter 12 [Joan Puts Heart]110-joan in [Her]110-joan Army [WE]1890-we WERE at [Blois]69-blois three days . Oh , [that camp]3187-that camp , it is one of the treasures of [my]110-joan memory ! Order ? There was no more order among [those brigands]3188-those brigands than there is among the wolves and [the hyenas]3189-the hyenas . [They]3183-the spectators went roaring and drinking about , whooping , shouting , swearing , and entertaining [themselves]3183-the spectators with all manner of rude and riotous horse - play ; and [the place]585-the place was full of [loud and lewd women]3191-loud and lewd women , and [they]3183-the spectators were no whit behind [the men for romps and noise and fantastics]3192-the men for romps and noise and fantastics . It was in the midst of this wild mob that [Noel]135-noel and [I]110-joan had [our]1890-we first glimpse of [La Hire]195-la hire . [He]195-la hire answered to [our]1890-we dearest dreams . [He]195-la hire was of great size and of martial bearing , [he]195-la hire was cased in mail from head to heel , with a bushel of swishing plumes on [his]195-la hire helmet , and at [his]195-la hire side the vast sword of the time . [He]195-la hire was on [his]195-la hire way to pay [his]195-la hire respects in state to [Joan]110-joan , and as [he]195-la hire passed through [the camp]979-the camp [he]195-la hire was restoring order , and proclaiming that [the Maid]1326-the maid had come , and [he]195-la hire would have no such spectacle as this exposed to [the head of [the army]3157-the army]3195-the head of the army . [His]195-la hire way of creating order was [his]195-la hire own , not borrowed . [He]195-la hire did it with [his]195-la hire great fists . As [he]195-la hire moved along swearing and admonishing , [he]195-la hire let drive this way , that way , and the other , and wherever [his]195-la hire blow landed , [a man]2329-a man went down . “[110-joan] Damn [you]1895-you ! ” [he]195-la hire said , “[1895-you] staggering and cursing around like this , and [the Commander - in - Chief in [the camp]979-the camp]1896-the commander - in - chief in the camp ! Straighten up ! ” and [he]195-la hire laid [the man]648-the man flat . What [his]195-la hire idea of straightening up was , was [his]195-la hire own secret . [We]3199-we followed [the veteran]3200-the veteran to [headquarters]1208-headquarters , listening , observing , admiring — yes , devouring , [you]3202-you may say , [the pet hero of [the boys of [France]4-france]3204-the boys of france from [[our]3199-we cradles]3205-our cradles]3203-the pet hero of the boys of france from our cradles up to that happy day , and [[their]3204-the boys of france idol]3206-their idol and [ours]3199-we . [I]1896-the commander - in - chief in the camp called to mind how [Joan]110-joan had once rebuked [the Paladin]732-the paladin , there in [the pastures of [Domremy]1-domremy]3208-the pastures of domremy , for uttering lightly those mighty names , [La Hire]195-la hire and [the Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2736-the bastard of orleans , and how [she]110-joan said that if [she]110-joan could but be permitted to stand afar off and let [her]110-joan eyes rest once upon [those great men]3210-those great men , [she]110-joan would hold it a privilege . [They]3210-those great men were to [her]110-joan and [the other girls]3211-the other girls just what [they]3210-those great men were to [the boys]747-the boys . Well , here was one of [them]3210-those great men at last — and what was [his]732-the paladin errand ? It was hard to realize it , and yet it was true ; [he]732-the paladin was coming to uncover [his]732-the paladin head before [her]110-joan and take [her]110-joan orders . While [he]732-the paladin was quieting [a considerable group of [[his]732-the paladin brigands]3214-his brigands]3213-a considerable group of his brigands in [his]732-the paladin soothing way , near headquarters , [we]3215-we stepped on ahead and got a glimpse of [[Joan]110-joan ’s military family]3216-joan ’s military family , [the great chiefs of [the army]3157-the army]3217-the great chiefs of the army , for [they]3216-joan ’s military family had all arrived now . There [they]3216-joan ’s military family were , [six officers of wide renown]3219-six officers of wide renown , [handsome men in beautiful armor]3220-handsome men in beautiful armor , but [the Lord High Admiral of [France]4-france]202-the lord high admiral of france was the handsomest of [them]3216-joan ’s military family all and had the most gallant bearing . When [La Hire]195-la hire entered , [one]461-one could see the surprise in [his]195-la hire face at [Joan]110-joan ’s beauty and extreme youth , and one could see , too , by [Joan]110-joan ’s glad smile , that it made [her]110-joan happy to get sight of [this hero of [her]110-joan childhood]3222-this hero of her childhood at last . [La Hire]195-la hire bowed low , with [his]195-la hire helmet in [his]195-la hire gauntleted hand , and made a bluff but handsome little speech with hardly an oath in it , and one could see that [those two]775-those two took to each other on the spot . The visit of ceremony was soon over , and [the others]733-the others went away ; but [La Hire]195-la hire stayed , and [he]195-la hire and [Joan]110-joan sat there , and [he]195-la hire sipped [her]110-joan wine , and [they]775-those two talked and laughed together like [old friends]3225-old friends . And presently [she]110-joan gave [him]195-la hire some instructions , in [his]195-la hire quality as [master of [the camp]979-the camp]3226-master of the camp , which made [his]195-la hire breath stand still . For , to begin with , [she]110-joan said that [all those loose women]3228-all those loose women must pack out of [the place]585-the place at once , [she]110-joan would n’t allow one of [them]3228-all those loose women to remain .
