Next , the rough carousing must stop , drinking must be brought within proper and strictly defined limits , and discipline must take the place of disorder . And finally [she]110-joan climaxed the list of surprises with this — which nearly lifted [him]195-la hire out of [his]195-la hire armor : “[1896-the commander - in - chief in the camp] [Every man who joins [my]0-i standard]1898-every man who joins my standard must confess before [the priest]399-the priest and absolve [himself]1898-every man who joins my standard from sin ; and [all accepted recruits]1900-all accepted recruits must be present at divine service twice a day . ” [La Hire]195-la hire could not say a word for a good part of a minute , then [he]195-la hire said , in deep dejection : “[1901-sweet child] Oh , [sweet child]1901-sweet child , [they]1902-they were littered in hell , [these poor darlings of mine]1903-these poor darlings of mine ! Attend mass ? Why , [dear heart]1904-dear heart , [they]1902-they ’ll see [us]1905-us both damned first ! ” And [he]195-la hire went on , pouring out a most pathetic stream of arguments and blasphemy , which broke [Joan]110-joan all up , and made [her]110-joan laugh as [she]110-joan had not laughed since [she]110-joan played in [the Domremy pastures]3230-the domremy pastures . It was good to hear . But [she]110-joan stuck to [her]110-joan point ; so [the soldier]1741-the soldier yielded , and said all right , if such were the orders [he]1741-the soldier must obey , and would do the best that was in [him]1741-the soldier ; then [he]1741-the soldier refreshed [himself]1741-the soldier with a lurid explosion of oaths , and said that if [any man in [the camp]979-the camp]3232-any man in the camp refused to renounce sin and lead a pious life , [he]3232-any man in the camp would knock [his]3232-any man in the camp head off . That started [Joan]110-joan off again ; [she]110-joan was really having a good time , [you]3234-you see . But [she]110-joan would not consent to that form of conversions . [She]110-joan said [they]3235-they must be voluntary . [La Hire]195-la hire said that that was all right , [he]195-la hire was n’t going to kill [the voluntary ones]3236-the voluntary ones , but only [the others]733-the others . No matter , [none of [them]733-the others]3238-none of them must be killed — [Joan]110-joan could n’t have it . [She]110-joan said that to give [a man]2329-a man a chance to volunteer , on pain of death if [he]2329-a man did n’t , left [him]2329-a man more or less trammeled , and [she]110-joan wanted [him]2329-a man to be entirely free . So [the soldier]1741-the soldier sighed and said [he]1741-the soldier would advertise the mass , but said [he]1741-the soldier doubted if there was [a man in [camp]3242-camp that was any more likely to go to it than [he]2329-a man was [himself]2329-a man]3241-a man in camp that was any more likely to go to it than he was himself . Then there was another surprise for [him]1741-the soldier , for [Joan]110-joan said : “[1902-they] But , [dear man]1906-dear man , [you]1906-dear man are going ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ? Impossible ! Oh , this is lunacy ! ” “[0-i] Oh , no , it is n’t . [You]1906-dear man are going to the service — twice a day . ” “[1906-dear man] Oh , am [I]0-i dreaming ? Am [I]0-i drunk — or is [my]0-i hearing playing [me]0-i false ? Why , [I]0-i would rather go to — ” “[0-i] Never mind where . In the morning [you]1906-dear man are going to begin , and after that it will come easy . Now do n’t look downhearted like that . Soon [you]1906-dear man wo n’t mind it . ” [La Hire]195-la hire tried to cheer up , but [he]195-la hire was not able to do it . [He]195-la hire sighed like [a zephyr]3243-a zephyr , and presently said : “[1906-dear man] Well , [I]0-i ’ll do it for [you]1906-dear man , but before [I]0-i would do it for another , [I]0-i swear [I]0-i — ” “[0-i] But do n’t swear . Break it off . ” “[0-i] Break it off ? It is impossible ! [I]0-i beg [you]1906-dear man to — to — Why — oh , [[my]0-i General]1907-my general , it is [my]0-i native speech ! ” [He]195-la hire begged so hard for grace for [his]195-la hire impediment , that [Joan]110-joan left [him]195-la hire one fragment of it ; [she]110-joan said [he]195-la hire might swear by [his]195-la hire baton , the symbol of [[his]195-la hire generalship]3244-his generalship . [He]195-la hire promised that [he]195-la hire would swear only by [his]195-la hire baton when in [her]110-joan presence , and would try to modify [himself]195-la hire elsewhere , but doubted [he]195-la hire could manage it , now that it was so old and stubborn a habit , and such a solace and support to [his]195-la hire declining years . [That tough old lion]3245-that tough old lion went away from there a good deal tamed and civilized — not to say softened and sweetened , for perhaps those expressions would hardly fit [him]195-la hire . [Noel]135-noel and [I]1907-my general believed that when [he]195-la hire was away from [Joan]110-joan ’s influence [his]195-la hire old aversions would come up so strong in [him]195-la hire that [he]195-la hire could not master them , and so would n’t go to mass . But [we]3246-we got up early in the morning to see . [Satan]144-satan was converted , [you]3247-you see . Well , [the rest]2453-the rest followed . [Joan]110-joan rode up and down [that camp]3187-that camp , and wherever [that fair young form]3250-that fair young form appeared in its shining armor , with that sweet face to grace the vision and perfect it , [the rude host]3251-the rude host seemed to think [they]3251-the rude host saw [the god of war in person]3252-the god of war in person , descended out of the clouds ; and first [they]3251-the rude host wondered , then [they]3251-the rude host worshiped . After that , [she]110-joan could do with [them]3251-the rude host what [she]110-joan would . In three days [it]3187-that camp was [a clean camp]3253-a clean camp and orderly , and [those barbarians]3254-those barbarians were herding to divine service twice a day like [good children]3255-good children . [The women]3256-the women were gone . [La Hire]195-la hire was stunned by these marvels ; [he]195-la hire could not understand [them]3251-the rude host . [He]195-la hire went outside [the camp]979-the camp when [he]195-la hire wanted to swear . [He]195-la hire was [that sort of a man]3258-that sort of a man — sinful by nature and habit , but full of superstitious respect for holy places . The enthusiasm of [the reformed army]3259-the reformed army for [Joan]110-joan , its devotion to [her]110-joan , and the hot desire [she]110-joan had aroused in it to be led against [the enemy]2442-the enemy , exceeded any manifestations of this sort which [La Hire]195-la hire had ever seen before in [his]195-la hire long career . [His]195-la hire admiration of it all , and [his]195-la hire wonder over the mystery and miracle of it , were beyond [his]195-la hire power to put into words . [He]195-la hire had held [this army]3261-this army cheap before , but [his]195-la hire pride and confidence in it knew no limits now . [He]195-la hire said : “[1907-my general] Two or three days ago it was afraid of [a hen - roost]1908-a hen - roost ; [one]461-one could storm the gates of hell with it now . ” [Joan]110-joan and [he]195-la hire were inseparable , and a quaint and pleasant contrast [they]3262-they made . [He]195-la hire was so big , [she]110-joan so little ; [he]195-la hire was so gray and so far along in [his]195-la hire pilgrimage of life , [she]110-joan so youthful ; [his]195-la hire face was so bronzed and scarred , [hers]110-joan so fair and pink , so fresh and smooth ; [she]110-joan was so gracious , and [he]195-la hire so stern ; [she]110-joan was so pure , so innocent , [he]195-la hire such a cyclopedia of sin . In [her]110-joan eye was stored all charity and compassion , in [his]195-la hire lightnings ; when [her]110-joan glance fell upon [you]3263-you it seemed to bring benediction and the peace of [God]140-god , but with [his]195-la hire it was different , generally . [They]3262-they rode through [the camp]979-the camp a dozen times a day , visiting every corner of [it]979-the camp , observing , inspecting , perfecting ; and wherever [they]3262-they appeared the enthusiasm broke forth . [They]3262-they rode side by side , [he]195-la hire [a great figure of brawn and muscle]3265-a great figure of brawn and muscle , [she]110-joan a little masterwork of roundness and grace ; [he]195-la hire a fortress of rusty iron , [she]110-joan a shining statuette of silver ; and when [the reformed raiders]3266-the reformed raiders and [bandits]3267-bandits caught sight of [them]1910-them [they]3262-they spoke out , with affection and welcome in [their]3262-they voices , and said : “[1910-them] There [they]1910-them come — [Satan]144-satan and the Page of [Christ]203-christ ! ” All the three days that [we]3268-we were in [Blois]69-blois , [Joan]110-joan worked earnestly and tirelessly to bring [La Hire]195-la hire to [God]140-god — to rescue [him]195-la hire from the bondage of sin — to breathe into [his]195-la hire stormy heart the serenity and peace of religion . [She]110-joan urged , [she]110-joan begged , [she]110-joan implored [him]195-la hire to pray . [He]195-la hire stood out , three days of [our]3268-we stay , begging about piteously to be let off — to be let off from just that one thing , that impossible thing ; [he]195-la hire would do anything else — anything — command , and [he]195-la hire would obey — [he]195-la hire would go through the fire for [her]110-joan if [she]110-joan said the word — but spare [him]195-la hire this , only this , for [he]195-la hire could n’t pray , had never prayed , [he]195-la hire was ignorant of how to frame a prayer , [he]195-la hire had no words to put it in . And yet — can any believe it?—she carried even that point , [she]110-joan won that incredible victory . [She]110-joan made [La Hire]195-la hire pray . It shows , [I]144-satan think , that nothing was impossible to [Joan of Arc]110-joan . Yes , [he]195-la hire stood there before [her]110-joan and put up [his]195-la hire mailed hands and made a prayer . And it was not borrowed , but was [his]195-la hire very own ; [he]195-la hire had none to help [him]195-la hire frame it , [he]195-la hire made it out of [his]195-la hire own head — saying : “[144-satan] [Fair Sir God]140-god , [I]0-i pray [you]140-god to do by [La Hire]195-la hire as [he]195-la hire would do by [you]140-god if [you]140-god were [La Hire]195-la hire and [he]195-la hire were [God]140-god . ” Then [he]195-la hire put on [his]195-la hire helmet and marched out of [[Joan]110-joan ’s tent]3269-joan ’s tent as satisfied with [himself]195-la hire as [any one]2338-any one might be who had arranged a perplexed and difficult business to the content and admiration of [all the parties concerned in the matter]3271-all the parties concerned in the matter . If [I]140-god had know that [he]195-la hire had been praying , [I]140-god could have understood why [he]195-la hire was feeling so superior , but of course [I]140-god could not know that . [I]140-god was coming to [the tent]3272-the tent at that moment , and saw [him]195-la hire come out , and saw [him]195-la hire march away in that large fashion , and indeed it was fine and beautiful to see . But when [I]140-god got to the tent door [I]140-god stopped and stepped back , grieved and shocked , for [I]140-god heard [Joan]110-joan crying , as [I]140-god mistakenly thought — crying as if [she]110-joan could not contain nor endure the anguish of [her]110-joan soul , crying as if [she]110-joan would die . But it was not so , [she]110-joan was laughing — laughing at [La Hire]195-la hire ’s prayer . It was not until six - and - thirty years afterward that [I]140-god found that out , and then — oh , then [I]140-god only cried when that picture of [young care - free mirth]3273-young care - free mirth rose before [me]140-god out of the blur and mists of that long - vanished time ; for there had come a day between , when [God]140-god ’s good gift of laughter had gone out from [me]140-god to come again no more in this life . ( 1 ) This prayer has been stolen many times and by [many nations]3274-many nations in the past four hundred and sixty years , but it originated with [La Hire]195-la hire , and the fact is of official record in [the National Archives of [France]4-france]274-the national archives of france . [We]3276-we have the authority of [Michelet]119-j. michelet for this.—TRANSLATOR Chapter 13 Checked by the Folly of the Wise [WE]3276-we MARCHED out in great strength and splendor , and took [the road]840-the road toward [Orleans]39-orleans . The initial part of [Joan]110-joan ’s great dream was realizing itself at last . It was the first time that [any of [us]3276-we youngsters]3278-any of us youngsters had ever seen [an army]1731-an army , and it was a most stately and imposing spectacle to [us]3276-we . It was indeed an inspiring sight , that interminable column , stretching away into the fading distances , and curving itself in and out of the crookedness of [the road]840-the road like a mighty serpent . [Joan]110-joan rode at the head of it with [her]110-joan personal staff ; then came a body of [priests singing the Veni Creator]3281-priests singing the veni creator , the banner of the Cross rising out of [their]3281-priests singing the veni creator midst ; after these the glinting forest of spears . [The several divisions]3282-the several divisions were commanded by [the great Armagnac generals]3283-the great armagnac generals , [La Hire]195-la hire , and [Marshal de Boussac]205-marshal de boussac , [the Sire de Retz]189-sire , [Florent d’Illiers]206-florent d’illiers , and [Poton de Saintrailles]207-poton de saintrailles . Each in [his]195-la hire degree was tough , and there were three degrees — tough , tougher , toughest — and [La Hire]195-la hire was the last by a shade , but only a shade . [They]3282-the several divisions were just [illustrious official brigands]3284-illustrious official brigands , [the whole party]3285-the whole party ; and by long habits of lawlessness [they]3282-the several divisions had lost all acquaintanceship with obedience , if [they]3282-the several divisions had ever had any . But what was the good of saying that ? [These independent birds]3286-these independent birds knew no law . [They]3286-these independent birds seldom obeyed [the King]270-the king ; [they]3286-these independent birds never obeyed [him]270-the king when it did n’t suit [them]3286-these independent birds to do it . Would [they]3286-these independent birds obey [the Maid]1326-the maid ? In the first place [they]3286-these independent birds would n’t know how to obey [her]1326-the maid or [anybody else]3289-anybody else , and in the second place it was of course not possible for [them]3286-these independent birds to take [her]1326-the maid military character seriously — [that country - girl of seventeen who had been trained for the complex and terrible business of war — how ? By tending sheep]3290-that country - girl of seventeen who had been trained for the complex and terrible business of war — how ? by tending sheep . [They]3286-these independent birds had no idea of obeying [her]1326-the maid except in cases where [their]3286-these independent birds veteran military knowledge and experience showed [them]3286-these independent birds that the thing [she]1326-the maid required was sound and right when gauged by the regular military standards . Were [they]3286-these independent birds to blame for this attitude ? [I]140-god should think not . [Old war - worn captains]3291-old war - worn captains are [hard - headed , practical men]3292-hard - headed , practical men . [They]3291-old war - worn captains do not easily believe in the ability of [ignorant children]3293-ignorant children to plan campaigns and command armies . [No general that ever lived]3294-no general that ever lived could have taken [Joan]110-joan seriously ( militarily ) before [she]110-joan raised the siege of [Orleans]39-orleans and followed it with the great campaign of [the Loire]42-the loire . Did [they]3286-these independent birds consider [Joan]110-joan valueless ? Far from it . [They]3286-these independent birds valued [her]110-joan as [the fruitful earth]3295-the fruitful earth values the sun — [they]3286-these independent birds fully believed [she]110-joan could produce the crop , but that it was in [their]3286-these independent birds line of business , not [hers]110-joan , to take it off . [They]3286-these independent birds had a deep and superstitious reverence for [her]110-joan as being endowed with a mysterious supernatural something that was able to do a mighty thing which [they]3286-these independent birds were powerless to do — blow the breath of life and valor into the dead corpses of [cowed armies]3296-cowed armies and turn [them]3286-these independent birds into [heroes]3297-heroes . To [their]3286-these independent birds minds [they]3286-these independent birds were everything with [her]110-joan , but nothing without [her]110-joan . [She]110-joan could inspire [the soldiers]2667-the soldiers and fit [them]2667-the soldiers for battle — but fight the battle [herself]110-joan ? Oh , nonsense — that was [their]3286-these independent birds function . [They]3286-these independent birds , [the generals]3299-the generals , would fight the battles , [Joan]110-joan would give the victory . That was [their]3286-these independent birds idea — an unconscious paraphrase of [Joan]110-joan ’s reply to [the Dominican]191-the sly dominican . So [they]3286-these independent birds began by playing a deception upon [her]110-joan . [She]110-joan had a clear idea of how [she]110-joan meant to proceed . It was [her]110-joan purpose to march boldly upon [Orleans]39-orleans by [the north bank of [the Loire]42-the loire]3300-the north bank of the loire . [She]110-joan gave that order to [[her]110-joan generals]3301-her generals . [They]3286-these independent birds said to [themselves]3286-these independent birds , “[140-god] The idea is insane — it is blunder No . 1 ; it is what might have been expected of [this child who is ignorant of war]1911-this child who is ignorant of war . ” [They]3286-these independent birds privately sent the word to [the Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2736-the bastard of orleans . [He]2736-the bastard of orleans also recognized the insanity of it — at least [he]2736-the bastard of orleans thought [he]2736-the bastard of orleans did — and privately advised [the generals]3299-the generals to get around the order in some way . [They]3299-the generals did it by deceiving [Joan]110-joan . [She]110-joan trusted [those people]1318-those people , [she]110-joan was not expecting this sort of treatment , and was not on the lookout for it . It was a lesson to [her]110-joan ; [she]110-joan saw to it that the game was not played a second time . Why was [Joan]110-joan ’s idea insane , from [the generals]3299-the generals ’ point of view , but not from [hers]110-joan ? Because [her]110-joan plan was to raise the siege immediately , by fighting , while [theirs]3286-these independent birds was to besiege [the besiegers]3306-the besiegers and starve [them]3306-the besiegers out by closing [their]3306-the besiegers communications — a plan which would require months in the consummation . [The English]128-the english had built a fence of [strong fortresses called bastilles around [Orleans]39-orleans]3307-strong fortresses called bastilles around orleans — [fortresses which closed all the gates of [the city]372-the city]3308-fortresses which closed all the gates of the city but one . To [the French generals]3310-the french generals the idea of trying to fight [their]3310-the french generals way past [those fortresses]3311-those fortresses and lead [the army]3157-the army into [Orleans]39-orleans was preposterous ; [they]3310-the french generals believed that the result would be [the army]3157-the army ’s destruction . [One]461-one may not doubt that [their]3310-the french generals opinion was militarily sound — no , would have been , but for one circumstance which [they]3310-the french generals overlooked . That was this : [the English soldiers]3315-the english soldiers were in a demoralized condition of superstitious terror ; [they]3315-the english soldiers had become satisfied that [the Maid]1326-the maid was in league with [Satan]144-satan . By reason of this a good deal of [their]3315-the english soldiers courage had oozed out and vanished . On the other hand , [[the Maid]1326-the maid ’s soldiers]3318-the maid ’s soldiers were full of courage , enthusiasm , and zeal . [Joan]110-joan could have marched by [the English forts]3319-the english forts . However , it was not to be . [She]110-joan had been cheated out of [her]110-joan first chance to strike a heavy blow for [[her]110-joan country]845-her country . In [camp]3242-camp that night [she]110-joan slept in [her]110-joan armor on the ground . It was a cold night , and [she]110-joan was nearly as stiff as [her]110-joan armor itself when [we]3322-we resumed the march in the morning , for iron is not good material for a blanket . However , [her]110-joan joy in being now so far on [her]110-joan way to the theater of [her]110-joan mission was fire enough to warm [her]110-joan , and it soon did it . [Her]110-joan enthusiasm and impatience rose higher and higher with every mile of progress ; but at last [we]3322-we reached [Olivet]74-olivet , and down it went , and indignation took its place . For [she]110-joan saw the trick that had been played upon [her]110-joan — [the river]454-the river lay between [us]3322-we and [Orleans]39-orleans . [She]110-joan was for attacking [one of the three bastilles that were on [[our]3322-we side of [the river]454-the river]814-our side of the river and forcing access to [the bridge which [it]3324-one of the three bastilles that were on our side of the river and forcing access to the bridge which it guarded guarded]3327-the bridge which it guarded]3324-one of the three bastilles that were on our side of the river and forcing access to the bridge which it guarded ( a project which , if successful , would raise the siege instantly ) , but the long - ingrained fear of [the English]128-the english came upon [[her]110-joan generals]3301-her generals and [they]3301-her generals implored [her]110-joan not to make the attempt . [The soldiers]2667-the soldiers wanted to attack , but had to suffer disappointment . So [we]3322-we moved on and came to a halt at [a point opposite [Checy]75-checy , six miles above [Orleans]39-orleans]3330-a point opposite checy , six miles above orleans . [Dunois]161-dunois , [Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans , with a body of [knights]3331-knights and [citizens]3057-citizens]186-bastard , came up from [the city]372-the city to welcome [Joan]110-joan . [Joan]110-joan was still burning with resentment over the trick that had been put upon [her]110-joan , and was not in the mood for soft speeches , even to revered military idols of [her]110-joan childhood . [She]110-joan said : “[1911-this child who is ignorant of war] Are [you]1912-you [the bastard]1913-the bastard ? ” “[1912-you] Yes , [I]0-i am [he]1913-the bastard , and am right glad of [your]1912-you coming . ” “[1912-you] And did [you]1912-you advise that [I]0-i be brought by [this side of [the river]454-the river]1914-this side of the river instead of straight to [Talbot]215-talbot and [the English]128-the english ? ” [Her]110-joan high manner abashed [him]1912-you , and [he]1912-you was not able to answer with anything like a confident promptness , but with many hesitations and partial excuses [he]1912-you managed to get out the confession that for what [he]1912-you and [the council]1427-the council had regarded as imperative military reasons [they]1427-the council so advised . “[1912-you] In [God]140-god ’s name , ” said [Joan]110-joan , “[1912-you] [[my]0-i Lord]2662-my lord ’s counsel is safer and wiser than [yours]1912-you . [You]1912-you thought to deceive [me]0-i , but [you]1912-you have deceived [yourselves]1912-you , for [I]0-i bring [you]1912-you the best help that [ever knight]1917-ever knight or [city]1918-city had ; for it is [God]140-god ’s help , not sent for love of [me]0-i , but by [God]140-god ’s pleasure . At the prayer of [St. Louis]78-st. louis and [St. Charlemagne]197-charlemagne [He]1919-he has had pity on [Orleans]39-orleans , and will not suffer [the enemy]2442-the enemy to have both [the Duke of [Orleans]39-orleans]1921-the duke of orleans and [[his]1921-the duke of orleans city]1922-his city . The provisions to save [the starving people]1923-the starving people are [here]2531-here , [the boats]1925-the boats are below [the city]372-the city , the wind is contrary , [they]1925-the boats can not come up hither . Now then , tell [me]0-i , in [God]140-god ’s name , [you]1927-you who are so wise , what [that council of yours]1928-that council of yours was thinking about , to invent this foolish difficulty . ” [Dunois]161-dunois and [the rest]2453-the rest fumbled around the matter a moment , then gave in and conceded that a blunder had been made . “[1928-that council of yours] Yes , a blunder has been made , ” said [Joan]110-joan , “[1928-that council of yours] and except [God]140-god take [your]1927-you proper work upon [Himself]140-god and change the wind and correct [your]1927-you blunder for [you]1927-you , there is none else that can devise a remedy . ” [Some of [these people]1264-these people]3336-some of these people began to perceive that with all [her]110-joan technical ignorance [she]110-joan had practical good sense , and that with all [her]110-joan native sweetness and charm [she]110-joan was not the right kind of [a person to play with]3338-a person to play with . Presently [God]140-god did take the blunder in hand , and by [His]140-god grace the wind did change . So [the fleet of boats]3339-the fleet of boats came up and went away loaded with provisions and cattle , and conveyed that welcome succor to [the hungry city]3340-the hungry city , managing the matter successfully under protection of a sortie from the walls against [the bastille of [St. Loup]79-st. loup]3341-the bastille of st. loup . Then [Joan]110-joan began on [the Bastard]186-bastard again : “[1929-you] [You]1929-you see [here]2531-here [the army]3157-the army ? ” “[3157-the army] Yes . ” “[3157-the army] It is here on this side by advice of [[your]1929-you council]1932-your council ? ” “[1932-your council] Yes . ” “[1932-your council] Now , in [God]140-god ’s name , can [that wise council]1933-that wise council explain why it is better to have it [here]2531-here than it would be to have it in [the bottom of [the sea]2548-the sea]1935-the bottom of the sea ? ” [Dunois]161-dunois made some wandering attempts to explain the inexplicable and excuse the inexcusable , but [Joan]110-joan cut [him]161-dunois short and said : “[1933-that wise council] Answer [me]0-i this , [good sir]1937-good sir — has [the army]3157-the army any value on [this side of [the river]454-the river]1914-this side of the river ? ” [The Bastard]1913-the bastard confessed that it hadn’t — that is , in view of the plan of campaign which [she]110-joan had devised and decreed . “[1933-that wise council] And yet , knowing this , [you]1937-good sir had the hardihood to disobey [my]0-i orders . Since [[the army]3157-the army ’s place]1942-the army ’s place is on the other side , will [you]1937-good sir explain to [me]0-i how it is to get [there]460-there ? ” The whole size of the needless muddle was apparent . Evasions were of no use ; therefore [Dunois]161-dunois admitted that there was no way to correct the blunder but to send the army all the way back to [Blois]69-blois , and let it begin over again and come up on the other side this time , according to [Joan]110-joan ’s original plan . [Any other girl]3343-any other girl , after winning such a triumph as this over [a veteran soldier of old renown]3344-a veteran soldier of old renown , might have exulted a little and been excusable for it , but [Joan]110-joan showed no disposition of this sort . [She]110-joan dropped a word or two of grief over the precious time that must be lost , then began at once to issue commands for the march back . [She]110-joan sorrowed to see [[her]110-joan army]3345-her army go ; for [she]110-joan said its heart was great and its enthusiasm high , and that with it at [her]110-joan back [she]110-joan did not fear to face all the might of [England]24-england . All arrangements having been completed for the return of [the main body of [the army]3157-the army]3346-the main body of the army , [she]110-joan took [the Bastard]1913-the bastard and [La Hire]195-la hire and [a thousand men]3349-a thousand men and went down to [Orleans]39-orleans , where all [the town]786-the town was in a fever of impatience to have sight of [her]110-joan face . It was eight in the evening when [she]110-joan and [the troops]3351-the troops rode in at the Burgundy gate , with [the Paladin]157-the paladin preceding [her]110-joan with [her]110-joan standard . [She]110-joan was riding a white horse , and [she]110-joan carried in [her]110-joan hand the sacred sword of [Fierbois]52-fierbois . [You]3352-you should have seen [Orleans]39-orleans then . What a picture it was ! [Such black seas of [people , such a starry firmament of torches , such roaring whirlwinds of welcome , such booming of bells and thundering of cannon]3354-people , such a starry firmament of torches , such roaring whirlwinds of welcome , such booming of bells and thundering of cannon]3353-such black seas of people , such a starry firmament of torches , such roaring whirlwinds of welcome , such booming of bells and thundering of cannon ! It was as if [the world]320-the world was come to an end . Everywhere in the glare of the torches [one]3356-one saw rank upon rank of upturned white faces , the mouths wide open , shouting , and the unchecked tears running down ; [Joan]110-joan forged [her]110-joan slow way through [the solid masses]3357-the solid masses , [her]110-joan mailed form projecting above the pavement of heads like a silver statue . [The people about [her]110-joan]3358-the people about her struggled along , gazing up at [her]110-joan through [their]3358-the people about her tears with the rapt look of [men]282-men and women who believe [they]3358-the people about her are seeing [one who is divine]3360-one who is divine ; and always [her]110-joan feet were being kissed by [grateful folk]3361-grateful folk , and such as [failed of that privilege]3362-failed of that privilege touched [her]110-joan horse and then kissed [their]3358-the people about her fingers . Nothing that [Joan]110-joan did escaped notice ; everything [she]110-joan did was commented upon and applauded . [You]3363-you could hear the remarks going all the time . “[1944-she] There — [she]1944-she ’s smiling — see ! ” “[1944-she] Now [she]1944-she ’s taking [her]1944-she little plumed cap off to [somebody]636-somebody — ah , it ’s fine and graceful ! ” “[1944-she] [She]1944-she ’s patting [that woman]1946-that woman on the head with [her]1944-she gauntlet . ” “[1944-she] Oh , [she]1944-she was born on a horse — see [her]1944-she turn in [her]1944-she saddle , and kiss the hilt of [her]1944-she sword to [the ladies in the window that threw the flowers down]1947-the ladies in the window that threw the flowers down . ” “[1944-she] Now there ’s [a poor woman]1948-a poor woman lifting up [a child]327-a child — [she]1948-a poor woman ’s kissed it — oh , [she]1948-a poor woman ’s divine ! ” “[1948-a poor woman] What [a dainty little figure it]1950-a dainty little figure it is , and what a lovely face — and such color and animation ! ” [Joan]110-joan ’s slender long banner streaming backward had an accident — the fringe caught fire from a torch . [She]110-joan leaned forward and crushed the flame in [her]110-joan hand . “[1944-she] [She]1944-she ’s not afraid of fire nor anything ! ” [they]3364-they shouted , and delivered a storm of admiring applause that made everything quake . [She]110-joan rode to [the cathedral]3365-the cathedral and gave thanks to [God]140-god , and [the people]313-the people crammed [the place]585-the place and added [their]313-the people devotions to [hers]110-joan ; then [she]110-joan took up [her]110-joan march again and picked [her]110-joan slow way through [the crowds]2771-the crowds and the wilderness of torches to [the house of [Jacques Boucher]130-jacques]3369-the house of jacques boucher , [treasurer of [the Duke of [Orleans]39-orleans]1921-the duke of orleans , where [she]110-joan was to be the guest of [[his]130-jacques wife]412-his wife as long as [she]110-joan stayed in [the city]372-the city , and have [[his]130-jacques young daughter]3374-his young daughter for [comrade]2613-comrade and [room - mate]3376-room - mate]3370-treasurer of the duke of orleans , where she was to be the guest of his wife as long as she stayed in the city , and have his young daughter for comrade and room - mate . The delirium of [the people]313-the people went on the rest of the night , and with it the clamor of the joy - bells and the welcoming cannon . [Joan of Arc]110-joan had stepped upon [her]110-joan stage at last , and was ready to begin . Chapter 14 What the English Answered [SHE]110-joan WAS ready , but must sit down and wait until there was [an army to work with]3378-an army to work with . Next morning , Saturday , April 30 , 1429 , [she]110-joan set about inquiring after [the messenger who carried [her]110-joan proclamation to the English from [Blois]69-blois]3379-the messenger who carried her proclamation to the english from blois — the one which [she]110-joan had dictated at [Poitiers]63-poitiers . Here is a copy of it . It is a remarkable document , for several reasons : for its matter - of - fact directness , for its high spirit and forcible diction , and for its naive confidence in [her]110-joan ability to achieve the prodigious task which [she]110-joan had laid upon [herself]110-joan , or which had been laid upon [her]110-joan — which [you]3380-you please . All through it [you]3380-you seem to see the pomps of war and hear the rumbling of the drums . In it [Joan]110-joan ’s warrior soul is revealed , and for the moment [the soft little shepherdess]3381-the soft little shepherdess has disappeared from [your]3380-you view . [This untaught country - damsel]3382-this untaught country - damsel , unused to dictating anything at all to [anybody]563-anybody , much less documents of state to [kings]1331-kings and [generals]3385-generals , poured out this procession of vigorous sentences as fluently as if this sort of work had been [her]110-joan trade from childhood : [JESUS MARIA]209-jesus maria King of [England]24-england and [[you]3380-you Duke of [Bedford]80-bedford who call [yourself]3380-you [Regent of [France]4-france]2455-regent of france]3386-you duke of bedford who call yourself regent of france ; [William de la Pole]210-william de la pole , [Earl of [Suffolk]264-suffolk]3388-earl of suffolk ; and [you]3380-you [Thomas Lord Scales]211-thomas lord scales , who style [[yourselves]3380-you lieutenants of [the said Bedford]3390-the said bedford]3389-yourselves lieutenants of the said bedford — do right to [the King of [Heaven]45-heaven]2664-the king of heaven . Render to [the Maid]1326-the maid who is sent by [God]140-god the keys of [all the good towns [you]3380-you have taken and violated in [France]4-france]3393-all the good towns you have taken and violated in france . [She]1326-the maid is sent hither by [God]140-god , to restore [the blood royal]3394-the blood royal . [She]1326-the maid is very ready to make peace if [you]3380-you will do [her]1326-the maid right by giving up [France]4-france and paying for what [you]3380-you have held . And [you]3380-you archers , [companions of war]3395-companions of war , [noble and otherwise]3396-noble and otherwise , who are before [the good city of [Orleans]39-orleans]3397-the good city of orleans , begone into [[your]3380-you own land]3398-your own land in [God]140-god ’s name , or expect news from [the Maid who will shortly go to see [you]3380-you to [your]3380-you very great hurt]3399-the maid who will shortly go to see you to your very great hurt . [King of [England]24-england]3400-king of england , if [you]3380-you do not so , [I]1948-a poor woman am [chief of war]3401-chief of war , and whenever [I]1948-a poor woman shall find [[your]3380-you people]3402-your people in [France]4-france , [I]1948-a poor woman will drive [them]3402-your people out , willing or not willing ; and if [they]3402-your people do not obey [I]1948-a poor woman will slay [them]3402-your people all , but if [they]3402-your people obey , [I]1948-a poor woman will have [them]3402-your people to mercy . [I]1948-a poor woman am come hither by [God]140-god , [the King of Heaven]2664-the king of heaven , body for body , to put [you]3380-you out of [France]4-france , in spite of [those who would work treason and mischief against]3404-those who would work treason and mischief against [the kingdom]2582-the kingdom . Think not [you]3380-you shall ever hold [the kingdom]2582-the kingdom from [the King of Heaven]2664-the king of heaven , [the Son of [the Blessed Mary]212-the blessed mary]3408-the son of the blessed mary ; [King Charles]185-the king shall hold it , for [God]140-god wills it so , and has revealed it to [him]185-the king by [the Maid]1326-the maid . If [you]3380-you believe not the news sent by [God]140-god through [the Maid]1326-the maid , wherever [we]3411-we shall meet [you]3380-you [we]3411-we will strike boldly and make such a noise as has not been in [France]4-france these thousand years . Be sure that [God]140-god can send more strength to [the Maid]1326-the maid than [you]3380-you can bring to any assault against [her]1326-the maid and [[her]1326-the maid good men]3413-her good men - at - arms ; and then [we]3411-we shall see who has the better right , [the King of Heaven]2664-the king of heaven , or [you]3380-you . [Duke of [Bedford]80-bedford]3415-duke of bedford , [the Maid]1326-the maid prays [you]3380-you not to bring about [your]3380-you own destruction . If [you]3380-you do [her]1326-the maid right , [you]3380-you may yet go in [her]1326-the maid company where [the French]213-the french shall do the finest deed that has been done in [Christendom]21-christendom , and if [you]3380-you do not , [you]3380-you shall be reminded shortly of [your]3380-you great wrongs . In that closing sentence [she]1326-the maid invites [them]3417-them to go on crusade with [her]1326-the maid to rescue [the Holy Sepulcher]214-the holy sepulcher . No answer had been returned to this proclamation , and [the messenger]3418-the messenger [himself]3418-the messenger had not come back . So now [she]1326-the maid sent [[her]1326-the maid two heralds]3419-her two heralds with a new letter warning [the English]128-the english to raise the siege and requiring [them]3419-her two heralds to restore [that missing messenger]3420-that missing messenger . [The heralds]3421-the heralds came back without [him]3418-the messenger . All [they]3421-the heralds brought was notice from [the English]2659-the english to [Joan]110-joan that [they]3421-the heralds would presently catch [her]1951-she and burn [her]1951-she if [she]1951-she did not clear out now while [she]1951-she had a chance , and “[1948-a poor woman] go back to [her]1951-she proper trade of minding cows . ” [She]1951-she held [her]1951-she peace , only saying it was a pity that [the English]128-the english would persist in inviting present disaster and eventual destruction when [she]1951-she was “[1951-she] doing all [she]1951-she could to get [them]1952-their out of [the country]315-the country with [their]1952-their lives still in [their]1952-their bodies . ” Presently [she]1951-she thought of an arrangement that might be acceptable , and said to [the heralds]3421-the heralds , “[1951-she] Go back and say to [Lord Talbot]215-talbot this , from [me]0-i : ‘ Come out of [[your]215-talbot bastilles]1954-your bastilles with [[your]215-talbot host]1955-your host , and [I]0-i will come with [mine]0-i ; if [I]0-i beat [you]215-talbot , go in peace out of [France]4-france ; if [you]215-talbot beat [me]0-i , burn [me]0-i , according to [your]215-talbot desire . ’ ” [I]215-talbot did not hear this , but [Dunois]161-dunois did , and spoke of it . The challenge was refused . Sunday morning [her]1951-she Voices or some instinct gave [her]1951-she a warning , and [she]1951-she sent [Dunois]161-dunois to [Blois]69-blois to take command of [the army]3157-the army and hurry it to [Orleans]39-orleans . It was a wise move , for [he]161-dunois found [Regnault de Chartres]216-regnault de chartres and [some more of [[the King]270-the king ’s pet rascals]3427-the king ’s pet rascals there trying [their]3428-their best to disperse [the army]3157-the army , and crippling all the efforts of [[Joan]110-joan ’s generals]3430-joan ’s generals to head it for [Orleans]39-orleans]3425-some more of the king ’s pet rascals there trying their best to disperse the army , and crippling all the efforts of joan ’s generals to head it for orleans . [They]3428-their were [a fine lot]3431-a fine lot , [those miscreants]3432-those miscreants . [They]3428-their turned [their]3428-their attention to [Dunois]161-dunois now , but [he]161-dunois had balked [Joan]110-joan once , with unpleasant results to [himself]161-dunois , and was not minded to meddle in that way again . [He]161-dunois soon had [the army]3157-the army moving . Chapter 15 [My]215-talbot Exquisite Poem Goes to Smash [WE]3434-we OF [the personal staff]3435-the personal staff were in [fairyland]3436-fairyland now , during the few days that [we]3434-we waited for the return of [the army]3157-the army . [We]3434-we went into society . To [[our]3434-we two knights]1343-our two knights this was not a novelty , but to [[us]3434-we young villagers]3439-us young villagers it was a new and wonderful life . Any position of any sort near [the person of [the Maid of Vaucouleurs]1353-the maid of vaucouleurs]3440-the person of the maid of vaucouleurs conferred high distinction upon [the holder]3442-the holder and caused [his]3442-the holder society to be courted ; and so [the D’Arc brothers]3443-the d’arc brothers , and [Noel]135-noel , and [the Paladin]732-the paladin , [humble peasants at [home]377-home]3445-humble peasants at home , were [gentlemen]3447-gentlemen [here]2531-here , [personages of weight and influence]3449-personages of weight and influence . It was fine to see how soon [their]1343-our two knights country diffidences and awkwardnesses melted away under this pleasant sun of deference and disappeared , and how lightly and easily [they]1343-our two knights took to [their]1343-our two knights new atmosphere . [The Paladin]157-the paladin was as happy as it was possible for any one in [this earth]3450-this earth to be . [His]157-the paladin tongue went all the time , and daily [he]157-the paladin got new delight out of hearing [himself]157-the paladin talk . [He]157-the paladin began to enlarge [his]157-the paladin ancestry and spread it out all around , and ennoble it right and left , and it was not long until it consisted almost entirely of [dukes]2705-dukes . [He]157-the paladin worked up [his]157-the paladin old battles and tricked [them]3452-them out with fresh splendors ; also with new terrors , for [he]157-the paladin added artillery now . [We]3453-we had seen cannon for the first time at [Blois]69-blois — a few pieces — here there was plenty of it , and now and then [we]3453-we had the impressive spectacle of [a huge English bastille hidden from sight in a mountain of smoke from its own guns]3454-a huge english bastille hidden from sight in a mountain of smoke from its own guns , with lances of red flame darting through it ; and this grand picture , along with the quaking thunders pounding away in the heart of it , inflamed [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s imagination and enabled [him]157-the paladin to dress out those ambuscade - skirmishes of [ours]3453-we with a sublimity which made it impossible for any to recognize [them]3452-them at all except [people who had not been there]3455-people who had not been there . [You]3456-you may suspect that there was a special inspiration for these great efforts of [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s , and there was . It was [the daughter of [the house]630-the house]3457-the daughter of the house , [Catherine Boucher]133-catherine , who was eighteen , and gentle and lovely in [her]133-catherine ways , and very beautiful . [I]215-talbot think [she]133-catherine might have been as beautiful as [Joan]110-joan [herself]133-catherine , if [she]133-catherine had had [Joan]110-joan ’s eyes . But that could never be . There was never but that one pair , there will never be another . [Joan]110-joan ’s eyes were deep and rich and wonderful beyond anything merely earthly . [They]3459-they spoke all the languages — they had no need of words . They produced all effects — and just by a glance , just a single glance ; a glance that could convict a liar of [his]157-the paladin lie and make [him]157-the paladin confess it ; that could bring down [a proud man]3460-a proud man ’s pride and make [him]3460-a proud man humble ; that could put courage into [a coward]1894-a coward and strike dead the courage of [the bravest]3462-the bravest ; that could appease resentments and real hatreds ; that could make [the doubter]3463-the doubter believe and the hopeless hope again ; that could purify the impure mind ; that could persuade — ah , there it is — persuasion ! that is the word ; what or who is it that it could n’t persuade ? [The maniac of [Domremy]1-domremy]3464-the maniac of domremy — [the fairy - banishing priest]3465-the fairy - banishing priest — [the reverend tribunal of [Toul]46-toul]3466-the reverend tribunal of toul — [the doubting and superstitious Laxart]3467-the doubting and superstitious laxart — [the obstinate veteran of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]3468-the obstinate veteran of vaucouleurs — [the characterless heir of [France]4-france]3469-the characterless heir of france — [the sages and scholars of [the Parliament]3471-the parliament and University of [Poitiers]63-poitiers]3470-the sages and scholars of the parliament and university of poitiers — [the darling of [Satan]144-satan]3472-the darling of satan , [La Hire]195-la hire — [the masterless Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans , accustomed to acknowledge no way as right and rational but [his]195-la hire own]3473-the masterless bastard of orleans , accustomed to acknowledge no way as right and rational but his own — these were the trophies of that great gift that made [her]3474-her the wonder and mystery that [she]3474-her was . [We]3475-we mingled companionably with [the great folk who flocked to [the big house]3477-the big house to make [Joan]110-joan ’s acquaintance]3476-the great folk who flocked to the big house to make joan ’s acquaintance , and [they]3476-the great folk who flocked to the big house to make joan ’s acquaintance made much of [us]3475-we and [we]3475-we lived in the clouds , so to speak . But what [we]3475-we preferred even to this happiness was the quieter occasions , when [the formal guests]3478-the formal guests were gone and [the family]2556-the family and [a few dozen of [its familiar friends]3481-its familiar friends]3480-a few dozen of its familiar friends were gathered together for a social good time . It was then that [we]3475-we did [our]3475-we best , [we]3475-we five youngsters , with such fascinations as [we]3475-we had , and the chief object of [them]3476-the great folk who flocked to the big house to make joan ’s acquaintance was [Catherine]133-catherine . None of [us]3475-we had ever been in love before , and now [we]3475-we had the misfortune to all fall in love with [the same person]3482-the same person at the same time — which was the first moment [we]3475-we saw [her]133-catherine . [She]133-catherine was a merry heart , and full of life , and [I]215-talbot still remember tenderly those few evenings that [I]215-talbot was permitted to have [my]215-talbot share of [her]133-catherine dear society and of comradeship with [that little company of [charming people]3484-charming people]3483-that little company of charming people . [The Paladin]157-the paladin made [us]3475-we all jealous the first night , for when [he]157-the paladin got fairly started on those battles of [his]157-the paladin [he]157-the paladin had everything to [himself]157-the paladin , and there was no use in [anybody else]3289-anybody else ’s trying to get any attention . [Those people]1318-those people had been living in the midst of real war for seven months ; and to hear [this windy giant]3487-this windy giant lay out [his]157-the paladin imaginary campaigns and fairly swim in blood and spatter it all around , entertained [them]1318-those people to the verge of the grave . [Catherine]133-catherine was like to die , for pure enjoyment . [She]133-catherine did n’t laugh loud — [we]3475-we , of course , wished [she]133-catherine would — but kept in the shelter of a fan , and shook until there was danger that [she]133-catherine would unhitch [her]133-catherine ribs from [her]133-catherine spine . Then when [the Paladin]157-the paladin had got done with a battle and [we]3475-we began to feel thankful and hope for a change , [she]133-catherine would speak up in a way that was so sweet and persuasive that it rankled in [me]215-talbot , and ask [him]157-the paladin about some detail or other in the early part of [his]157-the paladin battle which [she]133-catherine said had greatly interested [her]133-catherine , and would [he]157-the paladin be so good as to describe that part again and with a little more particularity?—which of course precipitated the whole battle on [us]3475-we , again , with a hundred lies added that had been overlooked before . [I]215-talbot do not know how to make [you]3488-you realize the pain [I]215-talbot suffered . [I]215-talbot had never been jealous before , and it seemed intolerable that [this creature]3489-this creature should have this good fortune which [he]3489-this creature was so ill entitled to , and [I]215-talbot have to sit and see [myself]215-talbot neglected when [I]215-talbot was so longing for the least little attention out of the thousand that [this beloved girl]3490-this beloved girl was lavishing on [him]157-the paladin . [I]215-talbot was near [her]133-catherine , and tried two or three times to get started on some of the things that [I]215-talbot had done in those battles — and [I]215-talbot felt ashamed of [myself]215-talbot , too , for stooping to such a business — but [she]133-catherine cared for nothing but [his]157-the paladin battles , and could not be got to listen ; and presently when one of [my]215-talbot attempts caused [her]133-catherine to lose some precious rag or other of [his]157-the paladin mendacities and [she]133-catherine asked [him]157-the paladin to repeat , thus bringing on a new engagement , of course , and increasing the havoc and carnage tenfold , [I]215-talbot felt so humiliated by this pitiful miscarriage of [mine]215-talbot that [I]215-talbot gave up and tried no more . [The others]733-the others were as outraged by [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s selfish conduct as [I]215-talbot was — and by [his]157-the paladin grand luck , too , of course — perhaps , indeed , that was the main hurt . [We]3492-we talked [our]3492-we trouble over together , which was natural , for [rivals]3493-rivals become [brothers]3494-brothers when a common affliction assails [them]3493-rivals and [a common enemy]3495-a common enemy bears off the victory . [Each of [us]3492-we]916-each of us could do things that would please and get notice if it were not for [this person , who occupied all the time and gave others]3497-this person , who occupied all the time and gave others no chance . [I]215-talbot had made a poem , taking a whole night to it — a poem in which [I]215-talbot most happily and delicately celebrated [that sweet girl]3498-that sweet girl ’s charms , without mentioning [her]3498-that sweet girl name , but [any one]2338-any one could see who was meant ; for the bare title—“The[215-talbot] Rose of Orleans”—would reveal that , as it seemed to [me]215-talbot . [It]3500-it pictured this pure and dainty white rose as growing up out of the rude soil of war and looking abroad out of its tender eyes upon the horrid machinery of death , and then — note this conceit — it blushes for the sinful nature of [man]577-man , and turns red in a single night . Becomes a red rose , [you]3502-you see — a rose that was white before . The idea was [my]215-talbot own , and quite new . Then it sent its sweet perfume out over [the embattled city]3503-the embattled city , and when [the beleaguering forces]3504-the beleaguering forces smelt it [they]3504-the beleaguering forces laid down [their]3504-the beleaguering forces arms and wept . This was also [my]215-talbot own idea , and new . That closed that part of the poem ; then [I]215-talbot put [her]3498-that sweet girl into the similitude of the firmament — not the whole of it , but only part . That is to say , [she]3498-that sweet girl was the moon , and all the constellations were following [her]3498-that sweet girl about , [their]3504-the beleaguering forces hearts in flames for love of [her]3498-that sweet girl , but [she]3498-that sweet girl would not halt , [she]3498-that sweet girl would not listen , for ’ twas thought [she]3498-that sweet girl loved another . ’ [Twas]217-twas thought [she]3498-that sweet girl loved [a poor unworthy suppliant who was upon [the earth]474-the earth , facing danger , death , and possible mutilation in [the bloody field]3507-the bloody field , waging relentless war against a heartless foe to save [her]3498-that sweet girl from an all too early grave , and [[her]3498-that sweet girl city]3508-her city from destruction]3505-a poor unworthy suppliant who was upon the earth , facing danger , death , and possible mutilation in the bloody field , waging relentless war against a heartless foe to save her from an all too early grave , and her city from destruction . And when [the sad pursuing constellations]3509-the sad pursuing constellations came to know and realize the bitter sorrow that was come upon [them]3509-the sad pursuing constellations — note this idea — [their]3509-the sad pursuing constellations hearts broke and [their]3509-the sad pursuing constellations tears gushed forth , filling the vault of heaven with a fiery splendor , for those tears were falling stars . It was a rash idea , but beautiful ; beautiful and pathetic ; wonderfully pathetic , the way [I]215-talbot had it , with the rhyme and all to help . At the end of each verse there was a two - line refrain pitying the poor earthly lover separated so far , and perhaps forever , from [her]3498-that sweet girl [he]3498-that sweet girl loved so well , and growing always paler and weaker and thinner in [his]3498-that sweet girl agony as [he]3498-that sweet girl neared the cruel grave — the most touching thing — [even [the boys]747-the boys [themselves]747-the boys]3510-even the boys themselves could hardly keep back [their]747-the boys tears , the way [Noel]135-noel said those lines . There were eight four - line stanzas in the first end of the poem — the end about the rose , the horticultural end , as [you]3512-you may say , if that is not too large a name for such a little poem — and eight in the astronomical end — sixteen stanzas altogether , and [I]215-talbot could have made it a hundred and fifty if [I]215-talbot had wanted to , [I]215-talbot was so inspired and so all swelled up with beautiful thoughts and fancies ; but that would have been too many to sing or recite before a company that way , whereas sixteen was just right , and could be done over again if desired . [The boys]747-the boys were amazed that [I]215-talbot could make such a poem as that out of [my]215-talbot own head , and so was [I]215-talbot , of course , it being as much a surprise to [me]215-talbot as it could be to [anybody]563-anybody , for [I]215-talbot did not know that it was in [me]215-talbot . If [any]3515-any had asked [me]215-talbot a single day before if it was in [me]215-talbot , [I]215-talbot should have told [them]747-the boys frankly no , it was not . That is the way with [us]3516-us ; [we]3516-us may go on half of [our]3516-us life not knowing such a thing is in [us]3516-us , when in reality it was there all the time , and all [we]3516-us needed was something to turn up that would call for it . Indeed , it was always so without [family]3517-family . [[My]215-talbot grandfather]3518-my grandfather had a cancer , and [they]747-the boys never knew what was the matter with [him]3518-my grandfather till [he]3518-my grandfather died , and [he]3518-my grandfather did n’t know [himself]3518-my grandfather . It is wonderful how gifts and diseases can be concealed in that way . All that was necessary in [my]215-talbot case was for [this lovely and inspiring girl]3519-this lovely and inspiring girl to cross [my]215-talbot path , and out came the poem , and no more trouble to [me]215-talbot to word it and rhyme it and perfect it than it is to stone a dog . No , [I]215-talbot should have said it was not in [me]215-talbot ; but it was . [The boys]747-the boys could n’t say enough about it , [they]747-the boys were so charmed and astonished . The thing that pleased [them]747-the boys the most was the way it would do [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s business for [him]3518-my grandfather . [They]747-the boys forgot everything in [their]747-the boys anxiety to get [him]3518-my grandfather shelved and silenced . [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel was clear beside [himself]135-noel with admiration of the poem , and wished [he]135-noel could do such a thing , but it was out of [his]135-noel line , and [he]135-noel could n’t , of course . [He]135-noel had it by heart in half an hour , and there was never anything so pathetic and beautiful as the way [he]135-noel recited it . For that was just [his]135-noel gift — that and mimicry . [He]135-noel could recite anything better than anybody in [the world]320-the world , and [he]135-noel could take of [La Hire]195-la hire to the very life — or [anybody else]3289-anybody else , for that matter . Now [I]215-talbot never could recite worth a farthing ; and when [I]215-talbot tried with this poem [the boys]747-the boys would n’t let [me]215-talbot finish ; [they]747-the boys would have [nobody]434-nobody but [Noel]135-noel . So then , as [I]215-talbot wanted the poem to make the best possible impression on [Catherine]133-catherine and [the company]639-the company , [I]215-talbot told [Noel]135-noel [he]135-noel might do the reciting . Never was [anybody]563-anybody so delighted . [He]135-noel could hardly believe that [I]215-talbot was in earnest , but [I]215-talbot was . [I]215-talbot said that to have [them]747-the boys know that [I]215-talbot was [the author of it]3527-the author of it would be enough for [me]215-talbot . [The boys]747-the boys were full of exultation , and [Noel]135-noel said if [he]135-noel could just get one chance at [those people]1318-those people it would be all [he]135-noel would ask ; [he]135-noel would make [them]1318-those people realize that there was something higher and finer than war - lies to be had [here]2531-here . But how to get the opportunity — that was the difficulty . [We]3531-we invented several schemes that promised fairly , and at last [we]3531-we hit upon one that was sure . That was , to let [the Paladin]157-the paladin get a good start in a manufactured battle , and then send in a false call for [him]157-the paladin , and as soon as [he]157-the paladin was out of [the room]1355-the room , have [Noel]135-noel take [his]135-noel place and finish the battle [himself]135-noel in the [Paladin]157-the paladin ’s own style , imitated to a shade . That would get great applause , and win [the house]630-the house ’s favor and put it in the right mood to hear the poem . The two triumphs together with finish [the Standard - Bearer]3534-the standard - bearer — modify [him]3534-the standard - bearer , anyway , to a certainty , and give the rest of [us]3531-we a chance for the future . So the next night [I]215-talbot kept out of the way until [the Paladin]157-the paladin had got [his]157-the paladin start and was sweeping down upon [the enemy]2442-the enemy like a whirlwind at the head of [[his]157-the paladin corps]3536-his corps , then [I]215-talbot stepped within the door in [my]215-talbot official uniform and announced that [a messenger from General La Hire ’s quarters]3537-a messenger from general la hire ’s quarters desired speech with [the Standard - Bearer]3534-the standard - bearer . [He]157-the paladin left [the room]1355-the room , and [Noel]135-noel took [his]135-noel place and said that the interruption was to be deplored , but that fortunately [he]135-noel was personally acquainted with the details of the battle [himself]135-noel , and if permitted would be glad to state them to [the company]639-the company . Then without waiting for the permission [he]135-noel turned [himself]135-noel to [the Paladin]157-the paladin — [a dwarfed Paladin]3541-a dwarfed paladin , of course — with manner , tones , gestures , attitudes , everything exact , and went right on with the battle , and it would be impossible to imagine a more perfectly and minutely ridiculous imitation than [he]135-noel furnished to [those shrieking people]3542-those shrieking people . [They]3542-those shrieking people went into spasms , convulsions , frenzies of laughter , and the tears flowed down [their]3542-those shrieking people cheeks in rivulets . The more [they]3542-those shrieking people laughed , the more inspired [Noel]135-noel grew with [his]135-noel theme and the greater marvels [he]135-noel worked , till really the laughter was not properly laughing any more , but screaming . Blessedest feature of all , [Catherine Boucher]133-catherine was dying with ecstasies , and presently there was little left of [her]133-catherine but gasps and suffocations . Victory ? It was a perfect [Agincourt]26-agincourt . [The Paladin]157-the paladin was gone only a couple of minutes ; [he]135-noel found out at once that a trick had been played on [him]135-noel , so [he]135-noel came back . When [he]135-noel approached the door [he]135-noel heard [Noel]135-noel ranting in there and recognized the state of the case ; so [he]135-noel remained near the door but out of sight , and heard the performance through to the end . The applause [Noel]135-noel got when [he]135-noel finished was wonderful ; and [they]3542-those shrieking people kept it up and kept it up , clapping [their]3542-those shrieking people hands like mad , and shouting to [him]135-noel to do it over again . But [Noel]135-noel was clever . [He]135-noel knew the very best background for a poem of deep and refined sentiment and pathetic melancholy was one where great and satisfying merriment had prepared the spirit for the powerful contrast . So [he]135-noel paused until all was quiet , then [his]135-noel face grew grave and assumed an impressive aspect , and at once all faces sobered in sympathy and took on a look of wondering and expectant interest . Now [he]135-noel began in a low but distinct voice the opening verses of The Rose . As [he]135-noel breathed the rhythmic measures forth , and one gracious line after another fell upon those enchanted ears in that deep hush , [one]461-one could catch , on every hand , half - audible ejaculations of “[215-talbot] How lovely — how beautiful — how exquisite ! ” By this time [the Paladin , who had gone away for a moment with the opening of the poem]3544-the paladin , who had gone away for a moment with the opening of the poem , was back again , and had stepped within the door . [He]135-noel stood there now , resting [his]135-noel great frame against the wall and gazing toward [the reciter]3545-the reciter like one entranced . When [Noel]135-noel got to the second part , and that heart - breaking refrain began to melt and move [all listeners]3546-all listeners , [the Paladin]157-the paladin began to wipe away tears with the back of first one hand and then the other . The next time the refrain was repeated [he]135-noel got to snuffling , and sort of half sobbing , and went to wiping [his]135-noel eyes with the sleeves of [his]135-noel doublet . [He]135-noel was so conspicuous that [he]135-noel embarrassed [Noel]135-noel a little , and also had an ill effect upon [the audience]1431-the audience . With the next repetition [he]135-noel broke quite down and began to cry like a calf , which ruined all the effect and started many to [the audience]1431-the audience to laughing . Then [he]135-noel went on from bad to worse , until [I]215-talbot never saw such a spectacle ; for [he]135-noel fetched out a towel from under [his]135-noel doublet and began to swab [his]135-noel eyes with it and let go the most infernal bellowings mixed up with sobbings and groanings and retchings and barkings and coughings and snortings and screamings and howlings — and [he]135-noel twisted [himself]135-noel about on [his]135-noel heels and squirmed this way and that , still pouring out that brutal clamor and flourishing [his]135-noel towel in the air and swabbing again and wringing it out . Hear ? [You]3549-you could n’t hear [yourself]3549-you think . [Noel]135-noel was wholly drowned out and silenced , and [those people]1318-those people were laughing the very lungs out of [themselves]1318-those people . It was the most degrading sight that ever was . Now [I]215-talbot heard the clankety - clank that plate - armor makes when [the man that is in it]3551-the man that is in it is running , and then alongside [my]215-talbot head there burst out the most inhuman explosion of laughter that ever rent the drum of [a person]467-a person ’s ear , and [I]215-talbot looked , and it was [La Hire]195-la hire ; and the stood there with [his]135-noel gauntlets on [his]135-noel hips and [his]135-noel head tilted back and [his]135-noel jaws spread to that degree to let out [his]135-noel hurricanes and [his]135-noel thunders that it amounted to indecent exposure , for [you]3549-you could see everything that was in [him]135-noel . Only one thing more and worse could happen , and it happened : at the other door [I]215-talbot saw the flurry and bustle and bowings and scrapings of [officials]3553-officials and [flunkeys]3554-flunkeys which means that [some great personage]3555-some great personage is coming — then [Joan of Arc]110-joan stepped in , and [the house]630-the house rose ! Yes , and tried to shut its indecorous mouth and make itself grave and proper ; but when it saw [the Maid]1326-the maid [herself]1326-the maid go to laughing , it thanked [God]140-god for this mercy and the earthquake that followed . Such things make a life of bitterness , and [I]215-talbot do not wish to dwell upon them . The effect of the poem was spoiled . Chapter 16 The Finding of [the Dwarf THIS EPISODE]3558-the dwarf this episode disagreed with [me]215-talbot and [I]215-talbot was not able to leave [my]215-talbot bed the next day . [The others]733-the others were in the same condition . But for this , [one or another of [us]3561-us]3560-one or another of us might have had the good luck that fell to [the Paladin]157-the paladin ’s share that day ; but it is observable that [God]140-god in [His]140-god compassion sends the good luck to such as are ill equipped with gifts , as compensation for [their]733-the others defect , but [requires such as are more fortunately endowed to get by labor]3562-requires such as are more fortunately endowed to get by labor and talent what [those others]3563-those others get by chance . It was [Noel]135-noel who said this , and it seemed to [me]215-talbot to be well and justly thought . [The Paladin]157-the paladin , going about [the town]786-the town all the day in order to be followed and admired and overhear [the people]313-the people say in an awed voice , “[215-talbot] ‘ Ssh!—look , it is [the Standard - Bearer of [Joan of Arc]110-joan]1956-the standard - bearer of joan of arc ! ” had speech with all sorts and conditions of [folk]3566-folk , and [he]157-the paladin learned from [some boatmen]3567-some boatmen that there was a stir of some kind going on in the bastilles on [the other side of [the river]454-the river]3568-the other side of the river ; and in the evening , seeking further , [he]157-the paladin found [a deserter from [the fortress]3571-the fortress]3570-a deserter from the fortress called [the “[215-talbot] Augustins]218-the augustins , ” who said that [the English]128-the english were going to send [me]215-talbot over to strengthen [the garrisons on [our]3573-our side]3572-the garrisons on our side during the darkness of the night , and were exulting greatly , for [they]3574-they meant to spring upon [Dunois]161-dunois and [the army]3157-the army when it was passing [the bastilles]3576-the bastilles and destroy [it]3576-the bastilles ; a thing quite easy to do , since [the “[215-talbot] Witch ”]3577-the “ witch ” would not be [there]460-there , and without [her]3577-the “ witch ” presence [the army]3157-the army would do like [the French armies of these many years past]3580-the french armies of these many years past — drop [their]3157-the army weapons and run when [they]3157-the army saw [an English face]3581-an english face . It was ten at night when [the Paladin]157-the paladin brought this news and asked leave to speak to [Joan]110-joan , and [I]215-talbot was up and on duty then . It was a bitter stroke to [me]215-talbot to see what a chance [I]215-talbot had lost . [Joan]110-joan made searching inquiries , and satisfied [herself]110-joan that the word was true , then [she]110-joan made this annoying remark : “[215-talbot] [You]1957-he have done well , and [you]1957-he have [my]0-i thanks . It may be that [you]1957-he have prevented a disaster . [Your]1957-he name and service shall receive official mention . ” Then [he]1957-he bowed low , and when [he]1957-he rose [he]1957-he was eleven feet high . As [he]1957-he swelled out past [me]215-talbot [he]1957-he covertly pulled down the corner of [his]1957-he eye with [his]1957-he finger and muttered part of that defiled refrain , “[215-talbot] Oh , tears , ah , tears , oh , sad sweet tears!—name in General Orders — personal mention to [the King]270-the king , [you]1957-he see ! ” [I]270-the king wished [Joan]110-joan could have seen [his]1957-he conduct , but [she]110-joan was busy thinking what [she]110-joan would do . Then [she]110-joan had [me]270-the king fetch [the knight [Jean de Metz]167-jean]3582-the knight jean de metz , and in a minute [he]1957-he was off for [[La Hire]195-la hire ’s quarters]3583-la hire ’s quarters with orders for [him]1957-he and [the Lord de Villars]219-the lord de villars and [Florent]206-florent d’illiers d’Illiers to report to [her]110-joan at five o’clock next morning with [five hundred picked men well mounted]3584-five hundred picked men well mounted . The histories say half past four , but it is not true , [I]270-the king heard the order given . [We]3585-we were on [our]3585-we way at five to the minute , and encountered the head of [the arriving column]3586-the arriving column between six and seven , a couple of leagues from [the city]372-the city . [Dunois]161-dunois was pleased , for [the army]3157-the army had begun to get restive and show uneasiness now that it was getting so near to [the dreaded bastilles]3589-the dreaded bastilles . But that all disappeared now , as the word ran down the line , with a huzza that swept along the length of [it]3586-the arriving column like a wave , that [the Maid]1326-the maid was come . [Dunois]161-dunois asked [her]110-joan to halt and let the column pass in review , so that [the men]788-the men could be sure that the reports of [her]110-joan presence was not a ruse to revive [their]788-the men courage . So [she]110-joan took position at the side of [the road]840-the road with [her]110-joan staff , and [the battalions]3593-the battalions swung by with a martial stride , huzzaing . [Joan]110-joan was armed , except [her]110-joan head . [She]110-joan was wearing the cunning little velvet cap with the mass of curved white ostrich plumes tumbling over its edges which [the city of [Orleans]39-orleans]3594-the city of orleans had given [her]110-joan the night [she]110-joan arrived — the one that is in the picture that hangs in [the Hotel de Ville]82-the hotel de ville at [Rouen]83-rouen . [She]110-joan was looking about fifteen . The sight of [soldiers]2473-soldiers always set [her]110-joan blood to leaping , and lit the fires in [her]110-joan eyes and brought the warm rich color to [her]110-joan cheeks ; it was then that [you]3596-you saw that [she]110-joan was too beautiful to be of [the earth]474-the earth , or at any rate that there was a subtle something somewhere about [her]110-joan beauty that differed it from the human types of [your]3596-you experience and exalted it above [them]2473-soldiers . In the train of [wains laden with supplies]3598-wains laden with supplies [a man]2329-a man lay on top of [the goods]3600-the goods . [He]2329-a man was stretched out on [his]2329-a man back , and [his]2329-a man hands were tied together with ropes , and also [his]2329-a man ankles . [Joan]110-joan signed to [the officer in charge of that division of [the train]3602-the train]3601-the officer in charge of that division of the train to come to [her]110-joan , and [he]3601-the officer in charge of that division of the train rode up and saluted . “[270-the king] What is [he]1959-he that is bound [there]460-there ? ” [she]110-joan asked . “[1961-a prisoner] [A prisoner]1961-a prisoner , [General]1962-general . ” “[1962-general] What is [his]1959-he offense ? ” “[1959-he] [He]1959-he is [a deserter]1963-a deserter . ” “[1963-a deserter] What is to be done with [him]1959-he ? ” “[1959-he] [He]1959-he will be hanged , but it was not convenient on the march , and there was no hurry . ” “[1959-he] Tell [me]0-i about [him]1959-he . ” “[1959-he] [He]1959-he is [a good soldier]1964-a good soldier , but [he]1959-he asked leave to go and see [[his]1959-he wife]412-his wife who was dying , [he]1959-he said , but it could not be granted ; so [he]1959-he went without leave . Meanwhile the march began , and [he]1959-he only overtook [us]1966-us yesterday evening . ” “[1959-he] Overtook [you]0-i ? Did [he]1959-he come of [his]1959-he own will ? ” “[1959-he] Yes , it was of [his]1959-he own will . ” “[1959-he] [He]1959-he [a deserter]1963-a deserter ! Name of [God]140-god ! Bring [him]1959-he to [me]0-i . ” [The officer]1251-the officer rode forward and loosed [the man]648-the man ’s feet and brought [him]648-the man back with [his]648-the man hands still tied . What a figure [he]648-the man was — a good seven feet high , and built for business ! [He]648-the man had a strong face ; [he]648-the man had an unkempt shock of black hair which showed up a striking way when [the officer]1251-the officer removed [his]1251-the officer morion for [him]648-the man ; for weapon [he]648-the man had a big ax in [his]648-the man broad leathern belt . Standing by [Joan]110-joan ’s horse , [he]648-the man made [Joan]110-joan look littler than ever , for [his]648-the man head was about on a level with [her]110-joan own . [His]648-the man face was profoundly melancholy ; all interest in life seemed to be dead in [the man]648-the man . [Joan]110-joan said : “[140-god] Hold up [your]1968-your hands . ” [The man]648-the man ’s head was down . [He]648-the man lifted it when [he]648-the man heard that soft friendly voice , and there was a wistful something in [his]648-the man face which made [one]461-one think that there had been music in it for [him]648-the man and that [he]648-the man would like to hear it again . When [he]648-the man raised [his]648-the man hands [Joan]110-joan laid [her]110-joan sword to [his]648-the man bonds , but [the officer]1251-the officer said with apprehension : “[1968-your] Ah , [madam]1969-madam — [[my]0-i General]1907-my general ! ” “[1969-madam] What is it ? ” [she]110-joan said . “[1969-madam] [He]1907-my general is under sentence ! ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i know . [I]0-i am responsible for [him]1907-my general ” ; and [she]110-joan cut the bonds . [They]3610-they had lacerated [his]648-the man wrists , and they were bleeding . “[0-i] Ah , pitiful ! ” [she]110-joan said ; “[0-i] blood — [I]0-i do not like it ” ; and [she]110-joan shrank from the sight . But only for a moment . “[636-somebody] Give [me]0-i something , [somebody]636-somebody , to bandage [his]1907-my general wrists with . ” [The officer]1251-the officer said : “[636-somebody] Ah , [[my]0-i General]1907-my general ! it is not fitting . Let [me]0-i bring [another]2787-another to do it . ” “[0-i] Another ? [De par le Dieu]220-de par le dieu ! [You]1974-you would seek far to find one that can do it better than [I]0-i , for [I]0-i learned it long ago among [both men]1975-both men and beasts . And [I]0-i can tie better than [those that did this]1976-those that did this ; if [I]0-i had tied [him]1907-my general the ropes had not cut [his]1907-my general flesh . ” [The man]648-the man looked on silent , while [he]648-the man was being bandaged , stealing a furtive glance at [Joan]110-joan ’s face occasionally , such as [an animal might that is receiving a kindness form an unexpected quarter]3613-an animal might that is receiving a kindness form an unexpected quarter and is gropingly trying to reconcile the act with its source . [All the staff]3614-all the staff had forgotten [the huzzaing army drifting by in its rolling clouds of dust]3615-the huzzaing army drifting by in its rolling clouds of dust , to crane [their]3614-all the staff necks and watch the bandaging as if it was the most interesting and absorbing novelty that ever was . [I]0-i have often seen [people]2327-people do like that — get entirely lost in the simplest trifle , when it is something that is out of [their]2327-people line . Now there in [Poitiers]63-poitiers , once , [I]0-i saw [two bishops and a dozen of those grave and famous scholars]3617-two bishops and a dozen of those grave and famous scholars grouped together watching [a man]2329-a man paint a sign on [a shop]3619-a shop ; [they]3617-two bishops and a dozen of those grave and famous scholars did n’t breathe , [they]3617-two bishops and a dozen of those grave and famous scholars were as good as dead ; and when it began to sprinkle [they]3617-two bishops and a dozen of those grave and famous scholars did n’t know it at first ; then [they]3617-two bishops and a dozen of those grave and famous scholars noticed it , and [each man]3620-each man hove a deep sigh , and glanced up with a surprised look as wondering to see [the others there]3621-the others there , and how [he]648-the man came to be [there]460-there [himself]648-the man — but that is the way with [people]2327-people , as [I]0-i have said . There is no way of accounting for [people]2327-people . [You]3625-you have to take [them]2327-people as [they]2327-people are . “[0-i] There , ” said [Joan]110-joan at last , pleased with [her]110-joan success ; “[0-i] [another]2787-another could have done it no better — not as well , [I]0-i think .
