Tell [me]0-i — what is it [you]1978-you did ? Tell [me]0-i all . ” [The giant]3626-the giant said : “[1978-you] It was this way , [[my]0-i angel]1979-my angel . [[My]0-i mother]2609-my mother died , then [[my]0-i three little children]1981-my three little children , one after the other , all in two years . It was the famine ; [others]506-others fared so — it was [God]140-god ’s will . [I]0-i saw [them]1981-my three little children die ; [I]0-i had that grace ; and [I]0-i buried [them]1981-my three little children . Then when [[my]0-i poor wife]1983-my poor wife ’s fate was come , [I]0-i begged for leave to go to [her]1983-my poor wife — [she]1983-my poor wife who was so dear to [me]0-i — [she]1983-my poor wife who was all [I]0-i had ; [I]0-i begged on [my]0-i knees . But [they]1981-my three little children would not let [me]0-i . Could [I]0-i let [her]1983-my poor wife die , friendless and alone ? Could [I]0-i let [her]1983-my poor wife die believing [I]0-i would not come ? Would [she]1983-my poor wife let [me]0-i die and [she]1983-my poor wife not come — with [her]1983-my poor wife feet free to do it if [she]1983-my poor wife would , and no cost upon it but only [her]1983-my poor wife life ? Ah , [she]1983-my poor wife would come — [she]1983-my poor wife would come through the fire ! So [I]0-i went . [I]0-i saw [her]1983-my poor wife . [She]1983-my poor wife died in [my]0-i arms . [I]0-i buried [her]1983-my poor wife . Then [the army]3157-the army was gone . [I]0-i had trouble to overtake it , but [my]0-i legs are long and there are many hours in a day ; [I]0-i overtook it last night . ” [Joan]110-joan said , musingly , as if [she]110-joan were thinking aloud : “[0-i] It sounds true . If true , it were no great harm to suspend the law this one time — any would say that . It may not be true , but if it is true — ” [She]110-joan turned suddenly to [the man]648-the man and said , “[0-i] [I]0-i would see [your]0-i eyes — look up ! ” The eyes of [the two]780-the two met , and [Joan]110-joan said to [the officer]1251-the officer , “[692-this man] [This man]692-this man is pardoned . Give [you]0-i good day ; [you]0-i may go . ” Then [she]110-joan said to [the man]648-the man , “[0-i] Did [you]0-i know it was death to come back to [the army]3157-the army ? ” “[0-i] Yes , ” [he]648-the man said , “[0-i] [I]0-i knew it . ” “[0-i] Then why did [you]0-i do it ? ” [The man]648-the man said , quite simply : “[0-i] Because it was death . [She]1987-she was all [I]0-i had . There was nothing left to love . ” “[0-i] Ah , yes , there was — [France]4-france ! [The children of [France]4-france]1988-the children of france have always [[their]1988-the children of france mother]1989-their mother — [they]1988-the children of france can not be left with nothing to love . [You]0-i shall live — and [you]0-i shall serve [France]4-france — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will serve [you!”—“you]0-i shall fight for [France]4-france — ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i will fight for [you]648-the man ! ”[0-i] “ [You]0-i shall be [[France]202-the lord high admiral of france ’s soldier]3632-france ’s soldier — ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i will be [[your]648-the man soldier!”—“you]3633-your soldier!”—“you[0-i] shall give all [your]0-i heart to [France]4-france — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will give all [my]0-i heart to [you]0-i — and all [my]0-i soul , if [I]0-i have one — and all [my]0-i strength , which is great — for [I]0-i was dead and am alive again ; [I]0-i had nothing to live for , but now [I]0-i have ! [You]4-france are [France]4-france for [me]0-i . [You]4-france are [[my]0-i [France]4-france]1990-my france , and [I]0-i will have [no other]1991-no other . ” [Joan]110-joan smiled , and was touched and pleased at [the man]648-the man ’s grave enthusiasm — solemn enthusiasm , [one]461-one may call it , for the manner of it was deeper than mere gravity — and [she]110-joan said : “[4-france] Well , it shall be as [you]0-i will . What are [you]0-i called ? ” [The man]648-the man answered with unsmiling simplicity : “[0-i] [They]1992-they call [me]0-i [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf , but [I]0-i think it is more in jest than otherwise . ” It made [Joan]110-joan laugh , and [she]110-joan said : “[1994-it] [It]1994-it has something of that look truly ! What is the office of that vast ax ? ” [The soldier]1741-the soldier replied with the same gravity — which must have been born to [him]1741-the soldier , it sat upon [him]1741-the soldier so naturally : “[1992-they] It is to persuade [persons]1995-persons to respect [France]4-france . ” [Joan]110-joan laughed again , and said : “[1992-they] Have [you]0-i given many lessons ? ” “[0-i] Ah , indeed , yes — many . ” “[0-i] [The pupils]1996-the pupils behaved to suit [you]0-i , afterward ? ” “[1996-the pupils] Yes ; it made [them]1996-the pupils quiet — quite pleasant and quiet . ” “[1996-the pupils] [I]0-i should think it would happen so . Would [you]0-i like to be [[my]0-i man]1997-my man - at - arms?—orderly , [sentinel]1998-sentinel , or something like that ? ” “[1998-sentinel] If [I]0-i may ! ” “[1998-sentinel] Then [you]0-i shall . [You]0-i shall have proper armor , and shall go on teaching [your]0-i art . Take one of those led horses [there]460-there , and follow the staff when [we]2000-we move . ” That is how [we]2000-we came by [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf ; and [a good fellow]1882-a good fellow [he]1993-the dwarf was . [Joan]110-joan picked [him]1993-the dwarf out on sight , but it was n’t a mistake ; [no one]284-no one could be faithfuler than [he]1993-the dwarf was , and [he]1993-the dwarf was [a devil]3641-a devil and the son of [a devil]3641-a devil when [he]1993-the dwarf turned [himself]1993-the dwarf loose with [his]1993-the dwarf ax . [He]1993-the dwarf was so big that [he]1993-the dwarf made [the Paladin]732-the paladin look like [an ordinary man]3644-an ordinary man . [He]1993-the dwarf liked to like [people]2327-people , therefore [people]2327-people liked [him]1993-the dwarf . [He]1993-the dwarf liked [[us]3647-us boys]3140-us boys from the start ; and [he]1993-the dwarf liked [the knights]1227-the knights , and liked pretty much everybody [he]1993-the dwarf came across ; but [he]1993-the dwarf thought more of a paring of [Joan]110-joan ’s finger - nail than [he]1993-the dwarf did of all the rest of [the world]320-the world put together . Yes , that is where [we]3647-us got [him]1993-the dwarf — stretched on the wain , going to [his]1993-the dwarf death , [poor chap]3651-poor chap , and [nobody]434-nobody to say a good word for [him]1993-the dwarf . [He]1993-the dwarf was [a good find]3653-a good find . Why , [the knights]1227-the knights treated [him]1993-the dwarf almost like [an equal]3655-an equal — it is the honest truth ; that is the sort of [a man [he]1993-the dwarf was]3656-a man he was . [They]1227-the knights called [him]1993-the dwarf [the Bastille]221-the bastille sometimes , and sometimes [they]1227-the knights called [him]1993-the dwarf [Hellfire]222-hellfire , which was on account of [his]1993-the dwarf warm and sumptuous style in battle , and [you]3657-you know [they]1227-the knights would n’t have given [him]1993-the dwarf pet names if [they]1227-the knights had n’t had a good deal of affection for [him]1993-the dwarf . To [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf , [Joan]110-joan was [France]4-france , [the spirit of [France]4-france]3659-the spirit of france made flesh — [he]1993-the dwarf never got away from that idea that [he]1993-the dwarf had started with ; and [God]140-god knows it was the true one . That was a humble eye to see so great a truth where [some others]3660-some others failed . To [me]2001-bastard that seems quite remarkable . And yet , after all , it was , in a way , just what [nations]3661-nations do . When [they]3661-nations love a great and noble thing , [they]3661-nations embody it — [they]3661-nations want it so that [they]3661-nations can see it with [their]3661-nations eyes ; like liberty , for instance . [They]3661-nations are not content with the cloudy abstract idea , [they]3661-nations make a beautiful statue of it , and then [their]3661-nations beloved idea is substantial and [they]3661-nations can look at it and worship it . And so it is as [I]2001-bastard say ; to [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf , [Joan]110-joan was [[our]3663-our country]711-our country embodied , [[our]3663-our country]711-our country made visible flesh cast in a gracious form . When [she]110-joan stood before [others]506-others , [they]506-others saw [Joan of Arc]110-joan , but [he]1993-the dwarf saw [France]4-france . Sometimes [he]1993-the dwarf would speak of [her]110-joan by that name . It shows [you]3667-you how the idea was embedded in [his]1993-the dwarf mind , and how real it was to [him]1993-the dwarf . [The world]320-the world has called [[our]3663-our kings]3669-our kings by it , but [I]2001-bastard know of none of [them]3669-our kings who has had so good a right as [she]110-joan to that sublime title . When the march past was finished , [Joan]110-joan returned to the front and rode at the head of the column . When [we]3663-our began to file past [those grim bastilles]3670-those grim bastilles and could glimpse [the men within]3671-the men within , standing to [their]3671-the men within guns and ready to empty death into [our]3663-our ranks , such a faintness came over [me]2001-bastard and such a sickness that all things seemed to turn dim and swim before [my]2001-bastard eyes ; and [the other boys]3672-the other boys looked droopy , too , [I]2001-bastard thought — including [the Paladin]157-the paladin , although [I]2001-bastard do not know this for certain , because [he]157-the paladin was ahead of [me]2001-bastard and [I]2001-bastard had to keep [my]2001-bastard eyes out toward the bastille side , because [I]2001-bastard could wince better when [I]2001-bastard saw what to wince at . But [Joan]110-joan was at [home]377-home — in [Paradise]84-paradise , [I]2001-bastard might say . [She]110-joan sat up straight , and [I]2001-bastard could see that [she]110-joan was feeling different from [me]2001-bastard . The awfulest thing was the silence ; there was n’t a sound but the screaking of the saddles , the measured tramplings , and the sneezing of the horses , afflicted by the smothering dust - clouds which [they]3674-they kicked up . [I]2001-bastard wanted to sneeze [myself]2001-bastard , but it seemed to [me]2001-bastard that [I]2001-bastard would rather go unsneezed , or suffer even a bitterer torture , if there is one , than attract attention to [myself]2001-bastard . [I]2001-bastard was not of a rank to make suggestions , or [I]2001-bastard would have suggested that if [we]3675-we went faster [we]3675-we should get by sooner . It seemed to [me]2001-bastard that it was an ill - judged time to be taking a walk . Just as [we]3675-we were drifting in that suffocating stillness past a great cannon that stood just within a raised portcullis , with nothing between [me]2001-bastard and it but [the moat]3676-the moat , [a most uncommon jackass in there]3677-a most uncommon jackass in there split [the world]320-the world with [his]3677-a most uncommon jackass in there bray , and [I]2001-bastard fell out of the saddle . [Sir Bertrand]223-sir bertrand grabbed [me]2001-bastard as [I]2001-bastard went , which was well , for if [I]2001-bastard had gone to the ground in [my]2001-bastard armor [I]2001-bastard could not have gotten up again by [myself]2001-bastard . [The English warders on the battlements]3679-the english warders on the battlements laughed a coarse laugh , forgetting that [every one]529-every one must begin , and that there had been a time when [they]3679-the english warders on the battlements [themselves]3679-the english warders on the battlements would have fared no better when shot by [a jackass]3681-a jackass . [The English]128-the english never uttered a challenge nor fired a shot . It was said afterward that when [[their]3679-the english warders on the battlements men]3682-their men saw [the Maid riding at the front]3683-the maid riding at the front and saw how lovely [she]3683-the maid riding at the front was , [their]3679-the english warders on the battlements eager courage cooled down in many cases and vanished in the rest , [they]3679-the english warders on the battlements feeling certain that the creature was not mortal , but [the very child of [Satan]144-satan]3684-the very child of satan , and so [the officers]2478-the officers were prudent and did not try to make [them]3679-the english warders on the battlements fight . It was said also that [some of [the officers]2478-the officers]3686-some of the officers were affected by the same superstitious fears . Well , in any case , [they]3686-some of the officers never offered to molest [us]3688-us , and [we]3688-us poked by all [the grisly fortresses]3689-the grisly fortresses in peace . During the march [I]2001-bastard caught up on [my]2001-bastard devotions , which were in arrears ; so it was not all loss and no profit for [me]2001-bastard after all . It was on this march that the histories say [Dunois]161-dunois told [Joan]110-joan that [the English]128-the english were expecting reinforcements under the command of [Sir John Fastolfe]224-sir john , and that [she]0-i turned upon [him]2001-bastard and said : “[2001-bastard] [Bastard]2001-bastard , [Bastard]2001-bastard , in [God]140-god ’s name [I]0-i warn [you]2001-bastard to let [me]0-i know of [his]2001-bastard coming as soon as [you]2001-bastard hear of it ; for if [he]2001-bastard passes without [my]0-i knowledge [you]2001-bastard shall lose [your]2001-bastard head ! ” It may be so ; [I]140-god do n’t deny it ; but [I]140-god did n’t [her]110-joan it . If [she]0-i really said it [I]140-god think [she]0-i only meant [she]0-i would take off [his]2001-bastard official head — degrade [him]2001-bastard from [his]2001-bastard command . It was not like [her]0-i to threaten [a comrade]3690-a comrade ’s life . [She]0-i did have [her]0-i doubts of [[her]0-i generals]3301-her generals , and was entitled to [them]3301-her generals , for [she]0-i was all for storm and assault , and [they]3301-her generals were for holding still and tiring [the English]128-the english out . Since [they]3301-her generals did not believe in [her]0-i way and were [experienced old soldiers]3692-experienced old soldiers , it would be natural for [them]3301-her generals to prefer [their]3301-her generals own and try to get around carrying [hers]0-i out . But [I]140-god did hear something that the histories did n’t mention and do n’t know about . [I]140-god heard [Joan]110-joan say that now that [the garrisons on [the other wide]3694-the other wide]3693-the garrisons on the other wide had been weakened to strengthen those on [our]3695-our side , the most effective point of operations had shifted to [the south shore]3696-the south shore ; so [she]0-i meant to go over there and storm [the forts which held the bridge end]3697-the forts which held the bridge end , and that would open up communication with [[our]3695-our own dominions]3698-our own dominions and raise the siege . [The generals]3299-the generals began to balk , privately , right away , but [they]3299-the generals only baffled and delayed [her]0-i , and that for only four days . [All Orleans]186-bastard met the army at the gate and huzzaed [it]3700-it through [the bannered streets]3701-the bannered streets to [[its]3700-it various quarters]3702-its various quarters , but [nobody]434-nobody had to rock [it]3700-it to sleep ; it slumped down dog - tired , for [Dunois]161-dunois had rushed [it]3700-it without mercy , and for the next twenty - four hours it would be quiet , all but the snoring . Chapter 17 [Sweet Fruit of Bitter Truth]112-sweet fruit of bitter truth WHEN [WE]3695-our got [home]377-home , breakfast for [us]3695-our minor fry was waiting in [[our]3695-our mess - room]3705-our mess - room and [the family]2556-the family honored [us]3695-our by coming in to eat it with [us]3695-our . [The nice old treasurer]3707-the nice old treasurer , and in fact [all three]3708-all three were flatteringly eager to hear about [our]3695-our adventures . [Nobody]434-nobody asked [the Paladin]157-the paladin to begin , but [he]157-the paladin did begin , because now that [his]157-the paladin specially ordained and peculiar military rank set [him]157-the paladin above [everybody on the personal staff]3710-everybody on the personal staff but [old D’Aulon]196-d’aulon , who did n’t eat with [us]3695-our , [he]157-the paladin did n’t care a farthing for [the knights]1227-the knights ’ nobility no mine , but took precedence in the talk whenever it suited [him]157-the paladin , which was all the time , because [he]157-the paladin was born that way . [He]157-the paladin said : “[140-god] [God]140-god be thanked , [we]2003-we found [the army]3157-the army in admirable condition [I]0-i think [I]0-i have never seen a finer body of animals . ” “[225-animals] [Animals]225-animals ! ” said [Miss Catherine]226-miss catherine . “[0-i] [I]0-i will explain to [you]2005-you what [he]2006-he means , ” said [Noel]135-noel . “[2006-he] [He]2006-he — ” “[2006-he] [I]0-i will trouble [you]2005-you not to trouble [yourself]2005-you to explain anything for [me]0-i , ” said [the Paladin]157-the paladin , loftily . “[0-i] [I]0-i have reason to think — ” “[0-i] That is [his]2006-he way , ” said [Noel]135-noel ; “[2006-he] always when [he]2006-he thinks [he]2006-he has reason to think , [he]2006-he thinks [he]2006-he does think , but this is an error . [He]2006-he did n’t see [the army]3157-the army . [I]0-i noticed [him]2006-he , and [he]2006-he did n’t see it . [He]2006-he was troubled by [his]2006-he old complaint . ” “[2006-he] What ’s [his]2006-he old complaint ? ” [Catherine]226-miss catherine asked . “[2006-he] Prudence , ” [I]2006-he said , seeing [my]2006-he chance to help . But it was not a fortunate remark , for [the Paladin]157-the paladin said : “[2006-he] It probably is n’t [your]2008-your turn to criticize [people]2327-people ’s prudence — [you]2008-your who fall out of the saddle when a donkey brays . ” [They]2327-people all laughed , and [I]2010-you was ashamed of [myself]2010-you for [my]2010-you hasty smartness . [I]2010-you said : “[2010-you] It is n’t quite fair for [you]2010-you to say [I]0-i fell out on account of the donkey ’s braying . It was emotion , just ordinary emotion . ” “[2010-you] Very well , if [you]2010-you want to call it that , [I]0-i am not objecting . What would [you]2010-you call it , [Sir Bertrand]223-sir bertrand ? ” “[2010-you] Well , it — well , whatever it was , it was excusable , [I]0-i think . All of [you]2011-you have learned how to behave in hot hand - to - hand engagements , and [you]2011-you do n’t need to be ashamed of [your]2011-you record in that matter ; but to walk along in front of death , with [one]461-one ’s hands idle , and no noise , no music , and nothing going on , is a very trying situation . If [I]0-i were [you]2010-you , [De Conte]110-joan , [I]0-i would name the emotion ; it ’s nothing to be ashamed of . ” It was as straight and sensible a speech as ever [I]0-i heard , and [I]0-i was grateful for the opening it gave [me]0-i ; so [I]0-i came out and said : “[0-i] It was fear — and thank [you]2010-you for the honest idea , too . ” “[2010-you] It was the cleanest and best way out , ” said [the old treasurer]3712-the old treasurer ; “[0-i] [you]0-i ’ve done well , [[my]0-i lad]2013-my lad . ” That made [me]0-i comfortable , and when [Miss Catherine]226-miss catherine said , “[0-i] It ’s what [I]0-i think , too , ” [I]0-i was grateful to [myself]0-i for getting into that scrape . [Sir Jean de Metz]227-sir jean de metz said : “[0-i] [We]2014-we were all in a body together when the donkey brayed , and it was dismally still at the time . [I]0-i do n’t see how [any young campaigner]2015-any young campaigner could escape some little touch of that emotion . ” [He]227-sir jean de metz looked about [him]227-sir jean de metz with a pleasant expression of inquiry on [his]227-sir jean de metz good face , and as each pair of eyes in turn met [his]227-sir jean de metz head [they]2014-we were in nodded a confession . Even [the Paladin]157-the paladin delivered [his]157-the paladin nod . That surprised [everybody]464-everybody , and saved [the Standard - Bearer]3534-the standard - bearer ’s credit . It was clever of [him]227-sir jean de metz ; [nobody]434-nobody believed [he]227-sir jean de metz could tell the truth that way without practice , or would tell that particular sort of a truth either with or without practice . [I]0-i suppose [he]227-sir jean de metz judged it would favorably impress [the family]2556-the family . Then [the old treasurer]3712-the old treasurer said : “[0-i] Passing [the forts]2016-the forts in that trying way required the same sort of nerve that [a person]467-a person must have when ghosts are about [him]467-a person in the dark , [I]0-i should think . What does [the Standard - Bearer]3534-the standard - bearer think ? ” “[3534-the standard - bearer] Well , [I]0-i do n’t quite know about that , [sir]2019-sir . [I]0-i ’ve often thought [I]0-i would like to see [a ghost]2020-a ghost if [I]0-i — ” “[2019-sir] Would [you]2019-sir ? ” exclaimed [the young lady]3718-the young lady . “[2019-sir] [We]2021-we ’ve got one ! Would [you]2019-sir try that one ? Will [you]2019-sir ? ” [She]3718-the young lady was so eager and pretty that [the Paladin]732-the paladin said straight out that [he]732-the paladin would ; and then as [none of the rest]3720-none of the rest had bravery enough to expose the fear that was in [him]732-the paladin , [one]461-one volunteered after the other with a prompt mouth and a sick heart till [all]738-all were shipped for the voyage ; then [the girl]3083-the girl clapped [her]3083-the girl hands in glee , and [the parents]1022-the parents were gratified , too , saying that the ghosts of [[their]1022-the parents house]3725-their house had been a dread and a misery to [them]1022-the parents and [[their]1022-the parents forebears]3726-their forebears for generations , and [nobody]434-nobody had ever been found yet who was willing to confront [them]1022-the parents and find out what [their]1022-the parents trouble was , so that [the family]2556-the family could heal it and content [the poor specters]3729-the poor specters and beguile [them]3729-the poor specters to tranquillity and peace . Chapter 18 [[Joan]110-joan ’s First Battle - Field]3730-joan ’s first battle - field ABOUT NOON [I]2019-sir was chatting with [Madame Boucher]228-madame boucher ; nothing was going on , all was quiet , when [Catherine Boucher]133-catherine suddenly entered in great excitement , and said : “[2019-sir] Fly , [sir]2019-sir , fly ! [The Maid]1326-the maid was doing in [her]1326-the maid chair in [[my]0-i room]2024-my room , when [she]1326-the maid sprang up and cried out , ‘ French blood is flowing!—my arms , give [me]0-i [my]0-i arms ! ’ [[Her]1326-the maid giant]2025-her giant was on guard at the door , and [he]2025-her giant brought [D’Aulon]196-d’aulon , who began to arm [her]1326-the maid , and [I]0-i and [the giant]3626-the giant have been warning [the staff]2027-the staff . Fly!—and stay by [her]1326-the maid ; and if there really is a battle , keep [her]1326-the maid out of it — don’t let [her]1326-the maid risk [herself]1326-the maid — there is no need — if [the men]788-the men know [she]1326-the maid is near and looking on , it is all that is necessary . Keep [her]1326-the maid out of the fight — don’t fail of this ! ” [I]0-i started on a run , saying , sarcastically — for [I]0-i was always fond of sarcasm , and it was said that [I]0-i had a most neat gift that way : “[0-i] Oh , yes , nothing easier than that — I’ll attend to it ! ” At the furthest end of [the house]630-the house [I]2648-your excellency met [Joan]110-joan , fully armed , hurrying toward the door , and [she]110-joan said : “[2648-your excellency] Ah , French blood is being spilt , and [you]0-i did not tell [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Indeed [I]0-i did not know it , ” [I]0-i said ; “[0-i] there are no sounds of war ; everything is quiet , [[your]0-i Excellency]2648-your excellency . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i will hear war - sounds enough in a moment , ” [she]110-joan said , and was gone . It was true . Before one could count five there broke upon the stillness the swelling rush and tramp of [an approaching multitude of men]3732-an approaching multitude of men and horses , with hoarse cries of command ; and then out of the distance came the muffled deep boom!—boom - boom!—boom ! of cannon , and straightway [that rushing multitude]3733-that rushing multitude was roaring by [the house]630-the house like a hurricane . [[Our]3735-our knights]1368-our knights and [all [our]3735-our staff]3737-all our staff came flying , armed , but with no horses ready , and [we]3735-our burst out after [Joan]110-joan in a body , [the Paladin in the lead with the banner]3738-the paladin in the lead with the banner . [The surging crowd]3739-the surging crowd was made up half of [citizens]3057-citizens and half of [soldiers]2473-soldiers , and had [no recognized leader]3742-no recognized leader . When [Joan]110-joan was seen a huzza went up , and [she]110-joan shouted : “[0-i] A horse — a horse ! ” A dozen saddles were at [her]110-joan disposal in a moment . [She]110-joan mounted , [a hundred people]3743-a hundred people shouting : “[0-i] Way , there — way for [the MAID OF [ORLEANS]39-orleans]2030-the maid of orleans ! ” The first time that that immortal name was ever uttered — and [I]2648-your excellency , praise [God]140-god , was there to hear it ! The mass divided itself like [the waters of [the Red Sea]85-the red sea]3744-the waters of the red sea , and down [this lane]3745-this lane [Joan]110-joan went skimming like a bird , crying , “[2648-your excellency] Forward , French hearts — follow [me]0-i ! ” and [we]3746-we came winging in [her]110-joan wake on the rest of the borrowed horses , the holy standard streaming above [us]3746-we , and [the lane]3747-the lane closing together in [our]3746-we rear . This was a different thing from the ghastly march past [the dismal bastilles]3748-the dismal bastilles . No , [we]3746-we felt fine , now , and all awhirl with enthusiasm . The explanation of this sudden uprising was this . [The city]372-the city and [the little garrison , so long hopeless and afraid]3750-the little garrison , so long hopeless and afraid , had gone wild over [Joan]110-joan ’s coming , and could no longer restrain [their]3750-the little garrison , so long hopeless and afraid desire to get at [the enemy]2442-the enemy ; so , without orders from [anybody]563-anybody , [a few hundred soldiers]3753-a few hundred soldiers and [citizens]3057-citizens had plunged out at the [Burgundy]34-burgundy gate on a sudden impulse and made a charge on [one of [[Lord Talbot]215-talbot ’s most formidable fortresses]3756-lord talbot ’s most formidable fortresses]3755-one of lord talbot ’s most formidable fortresses — [St. Loup]79-st. loup — and were getting the worst of it . The news of this had swept through [the city]372-the city and started [this new crowd that [we]3746-we were with]3758-this new crowd that we were with . As [we]3746-we poured out at the gate [we]3746-we met a force bringing in [the wounded from the front]3759-the wounded from the front . The sight moved [Joan]110-joan , and [she]110-joan said : “[0-i] Ah , French blood ; it makes [my]0-i hair rise to see it ! ” [We]3746-we were soon on [the field]698-the field , soon in the midst of the turmoil . [Joan]110-joan was seeing [her]110-joan first real battle , and so were [we]3746-we . It was a battle in [the open field]3761-the open field ; for [the garrison of [St. Loup]79-st. loup]3762-the garrison of st. loup had sallied confidently out to meet the attack , being used to victories when “[3763-witches ” were not around] [witches ” were not around]3763-witches ” were not around . [The sally]3764-the sally had been reinforced by troops from the “[282-men] [Paris ” bastille]2-paris , and when [we]3746-we approached [the French]213-the french were getting whipped and were falling back . But when [Joan]110-joan came charging through the disorder with [her]110-joan banner displayed , crying “[282-men] Forward , [men]282-men — follow [me]0-i ! ” there was a change ; [the French]213-the french turned about and surged forward like a solid wave of [the sea]2548-the sea , and swept [the English]128-the english before [them]282-men , hacking and slashing , and being hacked and slashed , in a way that was terrible to see . In [the field]698-the field [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf had no assignment ; that is to say , [he]1993-the dwarf was not under orders to occupy [any particular place]3768-any particular place , therefore [he]1993-the dwarf chose [his]1993-the dwarf place for [himself]1993-the dwarf , and went ahead of [Joan]110-joan and made [a road]3769-a road for [her]110-joan . It was horrible to see the iron helmets fly into fragments under [his]1993-the dwarf dreadful ax . [He]1993-the dwarf called it cracking nuts , and it looked like that . [He]1993-the dwarf made [a good road]3770-a good road , and paved [it]3770-a good road well with flesh and iron . [Joan]110-joan and [the rest of [us]3771-the rest of us]3771-the rest of us followed it so briskly that [we]3771-the rest of us outspeeded [[our]3771-the rest of us forces]3772-our forces and had [the English]128-the english behind [us]3771-the rest of us as well as before . [The knights]1227-the knights commanded [us]3771-the rest of us to face outward around [Joan]110-joan , which [we]3771-the rest of us did , and then there was work done that was fine to see . [One]461-one was obliged to respect [the Paladin]732-the paladin , now . Being right under [Joan]110-joan ’s exalting and transforming eye , [he]1993-the dwarf forgot [his]1993-the dwarf native prudence , [he]1993-the dwarf forgot [his]1993-the dwarf diffidence in the presence of danger , [he]1993-the dwarf forgot what fear was , and [he]1993-the dwarf never laid about [him]1993-the dwarf in [his]1993-the dwarf imaginary battles in a more tremendous way that [he]1993-the dwarf did in this real one ; and wherever [he]1993-the dwarf struck there was [an enemy the less]3776-an enemy the less . [We]3771-the rest of us were in [that close place]3777-that close place only a few minutes ; then [[our]3771-the rest of us forces to the rear]3778-our forces to the rear broke through with a great shout and joined [us]3771-the rest of us , and then [the English]128-the english fought a retreating fight , but in a fine and gallant way , and [we]3771-the rest of us drove [them]3778-our forces to the rear to [[their]3778-our forces to the rear fortress]3779-their fortress foot by foot , [they]3778-our forces to the rear facing [us]3771-the rest of us all the time , and [their]3778-our forces to the rear reserves on the walls raining showers of arrows , cross - bow bolts , and stone cannon - balls upon [us]3771-the rest of us . [The bulk of [the enemy]2442-the enemy]3780-the bulk of the enemy got safely within [the works]3782-the works and left [us]3771-the rest of us outside with piles of [French and English]3783-french and english dead and wounded for company — a sickening sight , an awful sight to [[us]3771-the rest of us youngsters]3784-us youngsters , for [our]3771-the rest of us little ambush fights in [February]88-february had been in the night , and the blood and the mutilations and the dead faces were mercifully dim , whereas [we]3771-the rest of us saw these things now for the first time in all [their]3778-our forces to the rear naked ghastliness . [Now]229-now arrived [Dunois]161-dunois from [the city]372-the city , and plunged through the battle on [his]161-dunois foam - flecked horse and galloped up to [Joan]110-joan , saluting , and uttering handsome compliments as [he]161-dunois came . [He]161-dunois waved [his]161-dunois hand toward the distant walls of [the city]372-the city , where a multitude of flags were flaunting gaily in the wind , and said [the populace]3787-the populace were up there observing [her]110-joan fortunate performance and rejoicing over it , and added that [she]110-joan and [the forces]3788-the forces would have a great reception now . “[282-men] Now ? Hardly now , [Bastard]186-bastard . Not yet ! ” “[186-bastard] Why not yet ? Is there more to be done ? ” “[2001-bastard] More , [Bastard]2001-bastard ? [We]2033-we have but begun ! [We]2033-we will take [this fortress]2034-this fortress . ” “[2033-we] Ah , [you]2001-bastard ca n’t be serious ! [We]2033-we ca n’t take [this place]2724-this place ; let [me]0-i urge [you]2001-bastard not to make the attempt ; it is too desperate . Let [me]0-i order [the forces]3788-the forces back . ” [Joan]110-joan ’s heart was overflowing with the joys and enthusiasms of war , and it made [her]110-joan impatient to hear such talk . [She]110-joan cried out : “[186-bastard] [Bastard]186-bastard , [Bastard]2001-bastard , will [ye]2001-bastard play always with [these English]2038-these english ? Now verily [I]0-i tell [you]2001-bastard [we]2033-we will not budge until [this place]2724-this place is [ours]2033-we . [We]2033-we will carry it by storm . Sound the charge ! ” “[1907-my general] Ah , [[my]0-i General]1907-my general — ” “[1907-my general] Waste no more time , [man]577-man — let the bugles sound the assault ! ” and [we]2033-we saw that strange deep light in [her]110-joan eye which [we]2033-we named the battle - light , and learned to know so well in later fields . The martial notes pealed out , [the troops]3351-the troops answered with a yell , and down [they]3351-the troops came against that formidable work , whose outlines were lost in its own cannon - smoke , and whose sides were spouting flame and thunder . [We]2033-we suffered repulse after repulse , but [Joan]110-joan was here and there and everywhere encouraging [the men]788-the men , and [she]110-joan kept [them]788-the men to [their]788-the men work . During three hours the tide ebbed and flowed , flowed and ebbed ; but at last [La Hire , who was now come]3791-la hire , who was now come , made a final and resistless charge , and [the bastille St. Loup]3792-the bastille st. loup was [ours]2033-we . [We]2033-we gutted [it]3792-the bastille st. loup , taking all [its]3792-the bastille st. loup stores and artillery , and then destroyed it . When all [our]2033-we host was shouting itself hoarse with rejoicings , and there went up a cry for [the General]3793-the general , for [they]3793-the general wanted to praise [her]110-joan and glorify [her]110-joan and do [her]110-joan homage for [her]110-joan victory , [we]2033-we had trouble to find [her]110-joan ; and when [we]2033-we did find [her]110-joan , [she]110-joan was off by [herself]110-joan , sitting among a ruck of corpses , with [her]110-joan face in [her]110-joan hands , crying — for [she]110-joan was [a young girl]1059-a young girl , [you]3795-you know , and [her]110-joan hero heart was [a young girl]1059-a young girl ’s heart too , with the pity and the tenderness that are natural to it . [She]110-joan was thinking of [the mothers of [those dead friends]3798-those dead friends]3797-the mothers of those dead friends and [enemies]1258-enemies . Among [the prisoners]3800-the prisoners were [a number of priests]3801-a number of priests , and [Joan]110-joan took these under [her]110-joan protection and saved [their]2042-them lives . It was urged that [they]2042-them were most probably combatants in disguise , but [she]110-joan said : “[577-man] As to that , how can any tell ? [They]2042-them wear the livery of [God]140-god , and if even one of [these]2042-them wears it rightfully , surely it were better that [all the guilty]2043-all the guilty should escape than that [we]2044-our have upon [our]2044-our hands the blood of [that innocent man]2045-that innocent man . [I]0-i will lodge [them]2042-them where [I]0-i lodge , and feed [them]2042-them , and sent [them]2042-them away in safety . ” [We]2044-our marched back to [the city]372-the city with [[our]2044-our crop of cannon]3803-our crop of cannon and [prisoners]3804-prisoners on view and [our]2044-our banners displayed . Here was the first substantial bit of war - work [the imprisoned people]3805-the imprisoned people had seen in the seven months that the siege had endured , the first chance [they]3805-the imprisoned people had had to rejoice over [a French exploit]3806-a french exploit . [You]3807-you may guess that [they]3805-the imprisoned people made good use of it . [They]3805-the imprisoned people and the bells went mad . [Joan]110-joan was [[their]3805-the imprisoned people darling]3808-their darling now , and the press of [people]2327-people struggling and shouldering [each other]1049-each other to get a glimpse of [her]110-joan was so great that [we]2044-our could hardly push [our]2044-our way through [the streets]361-the streets at all . [Her]110-joan new name had gone all about , and was on [everybody]464-everybody ’s lips . [The Holy Maid of [Vaucouleurs]29-vaucouleurs]3813-the holy maid of vaucouleurs was a forgotten title ; [the city]372-the city had claimed [her]110-joan for [its]372-the city own , and [she]110-joan was [the MAID OF [ORLEANS]39-orleans]2030-the maid of orleans now . It is a happiness to [me]0-i to remember that [I]0-i heard that name the first time it was ever uttered . Between that first utterance and the last time it will be uttered on [this earth]3450-this earth — ah , think how many moldering ages will lie in that gap ! [[The Boucher]133-catherine family]3817-the boucher family welcomed [her]110-joan back as if [she]110-joan had been [a child of [the house]630-the house]3818-a child of the house , and saved from death against all hope or probability . [They]3817-the boucher family chided [her]110-joan for going into the battle and exposing [herself]110-joan to danger during all those hours . [They]3817-the boucher family could not realize that [she]110-joan had meant to carry [her]110-joan warriorship so far , and asked [her]110-joan if it had really been [her]110-joan purpose to go right into the turmoil of the fight , or had n’t [she]110-joan got swept into it by accident and the rush of [the troops]3351-the troops ? [They]3817-the boucher family begged [her]110-joan to be more careful another time . It was good advice , maybe , but it fell upon pretty unfruitful soil . Chapter 19 [We]3821-we Burst In Upon [Ghosts]230-ghosts BEING WORN out with the long fight , [we]3821-we all slept the rest of the afternoon away and two or three hours into the night . Then [we]3821-we got up refreshed , and had supper . As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i could have been willing to let the matter of the ghost drop ; and [the others]733-the others were of a like mind , no doubt , for [they]733-the others talked diligently of the battle and said nothing of that other thing . And indeed it was fine and stirring to hear [the Paladin]732-the paladin rehearse [his]732-the paladin deeds and see [him]732-the paladin pile [his]732-the paladin dead , fifteen here , eighteen there , and thirty - five yonder ; but this only postponed the trouble ; it could not do more . [He]732-the paladin could not go on forever ; when [he]732-the paladin had carried the bastille by assault and eaten up [the garrison]989-the garrison there was nothing for it but to stop , unless [Catherine Boucher]133-catherine would give [him]732-the paladin a new start and have it all done over again — as [we]3821-we hoped [she]133-catherine would , this time — but [she]133-catherine was otherwise minded . As soon as there was a good opening and a fair chance , [she]133-catherine brought up [her]133-catherine unwelcome subject , and [we]3821-we faced it the best [we]3821-we could . [We]3821-we followed [her]133-catherine and [[her]133-catherine parents]1019-her parents to [the haunted room]3826-the haunted room at eleven o’clock , with candles , and also with torches to place in the sockets on the walls . [It]3826-the haunted room was [a big house]3827-a big house , with very thick walls , and [this room]3828-this room was in a remote part of [it]3826-the haunted room which had been left unoccupied for [nobody]434-nobody knew how many years , because of [its]3828-this room evil repute . This was [a large room]3830-a large room , like [a salon]3831-a salon , and had a big table in [it]3826-the haunted room of enduring oak and well preserved ; but the chair were worm - eaten and the tapestry on the walls was rotten and discolored by age . The dusty cobwebs under the ceiling had the look of not having had any business for a century . [Catherine]133-catherine said : “[0-i] Tradition says that these ghosts have never been seen — [they]2046-they have merely been heard . It is plain that [this room]3828-this room was once larger than [it]3828-this room is now , and that the wall at this end was built in some bygone time to make and fence off [a narrow room there]2048-a narrow room there . There is no communication anywhere with [that narrow room]2049-that narrow room , and if it exists — and of that there is no reasonable doubt — [it]3828-this room has no light and no air , but is [an absolute dungeon]2050-an absolute dungeon . Wait where [you]2051-you are , and take note of what happens . ” That was all . Then [she]133-catherine and [[her]133-catherine parents]1019-her parents left [us]3833-we . When [their]1019-her parents footfalls had died out in the distance down [the empty stone corridors]3834-the empty stone corridors an uncanny silence and solemnity ensued which was dismaler to [me]2054-i than the mute march past [the bastilles]3576-the bastilles . [We]3833-we sat looking vacantly at [each other]1049-each other , and it was easy to see that [no one there]3837-no one there was comfortable . The longer [we]3833-we sat so , the more deadly still that stillness got to be ; and when the wind began to moan around [the house]630-the house presently , it made [me]2054-i sick and miserable , and [I]2054-i wished [I]2054-i had been brave enough to be [a coward]1894-a coward this time , for indeed it is no proper shame to be afraid of [ghosts]3840-ghosts , seeing how helpless the living are in [their]3840-ghosts hands . And then [these ghosts]3841-these ghosts were invisible , which made the matter the worse , as it seemed to [me]2054-i . [They]3841-these ghosts might be in [the room]1355-the room with [us]3833-we at that moment — [we]3833-we could not know . [I]2054-i felt airy touches on [my]2054-i shoulders and [my]2054-i hair , and [I]2054-i shrank from [them]3841-these ghosts and cringed , and was not ashamed to show this fear , for [I]2054-i saw [the others]733-the others doing the like , and knew that [they]733-the others were feeling those faint contacts too . As this went on — oh , eternities it seemed , the time dragged so drearily — all those faces became as wax , and [I]2054-i seemed sitting with a congress of the dead . At last , faint and far and weird and slow , came a “[2054-i] boom!—boom!—boom!”—a distant bell tolling midnight . When the last stroke died , that depressing stillness followed again , and as before [I]2054-i was staring at those waxen faces and feeling those airy touches on [my]2054-i hair and [my]2054-i shoulders once more . One minute — two minutes — three minutes of this , then [we]3833-we heard a long deep groan , and [everybody]464-everybody sprang up and stood , with [his]464-everybody legs quaking . It came from [that little dungeon]3845-that little dungeon . There was a pause , then [we]3833-we herd muffled sobbings , mixed with pitiful ejaculations . Then there was a second voice , low and not distinct , and the one seemed trying to comfort [the other]646-the other ; and so the two voices went on , with moanings , and soft sobbings , and , ah , the tones were so full of compassion and sorry and despair ! Indeed , it made [one]461-one ’s heart sore to hear it . But those sounds were so real and so human and so moving that the idea of ghosts passed straight out of [our]3833-we minds , and [Sir Jean de Metz]227-sir jean de metz spoke out and said : “[2054-i] Come ! [we]2052-we will smash that wall and set [those poor captives]2053-those poor captives free . Here , with [your]2054-i ax ! ” [The Dwarf]1993-the dwarf jumped forward , swinging [his]1993-the dwarf great ax with both hands , and [others]506-others sprang for torches and brought [them]506-others . Bang!—whang!—slam!—smash went the ancient bricks , and there was a hole an ox could pass through . [We]3833-we plunged within and held up the torches . Nothing there but vacancy ! On the floor lay a rusty sword and a rotten fan . Now [you]2054-i know all that [I]2054-i know . Take the pathetic relics , and weave about [them]2053-those poor captives the romance of [[the dungeon]3850-the dungeon ’s long - vanished inmates]3851-the dungeon ’s long - vanished inmates as best [you]2054-i can . Chapter 20 [Joan Makes Cowards Brave Victors]110-joan THE NEXT day [Joan]110-joan wanted to go against [the enemy]2442-the enemy again , but it was the feast of the Ascension , and [the holy council of [bandit generals]3854-bandit generals]3853-the holy council of bandit generals were too pious to be willing to profane it with bloodshed . But privately [they]3853-the holy council of bandit generals profaned it with plottings , a sort of industry just in [their]3853-the holy council of bandit generals line . [They]3853-the holy council of bandit generals decided to do the only thing proper to do now in the new circumstances of the case — feign an attack on [the most important bastille]3855-the most important bastille on [the [Orleans]39-orleans side]3856-the orleans side , and then , if [the English]128-the english weakened [the far more important fortresses on [the other side of the river]3568-the other side of the river]3857-the far more important fortresses on the other side of the river to come to [its]128-the english help , cross in force and capture those works . This would give [them]3853-the holy council of bandit generals [the bridge]1244-the bridge and free communication with [the Sologne]89-the sologne , which was [French territory]3860-french territory . [They]3853-the holy council of bandit generals decided to keep this latter part of the program secret from [Joan]110-joan . [Joan]110-joan intruded and took [them]3853-the holy council of bandit generals by surprise . [She]110-joan asked [them]3853-the holy council of bandit generals what [they]3853-the holy council of bandit generals were about and what [they]3853-the holy council of bandit generals had resolved upon . [They]3853-the holy council of bandit generals said [they]3853-the holy council of bandit generals had resolved to attack [the most important of [the English bastilles on the [Orleans]39-orleans side]3862-the english bastilles on the orleans side]3861-the most important of the english bastilles on the orleans side next morning — and there [the spokesman]1373-the spokesman stopped . [Joan]110-joan said : “[2054-i] Well , go on . ” “[2054-i] There is nothing more . That is all . ” “[2054-i] Am [I]0-i to believe this ? That is to say , am [I]0-i to believe that [you]2055-you have lost [your]2055-you wits ? ” [She]110-joan turned to [Dunois]161-dunois , and said , “[186-bastard] [Bastard]186-bastard , [you]186-bastard have sense , answer [me]0-i this : if this attack is made and the bastille taken , how much better off would [we]2056-we be than [we]2056-we are now ? ” [The Bastard]1913-the bastard hesitated , and then began some rambling talk not quite germane to the question . [Joan]110-joan interrupted [him]1913-the bastard and said : “[186-bastard] That will not do , [good Bastard]2057-good bastard , [you]186-bastard have answered . Since [the Bastard]186-bastard is not able to mention any advantage to be gained by taking that bastille and stopping there , it is not likely that any of [you]186-bastard could better the matter . [You]186-bastard waste much time here in inventing plans that lead to nothing , and making delays that are a damage . Are [you]186-bastard concealing something from [me]0-i ? [Bastard]2001-bastard , [this council]2059-this council has a general plan , [I]0-i take it ; without going into details , what is it ? ” “[186-bastard] It is the same it was in the beginning , seven months ago — to get provisions for a long siege , then sit down and tire [the English]128-the english out . ” “[140-god] In the name of [God]140-god ! As if seven months was not enough , [you]186-bastard want to provide for a year of it . Now [ye]186-bastard shall drop these pusillanimous dreams — [the English]128-the english shall go in three days ! ” [Several]662-several exclaimed : “[1962-general] Ah , [General]1962-general , [General]1962-general , be prudent ! ” “[1962-general] Be prudent and starve ? Do [ye]186-bastard call that war ? [I]0-i tell [you]186-bastard this , if [you]186-bastard do not already know it : The new circumstances have changed the face of matters . The true point of attack has shifted ; it is on [the other side of [the river]454-the river]3568-the other side of the river now . [One]461-one must take [the fortifications that command [the bridge]1244-the bridge]2065-the fortifications that command the bridge . [The English]128-the english know that if [we]2067-we are not [fools]2580-fools and [cowards]2069-cowards [we]2067-we will try to do that . [They]2070-they are grateful for [your]186-bastard piety in wasting this day . [They]2070-they will reinforce [the bridge forts]2071-the bridge forts from this side to - night , knowing what ought to happen to - morrow . [You]186-bastard have but lost a day and made [our]2067-we task harder , for [we]2067-we will cross and take [the bridge forts]2071-the bridge forts . [Bastard]186-bastard , tell [me]0-i the truth — does not [this council]2059-this council know that there is no other course for [us]2067-we than the one [I]0-i am speaking of ? ” [Dunois]161-dunois conceded that [the council]1427-the council did know it to be the most desirable , but considered it impracticable ; and [he]161-dunois excused [the council]1427-the council as well as [he]161-dunois could by saying that inasmuch as nothing was really and rationally to be hoped for but a long continuance of the siege and wearying out of [the English]128-the english , [they]1427-the council were naturally a little afraid of [Joan]110-joan ’s impetuous notions . [He]161-dunois said : “[186-bastard] [You]186-bastard see , [we]2067-we are sure that the waiting game is the best , whereas [you]186-bastard would carry everything by storm . ” “[186-bastard] That [I]0-i would!—and moreover that [I]0-i will ! [You]186-bastard have [my]0-i orders — here and now . [We]2067-we will move upon [the forts of [the south bank]2075-the south bank]2074-the forts of the south bank to - morrow at dawn . ” “[2067-we] And carry [them]2074-the forts of the south bank by storm ? ” “[2067-we] Yes , carry [them]2074-the forts of the south bank by storm ! ” [La Hire]195-la hire came clanking in , and heard the last remark . [He]195-la hire cried out : “[2067-we] By [my]0-i baton , that is the music [I]0-i love to hear ! Yes , that is the right time and the beautiful words , [[my]0-i General]1907-my general — [we]2067-we will carry them by storm ! ” [He]195-la hire saluted in [his]195-la hire large way and came up and shook [Joan]110-joan by the hand . [Some member of the council]3868-some member of the council was heard to say : “[1907-my general] It follows , then , that [we]2067-we must begin with [the bastille St. John]2077-the bastille st. john , and that will give [the English]128-the english time to — ” [Joan]110-joan turned and said : “[2078-you] Give [yourselves]2078-you no uneasiness about [the bastille St. John]2077-the bastille st. john . [The English]2659-the english will know enough to retire from it and fall back on [the bridge bastilles]2081-the bridge bastilles when [they]2659-the english see [us]2067-we coming . ” [She]110-joan added , with a touch of sarcasm , “[2659-the english] Even a war - council would know enough to do that itself . ” Then [she]110-joan took [her]110-joan leave . [La Hire]195-la hire made this general remark to [the council]1427-the council : “[2082-she] [She]2082-she is [a child]327-a child , and that is all [ye]2078-you seem to see . Keep to that superstition if [you]2078-you must , but [you]2078-you perceive that [this child]1770-this child understands this complex game of war as well as any of [you]2078-you ; and if [you]2078-you want [my]0-i opinion without the trouble of asking for it , here [you]2078-you have it without ruffles or embroidery — by [God]140-god , [I]0-i think [she]2082-she can teach the best of [you]2078-you how to play it ! ” [Joan]110-joan had spoken truly ; [the sagacious English]3870-the sagacious english saw that the policy of [the French]213-the french had undergone a revolution ; that the policy of paltering and dawdling was ended ; that in place of taking blows , blows were ready to be struck now ; therefore [they]3870-the sagacious english made ready for the new state of things by transferring heavy reinforcements to the bastilles of [the south bank]2075-the south bank from [those of [the north]3873-the north]3872-those of the north . [The city]372-the city learned the great news that once more in French history , after all these humiliating years , [France]4-france was going to take the offensive ; that [France]4-france , so used to retreating , was going to advance ; that [France]4-france , so long accustomed to skulking , was going to face about and strike . The joy of [the people]313-the people passed all bounds . [The city]372-the city walls were black with [them]3870-the sagacious english to see [the army]3157-the army march out in the morning in that strange new position — [its]3157-the army front , not its tail , toward [an English camp]3878-an english camp . [You]2078-you shall imagine for [yourselves]2078-you what the excitement was like and how it expressed itself , when [Joan]110-joan rode out at the head of [the host]1581-the host with [her]110-joan banner floating above [her]110-joan . [We]3880-we crossed the five in strong force , and a tedious long job it was , for [the boats]1925-the boats were small and not numerous . [Our]3880-we landing on [the island of [St. Aignan]90-st. aignan]3882-the island of st. aignan was not disputed . [We]3880-we threw a bridge of [a few boats]3883-a few boats across [the narrow channel]3884-the narrow channel thence to [the south shore]3696-the south shore and took up [our]3880-we march in good order and unmolested ; for although there was [a fortress [there]460-there — [St. John]91-st. john]3886-a fortress there — st. john — [the English]128-the english vacated and destroyed [it]3886-a fortress there — st. john and fell back on [the bridge forts below]3888-the bridge forts below as soon as [[our]3880-we first boats]3889-our first boats were seen to leave [the Orleans shore]3890-the orleans shore ; which was what [Joan]110-joan had said would happen , when [she]110-joan was disputing with [the council]1427-the council . [We]3880-we moved down [the shore]3892-the shore and [Joan]110-joan planted [her]110-joan standard before [the bastille of the Augustins]3893-the bastille of the augustins , [the first of the formidable works that protected the end of [the bridge]1244-the bridge]3894-the first of the formidable works that protected the end of the bridge . The trumpets sounded the assault , and two charges followed in handsome style ; but [we]3880-we were too weak , as yet , for [our]3880-we main body was still lagging behind . Before [we]3880-we could gather for a third assault [the garrison of [St. Prive]92-st. prive]3896-the garrison of st. prive were seen coming up to reinforce [the big bastille]3897-the big bastille . [They]3896-the garrison of st. prive came on a run , and [the Augustins]218-the augustins sallied out , and [both forces]3898-both forces came against [us]3880-we with a rush , and sent [[our]3880-we small army]3899-our small army flying in a panic , and followed [us]3880-we , slashing and slaying , and shouting jeers and insults at [us]3880-we . [Joan]110-joan was doing [her]110-joan best to rally [the men]788-the men , but [their]788-the men wits were gone , [their]788-the men hearts were dominated for the moment by the old - time dread of [the English]128-the english . [Joan]110-joan ’s temper flamed up , and [she]110-joan halted and commanded the trumpets to sound the advance . Then [she]110-joan wheeled about and cried out : “[2082-she] If there is but a dozen of [you]2085-you that are [not cowards]2086-not cowards , it is enough — follow [me]0-i ! ” Away [she]110-joan went , and after [her]110-joan a few dozen who had heard [her]110-joan [words and been inspired by them]3901-words and been inspired by them . [The pursuing force]3902-the pursuing force was astonished to see [her]110-joan sweeping down upon [them]3902-the pursuing force with [this handful of men]3903-this handful of men , and it was [their]3902-the pursuing force turn now to experience a grisly fright — surely this is [a witch]1114-a witch , this is [a child of Satan]3905-a child of satan ! That was [their]3902-the pursuing force thought — and without stopping to analyze the matter [they]3902-the pursuing force turned and fled in a panic . [[Our]3906-we flying squadrons]3907-our flying squadrons heard the bugle and turned to look ; and when [they]3907-our flying squadrons saw [the Maid]1326-the maid ’s banner speeding in the other direction and [the enemy]2442-the enemy scrambling ahead of it in disorder , [their]3907-our flying squadrons courage returned and [they]3907-our flying squadrons came scouring after [us]3906-we . [La Hire]195-la hire heard it and hurried [his]195-la hire force forward and caught up with [us]3906-we just as [we]3906-we were planting [our]3906-we banner again before [the ramparts of [the Augustins]218-the augustins]3910-the ramparts of the augustins . [We]3906-we were strong enough now . [We]3906-we had a long and tough piece of work before [us]3906-we , but [we]3906-we carried it through before night , [Joan]110-joan keeping [us]3906-we hard at it , and [she]110-joan and [La Hire]195-la hire saying [we]3906-we were able to take that big bastille , and must . [The English]128-the english fought like — well , [they]3907-our flying squadrons fought like [the English]128-the english ; when that is said , there is no more to say . [We]3906-we made assault after assault , through the smoke and flame and the deafening cannon - blasts , and at last as the sun was sinking [we]3906-we carried [the place]585-the place with a rush , and planted [our]3906-we standard on [its]585-the place walls . [The Augustins]218-the augustins was [ours]3906-we . [The Tourelles]94-the tourelles must be [ours]3906-we , too , if [we]3906-we would free [the bridge]1244-the bridge and raise the siege . [We]3906-we had achieved one great undertaking , [Joan]110-joan was determined to accomplish the other . [We]3906-we must lie on [our]3906-we arms where [we]3906-we were , hold fast to what [we]3906-we had got , and be ready for business in the morning . So [Joan]110-joan was not minded to let [the men]788-the men be demoralized by pillage and riot and carousings ; [she]110-joan had [the Augustins]218-the augustins burned , with all its stores in it , excepting the artillery and ammunition . [Everybody]464-everybody was tired out with this long day ’s hard work , and of course this was the case with [Joan]110-joan ; still , [she]110-joan wanted to stay with [the army]3157-the army before [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles , to be ready for the assault in the morning . [The chiefs]3916-the chiefs argued with [her]110-joan , and at last persuaded [her]110-joan to go [home]377-home and prepare for the great work by taking proper rest , and also by having a leech look to a wound which [she]110-joan had received in [her]110-joan foot . So [we]3906-we crossed with [them]3916-the chiefs and went [home]377-home . Just as usual , [we]3906-we found [the town]786-the town in a fury of joy , all the bells clanging , [everybody]464-everybody shouting , and [several people drunk]3921-several people drunk . [We]3906-we never went out or came in without furnishing good and sufficient reasons for one of these pleasant tempests , and so the tempest was always on hand . There had been a blank absence of reasons for this sort of upheavals for the past seven months , therefore [the people]313-the people too to the upheavals with all the more relish on that account . Chapter 21 [She]110-joan Gently Reproves [[Her]110-joan Dear Friend]3923-her dear friend TO GET away from [the usual crowd of visitors]3924-the usual crowd of visitors and have a rest , [Joan]110-joan went with [Catherine]133-catherine straight to [the apartment which [the two]780-the two occupied together]3925-the apartment which the two occupied together , and there [they]780-the two took [their]780-the two supper and there the wound was dressed . But then , instead of going to bed , [Joan]110-joan , weary as [she]110-joan was , sent [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf for [me]0-i , in spite of [Catherine]133-catherine ’s protests and persuasions . [She]110-joan said [she]110-joan had something on [her]110-joan mind , and must send [a courier]3928-a courier to [Domremy]1-domremy with a letter for [our]780-the two old [Pere Fronte]129-pere fronte to read to [[her]110-joan mother]296-her mother . [I]0-i came , and [she]110-joan began to dictate . After some loving words and greetings to [[her]110-joan mother]296-her mother and [family]3517-family , came this : “[0-i] But the thing which moves [me]0-i to write now , is to say that when [you]2087-you presently hear that [I]0-i am wounded , [you]2087-you shall give [yourself]2087-you no concern about it , and refuse faith to any that shall try to make [you]2087-you believe it is serious . ” [She]110-joan was going on , when [Catherine]133-catherine spoke up and said : “[2088-her] Ah , but it will fright [her]2088-her so to read these words . Strike them out , [Joan]110-joan , strike them out , and wait only one day — two days at most — then write and say [your]110-joan foot was wounded but is well again — for it surely be well then , or very near it . Do n’t distress [her]2088-her , [Joan]110-joan ; do as [I]0-i say . ” A laugh like the laugh of the old days , the impulsive free laugh of an untroubled spirit , a laugh like a chime of bells , was [Joan]110-joan ’s answer ; then [she]0-i said : “[0-i] [My]0-i foot ? Why should [I]0-i write about such a scratch as that ? [I]0-i was not thinking of it , [dear heart]1904-dear heart . ” “[0-i] [Child]2713-child , have [you]110-joan another wound and a worse , and have not spoken of it ? What have [you]110-joan been dreaming about , that [you]110-joan — ” [She]0-i had jumped up , full of vague fears , to have the leech called back at once , but [Joan]110-joan laid [her]110-joan hand upon [her]110-joan arm and made [her]110-joan sit down again , saying : “[110-joan] There , now , be tranquil , there is no other wound , as yet ; [I]0-i am writing about one which [I]0-i shall get when [we]2091-we storm that bastille to - morrow . ” [Catherine]133-catherine had the look of [one who is trying to understand a puzzling proposition but can not quite do it]3932-one who is trying to understand a puzzling proposition but can not quite do it . [She]133-catherine said , in a distraught fashion : “[0-i] A wound which [you]110-joan are going to get ? But — but why grieve [[your]110-joan mother]2092-your mother when it — when it may not happen ? ” “[2092-your mother] May not ? Why , it will . ” The puzzle was a puzzle still . [Catherine]133-catherine said in that same abstracted way as before : “[0-i] Will . It is a strong word . [I]0-i can not seem to — [my]0-i mind is not able to take hold of this . Oh , [Joan]110-joan , such a presentiment is a dreadful thing — it takes [one]461-one ’s peace and courage all away . Cast it from [you!—drive]2094-you!—drive it out ! It will make [your]110-joan whole night miserable , and to no good ; for [we]2091-we will hope — ” “[2094-you!—drive] But it is n’t a presentiment — it is a fact . And it will not make [me]0-i miserable . It is uncertainties that do that , but this is not an uncertainty . ” “[110-joan] [Joan]110-joan , do [you]110-joan know it is going to happen ? ” “[110-joan] Yes , [I]0-i know it . [[My]0-i Voices]2636-my voices told [me]0-i . ” “[2636-my voices] Ah , ” said [Catherine]133-catherine , resignedly , “[2636-my voices] if [they]2636-my voices told [you]110-joan — But are [you]110-joan sure it was they?—quite sure ? ” “[110-joan] Yes , quite . It will happen — there is no doubt . ” “[2636-my voices] It is dreadful ! Since when have [you]110-joan know it ? ” “[110-joan] Since — [I]0-i think it is several weeks . ” [Joan]110-joan turned to [me]0-i . “[0-i] [Louis]110-joan , [you]110-joan will remember . How long is it ? ” “[110-joan] [[Your]110-joan Excellency]2648-your excellency spoke of it first to [the King]270-the king , in [Chinon]53-chinon , ” [I]110-joan answered ; “[110-joan] that was as much as seven weeks ago . [You]110-joan spoke of it again the 20th of April , and also the 22d , two weeks ago , as [I]0-i see by [my]0-i record here . ” These marvels disturbed [Catherine]133-catherine profoundly , but [I]110-joan had long ceased to be surprised at [them]3933-them . [One]461-one can get used to anything in [this world]345-this world . [Catherine]133-catherine said : “[110-joan] And it is to happen to - morrow?—always to - morrow ? Is it the same date always ? There has been no mistake , and no confusion ? ” “[110-joan] No , ” [Joan]110-joan said , “[110-joan] the 7th of May is the date — there is no other . ” “[110-joan] Then [you]110-joan shall not go a step out of [this house]2415-this house till that awful day is gone by ! [You]110-joan will not dream of it , [Joan]110-joan , will you?—promise that [you]110-joan will stay with [us]2099-us . ” But [Joan]110-joan was not persuaded . [She]110-joan said : “[110-joan] It would not help the matter , [dear good friend]2100-dear good friend . The wound is to come , and come to - morrow . If [I]0-i do not seek it , it will seek [me]0-i . [My]0-i duty calls [me]0-i to [that place]1518-that place to - morrow ; [I]0-i should have to go if [my]0-i death were waiting for [me]0-i there ; shall [I]0-i stay away for only a wound ? Oh , no , [we]2099-us must try to do better than that . ” “[110-joan] Then [you]110-joan are determined to go ? ” “[110-joan] Of a certainty , yes . There is only one thing that [I]0-i can do for [France]4-france — hearten [[her]4-france soldiers]2102-her soldiers for battle and victory . ” [She]0-i thought a moment , then added , “[461-one] However , [one]461-one should not be unreasonable , and [I]0-i would do much to please [you]2100-dear good friend , who are so good to [me]0-i . Do [you]2100-dear good friend love [France]4-france ? ” [I]2100-dear good friend wondered what [she]0-i might be contriving now , but [I]2100-dear good friend saw no clue . [Catherine]133-catherine said , reproachfully : “[2100-dear good friend] Ah , what have [I]0-i done to deserve this question ? ” “[2100-dear good friend] Then [you]2100-dear good friend do love [France]4-france . [I]0-i had not doubted it , [dear]2328-dear . Do not be hurt , but answer [me]0-i — have [you]2100-dear good friend ever told a lie ? ” “[2100-dear good friend] In [my]0-i life [I]0-i have not wilfully told a lie — fibs , but no lies . ” “[0-i] That is sufficient . [You]2100-dear good friend love [France]4-france and do not tell lies ; therefore [I]0-i will trust [you]2100-dear good friend . [I]0-i will go or [I]0-i will stay , as [you]2100-dear good friend shall decide . ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i thank [you]2100-dear good friend from [my]0-i heart , [Joan]110-joan ! How good and dear it is of [you]2100-dear good friend to do this for [me]0-i ! Oh , [you]2100-dear good friend shall stay , and not go ! ” In [her]0-i delight [she]0-i flung [her]0-i arms about [Joan]110-joan ’s neck and squandered endearments upon [her]110-joan the least of which would have made [me]2100-dear good friend rich , but , as it was , they only made [me]2100-dear good friend realize how poor [I]2100-dear good friend was — how miserably poor in what [I]2100-dear good friend would most have prized in [this world]345-this world . [Joan]110-joan said : “[2100-dear good friend] Then [you]2100-dear good friend will send word to [[my]0-i headquarters]2105-my headquarters that [I]0-i am not going ? ” “[2100-dear good friend] Oh , gladly . Leave that to [me]0-i . ” “[2100-dear good friend] It is good of [you]2100-dear good friend . And how will [you]2100-dear good friend word it?—for it must have proper official form . Shall [I]0-i word it for [you]2100-dear good friend ? ” “[0-i] Oh , do — for [you]2100-dear good friend know about these solemn procedures and stately proprieties , and [I]0-i have had no experience . ” “[2100-dear good friend] Then word it like this : ‘ [The chief of staff]2106-the chief of staff is commanded to make known to [[the King]270-the king ’s forces in garrison and in [the field]698-the field]2108-the king ’s forces in garrison and in the field , that [the General - in - Chief of the Armies of]2110-the general - in - chief of the armies of [France]4-france will not face [the English]128-the english on the morrow , [she]2110-the general - in - chief of the armies of being afraid [she]2110-the general - in - chief of the armies of may get hurt . Signed , [JOAN OF ARC]110-joan , by the hand of [CATHERINE BOUCHER]133-catherine , who loves [France]4-france . ’ ” There was a pause — a silence of the sort that tortures one into stealing a glance to see how the situation looks , and [I]2110-the general - in - chief of the armies of did that . There was a loving smile on [Joan]110-joan ’s face , but the color was mounting in crimson waves into [Catherine]133-catherine ’s , and [her]110-joan lips were quivering and the tears gathering ; then [she]0-i said : “[2110-the general - in - chief of the armies of] Oh , [I]0-i am so ashamed of [myself!—and]2111-myself!—and [you]2112-you are so noble and brave and wise , and [I]0-i am so paltry — so paltry and such [a fool]2732-a fool ! ” and [she]0-i broke down and began to cry , and [I]2732-a fool did so want to take [her]0-i in [my]2732-a fool arms and comfort [her]0-i , but [Joan]110-joan did it , and of course [I]2732-a fool said nothing . [Joan]110-joan did it well , and most sweetly and tenderly , but [I]2732-a fool could have done it as well , though [I]2732-a fool knew it would be foolish and out of place to suggest such a thing , and might make an awkwardness , too , and be embarrassing to [us]3937-us all , so [I]2732-a fool did not offer , and [I]2732-a fool hope [I]2732-a fool did right and for the best , though [I]2732-a fool could not know , and was many times tortured with doubts afterward as having perhaps let a chance pass which might have changed all [my]2732-a fool life and made it happier and more beautiful than , alas , it turned out to be . For this reason [I]2732-a fool grieve yet , when [I]2732-a fool think of that scene , and do not like to call it up out of the deeps of [my]2732-a fool memory because of the pangs it brings . Well , well , a good and wholesome thing is a little harmless fun in [this world]345-this world ; it tones a body up and keeps [him]3939-him human and prevents [him]3939-him from souring . To set that little trap for [Catherine]133-catherine was as good and effective a way as any to show [her]133-catherine what a grotesque thing [she]133-catherine was asking of [Joan]110-joan . It was a funny idea now , was n’t it , when [you]3940-you look at it all around ? Even [Catherine]133-catherine dried up [her]133-catherine tears and laughed when [she]133-catherine thought of [the English]128-the english getting hold of [the French Commander - in - Chief]3941-the french commander - in - chief ’s reason for staying out of a battle . [She]133-catherine granted that [they]3942-they could have a good time over a thing like that . [We]3943-our got to work on the letter again , and of course did not have to strike out the passage about the wound . [Joan]110-joan was in fine spirits ; but when [she]110-joan got to sending messages to this , that , and [the other playmate]3944-the other playmate and [friend]3945-friend , it brought [[our]3943-our village]848-our village and [the Fairy Tree]2356-the fairy tree and [the flowery plain]1052-the flowery plain and the browsing sheep and all the peaceful beauty of [[our]3943-our old humble home - place]3949-our old humble home - place back , and the familiar names began to tremble on [her]110-joan lips ; and when [she]110-joan got to [Haumette]149-haumette and [Little Mengette]138-little mengette it was no use , [her]110-joan voice broke and [she]110-joan could n’t go on . [She]110-joan waited a moment , then said : “[2732-a fool] Give [them]2114-them [my]0-i love — [my]0-i warm love — [my]0-i deep love — oh , out of [my]0-i heart of hearts ! [I]0-i shall never see [[our]2115-our home]2116-our home any more . ” Now came [Pasquerel]200-jean pasquerel , [[Joan]110-joan ’s confessor]3950-joan ’s confessor , and introduced [a gallant knight]3951-a gallant knight , [the Sire de Rais]231-the sire de rais , who had been sent with a message . [He]3951-a gallant knight said [he]3951-a gallant knight was instructed to say that [the council]1427-the council had decided that enough had been done for the present ; that it would be safest and best to be content with what [God]140-god had already done ; that [the city]372-the city was now well victualed and able to stand a long siege ; that the wise course must necessarily be to withdraw [the troops]3351-the troops from [the other side of [the river]454-the river]3568-the other side of the river and resume the defensive — therefore [they]1427-the council had decided accordingly . “[0-i] [The incurable cowards]2117-the incurable cowards ! ” exclaimed [Joan]110-joan . “[0-i] So it was to get [me]0-i away from [[my]0-i men]2118-my men that [they]2118-my men pretended so much solicitude about [my]0-i fatigue . Take this message back , not to [the council]1427-the council — [I]0-i have no speeches for [[those disguised ladies]2120-those disguised ladies ’ maids]2121-those disguised ladies ’ maids — but to [the Bastard]1913-the bastard and [La Hire]195-la hire , who are [men]282-men . Tell [them]2118-my men [the army]3157-the army is to remain where it is , and [I]0-i hold [them]2118-my men responsible if this command miscarries . And say the offensive will be resumed in the morning . [You]2125-you may go , [good sir]1937-good sir . ” Then [she]0-i said to [[her]0-i priest]3957-her priest : “[1937-good sir] Rise early , and be by [me]0-i all the day . There will be much work on [my]0-i hands , and [I]0-i shall be hurt between [my]0-i neck and [my]0-i shoulder . ” Chapter 22 The Fate of [France]4-france Decided [WE]3958-we WERE up at dawn , and after mass [we]3958-we started . In [the hall]1462-the hall [we]3958-we met [the master of [the house]630-the house , who was grieved , [good man]3962-good man , to see [Joan]110-joan going breakfastless to such a day ’s work]3960-the master of the house , who was grieved , good man , to see joan going breakfastless to such a day ’s work , and begged [her]110-joan to wait and eat , but [she]110-joan could n’t afford the time — that is to say , [she]110-joan could n’t afford the patience , [she]110-joan being in such a blaze of anxiety to get at that last remaining bastille which stood between [her]110-joan and the completion of the first great step in the rescue and [redemption of [France]4-france]3963-redemption of france . [Boucher]133-catherine put in another plea : “[0-i] But think — [we]2127-we poor beleaguered [citizens who have hardly known the flavor of fish for these many months]2128-citizens who have hardly known the flavor of fish for these many months , have [spoil of that sort]2129-spoil of that sort again , and [we]2127-we owe it to [you]2130-you . There ’s a noble shad for breakfast ; wait — be persuaded . ” [Joan]110-joan said : “[2648-your excellency] Oh , there ’s going to be fish in plenty ; when this day ’s work is done the whole [river - front]2131-river - front will be [yours]2130-you to do as [you]2130-you please with . ” “[2648-your excellency] Ah , [[your]2130-you Excellency]2648-your excellency will do well , that [I]0-i know ; but [we]2127-we do n’t require quite that much , even of [you]2130-you ; [you]2130-you shall have a month for it in place of a day . Now be beguiled — wait and eat . There ’s a saying that [he]2133-he that would cross [a river]2586-a river twice in the same day in [a boat]2135-a boat , will do well to eat fish for luck , lest [he]2133-he have an accident . ” “[2133-he] That does n’t fit [my]0-i case , for to - day [I]0-i cross but once in [a boat]2135-a boat . ” “[2133-he] Oh , do n’t say that . Are n’t [you]0-i coming back to [us]2127-we ? ” “[0-i] Yes , but not in [a boat]2135-a boat . ” “[0-i] How , then ? ” “[0-i] By [the bridge]1244-the bridge . ” “[0-i] Listen to that — by [the bridge]1244-the bridge ! Now stop this jesting , [dear General]2140-dear general , and do as [I]0-i would have done [you]2140-dear general . It ’s a noble fish . ” “[0-i] Be good then , and save [me]0-i some for supper ; and [I]0-i will bring one of [those Englishmen]2141-those englishmen with [me]0-i and [he]2142-he shall have [his]2142-he share . ” “[2142-he] Ah , well , have [your]2140-dear general way if [you]2140-dear general must . But [he]2142-he that fasts must attempt but little and stop early . When shall [you]0-i be back ? ” “[0-i] When [we]2127-we ’ve raised the siege of [Orleans]39-orleans . FORWARD ! ” [We]2127-we were off . [The streets]361-the streets were full of [citizens]3057-citizens and of [groups]3966-groups and squads of [soldiers]2473-soldiers , but the spectacle was melancholy . There was not a smile anywhere , but only universal gloom . It was as if some vast calamity had smitten all hope and cheer dead . [We]2127-we were not used to this , and were astonished . But when [they]2144-they saw [the Maid]1326-the maid , there was an immediate stir , and the eager question flew from mouth to mouth . “[2142-he] Where is [she]2143-she going ? [Whither]232-whither is [she]2143-she bound ? ” [Joan]110-joan heard it , and called out : “[232-whither] [Whither]232-whither would [ye]2144-they suppose ? [I]0-i am going to take the [Tourelles]94-the tourelles . ” It would not be possible for any to describe how those few words turned that mourning into joy — into exaltation — into frenzy ; and how a storm of huzzas burst out and swept down [the streets]361-the streets in every direction and woke [those corpse - like multitudes]3970-those corpse - like multitudes to vivid life and action and turmoil in a moment . [The soldiers]2667-the soldiers broke from [the crowd]3972-the crowd and came flocking to [our]2127-we standard , and [many of [the citizens]3974-the citizens]3973-many of the citizens ran and got pikes and halberds and joined [us]2127-we .
