As [we]2127-we moved on , [our]2127-we numbers increased steadily , and the hurrahing continued — yes , [we]2127-we moved through a solid cloud of noise , as [you]3975-you may say , and all the windows on both sides contributed to it , for [they]2667-the soldiers were filled with [excited people]3976-excited people . [You]3975-you see , [the council]1427-the council had closed the [Burgundy]34-burgundy gate and placed [a strong force there]3978-a strong force there , under [that stout soldier [Raoul de Gaucourt]184-raoul de gaucourt , Bailly of [Orleans]39-orleans]3979-that stout soldier raoul de gaucourt , bailly of orleans , with orders to prevent [Joan]110-joan from getting out and resuming the attack on [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles , and this shameful thing had plunged [the city]372-the city into sorrow and despair . But that feeling was gone now . [They]1427-the council believed [the Maid]1326-the maid was a match for [the council]1427-the council , and [they]1427-the council were right . When [we]2127-we reached the gate , [Joan]110-joan told [Gaucourt]184-raoul de gaucourt to open [it]3983-it and let [her]110-joan pass . [He]184-raoul de gaucourt said it would be impossible to do this , for [his]184-raoul de gaucourt orders were from [the council]1427-the council and were strict . [Joan]110-joan said : “[0-i] There is no authority above [mine]2145-mine but [the King]270-the king ’s . If [you]2147-you have an order from [the King]270-the king , produce it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not claim to have an order from [him]270-the king , [General]1962-general . ” “[1962-general] Then make way , or take the consequences ! ” [He]184-raoul de gaucourt began to argue the case , for [he]184-raoul de gaucourt was like the rest of [the tribe , always ready to fight with words , not acts]3985-the tribe , always ready to fight with words , not acts ; but in the midst of [his]184-raoul de gaucourt gabble [Joan]110-joan interrupted with the terse order : “[1962-general] Charge ! ” [We]3986-we came with a rush , and brief work [we]3986-we made of that small job . It was good to see [the Bailly]233-the bailly ’s surprise . [He]184-raoul de gaucourt was not used to this unsentimental promptness . [He]184-raoul de gaucourt said afterward that [he]184-raoul de gaucourt was cut off in the midst of what [he]184-raoul de gaucourt was saying — in the midst of an argument by which [he]184-raoul de gaucourt could have proved that [he]184-raoul de gaucourt could not let [Joan]110-joan pass — an argument which [Joan]110-joan could not have answered . “[0-i] Still , it appears [she]0-i did answer it , ” said [the person [he]184-raoul de gaucourt was talking to]3987-the person he was talking to . [We]3986-we swung through the gate in great style , with a vast accession of noise , the most of which was laughter , and soon [[our]3986-we van]3988-our van was over [the river]454-the river and moving down against [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles . First [we]3986-we must take a supporting work called [a boulevard]3990-a boulevard , and which was otherwise nameless , before [we]3986-we could assault [the great bastille]3991-the great bastille . [Its]3990-a boulevard rear communicated with [the bastille]3992-the bastille by a drawbridge , under which ran [a swift and deep strip of [the Loire]42-the loire]3993-a swift and deep strip of the loire . [The boulevard]3994-the boulevard was strong , and [Dunois]161-dunois doubted [our]3986-we ability to take it , but [Joan]110-joan had no such doubt . [She]110-joan pounded [it]3994-the boulevard with artillery all the forenoon , then about noon [she]110-joan ordered an assault and led [it]3994-the boulevard [herself]110-joan . [We]3986-we poured into [the fosse]3995-the fosse through the smoke and a tempest of missiles , and [Joan]110-joan , shouting encouragements to [[her]110-joan men]3996-her men , started to climb a scaling - ladder , when that misfortune happened which [we]3986-we knew was to happen — the iron bolt from an arbaquest struck between [her]110-joan neck and [her]110-joan shoulder , and tore its way down through [her]110-joan armor . When [she]110-joan felt the sharp pain and saw [her]110-joan blood gushing over [her]110-joan breast , [she]110-joan was frightened , [poor girl]3997-poor girl , and as [she]110-joan sank to the ground [she]110-joan began to cry bitterly . [The English]128-the english sent up a glad shout and came surging down in strong force to take [her]110-joan , and then for a few minutes the might of [both adversaries]3998-both adversaries was concentrated upon that spot . Over [her]110-joan and above [her]110-joan , [English]128-the english and [French]213-the french fought with desperation — for [she]110-joan stood for [France]4-france , indeed [she]110-joan was [France]4-france to both sides — whichever won [her]110-joan won [France]4-france , and could keep it forever . Right there in [that small spot]3999-that small spot , and in ten minutes by the clock , the fate of [France]4-france , for all time , was to be decided , and was decided . If [the English]128-the english had captured [Joan]110-joan then , [Charles VII]160-charles vii . would have flown [the country]315-the country , the Treaty of [Troyes]33-troyes would have held good , and [France]4-france , already [English property]4001-english property , would have become , without further dispute , [an English province]4002-an english province , to so remain until Judgment Day . [A nationality]4003-a nationality and [a kingdom]4004-a kingdom were at stake there , and no more time to decide it in than it takes to hard - boil an egg . It was the most momentous ten minutes that the clock has ever ticked in [France]4-france , or ever will . Whenever [you]4005-you read in histories about hours or days or weeks in which the fate of one or [another nation]4006-another nation hung in the balance , do not [you]4005-you fail to remember , nor [your]4005-you French hearts to beat the quicker for the remembrance , the ten minutes that [France]4-france , called otherwise [Joan of Arc]110-joan , lay bleeding in [the fosse]3995-the fosse that day , with [two nations]4008-two nations struggling over [her]110-joan for [her]110-joan possession . And [you]4005-you will not forget [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf . For [he]1993-the dwarf stood over [her]110-joan , and did the work of [any six of the others]4010-any six of the others . [He]1993-the dwarf swung [his]1993-the dwarf ax with both hands ; whenever it came down , [he]1993-the dwarf said those two words , “[0-i] For [France]4-france ! ” and a splintered helmet flew like eggshells , and the skull that carried it had learned its manners and would offend [the French]213-the french no more . [He]1993-the dwarf piled a bulwark of iron - clad dead in front of [him]1993-the dwarf and fought from behind it ; and at last when the victory was ours [we]4011-we closed about [him]1993-the dwarf , shielding [him]1993-the dwarf , and [he]1993-the dwarf ran up a ladder with [Joan]110-joan as easily as [another man]1873-another man would carry [a child]327-a child , and bore [her]110-joan out of the battle , [a great crowd following and anxious]4014-a great crowd following and anxious , for [she]110-joan was drenched with blood to [her]110-joan feet , half of it [her]110-joan own and [the other half English]4015-the other half english , for bodies had fallen across [her]110-joan as [she]110-joan lay and had poured [their]4016-their red life - streams over [her]110-joan . [One]461-one could n’t see the white armor now , with that awful dressing over it . The iron bolt was still in the wound — some say it projected out behind the shoulder . It may be — [I]0-i did not wish to see , and did not try to . It was pulled out , and the pain made [Joan]110-joan cry again , poor thing . [Some]505-some say [she]110-joan pulled it out [herself]110-joan because [others]506-others refused , saying [they]506-others could not bear to hurt [her]110-joan . As to this [I]0-i do not know ; [I]0-i only know it was pulled out , and that the wound was treated with oil and properly dressed . [Joan]110-joan lay on the grass , weak and suffering , hour after hour , but still insisting that the fight go on . Which it did , but not to much purpose , for it was only under [her]110-joan eye that [men]282-men were [heroes]3297-heroes and not afraid . [They]282-men were like [the Paladin]157-the paladin ; [I]0-i think [he]157-the paladin was afraid of [his]157-the paladin shadow — [I]0-i mean in the afternoon , when it was very big and long ; but when [he]157-the paladin was under [Joan]110-joan ’s eye and the inspiration of [her]110-joan great spirit , what was [he]157-the paladin afraid of ? Nothing in [this world]345-this world — and that is just the truth . Toward night [Dunois]161-dunois gave it up . [Joan]110-joan heard the bugles . “[0-i] What ! ” [she]110-joan cried . “[234-bugles] Sounding the retreat ! ” [Her]110-joan wound was forgotten in a moment . [She]110-joan countermanded the order , and sent another , to [the officer in command of [a battery]4024-a battery]4023-the officer in command of a battery , to stand ready to fire five shots in quick succession . This was a signal to [the force on [the [Orleans]39-orleans side of [the river]454-the river]4026-the orleans side of the river under [La Hire]195-la hire , who was not , as [some of the histories say , with [us]4029-we]4028-some of the histories say , with us]4025-the force on the orleans side of the river under la hire , who was not , as some of the histories say , with us . It was to be given whenever [Joan]110-joan should feel sure [the boulevard]3994-the boulevard was about to fall into [her]110-joan hands — then that force must make a counter - attack on [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles by way of [the bridge]1244-the bridge . [Joan]110-joan mounted [her]110-joan horse now , with [her]110-joan staff about [her]110-joan , and when [[our]4029-we people]4032-our people saw [us]4029-we coming [they]4032-our people raised a great shout , and were at once eager for another assault on [the boulevard]3994-the boulevard . [Joan]110-joan rode straight to [the fosse]3995-the fosse where [she]110-joan had received [her]110-joan wound , and standing there in the rain of bolts and arrows , [she]110-joan ordered [the Paladin]157-the paladin to let [her]110-joan long standard blow free , and to note when its fringes should touch [the fortress]3571-the fortress . Presently [he]157-the paladin said : “[234-bugles] It touches . ” “[234-bugles] Now , then , ” said [Joan]110-joan to [the waiting battalions]4036-the waiting battalions , “[2151-yours] [the place]585-the place is [yours]2151-yours — enter in ! [Bugles]234-bugles , sound the assault ! Now , then — all together — go ! ” And go it was . [You]2151-yours never saw anything like it . [We]4029-we swarmed up the ladders and over [the battlements]4037-the battlements like a wave — and [the place]585-the place was [[our]4029-we property]4039-our property . Why , [one]461-one might live a thousand years and never see so gorgeous a thing as that again . There , hand to hand , [we]4029-we fought like wild beasts , for there was no give - up to [those English]4041-those english — there was no way to convince [one of [those people]1318-those people]4042-one of those people but to kill [him]4042-one of those people , and even then [he]4042-one of those people doubted . At least so it was thought , in those days , and maintained by [many]1002-many . [We]4029-we were busy and never heard the five cannon - shots fired , but they were fired a moment after [Joan]110-joan had ordered the assault ; and so , while [we]4029-we were hammering and being hammered in [the smaller fortress]4045-the smaller fortress , [the reserve on [the [Orleans]39-orleans side]3856-the orleans side]4046-the reserve on the orleans side poured across [the bridge]1244-the bridge and attacked [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles from that side . [A fire - boat]4049-a fire - boat was brought down and moored under the drawbridge which connected [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles with [[our]4029-we boulevard]4050-our boulevard ; wherefore , when at last [we]4029-we drove [[our]4029-we English]4051-our english ahead of [us]4029-we and [they]4051-our english tried to cross that drawbridge and join [[their]4051-our english friends]4052-their friends in [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles , the burning timbers gave way under [them]4051-our english and emptied [them]4051-our english in a mass into [the river]454-the river in [their]4051-our english heavy armor — and a pitiful sight it was to see [brave men]4054-brave men die such a death as that . “[140-god] Ah , [God]140-god pity [them]2152-them ! ” said [Joan]110-joan , and wept to see that sorrowful spectacle . [She]110-joan said those gentle words and wept those compassionate tears although one of [those perishing men]4055-those perishing men had grossly insulted [her]110-joan with a coarse name three days before , when [she]110-joan had sent [him]4056-him a message asking [him]4056-him to surrender . That was [[their]2152-them leader]4057-their leader , [Sir Williams Glasdale]235-sir williams glasdale , [a most valorous knight]4058-a most valorous knight . [He]235-sir williams glasdale was clothed all in steel ; so [he]235-sir williams glasdale plunged under water like a lance , and of course came up no more . [We]4059-we soon patched [a sort of bridge]4060-a sort of bridge together and threw [ourselves]4059-we against [the last stronghold of the English power that barred [Orleans]39-orleans from [friends and supplies]4062-friends and supplies]4061-the last stronghold of the english power that barred orleans from friends and supplies . Before the sun was quite down , [Joan]110-joan ’s forever memorable day ’s work was finished , [her]110-joan banner floated from [the fortress of [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles]4063-the fortress of the tourelles , [her]110-joan promise was fulfilled , [she]110-joan had raised the siege of [Orleans]39-orleans ! The seven months ’ beleaguerment was ended , the thing which [the first generals of [France]4-france]4064-the first generals of france had called impossible was accomplished ; in spite of all that [[the King]270-the king ’s ministers]4066-the king ’s ministers and [war - councils]4067-war - councils could do to prevent it , [this little country - maid at seventeen]4068-this little country - maid at seventeen had carried [her]4068-this little country - maid at seventeen immortal task through , and had done it in four days ! Good news travels fast , sometimes , as well as bad . By the time [we]4059-we were ready to start homeward by the bridge [the whole city of [Orleans]39-orleans]4069-the whole city of orleans was one red flame of bonfires , and the heavens blushed with satisfaction to see it ; and the booming and bellowing of cannon and the banging of bells surpassed by great odds anything that even [Orleans]39-orleans had attempted before in the way of noise . When [we]4059-we arrived — well , there is no describing that . Why , [those acres of people that [we]4059-we plowed through]4070-those acres of people that we plowed through shed tears enough to raise [the river]454-the river ; there was not a face in the glare of those fires that had n’t tears streaming down it ; and if [Joan]110-joan ’s feet had not been protected by iron [they]2154-they would have kissed them off of [her]110-joan . “[140-god] Welcome ! welcome to [the Maid of [Orleans]39-orleans]2030-the maid of orleans ! ” That was the cry ; [I]2030-the maid of orleans heard it a hundred thousand times . “[2030-the maid of orleans] Welcome to [[our]2154-they Maid]2155-our maid ! ” [some of [them]2154-they]4072-some of them worded it . [No other girl in all history]4073-no other girl in all history has ever reached such a summit of glory as [Joan of Arc]110-joan reached that day . And do [you]4074-you think it turned [her]110-joan head , and that [she]110-joan sat up to enjoy that delicious music of homage and applause ? No ; [another girl]4075-another girl would have done that , but not this one . That was the greatest heart and the simplest that ever beat . [She]110-joan went straight to bed and to sleep , like [any tired child]4076-any tired child ; and when [the people]313-the people found [she]110-joan was wounded and would rest , [they]313-the people shut off all passage and traffic in [that region]2714-that region and stood guard [themselves]313-the people the whole night through , to see that [he]4079-he slumbers were not disturbed . [They]313-the people said , “[2155-our maid] [She]2155-our maid has given [us]2154-they peace , [she]2155-our maid shall have peace [herself]2155-our maid . ” [All]738-all knew that [that region]2714-that region would be empty of English next day , and [all]738-all said that [neither the present citizens]4083-neither the present citizens nor [[their]313-the people posterity]4084-their posterity would ever cease to hold that day sacred to the memory of [Joan of Arc]110-joan . That word has been true for more than sixty years ; it will continue so always . [Orleans]39-orleans will never forget the 8th of May , nor ever fail to celebrate it . It is [Joan of Arc]110-joan ’s day — and holy . ( 1 ) ( 1)It is still celebrated every year with civic and military pomps and solemnities.—TRANSLATOR . Chapter 23 [Joan]110-joan Inspires [the Tawdry King]272-the tawdry king IN THE earliest dawn of morning , [Talbot]215-talbot and [[his]215-talbot English forces]4086-his english forces evacuated [[their]313-the people bastilles]4087-their bastilles and marched away , not stopping to burn , destroy , or carry off anything , but leaving [[their]313-the people fortresses]4088-their fortresses just as [they]313-the people were , provisioned , armed , and equipped for a long siege . It was difficult for [the people]313-the people to believe that this great thing had really happened ; that [they]313-the people were actually free once more , and might go and come through any gate [they]313-the people pleased , with none to molest or forbid ; that [the terrible Talbot]4090-the terrible talbot , [that scourge of [the French]213-the french]4091-that scourge of the french , [that man whose mere name had been able to annul the effectiveness of [French armies]4093-french armies]4092-that man whose mere name had been able to annul the effectiveness of french armies , was gone , vanished , retreating — driven away by [a girl]2451-a girl . [The city]372-the city emptied [itself]372-the city . Out of every gate [the crowds]2771-the crowds poured . [They]2771-the crowds swarmed about [the English bastilles]4097-the english bastilles like an invasion of ants , but noisier than those creatures , and carried off the artillery and stores , then turned [all those dozen fortresses]4098-all those dozen fortresses into monster bonfires , imitation volcanoes whose lofty columns of thick smoke seemed supporting the arch of the sky . The delight of [the children]483-the children took another form . To some of [the younger ones]4100-the younger ones seven months was a sort of lifetime . [They]483-the children had forgotten what grass was like , and [the velvety green meadows]4101-the velvety green meadows seemed paradise to [their]483-the children surprised and happy eyes after the long habit of seeing nothing but [dirty lanes and streets]4102-dirty lanes and streets . It was a wonder to [them]483-the children — [those spacious reaches of [open country]4104-open country to run and dance and tumble and frolic in , after [their]483-the children dull and joyless captivity]4103-those spacious reaches of open country to run and dance and tumble and frolic in , after their dull and joyless captivity ; so [they]483-the children scampered far and wide over [the fair regions on both sides of [the river]454-the river]4105-the fair regions on both sides of the river , and came back at eventide weary , but laden with flowers and flushed with new health drawn from the fresh country air and the vigorous exercise . After the burnings , [the grown folk]4107-the grown folk followed [Joan]110-joan from [church]4108-church to [church]4108-church and put in the day in thanksgivings for [the city]372-the city ’s deliverance , and at night [they]4107-the grown folk feted [her]110-joan and [[her]110-joan generals]3301-her generals and illuminated [the town]786-the town , and high and low gave [themselves]4107-the grown folk up to festivities and rejoicings . By the time [the populace]3787-the populace were fairly in bed , toward dawn , [we]4114-we were in the saddle and away toward [Tours]70-tours to report to [the King]270-the king . That was a march which would have turned [any one]2338-any one ’s head but [Joan]110-joan ’s . [We]4114-we moved between emotional ranks of [grateful country - people]4117-grateful country - people all the way . [They]4107-the grown folk crowded about [Joan]110-joan to touch [her]110-joan feet , [her]110-joan horse , [her]110-joan armor , and [they]4107-the grown folk even knelt in [the road]840-the road and kissed [her]110-joan horse ’s hoof - prints . [The land]1069-the land was full of [her]110-joan praises . [The most illustrious chiefs of the church]4120-the most illustrious chiefs of the church wrote to [the King]270-the king extolling [the Maid]110-joan , comparing [her]110-joan to the saints and [heroes of the Bible]4122-heroes of the bible , and warning [him]270-the king not to let “[2155-our maid] unbelief , ingratitude , or other injustice ” hinder or impair the divine help sent through [her]110-joan . [One]461-one might think there was a touch of prophecy in that , and [we]4114-we will let it go at that ; but to [my]2156-disguised ladies ’ maids mind it had its inspiration in [those great men]3210-those great men ’s accurate knowledge of [the King]270-the king ’s trivial and treacherous character . [The King]270-the king had come to [Tours]70-tours to meet [Joan]110-joan . At the present day this poor thing is called [Charles the Victorious]236-charles the victorious , on account of victories which [other people]798-other people won for [him]236-charles the victorious , but in [our]4114-we time [we]4114-we had a private name for [him]236-charles the victorious which described [him]236-charles the victorious better , and was sanctified to [him]236-charles the victorious by personal deserving — [Charles the Base]237-charles the base . When [we]4114-we entered [the presence]4128-the presence [he]236-charles the victorious sat throned , with [his]236-charles the victorious tinseled snobs and dandies around [him]236-charles the victorious . [He]236-charles the victorious looked like a forked carrot , so tightly did [his]236-charles the victorious clothing fit [him]236-charles the victorious from [his]236-charles the victorious waist down ; [he]236-charles the victorious wore shoes with a rope - like pliant toe a foot long that had to be hitched up to the knee to keep it out of the way ; [he]236-charles the victorious had on a crimson velvet cape that came no lower than [his]236-charles the victorious elbows ; on [his]236-charles the victorious head [he]236-charles the victorious had a tall felt thing like a thimble , with a feather it its jeweled band that stuck up like a pen from an inkhorn , and from under that thimble [his]236-charles the victorious bush of stiff hair stuck down to [his]236-charles the victorious shoulders , curving outward at the bottom , so that the cap and the hair together made the head like a shuttlecock . All the materials of [his]236-charles the victorious dress were rich , and all the colors brilliant . In [his]236-charles the victorious lap [he]236-charles the victorious cuddled a miniature greyhound that snarled , lifting its lip and showing its white teeth whenever any slight movement disturbed it . [[The King]270-the king ’s dandies]4130-the king ’s dandies were dressed in about the same fashion as [himself]236-charles the victorious , and when [I]2156-disguised ladies ’ maids remembered that [Joan]110-joan had called the war - council of [Orleans]39-orleans “[2156-disguised ladies ’ maids] [disguised ladies ’ maids]2156-disguised ladies ’ maids , ” it reminded [me]2156-disguised ladies ’ maids of people who squander all [their]4130-the king ’s dandies money on a trifle and then have n’t anything to invest when [they]4130-the king ’s dandies come across a better chance ; that name ought to have been saved for [these creatures]4131-these creatures . [Joan]110-joan fell on [her]110-joan knees before [the majesty of [France]4-france]4132-the majesty of france , and the other frivolous animal in [his]236-charles the victorious lap — a sight which it pained [me]2156-disguised ladies ’ maids to see . What had [that man]2334-that man done for [[his]2334-that man country]4134-his country or for [anybody in it]4135-anybody in it , that [she]110-joan or [any other person]4136-any other person should kneel to [him]2334-that man ? But [she]110-joan — [she]110-joan had just done the only great deed that had been done for [France]4-france in fifty years , and had consecrated it with the libation of [her]110-joan blood . The positions should have been reversed . However , to be fair , one must grant that [Charles]237-charles the base acquitted [himself]237-charles the base very well for the most part , on that occasion — very much better than [he]237-charles the base was in the habit of doing . [He]237-charles the base passed [his]237-charles the base pup to [a courtier]4137-a courtier , and took off [his]237-charles the base cap to [Joan]110-joan as if [she]110-joan had been [a queen]4138-a queen . Then [he]237-charles the base stepped from [his]237-charles the base throne and raised [her]110-joan , and showed quite a spirited and manly joy and gratitude in welcoming [her]110-joan and thanking [her]110-joan for [her]110-joan extraordinary achievement in [his]237-charles the base service . [My]2156-disguised ladies ’ maids prejudices are of a later date than that . If [he]237-charles the base had continued as [he]237-charles the base was at that moment , [I]2156-disguised ladies ’ maids should not have acquired them . [He]237-charles the base acted handsomely . [He]237-charles the base said : “[2156-disguised ladies ’ maids] [You]2157-you shall not kneel to [me]0-i , [[my]0-i matchless General]2158-my matchless general ; [you]2157-you have wrought royally , and [royal courtesies]2159-royal courtesies are [your]2157-you due . ” Noticing that [she]2157-you was pale , [he]237-charles the base said , “[2157-you] But [you]2157-you must not stand ; [you]2157-you have lost blood for [France]4-france , and [your]2157-you wound is yet green — come . ” [He]237-charles the base led [her]2157-you to a seat and sat down by [her]2157-you . “[2157-you] Now , then , speak out frankly , as to one who owes [you]2157-you much and freely confesses it before all this courtly assemblage . What shall be [your]2157-you reward ? Name it . ” [I]162-the dauphin was ashamed of [him]237-charles the base . And yet that was not fair , for how could [he]237-charles the base be expected to know [this marvelous child]2670-this marvelous child in these few weeks , when [we]4140-we who thought [we]4140-we had known [her]2670-this marvelous child all [her]2670-this marvelous child life were daily seeing the clouds uncover some new altitudes of [her]2670-this marvelous child character whose existence was not suspected by [us]4140-we before ? But [we]4140-we are all that way : when [we]4140-we know a thing [we]4140-we have only scorn for [other people who do n’t happen to know it]4141-other people who do n’t happen to know it . And [I]162-the dauphin was ashamed of [these courtiers]4142-these courtiers , too , for the way [they]4142-these courtiers licked [their]4142-these courtiers chops , so to speak , as envying [Joan]110-joan [her]110-joan great chance , [they]4142-these courtiers not knowing [her]110-joan any better than [the King]270-the king did . A blush began to rise in [Joan]110-joan ’s cheeks at the thought that [she]110-joan was working for [[her]110-joan country]845-her country for pay , and [she]110-joan dropped [her]110-joan head and tried to hide [her]110-joan face , as [girls]716-girls always do when [they]716-girls find [themselves]716-girls blushing ; [no one]284-no one knows why [they]716-girls do , but [they]716-girls do , and the more [they]716-girls blush the more [they]716-girls fail to get reconciled to it , and the more [they]716-girls ca n’t bear to have [people]2327-people look at [them]716-girls when [they]716-girls are doing it . [The King]270-the king made it a great deal worse by calling attention to it , which is the unkindest thing [a person]467-a person can do when [a girl]2451-a girl is blushing ; sometimes , when there is a big crowd of [strangers]707-strangers , it is even likely to make [her]2451-a girl cry if [she]2451-a girl is as young as [Joan]110-joan was . [God]140-god knows the reason for this , it is hidden from [men]282-men . As for [me]162-the dauphin , [I]162-the dauphin would as soon blush as sneeze ; in fact , [I]162-the dauphin would rather . However , these meditations are not of consequence : [I]162-the dauphin will go on with what [I]162-the dauphin was saying . [The King]270-the king rallied [her]110-joan for blushing , and this brought up the rest of the blood and turned [her]110-joan face to fire . Then [he]270-the king was sorry , seeing what [he]270-the king had done , and tried to make [her]110-joan comfortable by saying the blush was exceeding becoming to [her]110-joan and not to mind it — which caused even [the dog]4154-the dog to notice it now , so of course the red in [Joan]110-joan ’s face turned to purple , and the tears overflowed and ran down — [I]162-the dauphin could have told [anybody]563-anybody that that would happen . [The King]270-the king was distressed , and saw that the best thing to do would be to get away from this subject , so [he]270-the king began to say the finest kind of things about [Joan]110-joan ’s capture of [the Tourelles]94-the tourelles , and presently when [she]110-joan was more composed [he]270-the king mentioned the reward again and pressed [her]110-joan to name it . [Everybody]238-everybody listened with anxious interest to hear what [her]110-joan claim was going to be , but when [her]110-joan answer came [their]238-everybody faces showed that the thing [she]110-joan asked for was not what [they]238-everybody had been expecting . “[162-the dauphin] Oh , dear and gracious [Dauphin]162-the dauphin , [I]0-i have but one desire — only one . If — ” “[2372-my child] Do not be afraid , [[my]0-i child]2372-my child — name it . ” “[162-the dauphin] That [you]162-the dauphin will not delay a day . [[My]0-i army]2161-my army is strong and valiant , and eager to finish [its]2161-my army work — march with [me]0-i to [Rheims]54-rheims and receive [your]162-the dauphin crown . ” [You]162-the dauphin could see [the indolent King]4157-the indolent king shrink , in [his]4157-the indolent king butterfly clothes . “[1907-my general] To [Rheims]54-rheims — oh , impossible , [[my]0-i General]1907-my general ! [We]2163-us march through [the heart of [England]24-england]2164-the heart of england ’s power ? ” Could those be French faces [there]460-there ? [Not one of [them]460-there]4159-not one of them lighted in response to [the girl]3083-the girl ’s brave proposition , but all promptly showed satisfaction in [the King]270-the king ’s objection . Leave this silken idleness for the rude contact of war ? [None of [these butterflies]4163-these butterflies]4162-none of these butterflies desired that . [They]4163-these butterflies passed [their]4163-these butterflies jeweled comfit - boxes one to another and whispered [their]4163-these butterflies content in the head butterfly ’s practical prudence . [Joan]110-joan pleaded with [the King]270-the king , saying : “[1907-my general] Ah , [I]0-i pray [you]1907-my general do not throw away this perfect opportunity . Everything is favorable — everything . It is as if the circumstances were specially made for it . [The spirits of [[our]2163-us army]2166-our army]2165-the spirits of our army are exalted with victory , those of [the English forces]2167-the english forces depressed by defeat . Delay will change this . Seeing [us]2163-us hesitate to follow up [our]2163-us advantage , [[our]2163-us men]1164-our men will wonder , doubt , lose confidence , and [the English]128-the english will wonder , gather courage , and be bold again . Now is the time — pritheee let [us]2163-us march ! ” [The King]270-the king shook [his]270-the king head , and [La Tremouille]239-la tremouille , being asked for an opinion , eagerly furnished it : “[2169-sire] [Sire]2169-sire , all prudence is against it . Think of [the English strongholds along [the Loire]42-the loire]2170-the english strongholds along the loire ; think of those that lie between [us]2163-us and [Rheims]54-rheims ! ” [He]270-the king was going on , but [Joan]110-joan cut [him]270-the king short , and said , turning to [him]270-the king : “[2170-the english strongholds along the loire] If [we]2163-us wait , [they]2170-the english strongholds along the loire will all be strengthened , reinforced . Will that advantage [us]2163-us ? ” “[2170-the english strongholds along the loire] Why — no . ” “[2170-the english strongholds along the loire] Then what is [your]2169-sire suggestion?—what is it that [you]2169-sire would propose to do ? ” “[2169-sire] [My]0-i judgment is to wait . ” “[2169-sire] Wait for what ? ” [The minister]4166-the minister was obliged to hesitate , for [he]4166-the minister knew of no explanation that would sound well . Moreover , [he]4166-the minister was not used to being catechized in this fashion , with the eyes of [a crowd of people]3132-a crowd of people on [him]4166-the minister , so [he]4166-the minister was irritated , and said : “[2169-sire] Matters of state are not proper matters for public discussion . ” [Joan]110-joan said placidly : “[0-i] [I]0-i have to beg [your]2169-sire pardon . [My]0-i trespass came of ignorance . [I]0-i did not know that matters connected with [[your]2169-sire department of [the government]2172-the government]2171-your department of the government were matters of state . ” [The minister]4166-the minister lifted [his]4166-the minister brows in amused surprise , and said , with a touch of sarcasm : “[0-i] [I]0-i am [[the King]270-the king ’s chief minister]2174-the king ’s chief minister , and yet [you]2169-sire had the impression that matters connected with [[my]0-i department]2175-my department are not matters of state ? Pray , how is that ? ” [Joan]110-joan replied , indifferently : “[2169-sire] Because there is no state . ” “[2169-sire] [No state]2176-no state ! ” “[2169-sire] No , [sir]2019-sir , there is [no state]2176-no state , and no use for [a minister]2179-a minister . [France]4-france is shrunk to a couple of acres of ground ; [[a sheriff]2180-a sheriff ’s constable]2181-a sheriff ’s constable could take care of [it]4-france ; [its]4-france affairs are not matters of state . The term is too large . ” [The King]270-the king did not blush , but burst into a hearty , careless laugh , and [the court]389-the court laughed too , but prudently turned [its]389-the court head and did it silently . [La Tremouille]239-la tremouille was angry , and opened [his]239-la tremouille mouth to speak , but [the King]270-the king put up [his]270-the king hand , and said : “[0-i] There — [I]0-i take [her]2182-her under the royal protection . [She]2182-her has spoken the truth , the ungilded truth — how seldom [I]0-i hear it ! With all this tinsel on [me]0-i and all this tinsel about [me]0-i , [I]0-i am but [a sheriff]2180-a sheriff after all — [a poor shabby two - acre sheriff]2184-a poor shabby two - acre sheriff — and [you]2185-you are but [a constable]2186-a constable , ” and [he]2180-a sheriff laughed [his]2180-a sheriff cordial laugh again . “[2186-a constable] [Joan]110-joan , [[my]0-i frank]2187-my frank , [honest General]2188-honest general , will [you]110-joan name [your]110-joan reward ? [I]0-i would ennoble [you]110-joan . [You]110-joan shall quarter the crown and the lilies of [France]4-france for blazon , and with [them]2189-them [your]110-joan victorious sword to defend [them]2189-them — speak the word . ” It made an eager buzz of surprise and envy in the assemblage , but [Joan]110-joan shook [her]110-joan head and said : “[110-joan] Ah , [I]0-i can not , [dear and noble Dauphin]2190-dear and noble dauphin . To be allowed to work for [France]4-france , to spend one ’s self for [France]4-france , is itself so supreme a reward that nothing can add to it — nothing . Give [me]0-i the one reward [I]0-i ask , the dearest of all rewards , the highest in [your]110-joan gift — march with [me]0-i to [Rheims]54-rheims and receive [your]110-joan crown . [I]0-i will beg it on [my]0-i knees . ” But [the King]270-the king put [his]270-the king hand on [her]110-joan arm , and there was a really brave awakening in [his]270-the king voice and a manly fire in [his]270-the king eye when [he]270-the king said : “[0-i] No , sit . [You]110-joan have conquered [me]0-i — it shall be as [you]110-joan — ” But a warning sign from [[his]270-the king minister]4173-his minister halted [him]270-the king , and [he]270-the king added , to the relief of [the court]389-the court : “[110-joan] Well , well , [we]2191-we will think of it , [we]2191-we will think it over and see . Does that content [you]110-joan , [impulsive little soldier]2192-impulsive little soldier ? ” The first part of the speech sent a glow of delight to [Joan]110-joan ’s face , but the end of it quenched it and [she]110-joan looked sad , and the tears gathered in [her]110-joan eyes . After a moment [she]0-i spoke out with what seemed a sort of terrified impulse , and said : “[2192-impulsive little soldier] Oh , use [me]0-i ; [I]0-i beseech [you]110-joan , use [me]0-i — there is but little time ! ” “[0-i] But little time ? ” “[0-i] Only a year — [I]0-i shall last only a year . ” “[0-i] Why , [child]2713-child , there are fifty good years in that compact little body yet . ” “[110-joan] Oh , [you]110-joan err , indeed [you]110-joan do . In one little year the end will come . Ah , the time is so short , so short ; the moments are flying , and so much to be done . Oh , use [me]0-i , and quickly — it is life or death for [France]4-france . ” Even those insects were sobered by [her]0-i impassioned words . [The King]270-the king looked very grave — grave , and strongly impressed . [His]270-the king eyes lit suddenly with an eloquent fire , and [he]270-the king rose and drew [his]270-the king sword and raised it aloft ; then [he]270-the king brought it slowly down upon [Joan]110-joan ’s shoulder and said : “[2194-thy] Ah , [thou]2194-thy art so simple , so true , so great , so noble — and by this accolade [I]0-i join [thee]2194-thy to [the nobility of [France]4-france]2195-the nobility of france , [[thy]2194-thy fitting place]2196-thy fitting place ! And for [thy]2194-thy sake [I]0-i do hereby ennoble [all [[thy]2194-thy family]2198-thy family and [all [thy]2194-thy kin]2199-all thy kin]2197-all thy family and all thy kin ; and all [[their]2197-all thy family and all thy kin descendants born in wedlock]2200-their descendants born in wedlock , not only in [the male]2201-the male but also in [the female line]2202-the female line . And more!—more ! To distinguish [[thy]2194-thy house]2203-thy house and honor it above all others , [we]2204-we add a privilege never accorded to any before in the history of these dominions : [the females of [thy]2194-thy line]2205-the females of thy line shall have and hold the right to ennoble [[their]2205-the females of thy line husbands]2206-their husbands when these shall be of inferior degree . ” [ Astonishment and envy flared up in every countenance when the words were uttered which conferred this extraordinary grace . [The King]270-the king paused and looked around upon these signs with quite evident satisfaction . ] “[110-joan] Rise , [Joan of Arc]110-joan , now and henceforth surnamed [Du Lis]240-du lis , in grateful acknowledgment of the good blow which [you]110-joan have struck for the lilies of [France]4-france ; and [they]2207-they , and the royal crown , and [your]110-joan own victorious sword , fit and fair company for each other , shall be grouped in [you]110-joan escutcheon and be and remain the symbol of [[your]110-joan high nobility]2208-your high nobility forever . ” As [[my]2209-they [Lady Du Lis]240-du lis]4177-my lady du lis rose , [the gilded children of privilege]4178-the gilded children of privilege pressed forward to welcome [her]240-du lis to [their]4178-the gilded children of privilege sacred ranks and call [her]240-du lis by [her]240-du lis new name ; but [she]240-du lis was troubled , and said these honors were not meet for one of [her]240-du lis lowly birth and station , and by [their]4178-the gilded children of privilege kind grace [she]240-du lis would remain simple [Joan of Arc]110-joan , nothing more — and so be called . Nothing more ! As if there could be anything more , anything higher , anything greater . [[My]2209-they Lady Du Lis]4177-my lady du lis — why , it was tinsel , petty , perishable . But , [JOAN OF ARC]110-joan ! The mere sound of it sets one ’s pulses leaping . Chapter 24 Tinsel Trappings of [Nobility]4180-nobility [IT]4181-it WAS vexatious to see what a to - do [the whole town]3054-the whole town , and next [the whole country]4183-the whole country , made over the news . [Joan of Arc]110-joan ennobled by [the King]270-the king ! [People]2327-people went dizzy with wonder and delight over it . [You]4186-you can not imagine how [she]240-du lis was gaped at , stared at , envied . Why , [one]461-one would have supposed that some great and fortunate thing had happened to [her]240-du lis . But [we]4188-us did not think any great things of it . To [our]4188-us minds [no mere human hand]4189-no mere human hand could add a glory to [Joan of Arc]110-joan . To [us]4188-us [she]240-du lis was the sun soaring in the heavens , and [[her]240-du lis new nobility]4190-her new nobility a candle atop of it ; to [us]4188-us [it]4190-her new nobility was swallowed up and lost in [her]240-du lis own light . And [she]240-du lis was as indifferent to it and as unconscious of it as the other sun would have been . But it was different with [[her]240-du lis brothers]1018-her brothers . [They]1018-her brothers were proud and happy in [their]1018-her brothers new dignity , which was quite natural . And [Joan]110-joan was glad it had been conferred , when [she]110-joan saw how pleased [they]1018-her brothers were . It was a clever thought in [the King]270-the king to outflank [her]240-du lis scruples by marching on [them]1018-her brothers under shelter of [her]240-du lis love for [[her]240-du lis family]4193-her family and [[her]240-du lis kin]4194-her kin . [The Standard - Bearer]3534-the standard - bearer said , with some touch of bitterness , that [he]3534-the standard - bearer could see that [they]2209-they just felt good to be alive , [they]2209-they were so soaked with the comfort of [their]2209-they glory ; and did n’t like to sleep at all , because when [they]2209-they were asleep [they]2209-they did n’t know [they]2209-they were noble , and so sleep was a clean loss of time . And then [he]3534-the standard - bearer said : “[2209-they] [They]2209-they ca n’t take precedence of [me]0-i in military functions and state ceremonies , but when it comes to [civil ones]2210-civil ones and society affairs [I]0-i judge [they]2209-they ’ll cuddle coolly in behind [you]2211-you and [the knights]1227-the knights , and [Noel]135-noel and [I]0-i will have to walk behind [them]2209-they — hey ? ” “[135-noel] Yes , ” [I]135-noel said , “[135-noel] [I]0-i think [you]0-i are right . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i was just afraid of it — just afraid of it , ” said [the Standard - Bearer]3534-the standard - bearer , with a sigh . “[0-i] Afraid of it ? [I]0-i ’m talking like [a fool]2732-a fool ; of course [I]0-i knew it . Yes , [I]0-i was talking like [a fool]2732-a fool . ” [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel said , musingly : “[2732-a fool] Yes , [I]0-i noticed something natural about the tone of it . ” [[We]4200-we others]4201-we others laughed . “[0-i] Oh , [you]0-i did , did [you]0-i ? [You]0-i think [you]0-i are very clever , do n’t [you]0-i ? [They]2215-they are away below the grand possibilities . [I]0-i did n’t mean to be ill - mannered , but [I]0-i did n’t know the half of this that [you]2229-you ’ve been telling . [I]0-i ’ve been [an ass]1183-an ass . Yes , that is all there is to it — [I’ve]0-i been [an ass]1183-an ass . ” [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel said , in a kind of weary way : “[1183-an ass] Yes , that is likely enough ; but [I]0-i do n’t see why [you]2229-you should seem surprised at it . ” “[0-i] [You]2229-you do n’t , do n’t [you]2229-you ? Well , why do n’t [you]2229-you ? ” “[2229-you] Because [I]0-i do n’t see any novelty about it . With [some people]2232-some people it is a condition which is present all the time . Now [you]2229-you take a condition which is present all the time , and the results of that condition will be uniform ; this uniformity of result will in time become monotonous ; monotonousness , by the law of its being , is fatiguing . If [you]2229-you had manifested fatigue upon noticing that [you]2229-you had been [an ass]1183-an ass , that would have been logical , that would have been rational ; whereas it seems to [me]0-i that to manifest surprise was to be again [an ass]1183-an ass , because the condition of intellect that can enable [a person]467-a person to be surprised and stirred by inert monotonousness is a — ” “[1183-an ass] Now that is enough , [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel ; stop where [you]2229-you are , before [you]2229-you get [yourself]2229-you into trouble . And do n’t bother [me]0-i any more for some days or a week an it please [you]2229-you , for [I]0-i can not abide [your]2229-you clack . ” “[2229-you] Come , [I]0-i like that ! [I]0-i did n’t want to talk . [I]0-i tried to get out of talking . If [you]2229-you did n’t want to hear [my]0-i clack , what did [you]2229-you keep intruding [your]2229-you conversation on [me]0-i for ? ” “[2229-you] [I]0-i ? [I]0-i never dreamed of such a thing . ” “[2229-you] Well , [you]2229-you did it , anyway . And [I]0-i have a right to feel hurt , and [I]0-i do feel hurt , to have [you]2229-you treat [me]0-i so . It seems to [me]0-i that when [a person]467-a person goads , and crowds , and in a manner forces [another person]2237-another person to talk , it is neither very fair nor very good - mannered to call what [he]2237-another person says clack . ” “[2237-another person] Oh , snuffle — do ! and break [your]2229-you heart , [you]2229-you poor thing . [Somebody]636-somebody fetch [this sick doll]2239-this sick doll a sugar - rag . Look [you]2229-you , [Sir Jean de Metz]227-sir jean de metz , do [you]2229-you feel absolutely certain about that thing ? ” “[2229-you] What thing ? ” “[2229-you] Why , that [Jean]227-sir jean de metz and [Pierre]132-pierre are going to take precedence of all the lay noblesse hereabouts except [the Duke d’Alencon]2240-the duke d’alencon ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think there is not a doubt of it . ” [The Standard - Bearer]3534-the standard - bearer was deep in thoughts and dreams a few moments , then the silk - and - velvet expanse of [his]3534-the standard - bearer vast breast rose and fell with a sigh , and [he]3534-the standard - bearer said : “[0-i] [Dear]2328-dear , [dear]2328-dear , what a lift it is ! It just shows what luck can do . Well , [I]0-i do n’t care . [I]0-i should n’t care to be a painted accident — [I]0-i should n’t value it . [I]0-i am prouder to have climbed up to where [I]0-i am just by sheer natural merit than [I]0-i would be to ride the very sun in the zenith and have to reflect that [I]0-i was nothing but a poor little accident , and got shot up there out of [somebody else]2243-somebody else ’s catapult . To [me]0-i , merit is everything — in fact , the only thing . All else is dross . ” Just then the bugles blew the assembly , and that cut [our]4203-our talk short . Chapter 25 At Last — Forward ! THE DAYS began to waste away — and nothing decided , nothing done . [The army]3157-the army was full of zeal , but it was also hungry . [It]3157-the army got no pay , the treasury was getting empty , it was becoming impossible to feed [it]3157-the army ; under pressure of privation it began to fall apart and disperse — which pleased [the trifling court]4205-the trifling court exceedingly . [Joan]110-joan ’s distress was pitiful to see . [She]110-joan was obliged to stand helpless while [[her]110-joan victorious army]4206-her victorious army dissolved away until hardly the skeleton of it was left . At last one day [she]110-joan went to [the Castle of [Loches]97-loches]4207-the castle of loches , where [the King]270-the king was idling . [She]110-joan found [him]270-the king consulting with [three of [[his]270-the king councilors]4210-his councilors]4209-three of his councilors , [Robert le Maton]241-robert le maton , [a former Chancellor of [France]4-france]4211-a former chancellor of france , [Christophe d’Harcourt]242-christophe d’harcourt , and [Gerard Machet]243-gerard machet . [The Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2736-the bastard of orleans was present also , and it is through [him]270-the king that [we]4213-we know what happened . [Joan]110-joan threw [herself]110-joan at [the King]270-the king ’s feet and embraced [his]270-the king knees , saying : “[162-the dauphin] [Noble Dauphin]162-the dauphin , prithee hold no more of these long and numerous councils , but come , and come quickly , to [Rheims]54-rheims and receive [your]162-the dauphin crown . ” [Christophe d’Harcourt]242-christophe d’harcourt asked : “[162-the dauphin] Is it [your]162-the dauphin Voices that command [you]162-the dauphin to say that to [the King]270-the king ? ” “[162-the dauphin] Yes , and urgently . ” “[162-the dauphin] Then will [you]162-the dauphin not tell [us]2245-us in [the King]270-the king ’s presence in what way [the Voices]174-the voices communicate with [you]162-the dauphin ? ” It was another sly attempt to trap [Joan]110-joan into indiscreet admissions and dangerous pretensions . But nothing came of it . [Joan]110-joan ’s answer was simple and straightforward , and [the smooth Bishop]4215-the smooth bishop was not able to find any fault with it . [She]110-joan said that when [she]110-joan met with [people who doubted the truth of [her]110-joan mission]4216-people who doubted the truth of her mission [she]110-joan went aside and prayed , complaining of the distrust of these , and then the comforting Voices were heard at [her]110-joan ear saying , soft and low , “[174-the voices] Go forward , [Daughter of God]2247-daughter of god , and [I]0-i will help [thee]2248-thee . ” Then [she]110-joan added , “[0-i] When [I]0-i hear that , the joy in [my]0-i heart , oh , it is insupportable ! ” [The Bastard]1913-the bastard said that when [she]110-joan said these words [her]110-joan face lit up as with a flame , and [she]110-joan was like one in an ecstasy . [Joan]110-joan pleaded , persuaded , reasoned ; gaining ground little by little , but opposed step by step by [the council]1427-the council . [She]110-joan begged , [she]110-joan implored , leave to march . When [they]1427-the council could answer nothing further , [they]1427-the council granted that perhaps it had been a mistake to let [the army]3157-the army waste away , but how could [we]2249-we help [it]3157-the army now ? how could [we]2249-we march without [an army]1731-an army ? “[0-i] Raise one ! ” said [Joan]110-joan . “[0-i] But it will take six weeks . ” “[0-i] No matter — begin ! let [us]2249-we begin ! ” “[2249-we] It is too late . Without doubt [the Duke of [Bedford]80-bedford]2250-the duke of bedford has been gathering [troops]2251-troops to push to the succor of [[his]2250-the duke of bedford strongholds on [the Loire]42-the loire]2252-his strongholds on the loire . ” “[2251-troops] Yes , while [we]2249-we have been disbanding [ours]2249-we — and pity ’ tis . But [we]2249-we must throw away no more time ; [we]2249-we must bestir [ourselves]2249-we . ” [The King]270-the king objected that [he]270-the king could not venture toward [Rheims]54-rheims with [those strong places on [the Loire]42-the loire in [his]270-the king path]4222-those strong places on the loire in his path . But [Joan]110-joan said : “[2249-we] [We]2249-we will break [them]2253-them up . Then [you]2254-you can march . ” With that plan [the King]270-the king was willing to venture assent . [He]270-the king could sit around out of danger while [the road]840-the road was being cleared . [Joan]110-joan came back in great spirits . Straightway everything was stirring . Proclamations were issued calling for [men]282-men , [a recruiting - camp was established at [Selles]98-selles in [Berry]99-berry]4226-a recruiting - camp was established at selles in berry , and [the commons]4227-the commons and [the nobles]4196-the nobles began to flock to [it]4226-a recruiting - camp was established at selles in berry with enthusiasm . A deal of the month of May had been wasted ; and yet by the 6th of June [Joan]110-joan had swept together [a new army]4229-a new army and was ready to march . [She]110-joan had [eight thousand men]4230-eight thousand men . Think of that . Think of gathering together such a body as that in [that little region]4231-that little region . And these were [veteran soldiers]4232-veteran soldiers , too . In fact , [most of [the men in [France]4-france]4234-the men in france]4233-most of the men in france were [soldiers]2473-soldiers , when [you]4236-you came to that ; for the wars had lasted generations now . Yes , [most Frenchmen]4237-most frenchmen were [soldiers]2473-soldiers ; and [admirable runners]4239-admirable runners , too , both by practice and inheritance ; [they]4237-most frenchmen had done next to nothing but run for near a century . But that was not [their]4237-most frenchmen fault . [They]4237-most frenchmen had had no fair and proper leadership — at least leaders with a fair and proper chance . Away back , [King]2629-king and [Court]3012-court got the habit of being treacherous to [the leaders]4242-the leaders ; then [the leaders]4242-the leaders easily got the habit of disobeying [the King]270-the king and going [their]4242-the leaders own way , each for [himself]270-the king and [nobody]434-nobody for [the lot]4246-the lot . [Nobody]434-nobody could win victories that way . Hence , running became the habit of [the French troops]4248-the french troops , and no wonder . Yet all that [those troops]4249-those troops needed in order to be [good fighters]4250-good fighters was [a leader who would attend strictly to business]4251-a leader who would attend strictly to business — [a leader with all authority in [his]4251-a leader who would attend strictly to business hands in place of a tenth of it along with [nine other generals equipped with an equal tenth apiece]4253-nine other generals equipped with an equal tenth apiece]4252-a leader with all authority in his hands in place of a tenth of it along with nine other generals equipped with an equal tenth apiece . [They]4249-those troops had [a leader rightly clothed with authority]4254-a leader rightly clothed with authority now , and with a head and heart bent on war of the most intensely businesslike and earnest sort — and there would be results . No doubt of that . [They]4249-those troops had [Joan of Arc]110-joan ; and under that leadership [their]4249-those troops legs would lose the art and mystery of running . Yes , [Joan]110-joan was in great spirits . [She]110-joan was here and there and everywhere , all over [the camp]979-the camp , by day and by night , pushing things . And wherever [she]110-joan came charging down the lines , reviewing [the troops]3351-the troops , it was good to hear [them]3351-the troops break out and cheer . And [nobody]434-nobody could help [cheering]4258-cheering , [she]110-joan was such a vision of [young bloom and beauty and grace , and such an incarnation of pluck and life and go]4259-young bloom and beauty and grace , and such an incarnation of pluck and life and go ! [she]110-joan was growing more and more ideally beautiful every day , as was plain to be seen — and these were days of development ; for [she]110-joan was well past seventeen now — in fact , [she]110-joan was getting close upon seventeen and a half — indeed , just [a little woman]4260-a little woman , as [you]4261-you may say . [The two young [Counts de Laval]244-counts de laval]4262-the two young counts de laval arrived one day — [fine young fellows allied to [the greatest and most illustrious houses of [France]4-france]4264-the greatest and most illustrious houses of france]4263-fine young fellows allied to the greatest and most illustrious houses of france ; and [they]4262-the two young counts de laval could not rest till [they]4262-the two young counts de laval had seen [Joan of Arc]110-joan .
