When [they]4262-the two young counts de laval heard that rich voice of [hers]110-joan [they]4262-the two young counts de laval must have thought it was a flute ; and when [they]4262-the two young counts de laval saw [her]110-joan deep eyes and [her]110-joan face , and the soul that looked out of that face , [you]4261-you could see that the sight of [her]110-joan stirred [them]4262-the two young counts de laval like a poem , like lofty eloquence , like martial music . [One of [them]4262-the two young counts de laval]4266-one of them wrote [home]377-home to [[his]4266-one of them people]2470-his people , and in [his]4266-one of them letter [he]4266-one of them said , “[2254-you] It seemed something divine to see [her]2255-her and hear [her]2255-her . ” Ah , yes , and it was a true word . Truer word was never spoken . [He]4266-one of them saw [her]2255-her when [she]2255-her was ready to begin [her]2255-her march and open the campaign , and this is what [he]4266-one of them said about it : “[2254-you] [She]2255-her was clothed all in white armor save [her]2255-her head , and in [her]2255-her hand [she]2255-her carried a little battle - ax ; and when [she]2255-her was ready to mount [her]2255-her great black horse [he]2256-he reared and plunged and would not let [her]2255-her . Then [she]2255-her said , ‘ Lead [him]2256-he to the cross . ’ This cross was in front of [the church close by]2257-the church close by . So [they]2258-they led [him]2256-he [there]460-there . Then [she]2255-her mounted , and [he]2256-he never budged , any more than if [he]2256-he had been tied . Then [she]2255-her turned toward the door of [the church]409-the church and said , in [her]2255-her soft womanly voice , ‘ [You]2261-you , [priests]1415-priests and [people of [the Church]409-the church]2263-people of the church , make processions and pray to [God]140-god for [us]2258-they ! ’ Then [she]2255-her spurred away , under [her]2255-her standard , with [her]2255-her little ax in [her]2255-her hand , crying ‘ Forward — march ! ’ [One of [[her]2255-her brothers]1018-her brothers , who came eight days ago , departed with [her]2255-her]2265-one of her brothers , who came eight days ago , departed with her ; and [he]2256-he also was clad all in white armor . ” [I]2255-her was there , and [I]2255-her saw it , too ; saw it all , just as [he]2256-he pictures it . And [I]2255-her see it yet — the little battle - ax , the dainty plumed cap , the white armor — all in the soft June afternoon ; [I]2255-her see it just as if it were yesterday . And [I]2255-her rode with the staff — the personal staff — the staff of [Joan of Arc]110-joan . [That young count]4269-that young count was dying to go , too , but [the King]270-the king held [him]4269-that young count back for the present . But [Joan]110-joan had made [him]4269-that young count a promise . In [his]4269-that young count letter [he]4269-that young count said : “[2255-her] [She]2255-her told [me]0-i that when [the King]270-the king starts for [Rheims]54-rheims [I]0-i shall go with [him]270-the king . But [God]140-god grant [I]0-i may not have to wait till then , but may have a part in the battles ! ” [She]110-joan made [him]4269-that young count that promise when [she]110-joan was taking leave of [[my]0-i lady]4271-my lady the Duchess d’Alencon . [The duchess]4272-the duchess was exacting a promise , so it seemed a proper time for [others]506-others to do the like . [The duchess]4272-the duchess was troubled for [[her]4272-the duchess husband]4275-her husband , for [she]4272-the duchess foresaw desperate fighting ; and [she]0-i held [Joan]110-joan to [her]4272-the duchess breast , and stroked [her]110-joan hair lovingly , and said : “[0-i] [You]0-i must watch over [him]270-the king , [dear]2328-dear , and take care of [him]270-the king , and send [him]270-the king back to [me]0-i safe . [I]0-i require it of [you]0-i ; [I]0-i will not let [you]0-i go till [you]0-i promise . ” [Joan]110-joan said : “[0-i] [I]0-i give [you]0-i the promise with all [my]0-i heart ; and it is not just words , it is a promise ; [you]0-i shall have [him]270-the king back without a hurt . Do [you]0-i believe ? And are [you]0-i satisfied with [me]0-i now ? ” [The duchess]4272-the duchess could not speak , but [she]4272-the duchess kissed [Joan]110-joan on the forehead ; and so [they]4277-they parted . [We]4277-they left on the 6th and stopped over at [Romorantin]100-romorantin ; then on the 9th [Joan]110-joan entered [Orleans]39-orleans in state , under triumphal arches , with the welcoming cannon thundering and seas of welcoming flags fluttering in the breeze . [The Grand Staff]245-the grand staff rode with [her]110-joan , clothed in shining splendors of costume and decorations : [the Duke d’Alencon]2240-the duke d’alencon ; [the Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2736-the bastard of orleans ; [the Sire de Boussac]246-the sire de boussac , [Marshal of [France]4-france]4280-marshal of france ; [the Lord de Granville]247-the lord de granville , [Master of [the Crossbowmen]248-the crossbowmen]4281-master of the crossbowmen ; [the Sire de Culan]249-the sire de culan , [Admiral of [France]4-france]4282-admiral of france ; [Ambroise de Lor]250-ambroise de lor ; [Etienne de Vignoles]251-etienne de vignoles , called [La Hire]4283-la hire ; [Gautier de Brusac]252-gautier de brusac , and [other illustrious captains]4284-other illustrious captains . It was grand times ; the usual shoutings and packed multitudes , the usual crush to get sight of [Joan]110-joan ; but at last [we]4285-we crowded through to [[our]4285-we old lodgings]4286-our old lodgings , and [I]0-i saw [old Boucher]133-catherine and [the wife]4287-the wife and that dear [Catherine]133-catherine gather [Joan]110-joan to [their]4288-their hearts and smother [her]110-joan with kisses — and [my]0-i heart ached for [her]110-joan so ! for [I]0-i could have kissed [Catherine]133-catherine better than [anybody]563-anybody , and more and longer ; yet was not thought of for that office , and [I]0-i so famished for it . Ah , [she]110-joan was so beautiful , and oh , so sweet ! [I]0-i had loved [her]110-joan the first day [I]0-i ever saw [her]110-joan , and from that day forth [she]110-joan was sacred to [me]0-i . [I]0-i have carried [her]110-joan image in [my]0-i heart for sixty - three years — all lonely [thee]110-joan , yes , solitary , for it never has had company — and [I]0-i am grown so old , so old ; but it , oh , it is as fresh and young and merry and mischievous and lovely and sweet and pure and witching and divine as it was when it crept in there , bringing benediction and peace to [its]110-joan habitation so long ago , so long ago — for it has not aged a day ! Chapter 26 The Last Doubts Scattered THIS TIME , as before , [the King]270-the king ’s last command to [the generals]3299-the generals was this : “[0-i] See to it that [you]2269-you do nothing without the sanction of [the Maid]1326-the maid . ” And this time the command was obeyed ; and would continue to be obeyed all through the coming great days of the [Loire]42-the loire campaign . That was a change ! That was new ! It broke the traditions . It shows [you]2269-you what sort of a reputation as [a commander - in - chief]4292-a commander - in - chief [the child]634-the child had made for [herself]634-the child in ten days in the field . It was a conquering of [men]282-men ’s doubts and suspicions and a capturing and solidifying of [men]282-men ’s belief and confidence such as [the grayest veteran on the Grand Staff]4296-the grayest veteran on the grand staff had not been able to achieve in thirty years . Do n’t [you]2269-you remember that when at sixteen [Joan]110-joan conducted [her]110-joan own case in a grim court of law and won it , [the old judge]4297-the old judge spoke of [her]110-joan as “[1326-the maid] [this marvelous child ”]4298-this marvelous child ” ? It was the right name , [you]2269-you see . [These veterans]4299-these veterans were not going to branch out and do things without the sanction of [the Maid]1326-the maid — that is true ; and it was a great gain . But at the same time there were some among [them]4299-these veterans who still trembled at [her]110-joan new and dashing war tactics and earnestly desired to modify them . And so , during the 10th , while [Joan]110-joan was slaving away at [her]110-joan plans and issuing order after order with tireless industry , the old - time consultations and arguings and speechifyings were going on among [certain of [the generals]3299-the generals]4301-certain of the generals . In the afternoon of that day [they]4301-certain of the generals came in a body to hold one of these councils of war ; and while [they]4301-certain of the generals waited for [Joan]110-joan to join [them]4301-certain of the generals [they]4301-certain of the generals discussed the situation . Now this discussion is not set down in the histories ; but [I]140-god was there , and [I]140-god will speak of it , as knowing [you]2269-you will trust [me]140-god , [I]140-god not being given to beguiling [you]2269-you with lies . [Gautier de Brusac]252-gautier de brusac was spokesman for [the timid ones]4303-the timid ones ; [Joan]110-joan ’s side was resolutely upheld by d’Alencon , [the Bastard]1913-the bastard , [La Hire]195-la hire , [the Admiral of [France]4-france]4305-the admiral of france , [the Marshal de Boussac]205-marshal de boussac , and [all the other really important chiefs]4306-all the other really important chiefs . [De Brusac]253-de brusac argued that the situation was very grave ; that [Jargeau]256-joan , the first point of attack , was formidably strong ; [its]256-joan imposing walls bristling with artillery ; with [seven thousand picked English veterans behind [them]4307-seven thousand picked english veterans behind them]4307-seven thousand picked english veterans behind them , and at [their]4307-seven thousand picked english veterans behind them head [the great Earl of [Suffolk]264-suffolk]4308-the great earl of suffolk and [[his]4308-the great earl of suffolk two redoubtable brothers]4309-his two redoubtable brothers , [the De la Poles]254-the de la poles . It seemed to [him]4308-the great earl of suffolk that the proposal of [Joan of Arc]110-joan to try to take such a place by storm was a most rash and over - daring idea , and [she]2271-she ought to be persuaded to relinquish it in favor of the soberer and safer procedure of investment by regular siege . It seemed to [him]4308-the great earl of suffolk that this fiery and furious new fashion of hurling masses of [men]282-men against impregnable walls of stone , in defiance of the established laws and usages of war , was — But [he]4308-the great earl of suffolk got no further . [La Hire]195-la hire gave [his]195-la hire plumed helm an impatient toss and burst out with : “[140-god] By [God]140-god , [she]2271-she knows [her]2271-she trade , and [none]367-none can teach it [her]2271-she ! ” And before [he]195-la hire could get out anything more , [D’Alencon]255-d’alencon was on [his]195-la hire feet , and [the Bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans]2736-the bastard of orleans , and [a half a dozen others]4312-a half a dozen others , all thundering at once , and pouring out [their]4312-a half a dozen others indignant displeasure upon any and all that might hold , secretly or publicly , distrust of the wisdom of [the Commander - in - Chief]4313-the commander - in - chief . And when [they]4312-a half a dozen others had said [their]4312-a half a dozen others say , [La Hire]195-la hire took a chance again , and said : “[2271-she] There are [some that never know how to change]2273-some that never know how to change . Circumstances may change , but [those people]1318-those people are never able to see that [they]1318-those people have got to change too , to meet those circumstances . All that [they]1318-those people know is the one beaten track that [[their]1318-those people fathers]524-their fathers and [grandfathers]2276-grandfathers have followed and that [they]1318-those people [themselves]1318-those people have followed in [their]1318-those people turn . If an earthquake come and rip [the land]1069-the land to chaos , and that beaten track now lead over precipices and into morasses , [those people ca n’t]2278-those people ca n’t learn that [they]1318-those people must strike out a new road — no ; [they]1318-those people will march stupidly along and follow the old one , to death and perdition . [Men]282-men , there ’s a new state of things ; and [a surpassing military genius]2280-a surpassing military genius has perceived it with [her]2280-a surpassing military genius clear eye . And [a new road]2281-a new road is required , and that same clear eye has noted where it must go , and has marked it out for [us]2282-us . [The man]648-the man does not live , never has lived , never will live , that can improve upon it ! The old state of things was defeat , defeat , defeat — and by consequence [we]2282-us had [troops with no dash , no heart , no hope]2284-troops with no dash , no heart , no hope . Would [you]2285-you assault stone walls with such ? No — there was but one way with that kind : sit down before [a place]2800-a place and wait , wait — starve it out , if [you]2285-you could . The new case is the very opposite ; it is this : [men all on fire with pluck and dash and vim and fury and energy]2287-men all on fire with pluck and dash and vim and fury and energy — a restrained conflagration ! What would [you]2285-you do with it ? Hold it down and let it smolder and perish and go out ? What would [Joan of Arc]110-joan do with it ? Turn [it]2281-a new road loose , by [the Lord God of [heaven and earth]2289-heaven and earth]2288-the lord god of heaven and earth , and let [it]2281-a new road swallow up the foe in the whirlwind of its fires ! Nothing shows the splendor and wisdom of [her]110-joan military genius like [her]110-joan instant comprehension of the size of the change which has come about , and [her]110-joan instant perception of the right and only right way to take advantage of it . With [her]110-joan is no sitting down and starving out ; no dilly - dallying and fooling around ; no lazying , loafing , and going to sleep ; no , it is storm ! storm ! storm ! and still storm ! storm ! storm ! and forever storm ! storm ! storm ! hunt [the enemy]2442-the enemy to [his]2442-the enemy hole , then turn [her]110-joan French hurricanes loose and carry [him]2442-the enemy by storm ! And that is [my]0-i sort ! [Jargeau]256-joan ? What of [Jargeau]256-joan , with [its]256-joan battlements and towers , [its]256-joan devastating artillery , [[its]256-joan seven thousand picked [veterans]2292-veterans]2291-its seven thousand picked veterans ? [Joan of Arc]110-joan is to the fore , and by the splendor of [God]140-god [its]110-joan fate is sealed ! ” Oh , [he]2442-the enemy carried [them]4314-them . There was not another word said about persuading [Joan]110-joan to change [her]110-joan tactics . [They]2294-we sat talking comfortably enough after that . By and by [Joan]110-joan entered , and [they]2294-we rose and saluted with [their]2294-we swords , and [she]110-joan asked what [their]2294-we pleasure might be . [La Hire]195-la hire said : “[1907-my general] It is settled , [[my]0-i General]1907-my general . The matter concerned [Jargeau]114-jargeau personal . There were some who thought [we]2294-we could not take [the place]585-the place . ” [Joan]110-joan laughed [her]110-joan pleasant laugh , [her]110-joan merry , carefree laugh ; the laugh that rippled so buoyantly from [her]110-joan lips and made [old people]4315-old people feel young again to hear it ; and [she]110-joan said to [the company]639-the company : “[2296-them] Have no fears — indeed , there is no need nor any occasion for [them]2296-them . [We]2294-we will strike [the English]2659-the english boldly by assault , and [you]2298-you will see . ” Then a faraway look came into [her]110-joan eyes , and [I]2298-you think that a picture of [[her]110-joan home]4317-her home drifted across the vision of [her]110-joan mind ; for [she]110-joan said very gently , and as one who muses , “[2298-you] But that [I]0-i know [God]140-god guides [us]2294-we and will give [us]2294-we success , [I]0-i had liefer keep sheep than endure these perils . ” [We]2294-we had a homelike farewell supper that evening — just [the personal staff]3435-the personal staff and [the family]2556-the family . [Joan]110-joan had to miss it ; for [the city]372-the city had given a banquet in [her]110-joan honor , and [she]110-joan had gone [there]460-there in state with [the Grand Staff]4322-the grand staff , through a riot of joy - bells and a sparkling Milky Way of illuminations . After supper [some lively young folk whom [we]2294-we knew]4323-some lively young folk whom we knew came in , and [we]2294-we presently forgot that [we]2294-we were [soldiers]2473-soldiers , and only remembered that [we]2294-we were [boys]3141-boys and [girls and full of animal spirits]4326-girls and full of animal spirits and long - pent fun ; and so there was dancing , and games , and romps , and screams of laughter — just as extravagant and innocent and noisy a good time as ever [I]0-i had in [my]0-i life . Dear , [dear]2328-dear , how long ago it was!—and [I]0-i was young then . And outside , all the while , was the measured tramp of marching battalions , belated odds and ends of the French power gathering for the morrow ’s tragedy on the grim stage of war . Yes , in those days [we]2294-we had those contrasts side by side . And as [I]0-i passed along to bed there was another one : [the big Dwarf]4328-the big dwarf , in brave new armor , sat sentry at [Joan]110-joan ’s door — [the stern Spirit of War made flesh]4329-the stern spirit of war made flesh , as it were — and on [his]4328-the big dwarf ample shoulder was curled a kitten asleep . Chapter 27 How [Joan Took Jargeau]256-joan [WE]2294-we MADE a gallant show next day when [we]2294-we filed out through [the frowning gates of [Orleans]39-orleans]4330-the frowning gates of orleans , with banners flying and [Joan]256-joan and [the Grand Staff]4322-the grand staff in the van of the long column . [Those two young De Lavals]4332-those two young de lavals were come now , and were joined to [the Grand Staff]4322-the grand staff . Which was well ; war being [their]4332-those two young de lavals proper trade , for [they]4332-those two young de lavals were [grandsons of [that illustrious fighter [Bertrand du Guesclin]257-that illustrious fighter bertrand du guesclin , constable of france , Constable of [France]4-france]257-that illustrious fighter bertrand du guesclin , constable of france in earlier days]4334-grandsons of that illustrious fighter bertrand du guesclin , constable of france in earlier days . [Louis de Bourbon]258-louis de bourbon , [the Marshal de Rais]259-the marshal de rais , and [the Vidame de Chartres]260-the vidame de chartres were added also . [We]2294-we had a right to feel a little uneasy , for [we]2294-we knew that [a force of [five thousand men]4336-five thousand men]4335-a force of five thousand men was on its way under [Sir John Fastolfe]224-sir john to reinforce [Jargeau]256-joan , but [I]0-i think [we]2294-we were not uneasy , nevertheless . In truth , that force was not yet in [[our]2294-we neighborhood]4337-our neighborhood . [Sir John]224-sir john was loitering ; for some reason or other [he]224-sir john was not hurrying . [He]224-sir john was losing precious time — four days at [Etampes]103-etampes , and four more at [Janville]104-janville . [We]2294-we reached [Jargeau]256-joan and began business at once . [Joan]256-joan sent forward a heavy force which hurled itself against [the outworks]4338-the outworks in handsome style , and gained a footing and fought hard to keep it ; but it presently began to fall back before a sortie from [the city]372-the city . Seeing this , [Joan]256-joan raised [her]256-joan battle - cry and led a new assault [herself]256-joan under a furious artillery fire . [The Paladin]157-the paladin was struck down at [her]256-joan side wounded , but [she]256-joan snatched [her]256-joan standard from [his]157-the paladin failing hand and plunged on through the ruck of flying missiles , cheering [[her]256-joan men]3996-her men with encouraging cries ; and then for a good time one had turmoil , and clash of steel , and collision and confusion of [struggling multitudes]4341-struggling multitudes , and the hoarse bellowing of the guns ; and then the hiding of it all under a rolling firmament of smoke — a firmament through which veiled vacancies appeared for a moment now and then , giving fitful dim glimpses of the wild tragedy enacting beyond ; and always at these times one caught sight of [that slight figure in white mail which was the center and soul of]4342-that slight figure in white mail which was the center and soul of [our]2294-we hope and trust , and whenever [we]2294-we saw that , with its back to [us]2294-we and its face to the fight , [we]2294-we knew that all was well . At last a great shout went up — a joyous roar of shoutings , in fact — and that was sign sufficient that the faubourgs were [ours]2294-we . Yes , [they]4343-they were [ours]2294-we ; [the enemy]2442-the enemy had been driven back within the walls . On the ground which [Joan]256-joan had won [we]2294-we camped ; for night was coming on . [Joan]256-joan sent a summons to [the English]128-the english , promising that if [they]4343-they surrendered [she]256-joan would allow [them]4343-they to go in peace and take [their]4343-they horses with [them]4343-they . [Nobody]434-nobody knew that [she]256-joan could take that strong place , but [she]256-joan knew it — knew it well ; yet [she]256-joan offered that grace — offered it in a time when such a thing was unknown in war ; in a time when it was custom and usage to massacre [the garrison]989-the garrison and [the inhabitants of [captured cities]4348-captured cities]4347-the inhabitants of captured cities without pity or compunction — yes , even to [the harmless women]4349-the harmless women and [children]550-children sometimes . There are [neighbors all about [you]4352-you who well remember the unspeakable atrocities which [Charles the Bold]261-charles the bold inflicted upon [the men and women and children of [Dinant]105-dinant]4353-the men and women and children of dinant when [he]261-charles the bold took that place some years ago]4351-neighbors all about you who well remember the unspeakable atrocities which charles the bold inflicted upon the men and women and children of dinant when he took that place some years ago . It was a unique and kindly grace which [Joan]256-joan offered [that garrison]4354-that garrison ; but that was [her]256-joan way , that was [her]256-joan loving and merciful nature — [she]256-joan always did [her]256-joan best to save [[her]256-joan enemy]4355-her enemy ’s life and [his]4355-her enemy soldierly pride when [she]256-joan had the mastery of [him]4355-her enemy . [The English]2659-the english asked fifteen days ’ armistice to consider the proposal in . And [Fastolfe]224-sir john coming with [five thousand men]4336-five thousand men ! [Joan]256-joan said no . But [she]256-joan offered another grace : [they]4336-five thousand men might take both [their]4336-five thousand men horses and [their]4336-five thousand men side - arms — but [they]4336-five thousand men must go within the hour . Well , [those bronzed English veterans]4358-those bronzed english veterans were [pretty hard - headed folk]4359-pretty hard - headed folk . [They]4358-those bronzed english veterans declined again . Then [Joan]256-joan gave command that [[her]256-joan army]3345-her army be made ready to move to the assault at nine in the morning . Considering the deal of marching and fighting which [the men]788-the men had done that day , [D’Alencon]255-d’alencon thought the hour rather early ; but [Joan]256-joan said it was best so , and so must be obeyed . Then [she]256-joan burst out with one of those enthusiasms which were always burning in [her]256-joan when battle was imminent , and said : “[0-i] Work ! work ! and [God]140-god will work with [us]2299-our ! ” Yes , [one]461-one might say that [her]256-joan motto was “[140-god] Work ! stick to it ; keep on working ! ” for in war [she]256-joan never knew what indolence was . And [whoever will take that motto and live by it]4363-whoever will take that motto and live by it will likely to succeed . There ’s many a way to win in [this world]345-this world , but none of [them]4365-them is worth much without good hard work back out of it . [I]140-god think [we]2299-our should have lost [[our]2299-our big Standard - Bearer]4366-our big standard - bearer that day , if [[our]2299-our bigger [Dwarf]111-the dwarf]4367-our bigger dwarf had not been at hand to bring [him]4366-our big standard - bearer out of the melee when [he]4366-our big standard - bearer was wounded . [He]4366-our big standard - bearer was unconscious , and would have been trampled to death by [our]2299-our own horse , if [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf had not promptly rescued [him]4366-our big standard - bearer and haled [him]4366-our big standard - bearer to the rear and safety . [He]4366-our big standard - bearer recovered , and was [himself]4366-our big standard - bearer again after two or three hours ; and then [he]4366-our big standard - bearer was happy and proud , and made the most of [his]4366-our big standard - bearer wound , and went swaggering around in [his]4366-our big standard - bearer bandages showing off like [an innocent big - child]4369-an innocent big - child — which was just what [he]4366-our big standard - bearer was . [He]4366-our big standard - bearer was prouder of being wounded than [a really modest person]4370-a really modest person would be of being killed . But there was no harm in [his]4366-our big standard - bearer vanity , and [nobody]434-nobody minded it . [He]4366-our big standard - bearer said [he]4366-our big standard - bearer was hit by a stone from a catapult — a stone the size of [a man]2329-a man ’s head . But the stone grew , of course . Before [he]4366-our big standard - bearer got through with it [he]4366-our big standard - bearer was claiming that [the enemy]2442-the enemy had flung [a building]4374-a building at [him]4366-our big standard - bearer . “[140-god] Let [him]2300-him alone , ” said [Noel Rainguesson]135-noel . “[140-god] Do n’t interrupt [his]2300-him processes . To - morrow it will be [a cathedral]2301-a cathedral . ” [He]4366-our big standard - bearer said that privately . And , sure enough , to - morrow it was [a cathedral]2301-a cathedral . [I]140-god never saw [anybody with such an abandoned imagination]4376-anybody with such an abandoned imagination . [Joan]256-joan was abroad at the crack of dawn , galloping here and there and yonder , examining the situation minutely , and choosing what [she]256-joan considered the most effective positions for [her]256-joan artillery ; and with such accurate judgment did [she]256-joan place [her]256-joan guns that [[her]256-joan Lieutenant - General]4377-her lieutenant - general ’s admiration of it still survived in [his]4377-her lieutenant - general memory when [his]4377-her lieutenant - general testimony was taken at [the Rehabilitation]4378-the rehabilitation , a quarter of a century later . In this testimony [the Duke d’Alencon]2240-the duke d’alencon said that at [Jargeau]256-joan that morning of the 12th of June [she]256-joan made [her]256-joan dispositions not like [a novice]4380-a novice , but “[140-god] with the sure and clear judgment of [a trained general of twenty or thirty years ’ experience]2302-a trained general of twenty or thirty years ’ experience . ” [The veteran captains of [the armies of [France]4-france]339-the armies of france]4381-the veteran captains of the armies of france said [she]256-joan was great in war in all ways , but greatest of all in [her]256-joan genius for posting and handling artillery . Who taught [the shepherd - girl]4383-the shepherd - girl to do these marvels — [she]4383-the shepherd - girl who could not read , and had had no opportunity to study the complex arts of war ? [I]140-god do not know any way to solve such a baffling riddle as that , there being no precedent for it , nothing in history to compare it with and examine it by . For in history there is [no great general , however gifted , who arrived at success otherwise than through able teaching and hard study and some experience]4384-no great general , however gifted , who arrived at success otherwise than through able teaching and hard study and some experience . It is a riddle which will never be guessed . [I]140-god think these vast powers and capacities were born in [her]256-joan , and that [she]256-joan applied them by an intuition which could not err . At eight o’clock all movement ceased , and with it all sounds , all noise . A mute expectancy reigned . The stillness was something awful — because it meant so much . There was no air stirring . The flags on [the towers and ramparts]4385-the towers and ramparts hung straight down like tassels . Wherever [one]461-one saw [a person]467-a person , [that person]2332-that person had stopped what [he]2332-that person was doing , and was in a waiting attitude , a listening attitude . [We]4389-we were on a commanding spot , clustered around [Joan]256-joan . Not far from [us]4389-we , on every hand , were [the lanes and humble dwellings of [these outlying suburbs]4391-these outlying suburbs]4390-the lanes and humble dwellings of these outlying suburbs . [Many people]4392-many people were visible — all were listening , [not one]4393-not one was moving . [A man]2329-a man had placed a nail ; [he]2329-a man was about to fasten something with it to the door - post of [[his]2329-a man shop]4395-his shop — but [he]2329-a man had stopped . There was [his]2329-a man hand reaching up holding the nail ; and there was [his]2329-a man other hand in the act of striking with the hammer ; but [he]2329-a man had forgotten everything — [his]2329-a man head was turned aside listening . Even [children]550-children unconsciously stopped in [their]550-children play ; [I]140-god saw [a little boy]1872-a little boy with [his]1872-a little boy hoop - stick pointed slanting toward the ground in the act of steering the hoop around the corner ; and so [he]1872-a little boy had stopped and was listening — the hoop was rolling away , doing its own steering . [I]140-god saw [a young girl]1059-a young girl prettily framed in an open window , a watering - pot in [her]1059-a young girl hand and window - boxes of red flowers under its spout — but the water had ceased to flow ; [the girl]3083-the girl was listening . Everywhere were these impressive petrified forms ; and everywhere was suspended movement and that awful stillness . [Joan of Arc]110-joan raised [her]110-joan sword in the air . At the signal , the silence was torn to rags ; cannon after cannon vomited flames and smoke and delivered its quaking thunders ; and [we]140-god saw answering tongues of fire dart from [the towers and walls of [the city]372-the city]4400-the towers and walls of the city , accompanied by answering deep thunders , and in a minute the walls and [the towers]4402-the towers disappeared , and in [their]4400-the towers and walls of the city place stood vast banks and pyramids of snowy smoke , motionless in the dead air . [The startled girl]4403-the startled girl dropped [her]4403-the startled girl watering - pot and clasped [her]4403-the startled girl hands together , and at that moment a stone cannon - ball crashed through [her]4403-the startled girl fair body . The great artillery duel went on , each side hammering away with all its might ; and it was splendid for smoke and noise , and most exalting to one ’s spirits . [The poor little town around about [us]140-god]4404-the poor little town around about us suffered cruelly . The cannon - balls tore through [[its]4404-the poor little town around about us slight buildings]4405-its slight buildings , wrecking them as if they had been built of cards ; and every moment or two one would see a huge rock come curving through the upper air above the smoke - clouds and go plunging down through the roofs . Fire broke out , and columns of flame and smoke rose toward the sky . Presently the artillery concussions changed the weather . The sky became overcast , and a strong wind rose and blew away the smoke that hid [the English fortresses]4406-the english fortresses . Then the spectacle was fine ; turreted gray walls and towers , and streaming bright flags , and jets of red fire and gushes of white smoke in long rows , all standing out with sharp vividness against the deep leaden background of the sky ; and then the whizzing missiles began to knock up the dirt all around [us]140-god , and [I]140-god felt no more interest in the scenery . There was one English gun that was getting [our]140-god position down finer and finer all the time . Presently [Joan]110-joan pointed to it and said : “[140-god] [Fair duke]2303-fair duke , step out of [your]2303-fair duke tracks , or that machine will kill [you]2303-fair duke . ” [The Duke]1695-the duke d’Alencon did as [he]1695-the duke was bid ; but [Monsieur du Lude]262-monsieur du lude rashly took [his]1695-the duke place , and that cannon tore [his]1695-the duke head off in a moment . [Joan]110-joan was watching all along for the right time to order the assault . At last , about nine o’clock , [she]110-joan cried out : “[140-god] Now — to the assault ! ” and [the buglers]4408-the buglers blew the charge . Instantly [we]140-god saw the body of [men that had been appointed to this service]4409-men that had been appointed to this service move forward toward a point where the concentrated fire of [our]140-god guns had crumbled the upper half of a broad stretch of wall to ruins ; [we]140-god saw [this force]4410-this force descend into the ditch and begin to plant the scaling - ladders . [We]140-god were soon with [them]4410-this force . [The Lieutenant - General]4411-the lieutenant - general thought the assault premature . But [Joan]110-joan said : “[140-god] Ah , [gentle duke]2304-gentle duke , are [you]2303-fair duke afraid ? Do [you]2303-fair duke not know that [I]0-i have promised to send [you]2303-fair duke [home]377-home safe ? ” It was warm work in [the ditches]4412-the ditches . [The walls]4413-the walls were crowded with [men]282-men , and [they]282-men poured avalanches of stones down upon [us]140-god . There was [one gigantic Englishman who did [us]140-god more hurt than any dozen of [[his]4415-one gigantic englishman who did us more hurt than any dozen of his brethren brethren]4416-his brethren]4415-one gigantic englishman who did us more hurt than any dozen of his brethren . [He]4415-one gigantic englishman who did us more hurt than any dozen of his brethren always dominated [the places easiest of assault]4417-the places easiest of assault , and flung down exceedingly troublesome big stones which smashed [men]282-men and ladders both — then [he]4415-one gigantic englishman who did us more hurt than any dozen of his brethren would near burst [himself]4415-one gigantic englishman who did us more hurt than any dozen of his brethren with laughing over what [he]4415-one gigantic englishman who did us more hurt than any dozen of his brethren had done . But [the duke]1695-the duke settled accounts with [him]4415-one gigantic englishman who did us more hurt than any dozen of his brethren . [He]1695-the duke went and found [the famous cannoneer]4420-the famous cannoneer , [Jean le Lorrain]263-jean le lorrain , and said : “[2306-your] Train [your]2306-your gun — kill [me]0-i [this demon]2307-this demon . ” [He]1695-the duke did it with the first shot . [He]1695-the duke hit [the Englishman]4421-the englishman fair in the breast and knocked [him]4421-the englishman backward into [the city]372-the city . [The enemy]2442-the enemy ’s resistance was so effective and so stubborn that [[our]4424-we people]4032-our people began to show signs of doubt and dismay . Seeing this , [Joan]110-joan raised [her]110-joan inspiring battle - cry and descended into [the fosse]3995-the fosse [herself]110-joan , [the Dwarf]1993-the dwarf helping [her]110-joan and [the Paladin]732-the paladin sticking bravely at [her]110-joan side with the standard . [She]110-joan started up a scaling - ladder , but a great stone flung from above came crashing down upon [her]110-joan helmet and stretched [her]110-joan , wounded and stunned , upon the ground . But only for a moment . [The Dwarf]1993-the dwarf stood [her]110-joan upon [her]110-joan feet , and straightway [she]110-joan started up the ladder again , crying : “[2306-your] To the assault , [friends]2434-friends , to the assault — [the English]128-the english are [ours]128-the english ! It is the appointed hour ! ” There was a grand rush , and a fierce roar of war - cries , and [we]4424-we swarmed over [the ramparts]4430-the ramparts like ants . [The garrison]989-the garrison fled , [we]4424-we pursued ; [Jargeau]256-joan was [ours]4424-we ! [The Earl of Suffolk]264-suffolk was hemmed in and surrounded , and [the Duke]1695-the duke d’Alencon and [the Bastard of]4433-the bastard of [Orleans]39-orleans demanded that [he]264-suffolk surrender [himself]264-suffolk . But [he]264-suffolk was [a proud nobleman]4434-a proud nobleman and came of [a proud race]4435-a proud race . [He]264-suffolk refused to yield [his]264-suffolk sword to [subordinates]4436-subordinates , saying : “[0-i] [I]0-i will die rather . [I]0-i will surrender to [the Maid of [Orleans]39-orleans]2030-the maid of orleans alone , and to [no other]1991-no other . ” And so [he]264-suffolk did ; and was courteously and honorably used by [her]2030-the maid of orleans . [[His]264-suffolk two brothers]4437-his two brothers retreated , fighting step by step , toward [the bridge]1244-the bridge , [we]4439-we pressing [[their]4437-his two brothers despairing forces]4440-their despairing forces and cutting [them]4437-his two brothers down by scores . Arrived on [the bridge]1244-the bridge , the slaughter still continued . [Alexander de la Pole]265-alexander de la pole was pushed overboard or fell over , and was drowned . [Eleven hundred men]4442-eleven hundred men had fallen ; [John de la Pole]266-john de la pole decided to give up the struggle . But [he]266-john de la pole was nearly as proud and particular as [[his]266-john de la pole brother]4443-his brother of [Suffolk]264-suffolk as to whom [he]266-john de la pole would surrender to . [The French officer nearest at hand]4444-the french officer nearest at hand was [Guillaume Renault]267-guillaume renault , who was pressing [him]2311-him closely . [Sir John]224-sir john said to [him]2311-him : “[2030-the maid of orleans] Are [you]2311-him [a gentleman]2532-a gentleman ? ” “[2311-him] Yes . ” “[2311-him] And [a knight]2313-a knight ? ” “[2313-a knight] No . ” Then [Sir John]224-sir john knighted [him]2311-him [himself]224-sir john there on [the bridge]1244-the bridge , giving [him]2311-him the accolade with English coolness and tranquillity in the midst of that storm of slaughter and mutilation ; and then bowing with high courtesy took the sword by the blade and laid the hilt of it in [the man]648-the man ’s hand in token of surrender . Ah , yes , [a proud tribe]2316-a proud tribe , those [De la Poles]254-the de la poles . It was a grand day , a memorable day , a most splendid victory . [We]2317-we had [a crowd of prisoners]2318-a crowd of prisoners , but [Joan]256-joan would not allow [them]2318-a crowd of prisoners to be hurt . [We]2317-we took [them]2318-a crowd of prisoners with [us]2317-we and marched into [Orleans]39-orleans next day through the usual tempest of welcome and joy . And this time there was a new tribute to [[our]2317-we leader]2319-our leader . From everywhere in [the packed streets]2320-the packed streets [the new recruits]2321-the new recruits squeezed [their]2321-the new recruits way to [her]256-joan side to touch the sword of [Joan of Arc]110-joan , and draw from it somewhat of that mysterious quality which made it invincible . * * *
